No. Not now. Not until you return to the path of wisdom.
Do not confuse inaction with indifference. Often the wisest course is to wait and watch events unfold, until the time to act is clear.
The Blades have never followed that path, of course.
Those who are ignorant find the Way of the Voice easy to ridicule.
This is why so few follow it, and why the world is as it is.
Arngeir. Rok los Dovahkiin, Strundu'ul. Rok fen tinvaak Paarthurnax.
Arngeir. Rek los Dovahkiin, Strundu'ul. Rek fen tinvaak Paarthurnax.
Dragonborn... wait.
I cannot teach you the Shout, because I do not know it.
It is called [QUOTE]Dragonrend[QUOTE], but its Words of Power are unknown to us.
We do not regret this loss. Dragonrend holds no place within the Way of the Voice.
He is our leader. He surpasses us all in his mastery of the Way of the Voice.
But not Dragonrend. The knowledge of that Shout was lost in the time before history began.
Perhaps only its creators ever knew it. But I am not the one to speak of it to you.
I'm glad to see you're embracing our methods. It would be a waste to lose a contact at the East Empire Company before we had the entire story.
Just keep on Gulum-Ei's tail and he's bound to step into something he can't scrape off his boot.
Hasn't Mercer Frey taught you people anything?
You kill me and your only contact with the East Empire Company vanishes. That's not smart for business.
I have a buyer looking for a case of Firebrand Wine. There just so happens to be a single case in the Blue Palace.
Bring it to me, and we'll talk about Goldenglow Estate.
Good. Can't have the buyer getting impatient and looking elsewhere for this, can we?
Here, take this. I certainly can't use it, but I suppose I need to pay you something for the goods.
Not at all. I consider it an investment in prolonging my life.
As far as Goldenglow Estate goes, I'll tell you what I know.
Now you won't forget to tell Mercer I cooperated, will you?
Give Mercer my regards when you return to Riften.
Look, did you want the information or not?
Do take care handling that case of wine... it's irreplaceable.
If you're the best the Guild's got, they're in worse shape than I imagined.
I need you to put all your efforts into this job. We can't afford any mistakes.
Good luck in Solitude. Keep Gulum-Ei alive, but remind him who we are.
You have gone beyond my teachings, which is quite a feat. I did not think it possible.
But there is always more to learn. I believe you are ready for the next step.
Knowledge of truly powerful Illusion spells is here at the College, but it is hidden from those who might misuse it.
I shall teach you a spell to discern things hidden from others. With it, you will be able to acquire the texts you need.
Bring all four to me, and I shall use them to inscribe the spells for you.
I continue to hear things about dragon sightings in Skyrim.
Dragons? Well, that's fascinating. We should have someone look into that.
Would you like me to send someone? Faralda or Phinis, perhaps?
I'll think about it.
Is it true? Are there really dragons in Skyrim?
There's talk of it, but I find it hard to believe.
I do hope it's true. So many opportunities...
Opportunities for what?
What? Oh, nothing. It's just... It's an interesting development.
You haven't heard any more about dragon sightings, have you?
No, which is fine with me.
A pity. You have any idea how much fangs would be worth? Or even better -- bottle their flame. The right buyer would pay an immense amount.
Bottle... their flame? I can't... No, I don't think I've any interest in that sort of thing.
Folks have gone missing the past few weeks. Word now's that our hunters are gone, too.
Say, if you're traveling, could you keep an eye out for them? Valdr and his men. I think they were after bear up north.
I just need a little to get going.
Thank you. Please hurry!
Please, I need help! I don't want to die on this damned log!
It's done, then. Justice, if you can call it that.
Look, I want you to have this. I know it isn't much, but it's important to me.
Changed your mind? Well, I can't give up so easily. I'm heading back.
Now that this is a Black-Briar Meadery, you can be sure that we'll be selling only the best mead in Skyrim.
What's left of the Honningbrew has been dumped into the sewers. Good riddance.
Maven Black-Briar always remembers her friends. That's why I'm in charge of the place.
If you have anything you're having a hard time selling, I can take it off your hands.
It was you, wasn't it. I should of known better. Now look at me.
You've sent an innocent man to jail. I hope your proud of yourself.
Maven be damned. One day, she'll get hers. I can promise you that.
Leave me alone. Haven't you done enough damage already?
Yes, lad? Did you need something?
Yes, lass? Did you need something?
Good to see you, lad! How are things?
Good to see you, lass! How are things?
Things are looking up around here, lass.
Things are looking up around here, lad.
Planning some exciting heists I hope?
Enjoying your newfound abilities I trust?
What brings you back to Nightingale Hall?
I trust the night finds you well?
Things seem to be going well at the Guild.
I'm hearing good things about you from Brynjolf.
Hopefully they made it to safety before the attack.  I'll begin the search after a quick restock.
Anyway, here is your reward.  Thanks again.
An alchemy lab, it could be in here.  It's worth a look.
This looks like some sort of lever puzzle.  We'll have to figure out the correct order to flip them.
Maybe the order has something to do with the Symbols up there.
I will see you dead, monster.
Stop! We know you're holding a Daedric artifact. Hand it over.
The Vigil of Stendarr cleanses all Daedric filth from Tamriel. Give us any artifacts you have, or we'll purge you like all the others.
Then prepare yourself to receive Stendarr's Mercy.
Five, four, three, two, one... go!
Five, four, three, two, one... go!
I feel like I can beat anything.
I'm just itching for a fight.
I ain't scared of nothin'.
No one can defeat me.
I've never felt this brave.
Suddenly I feel like I can take on the world.
Bah! Is there no one who can offer a challenge?
I've never been more ready!
My claws are sharp. My will to kill... unquenchable.
I cannot be beaten!
I may be old, but I can show 'em a trick or two.
I'm ready. Let's go!
Hmph. Everyone seems so insignificant now.
I'm ready. More than ready.
Come on! Let's go.
I feel... unbeatable.
By the gods, I feel like I could crush a giant's head like a walnut.
Ha ha! Look out. Here I come!
There is none who can stand in my way.
Come on, I can take anyone. And that ain't just the mead talkin'.
I feel like I can beat anyone.
Even my claws feel sharper.
By Ysmir, I feel... invincible!
Been too long since I've embraced my rage...
Just point me to the fight.
I fight and I'll win. Simple as that.
I feel like I can take on all of Skyrim.
If you need to sample some of the finest mead in Skyrim, you're in the right place.
If you're looking to purchase any mead, speak to the owner, Sabjorn.
If you're looking to purchase any mead, speak to the brewmaster, Mallus.
We're a small meadery, but growing quickly. Sabjorn's only been running this place for a short time now and look at it.
It's a shame the Black-Briar Meadery took this place over. I never liked it as much as our Honningbrew.
Mallus is teaching me everything he knows about brewing. Hopefully, I can take over his position some day.
Welcome. I'm the owner and proprietor of Honningbrew Meadery.
Honningbrew uses only the finest natural honey, not that sludge you'll find at Goldenglow Estate.
We may be small, but what we lack in size we make up for in quality.
Black-Briar Mead is just fine, if you need something to wash the dirt off a riding horse's hooves.
You need something to do, or you just enjoy slowing down the hard-working folk?
If you want to buy something, go find Sabjorn. Otherwise, piss off.
To tell you the truth, Sabjorn isn't much of an owner. Slave driver, sure.
I've never met someone like him that revels so much in other's misery.
Because, even after all their posturing and planning, they've made a mistake.
The parchment you recovered mentions a [QUOTE]Gajul-Lei.[QUOTE] According to my sources, that's an old alias used by one of our contacts.
His real name is Gulum-Ei. Slimy bastard.
Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude.
I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.
Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions.
They're well-funded and they've been able to avoid identification for years. I'm impressed it reached this point.
Just don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
You jest, but they've been able to avoid identification for years. They're obviously well-funded, driven and patient.
Just don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
Don't dismiss our adversary so easily. They're well-funded, patient and have been able to avoid identification for years.
However, don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
When Gulum-Ei was getting us merchandise from the East Empire Company, we were making a hefty profit.
It was so lucrative, I was considering moving the Guild to Solitude to save us time.
Gulum-Ei started to get greedy and cut us out of the deal. Almost can't say I blame the scaly bastard.
It started out innocent enough; he kept claiming the shipments were light because of Imperial interference.
Then, maybe a few years ago, it all stopped. He didn't even bother to contact us anymore.
Don't just walk away from me! Where do you think you're going?
To the Inn for a drink, of course! Where else could I even go in this gods-forsaken town?
And what, you think that'll solve all your problems?
Probably not, but it's worth a try!
Well in that case. You'll have to hand over your life as well as your coin.
We'll see about that. Won't we boys?
Oh, thank goodness! I've been wandering alone for so long, I thought I'd never see another soul again.
I was kidnapped by these bandits weeks ago. They locked me up in the towers near Mistwatch.
I managed to pick the lock and slip out while the guard slept, but now I'm completely lost. Can you help me, please?
Oh, thank you, but I should be fine now that you've shown me the way. But those bandits have to be stopped!
They're at Mistwatch. Here, let me show you on your map....
If you can stop them, you'll be a true hero!
Nothing to do now but sit back, relax, and enjoy the trip home.
Years of work, finally going to pay off...
...but what's this? These results... They're not at all what they should be.
Something is creating an incredible amount of interference.
Something in Winterhold, it looks like.
What are you playing at? Is this some attempt to stall my work?!
Now the crystal needs to be focused. It was created so far away, we knew that some adjustments would have to be made.
Heating and cooling the crystal will cause it to expand or contract, which will change how the light passes through it.
You'll need to use spells to do that. Being from the College, I assume you know them already.
There should be a few basic tomes around here somewhere in case your training is even more sub-standard than I've heard.
You'll have to get the crystal to focus properly. Heat and cold will affect it; simple concentration spells should be enough.
You'll also need to align the mirrors using the controls up above. Once everything is lined up, the light will reflect back through the crystal.
Then you'll see some real magic.
Place the crystal in the center of the armillary. Then we can worry about attuning it.
Another wanderer, here to lick my father's boots. Good job.
The only grownups who talk to me are the kind I don't want talking to me.
Have I done something to make you bother me?
You... you know the Whispering Lady, don't you. I can tell.
You're going to end up helping me. I know it.
Kind of nice being in on the secret, itsn't it.
Father says I'm too young to train with a sword, so I practice with my fists!
Hope this war lasts long enough that I get to fight in it. Battle! Glory!
You're not from around here. I'll bet you're here to help with the war!
One of the new servants? Remember that I like my meat rare.
Absurd that you can't get good sweet rolls in this skeeverhole of a city.
Where is papa? I want to ride Karinda now!
Blasted war. I was due a new dress from Solitude, but it will never get here.
I'm sorry, could you describe the smell?
Like some horrible monster was turned inside out, and then exploded. What did you do?
It was a minor miscalculation. I've already corrected it for future experiments.
This, this is why people have a problem with your college, Nelacar.
Heh, a Nord skull makes the best axe blade. 'bout all they're good for.
Lead the way.
Then lead on, friend.
We are in this together, yes?
Lead, then. You have my steel.
Let's not waste any time.
Looks like you've already got someone with you.
You have someone with you, already.
You have someone already, friend.
You already have someone to do your fighting for you. Don't need me.
Looks like you got someone already.
I'm right behind you.
You already appear to have someone with you.
You can't scare me into submission. Let's go.
At last, a worthy opponent!
I used to dream of it. In the dream, I was standing... someplace high up... a tower, or mountain.
It was always just before dawn. The whole world was in darkness.
Then came the flash of light - just on the horizon, within the clouds that mark the border between worlds.
It could have been lightning, but there was no thunder. In the dream, the sense of foreboding grew, but I could never wake up.
Then it came again, this time more distinct. Closer. Definitely not lightning now. It was orange - brilliant orange, the color of hearth and dawn.
And a sound, too. Distinct and indistinct. Not thunder... something else. Something I should recognize, but in the dream I cannot place it.
I want to leave my high place, to seek shelter. From what, I don't yet know.
In the manner of dreams, I cannot escape. I'm forced to wait and watch.
Then, finally, realization and horror arrive together. The orange is flame, heat. The sound a roar, a challenge in their ancient tongue.
But now it's too late for escape. The dragon is upon me - fire and darkness descending like a thunderbolt.
And not just any dragon, but the Dragon - Alduin, the World-Eater, the dragon who devours both the living and the dead.
And then I would wake up. And hope that it was just a dream... but know that it was not.
Speak to Vex. We have nothing else to talk about.
The Guild will not tolerate the kind of behavior you've been displaying. Too much is at stake.
I'm taking you out of the game for now. No jobs will be offered and you won't be able to fence your goods.
Speak to Vex to make the proper reparations if you want back in. Now get out of my sight.
Until you're done with Vex, we don't have anything to discuss.
You've done it now, whelp. You broke the rules and now you're knee deep in it.
That means your out. No jobs, no payouts... no nothing.
You want to get back into our graces, you need to talk to Vex. She'll set you straight.
Sorry. We got nothin' to talk about. Vex will straighten you out.
Are you crazy? What were you thinkin'? You can't just go around doin' things the way you please!
Now we have to kick you out until things cool down. Can't give you any jobs or payouts for goods.
Go talk to Vex. She'll tell you the why's and how's if you want to get back in.
Until you get back into the Guild's graces, we have nothing to speak about.
Straighten yourself out with the Guild and then maybe we can talk.
Don't want to know what you did and I don't care. Just keep away from me.
I may be new around here, but at least I know how to follow the rules.
Sorry, I'm not buying any goods until you straighten this out with Vex.
I'll serve you after you've paid Vex.
You better straighten things with the Guild or you won't be welcome here anymore.
Settle your accounts with Vex, and then we can talk.
Hmph. I don't talk with Guild traitors.
Pay your dues and we'll speak.
It's a shame you got booted from the Guild... things were going so well.
Come back when you're in the Guild's good graces.
You want my advice? Pay your debt to Vex quickly and she'll forget the whole thing.
You're in it deep... better start shoveling your way out.
I'm surprised you're even showing your face around here after what you did.
Well, well. If it isn't Brynjolf's little protege.
I'm going to make this short and sweet, because frankly I don't think you deserve another shot.
You've broken the rules and now you need to pay... and it's going to cost you quite a bit.
This is the Thieves Guild, genius. How do you think? With gold. A lot of gold.
Did you think we'd accept a heartfelt apology and let bygones be bygones?
I'd say it's time you put your nose to the grindstone and figure it out for yourself. You claim to be a thief... act like one.
Pick pockets, knock over houses... heck, I don't care if you have to bust into a palace. You do what you have to do to come up with the coin.
You'd better. Because until you do, you don't get a single coin from us... and you won't be able to use our fences.
Anything you steal, you bring it straight to me.
Now get out of here and don't come back until your pockets are full.
Again? Didn't we teach you enough of a lesson the first time?
I suppose it's tough for an old dog to learn new tricks.
Anyway, you know the drill. You want to buy back in, and it'll cost you.
And here I expected you to hop the next caravan to Morrowind. What have you got for me?
I hope you brought a little something for me.
First, let's count the coin, then we can get back to business.
It's all here. Well, congratulations. You're one of us again.
Next time you decide to pull a stunt like that again, just remember how much it hurt to give this away.
I hope you come up with that gold soon.
You have the gold yet or what?
I believe you owe the Guild something.
Got any ale or mead?
First war, and now dragons. Everywhere they go, the Nords bring nothing but ruin.
Ain't nothing for it. They're still in charge.
I wonder if we should finally leave Markarth. These dragon attacks, I think Skyrim is cursed.
What kind of talk is this? The man I married would never speak of leaving his home.
I just don't know if I can keep you safe.
We will keep each other safe. No matter what.
More settlements have sent riders to say dragons are being spotted throughout Skyrim.
The Forsworn ambush our roads and dragons cloud the skies. Is there any good news?
Umm.... No, my Jarl. I'm afraid there isn't.
I want soldiers sent to deal with these dragons. Every able-bodied man and woman who can carry a bow.
We can't do that. Every soldier we send to hunt dragons is one more man that can't defend the Reach.
Killing dragons isn't defending the Reach?
Our men know how to kill Forsworn and Legionnaires, not dragons.
Surprised to see you working. Mulush almost broke your arm yesterday.
Does it look like I can afford losing a day's wage? That damn Orc isn't getting the best of me.
Oh, no.
Dagur's been talking at you, hasn't he? Gotten you roped into his little plan to fix Ranmir's life?
I'll tell you what I told him -- stay out of it. It's none of your business. Those aren't folks you want to get tangled up with.
No there isn't. And I suggest you leave it at that. I don't want to see anyone get hurt over this.
You'll wind up getting yourself killed. Dagur shouldn't have said a word about it.
I love the man, bless his heart, but he doesn't know the whole story.
Enough to know that it's not worth it.
Ranmir's a good boy, and he doesn't deserve what fate pushed his way, but there's only so far I'll go to risk my neck.
One night Ranmir was in here like always, drinking himself to death.
When I told him there was no more Honningbrew, that he'd drank it all, he got angry.
He ranted at me, how I didn't know what he's been through, how Isabelle broke his heart when she ran off with some thief named Vex...
He said he'd even gone to Riften to try and find the bastard. I think maybe he was hoping they'd just kill him, and that'd be the end of it.
Dagur never heard any of this, and I chose to keep it to myself. I'm only telling you so you don't get into trouble.
Riften and thieves means trouble. Just leave it alone.
That remains to be seen. By rights, she has a legitimate claim as High Queen of Skyrim.
That's the real question, isn't it? No one can deny Elisif has a legitimate claim to become High Queen of Skyrim...
Well... By rights, she had a legitimate claim as High Queen of Skyrim.
But now Skyrim is at Ulfric's mercy.
The moot will meet and choose Ulfric as High King. With his troops in most of the cities, they have little choice.
Of course he does. What sort of a question is that?
Maybe you've been listening to Erikur. There's been loose talk among some of the Thanes, and I suspect he's the cause of it.
You'll pay those rumors no heed if you wish to retain your welcome in this city.
She may be young, but Elisif is the Jarl by right. And here in Skyrim, if nothing else, we respect the traditions of our father's fathers.
You'd do well to remember that.
Because killing her would yield no political advantage.
By leaving Elisif alive, Ulfric completes the separation of the Empire and Skyrim.
With Ulfric's troops here, Elisif will be forced to support his bid for High King. He secures the position and appears above reproach.
What's more, Ulfric's refusal to execute his slain enemy's wife will be portrayed as the ultimate act of compassion. Hmph. It's genius, really.
Oh, most certainly. At least, when Elisif herself asks.
If you're inquiring whether we have concerns about her age and inexperience, well, let me put it this way...
The Thanes have every confidence in General Tullius's leadership.
I don't suppose it matters much anymore.
As long as Ulfric wishes Elisif to remain Jarl, remain Jarl she will. And the Thanes will continue to follow her orders.
As long as those orders came from Ulfric.
Ulfric coveted the High King's throne. He thought he deserved it more than Torygg.
Now it would seem Ulfric has his wish. And there truly is no justice in the world.
Because that's what traitorous cowards do when they desire power.
Ulfric coveted the High King's throne. He thought he deserved it more than Torygg.
And so he came before my husband and he... he shouted. With that terrible voice. Like something out of a legend... Or a nightmare.
When Ulfric unleashed such fury, my husband he... he simply ceased to be.
That is all I will say, for it grieves me to speak of it.
Hmmm... A question I am all to familiar with. One my very Thanes ask often.
They worry that Tullius is so focused on the war, that he risks forgetting what's best for our people.
The real irony is that, while General Tullius is certainly no Nord, the people of Skyrim would be lost without him.
Trust is always difficult, especially for my people. Yet we must trust in Tullius' leadership. For what other choice do we have?
By Ysgramor!
For honor!
Glory awaits!
Yaaaargh!
Ffffeeeargh!
Rlyehhhgh1
Your depths will open to the mind!
Your length is cut!
Open to the will of Septimus!
Into the dark with you!
Cross the bridge at your own peril!
The way is dangerous, and the gate will not open. You shall not gain entry!
Welcome to the College of Winterhold. I am Faralda, one of the senior Wizards here.
I trust you found your journey to Winterhold not entirely unpleasant.
Now, I must advise you that if your only purpose in being here is to complain, you would be far better off speaking with the Jarl of Winterhold.
If, however, you seek something more, I will be happy to assist you.
Is there some way I can assist you?
Oh, forgive me.
Most who arrive here do so because they have heard of the College beforehand.
This is the College of Winterhold, a safe haven for mages in Skyrim. A place of wisdom and arcane knowledge.
It is no great secret that we have been unjustly blamed for a great many things over the years.
The good people of Skyrim on occasion would rather pass judgment than attempt to understand what we do here.
Thus we must take certain precautions in order to secure our safety.
I am here to assist those seeking the wisdom of the College.
And if, in the process, my presence helps to deter those who might seek to do harm, so be it.
The more important question is: why are you here?
Perhaps. But what is it you expect to find within?
It would seem that the College has what you seek. The question now is what you can offer the College.
Not just anyone is allowed inside. Those wishing to enter must show some degree of skill with magic.
A small test, if you will.
If you can pass the test, then yes.
I see. That power certainly exists, I assure you. Wield it faithfully, and few can withstand you.
Do you?
It is true there are some here who have spent years studying the accumulated knowledge of the scrolls.
But what you seek does not come easily, and can destroy those without a strong will.
Yes, the school of Illusion can be quite influential. Kings have risen to power because of it, and empires have been razed with it.
Shhhhhh...
Shhhhhh...
That's definitely going in my part of the Edda.
Sorry, I need to pay attention so I can remember this.
A man opens a gate and they cut his head off? Doesn't seem right to me.
I guess it's all over. I expected... I don't know what I expected.
Roggvir always talked about his honor. Seems to me honorable men don't get executed.
They should have drawn it out some more. He deserved a slower death.
Excuse me, I'm trying to watch a traitor to the Empire lose his head.
Roggvir... Why did it have to be like this?
That's my brother up there.
I still can't believe he knew what he was doing when he opened that gate...
Can we talk later?
Been hearing some strange tales of the Jarl's children. Say the one's turning wicked, and the others have an ill-favored look to them.
Best to keep clear.
Look at this. Cowards must have locked the place down after Skjor charged in. You can taste the fear.
There's a dead one, isn't there. Thought so.
Nobody we know, by the smell.
Some can't separate the animal from themselves. Go feral. This poor sod could have been anyone.
We should keep moving.
Nothing we can do for these ones now.
Don't even want to think about what those cretins did to them before they died.
No surprise they keep vermin around. Filthy squalor.
We're getting close now. Be careful. Their leader is a tricky one.
They call him [QUOTE]the Skinner.[QUOTE]
They call her [QUOTE]the Skinner.[QUOTE]
I don't think I need to tell you why.
Perhaps some other time.
I stand where I have always stood. Here in Morthal.
Now is not the time to fight amongst ourselves. I fear dark days approach and all of Skyrim's strength will be needed.
That's what many here wanted. A quiet life in a quiet place, without the noise or the trouble of a city.
Now some worry this wizard, Falion, will foul it all up.
The people still doubt me, don't they.
No, not at all. It's just...
It does not surprise me. They do not share in what I see, and I cannot explain it to them.
Just guide them well, and all will work out.
I have never doubted that, husband.
Have you made a decision about Falion?
What decision is there to be made? I allowed him to live here. I stand by that.
Yes, but there are concerns. Rumors that he's up to something.
We are all up to something, my dear. All is as it should be.
What troubles you, husband?
What? Oh, nothing. All is well.
It's Joric. I fear his condition is worse.
He calls out in his sleep sometimes. I've heard Falion's name. What does it mean?
Joric will be what Joric will be. Give it time.
Still, I fear there is some connection.
How's business?
Very funny.
No, I... I was just asking.
It's as bad as ever.
When are you gonna do somethin' to help Falion? Stop people sayin' things about him?
You have to understand, his presence here has caused... Well, it's difficult for the people to get used to.
They got used to Idgrod just fine, didn't they? So what's the difference?
Yes, well. Perhaps you're right.
What are you hiding, priest?
I'm not hiding anything. It's closed for a reason.
Typical Imperial lies. First you take away Talos, now you're keeping us from seeing our honored dead?
You and the Jarl will answer for any desecration of my ancestors' bodies.
The mine will be the talk of Skyrim soon, you'll see. It'll be the stuff of legends.
It's a matter of time before the Jarl is coming to me asking for money. This mine is going to make me... I  mean us, rich.
I know they laughed when I said I wanted to keep the mine open. I'll show them. I'll show them all.
You're welcome to look around, of course, but understand that this place belongs to me.
Thorgar says we'll find rocks soon, the kind worth gold.
I'm the best at breaking up rocks. Thorgar says so.
It's cold in the mine, but Thorgar really needs me, so I stay.
Be careful where you step in the mine. Don't want to cover up some valuable ore, or gems, or... Or something...
Any time I get tired of working, I just think that maybe that next swing will make me rich. It keeps me going.
It's going to happen soon, I just know it. We'll strike something better than iron. Silver, or maybe even gold. You'll see.
We were supposed to be rich by now, you know. Thorgar insisted we'd be swimming in gold.
I'm starting to think we might not even find iron in here. We've been at it for so long.
Is it still worth it? When do you decide enough is enough, and just walk away?
You can't catch me!
Hahaha!
<Giggling>
You're it!
Got you!
You're too slow!
I forget that you've never seen it. Beneath the Skyforge, where Eorlund works.
The door is hidden, but I will show you the way.
Aela will be joining us shortly. Once she's inside, we can follow.
Are you prepared?
Here's all you need to know. Jorrvaskr is the oldest building in Whiterun. The Skyforge was here long before it was.
And the Underforge taps an ancient magic that is older than men or elves.
We bring you here to make you stronger, new blood. Now let's move.
This is no test, new blood. This is a gift. Come inside.
I would hope you recognize Aela, even in this form.
She's agreed to be your forebear.
Are you prepared to join your spirit with the beast world, friend?
Very well.
Are you awake?
I was starting to think you might never come back.
You were born into the pack, brother.
You were born into the pack, sister.
I almost envy you. That first time is always the most... intense.
You gave us even more trouble than Farkas did at his first turning.
You have the blood of the wolf in you. You'll need to build up your strength before you can call on it again, though.
Just be careful where you do it. Some cowards in this land can't stand the sight of glory before them.
Nothing, until you choose to use it.
Then, well... you got a taste. Stronger, faster.
It doesn't last long, though. The blood of your foes can sustain you. If you're willing to feed.
Cure? Hah. You're sounding like the old man.
I... shouldn't say that.
I love Kodlak. I respect and follow him. But he's wrong on this. It's no curse. We're made into the greatest hunters in the land.
If he's worried about some mead-swilling afterlife in Sovngarde, he's free to pursue it. I'll take the glories of the hunt right here.
Oh! You got me!
Argh!
Ha! You caught me!
Hold it. This here's a toll road, see? Yer gonna have to hand over, say, 200 gold if you want to use our road.
Wise move. Now get out of here ya goat licker, before I decide the toll's gone up.
That's a real shame. Gonna make it hard for you to pay a healer after we cave your skull in.
Get on your way before I change my mind.
Go on. Get lost.
Should have left when you had the chance, friend. Now we're gonna have to spill your brains on the road here.
You know, now that I think of it, that sounds fair. Just shove off before the others notice.
Ha! Tough talk for someone who's about to have their guts spilled.
Eh, fine. I can tell you aren't worth the trouble. Just get out of here before I change my mind.
How does a knife in the gut sound? It's 200 gold or your life.
You mean they used a Shout to defeat Alduin? You're sure?
Hmm? Oh, yes. Presumably something rather specific to dragons, or even Alduin himself.
So you think that Alduin's Wall will tell us how to defeat Alduin?
Well, yes, but... there's no guarantee, of course.
Sky Haven Temple it is, then. I knew you'd have something for us, Esbern.
Always. Let's go see if we can find this Sky Haven Temple.
From Riverwood? The road south through Falkreath is the most direct route.
Or you could catch the carriage from Whiterun to Markarth and then approach from the west.
Either way, the Reach is wild country these days. The Forsworn are everywhere. Best be careful.
We'll meet you there. Be careful. That part of the Reach is rough country these days.
Yes, exactly. Well, I think so. It's certainly our best hope. The ancient Blades remembered much Akaviri dragonlore that has now been forgotten.
This is what I've been trying to explain. It's in Sky Haven Temple, an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach.
That's where we'll find Alduin's Wall.
Orgnar, this is it. The inn is yours. I'm probably never coming back here.
Well, now. That's something to think about.
Take care of yourself, Orgnar. Goodbye.
Yeah... sure. You, too, Delphine. You be safe.
Remember, this is where they recorded all they knew of Alduin and his return.
Thank you. Please, do not open it. It is... private.
I understand.
The Divines reveal things to me at times, yes. I do not hide this.
It is a gift. Anyone who believes otherwise does not and cannot understand it.
If you stand before me to accuse me of sacrificing children, or eating the hearts of the dead, you may save your breath.
I have done no such thing, nor do I intend to. I simply wish to live my life in peace.
The people of Morthal would much rather weave their own horrid tales about my life than simply ask me for the truth.
If they choose to fear me in their ignorance, that is their choice. But it will not change what is true.
I keep to myself. I offer spells and scrolls to those who need them, and wisdom in Conjuration magic for those who wish to learn.
Beyond that I seek only to be left alone to pursue my research.
You will not disrespect Jarl Idgrod while in this Hall. Do we have an understanding?
Then by all means, go about your business.
It's no secret that Jarl Idgrod is... different. It's also no secret that there are rumors about her and her visions.
I won't repeat them, and I won't allow them to be spread under this roof.
Now, you go about your business.
No? Then how do you like the idea of having your legs broken?
Mind your manners in this hall, friend.
Why, good evening Jonna!
Is it true that you kill deer and eat their hearts?
What? Where did you hear such a thing?
I don't know. Someone in town said it.
It's not true, I assure you.
Okay.
Don't believe everything you hear, child.
You are looking after your brother, yes?
Yes, mother.
Good. He must be kept safe from harm.
What sort of harm? Have you had a vision?
No, no. Just watch over him.
I will be Jarl someday, mother?
That is what the Divines have planned for you, yes.
Have you... Do you see that future? Will I be a good leader?
All things are possible, my child. But I believe it is within you to succeed.
You are troubled, Gorm.
No, no. I'm fine. Is there something you need?
No, Gorm. I am simply telling you what I see.
Yes, okay. Well thank you.
How are you feeling, Jarl Idgrod?
The visions continue to hold me in balance, Gorm.
So, the same then.
Do not worry, my friend. All is well.
All right, you want to go?
Watch it, there, brother.
Watch it, there, sister.
Look at that.
That someone would attack Jorrvaskr... it's unthinkable.
Hmm?
You don't look so good. Are you feeling all right?
You should probably be in bed. You're looking a bit under the weather.
How do you feel? I think you might be sick.
You look sick. I hope it's not contagious.
Are you feeling all right, dear? You look a little ill.
Don't take this the wrong way, but you look a little sickly.
You're looking a little rough around the edges. You feeling all right?
You look a bit peaked. You sure you shouldn't be home, in bed?
You look worse than I feel.
Are you feeling sick?
You look awful. Better not get me sick.
You all right? You look like you might be sick.
No offense, but you're not looking so good. Are you feeling ill?
Don't let Viola catch you in her house.
Sneak that ring back to Viola before we both get caught.
Have you taken care of that... little problem?
Remember. I need that bandit dead. Not alive.
Bandits are cowards. Don't strain yourself chasing them all down.
Show those marauders what Windhelm justice tastes like.
Vampires are clever hunters. More clever than you, definitely.
I want no mercy for those Forsworn. Understand?
Good luck with the giant. Don't get stepped on.
Execute every last bandit. Spare no one.
Retrieve that shield at all costs.
Come back as soon as you have the helm.
If you find that sword, please bring it to me.
If you find that ring, bring it here.
That journal means a lot to me, if you find it.
I do miss that helmet....
Hopefully, that story about Lenne's Shield is true.
Don't forget. You find Queen Freydis's Sword, I'll reward you.
This looks promising.
Yes. Definitely early Akaviri stonework here.
We've got to get this bridge down.
These pillars must have something to do with it.
Yes. These are Akaviri symbols.
Let's see... you have the symbol for [QUOTE]King[QUOTE]... and [QUOTE]Warrior[QUOTE]...
And of course the symbol for [QUOTE]Dragonborn.[QUOTE] That's the one that appears to have a sort of arrow shape pointing downward at the bottom.
Yes, that's it. The symbol on the pillar on the left.
Yes, that's it. The symbol on the middle pillar.
Yes, that's it. The symbol on the pillar on the right.
Given that Sky Haven Temple was sealed against the return of the Dragonborn, I would try turning all the pillars to that symbol.
Whatever you did, it worked. Let's see what else those old Blades left in our way.
Wait.
Why are you stopping?
We should be careful here. See these symbols on the floor?
Hmm, Esbern's right. Look like pressure plates.
I would suggest staying on the plates with the Dragonborn symbol.
Be careful.
There should be a way to turn this off.
We'll cross once it's safe.
Looks safe now. Let's move.
Yes, yes! I think we must be close to the entrance.
Esbern, look out!
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you?
What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
Yes. It's an altar. Men would come and sacrifice the wretched in my name. The weak would be punished by the strong.
But a Daedric Lord has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate the altar. Until you came.
Yes. Your reward is waiting for you, mortal. Further down.
Rusted. Dry. There was a time when this mace dripped with the blood of the feeble and the worthless.
But a Daedric Lord has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. Left it here to decay. Until you came.
Rescue? No one knew where I was, when I was taken. Who sent you?
The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal.
When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.
Now, I have a soul in Oblivion that needs claiming. Take care of the house while I'm gone. Ha ha ha!
Know your place, mortal. Or Molag Bal may just send another champion to claim his mace from your broken corpse.
Now, I have a soul in Oblivion to claim. Take care of the house while I'm gone. Ha ha ha!
Got a witchhunter in town, from the Priesthood of Stendarr. Keeps asking questions about that old abandoned house.
A witchhunter from the Priesthood of Stendarr is in town. He's asking a lot of questions about that old abandoned house.
We are on the hunt.
Meat from fresh kills.
What do you think you're doing, walking around dressed like a damn Stormcloak traitor?
You've got a lot of nerve, walking around here dressed like an Imperial Legionnaire.
Well. I'll let it slide this time. But you'd be smart to take that off. Someone might get the wrong idea.
Hmm. I still don't like it, but I guess I'll overlook it. This time.
You don't seem to realize there's a war on. What you are is a damn Imperial spy!
Is that right? Here's how the Legion deals with rebel scum like you.
I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood.
You sure you won't change your mind? Riverwood isn't far. I'm sure my sister will be glad to help you out.
See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. I never understood how my sister could stand living in the shadow of that place.
Remember, this isn't Stormcloak territory. If we're ahead of the news from Helgen we should be fine as long as we don't do anything stupid.
If we run into any Imperials, just let me do the talking, all right?
I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood.
You sure you won't change your mind? Riverwood isn't far. I'm sure my uncle will be glad to help you out.
See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. When I was a boy, that place always used to give me nightmares.
Listen, as far as I'm concerned you've already earned your pardon.
But until we get that confirmed by General Tullius, just stay clear of other Imperial soldiers and avoid any complications, all right?
I hear you've been busy of late.
Oh? Well, I won't turn down your money.
By helping me, you're helping the good folk of Whiterun. How could I say no to that?
I'll take your money, but I make no promises of a large return on your investment. These are troubled times, after all.
Splendid! With the extra coin, I'll be able to purchase twice the volume in supplies that I normally do.
I've been looking to expand the business, and your investment will certainly help with that. I accept!
Such an investment will mean that I can take better care of my family, as well as my customers.
An investment, is it? Alright, I'm sure I can put the extra money to good use.
Splendid! I've been looking for a new investor. Now it seems my search is over.
Come to see the hag with an offering of coin, then? So be it. I accept your investment.
Of course you want to invest in my business. I'm the finest blacksmith in all Skyrim.
How kind. At my age, I've certainly learned how to spend wisely.
You want to give me money? Just like that? Fine, but I intend to earn that investment. I don't need handouts.
Ah yes, good idea. Best to let a professional businessman handle that money for you.
You make an interesting offer. Very well, I'm sure that I can put the extra coin to good use.
An investment? Very well, I don't see why not.
You have my thanks, friend.
Ah, the sound of clinking coins. Even better, the sound of clinking coins in my hand!
I'll call upon my suppliers this very evening and arrange to double my orders.
I'll start planning how best to spend this. You have my thanks!
You'll look back on this as one of your best decisions, I swear it.
If you want to make the most of your investment, you'll come here to sell your goods.
Thank you so much! With this coin, I'll be able to double my stock.
Ah, look at the pretty, shiny coins. Now, how best to spend them?
If you have spare weapons and armor to sell, bring them here.
More coin means more supplies, and that means more useful balms, potions and remedies for everyone.
I'll work hard to justify your faith in me.
A wise choice, my friend. After all, what would a common adventurer know about the complexities of finance?
Wise is the one who spends a few coins now to make a fortune later.
Thank you. When I have the time, I'll try to think of how best to use this.
May prosperity bless us both!
Excellent. I think you'll be glad that you made this decision.
If you change your mind, you know where to find me.
Thank you. I'll be sure to put it to good use.
No! You'll never take me alive!
Take the money, just let us go...
Shut up or they'll kill us, you idiot! Once they're gone I'll pick the lock...
Come on... there! I got it, let's go!
Hey, Longhammer, set us up with a round of... what in Oblivion happened in here?
Hey! What the... keep your damn magic to yourself.
What the... Don't do that!
Keep your damn spells to yourself.
That was pathetic. It didn't even do anything.
Ah! Damn wizard. Keep your spells off of me.
Stop that! Keep your spells to yourself.
Don't try to magic me, you damn wizard.
Hey! What are you trying to pull?
Huh? Don't do that!
Don't know what that was, but don't try it again.
Hey! Stop that.
Magic is for the weak. Pick up some steel if you want to fight me.
Wizards. There oughta be a law against them.
Whoa, whoa, whoa? What did you do?
Ah! Keep your spells away from me.
Ah! Don't do that.
Ah! I'm just an old woman. Don't hurt me.
You stop that! I will not be violated by some... half-Septim magician!
Oh! What did you just do?
Hey! I didn't ask you to magic me.
Hey! Don't do that.
Ah! Picking on an old man? What did I ever do to you?
Oh! I don't feel any different. What did you do?
Stop it! I don't like magic.
Wow! That was fun. Do it again!
Ah Please! Don't hurt me!
You there! That was uninvited. No more.
What was that? Don't do it again.
Huh... what was that? What'd you do?
I did not ask for that! No more magic.
My thanks. I feel... better.
I suppose you think you're better than me because you can do that?
I hope you're not expecting a thank you.
A healing spell? Was that really necessary?
Huh. I feel better now.
My old bones don't hurt so much now.
Healing magic? An Orc lets her wounds heal naturally...
Huh? What...oh! That felt nice.
What...hey! That felt good.
No need to do that now.
Suddenly I feel much better.
You heal away my scars and there's gonna be a problem...
That put a spring in my step.
Hey! You trying to pull a fast one on me?
Save it for the battlefield.
I wasn't hurt, but that did make me feel better.
A healing spell? Are you a priest?
Don't go casting spells on a woman without asking her permission.
Thanks!
Hmm. Feel a bit better now. Thanks.
Was that some sort of... healing spell?
Thanks! Not sure it was necessary, though.
Healing spells always leave me light-headed...
Ah! What did you do? Stop that!
Mmm. That felt nice.
Ah! That felt refreshing.
Wow! What was that? Do it again!
Hey! My hangover is gone!
Ah! I feel like I just woke from a nap.
I...I'm fading away!
Now what am I supposed to do? I can't be seen in public like this. If I can even be seen at all...
You turned me invisible!
Not bad. Now turn me back.
I'm...I'm invisible!
What did ya do that for?
Bah! Save your magic. A warrior should face her foe, not hide from him.
Ooohh... The things I could do now...
Hey! Where did I go?
Magic! I'm not sure I approve.
You're a tricky one. Now fix it.
Hey! I can't see myself! What did you do to me?
Wizard tricks! An Orc faces the enemy. He doesn't hide from him.
Stop that! How can I do my job if I'm invisible?
Clever. To think, now I could... Well, never mind.
Ahhh... no one will know I'm here now.
What did you do to me? What am I made of? Air? Shadow? Oh, this is not good...
What the...I'm invisible!
Goodness!
What did you do! I'm...I'm see through! This better not be permanent. You can't just go around making women invisible like this!
Oh! I didn't expect that!
What have you done to me?
Hey! Where did I go? I can't see myself!
Hey! This could be handy!
Ah! I am now like the Shadowscales of old.
Hmm. I could be a great hunter like this.
Wow! I'm see through!
Hey! What did you do to me? My body is gone!
What? Do I have mead on my chin?
I'd appreciate if you don't bother my wife, Tova. She's still in mourning.
Oh, this pendant would look lovely on my sister.
By the Divines, the Forsworn are here in the city!
Everyone stay back. The Markarth city guard have this all under control. There are no Forsworn here.
By the gods, that man nearly killed me. You saved my life.
Thank you. Here, I was going to bring this to my sister, but I think you should have it.
Thank you again. I can't believe I was this close to being killed.
No. I don't have any idea. I was just shopping for a pendant for my sister back in the Imperial City.
I've heard of them. Something about the men who live in the hills and attack caravans.
I'm sorry. I don't know anymore. I'm just visiting here from Cyrodiil.
Don't come too close with that.
Get away from me!
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
That spell looks dangerous...
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Please! Keep that magic away from me.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
You really should be more careful with the spells you cast.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
You should be more careful with your spell casting.
You keep your distance with that magic
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Dear, that spell is making me nervous.
Hurt anyone with that spell and you'll be sorry.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Uuh. Would you mind dousing that magic?
It's wearing a dangerous spell...
That spell looks like it'll hurt.
That looks dangerous...
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Please stay away while you got that spell on you.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Don't hurt me!
Keep your distance.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Walking around like that is why magic gets a bad name. Shame on you.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
This one thinks you should be more careful with your spells.
You're asking for trouble walking around with dangerous magic like that.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
Do be careful with that spell, will you?
You better be careful with that magic, if you know what's good for you.
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
I trust you know what you're doing with that spell?
That spell looks dangerous... keep your distance.
We left to help with the war and these filth bags swooped in and seized the place.  My family is in there.
There's no way out. There's no way out....
Out the way we came. Hurry!
We're getting out of here. Now.
See if you can get the door open.
Something's going on here.
Eyes open.
Haven't you talked to Astrid? She's by the pool, greeting the Night Mother and her little jester. She has a contract for you. Come see me afterward.
Darling! I've been waiting for you to return, to consummate our love!
What? You want it for that hussy Esmerelda, with the dark feathers - don't you? I won't let her have you!
I've heard Jaree-Ra is hanging around the Wells District, looking for new blood to hire.
Yes, the claw. I know how it works. The claw, the markings, the door in the Hall of Stories. I know how they all fit together!
Help me down, and I'll show you. You won't believe the power the Nords have hidden there.
Does it look like I can move? You have to cut me down, first.
Sweet breath of Arkay, thank you.
This is Helgen. I used to be sweet on a girl from here. Wonder if Vilod is still making that mead with juniper berries mixed in.
Well, that's it. Sorry if it isn't the ceremony you were hoping for, but we're not exactly known for throwing our coin around.
After we're done here, head over to Tonilia and she'll set you up with your Guild Master Armor.
Oh, and one last thing. Here, I want you to take this. It's sort of a tradition around here.
Yes, and I'm more than happy to give it to you.
I mean look at this place. I've never seen so much wealth down here. You've made us all rich.
Here you go... should fit you like a glove... boss.
I had another run-in with the Thieves Guild.
Be careful, Mjoll. The Thieves Guild has Maven Black-Briar at her back.
One snap of her fingers, and you could end up in Riften Jail... or worse.
They represent the reason I'm here. I can't just ignore them, Aerin.
I know. I just don't want you to leave; you're the only good thing that's happened to this city in a long time.
I'll meet you outside!
Oh, really? You're just like my brother. Fine, but if you change your mind, I'll be right here.
What? Who is this, Brother? Another of the smooth skins looking for food? But this one wasn't trapped with us...
Thank you for your help with Vals. Please, take this and leave me to see to Aunt Agna and my other family members.
Oooh... pretty colors.
What a display of color!
Oh, such colors!
Is that magic? Careful, please...
Oh, look at the colors!
Wow! Look at all the colors!
Colorful...
Whoa.
Brilliant!
Keep that magic away from me.
Well hey, that's not something you see every day.
Guard. Prepare the prisoner.
I don't need your help.
Thank you for your time.
Very well, Roggvir. Bow your head.
Not right now.
A traitor right up to the end.
I've been waiting for Roggvir's execution. Talk to me later.
Go away.
They can't hurt uncle Roggvir. Tell them he didn't do it.
Of course! You don't remember getting here.
Svari, you need to go home. Go home and stay there until your mother comes.
You should tell her that her uncle is scum that betrayed his High King. Best she know now, Addvar.
You're all heart, Vivienne.
No! Aunt Agna! Talos, why didn't I go in with her?
He's barred the door. Gods only know how he's... defiling the bodies of my ancestors in there!
Agna once told me there is a secret room deeper in where they buried disgraced members of the family. Maybe that will get us into the main chamber...
This looks like the area Agna told me about. She said that the bear would show the way...
You found it! The passage goes through the sarcophagus... I don't like this... but we'd better keep going.
We're not killing them, they were already dead. We're helping them back to Sovngarde.
Vals Veran will die for what he's done.
That dark elf is about to be a dead elf.
The dead should be made to serve the living, not the other way around!
Sovngarde is a myth, you s'wit! And now you can join your ancestors in service to me!
I'll return my ancestors to Sovngarde, and you with them!
I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat.
Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
You look like someone who can hold their liquor. How about a friendly contest to win a staff?
Ha! We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started.
Well come back when you do, my friend. Come back when you do.
I'll start round one. Down the hatch!
Your turn!
One down, my friend. One down.
Sorry to hear that.
And another one for me.
And how about you?
So says you. I think I've hit my limit on these things. Tell you what, one more and you win the contest.
Awww, well, maybe next time.
Wow. You've really done it. The staff is yours.
You know, you're a fun person to drink with. I know this great little place where the wine flows like water. We should head there.
Hey, you don't look so good...
Those born with the Dragon Blood in 'em. Like old Tiber Septim himself.
What do you say, Irileth? You're being awfully quiet.
Come on, Irileth, tell us, do you believe in this Dragonborn business?
Hmph. Some of you would be better off keeping quiet than flapping your gums on matters you don't know anything about.
But I don't need some mythical Dragonborn. Someone who can put down a dragon is more than enough for me.
That was Shouting, what you just did! Must be. You really are Dragonborn, then...
Here's a dead dragon, and that's something I definitely understand. Now we know we can kill them.
If you really are Dragonborn, like out of the old tales, you ought to be able to Shout. Can you? Have you tried?
Go ahead... try to Shout.
Have you tried to Shout?
They say the Dragonborn can Shout without any training. Like Talos himself...
I've heard the Empire plans to levy a tax on our trading ships. Falk, you've got to do something about this.
General Tullius needs more money for the war effort. We need the funds to arm and provision more troops.
Then let's increase the taxes on the farms and merchants. We can't afford to lose the loyalty of the ship captains.
We know full well about your investment in shipping ventures, Erikur.
I've also heard troubling rumors about dealings between you and the crew of that pirate ship, the Red Wave.
Thankfully, Jarl Elisif cares far less about your lost profits than she does about winning the war!
The Jarl would be wise to remember that it is her thanes - and my profits - that are paying for this war.
There's something that's been troubling me, Falk. I am hesitant to share it, but I feel that I must.
Speak your mind, Bryling. You're among friends here.
You know that I support the Empire, as we all do. However, I fear General Tullius is underestimating the Stormcloaks.
Too often the general has lost good soldiers because he did not take Ulfric and his men seriously.
If this continues, and the worst comes to pass, Solitude will pay the price. The Empire is headquartered here, after all.
We don't have the luxury of hanging back to see who wins before choosing our friends, Bryling. You know this.
And besides, no Nord with a shred of honor would consider it. We're no cowards.
Yes, of course, but Ulfric's message is a powerful one. More of our people flock to his cause every day.
Have faith, Bryling. When this war is over and Ulfric is dead, you'll see that you were jumping at shadows, and nothing more.
It's nearly time to collect taxes on your properties here in the city, Bryling.
We'll need to visit each home for an assessment.
Is it that time again already?
Very well, let's meet this evening and make the arrangements.
Oh, well done. Very subtle.
I beg your pardon?
Oh, I'm sorry, did I imply that you'd be meeting for purposes other than court business? You must forgive me.
Hold your tongue, Wizard, or you're likely to lose it.
I should very much like to see you try it, my dear steward.
Stop it, both of you. You're acting like children.
Steward Falk, I have a task for you.
I want to begin stockpiling food and water in the event we come under siege, and I would like you to oversee this work personally.
A wise course of action, my Jarl. However, we have little food or water to spare.
General Tullius will never allow that. He's ordered all surplus food to be given over for the war effort.
General Tullius does not run this city, Thane Erikur. Or have you forgotten your oaths of fealty?
My apologies, Jarl Elisif. I was thinking only of the importance of the war effort.
There's no need for an apology, and you're right about the war.
Perhaps this is a matter best discussed with with the general in person.
I will make the arrangements, my Jarl.
Steward, I have an idea that might help to bolster the morale of our people in this difficult time.
I think we shall have a grand parade, and let General Tullius march his troops from the Blue Palace to Castle Dour in all their finery.
What a... fine idea, my Jarl. However, I would suggest we wait until the war has ended.
After all, the General needs his soldiers out in the field, fighting battles against the Stormcloaks.
I must protest, my Jarl.
A parade would make you an easy target for a Stormcloak assassin. You're safer here in the palace.
Oh, very well. I can see there's no changing your stubborn Nord minds.
But when this war is won, I will have my parade!
Yes, my Jarl.
We lost another five guardsmen, my Jarl.
If General Tullius continues to conscript our men and send them off to battle, we'll have none left to protect the city.
Yes, I know. The general acted with my blessing.
It is vital that we bring Ulfric to justice, but that cannot happen until his army of Stormcloaks is defeated utterly.
Told you that, did he?
I'm sworn to protect you, my Jarl, but I'm the last line of defense.
The first line is the walls around this city and the men who patrol them.
Men who, I might add, we're precious short on.
I'm aware of that, Bolgeir, and I appreciate your dedication.
However, if we lose the war, the guardsmen of Solitude will make little difference in the end.
No disrespect toward the general, but sometimes I wonder if he's got your best interests at heart.
In any case he won't be turnin' me into no Imperial soldier. I know my place, and it's at your side.
It comforts me to know that, Bolgeir.
Old Nord sacrifice place. Be careful around here. Let's look for a way to open the bars.
Ah, the ceremonial juncture. The old Nords used to do sacrifices here. Look around for a way to open those bars.
The only thing I heard is a rumor that a boy named Aventus Aretino, in Windhelm, has been attempting to contact the Dark Brotherhood.
He used to live here in Riften at the Orphanage on the other side of town but I think he ran away. Can't say I blame him.
They call me Dirge, 'cause I'm the last thing you hear before they put you in the ground.
Why? You think it's funny or something?
What, you still think it's funny?
I already told you. They call me Dirge, 'cause I'm the last thing you hear before they put you in the ground.
Oh yeah? I think so too. You're pretty smart.
Hey, here. Have one on the house.
Good. Now shut up and get out of my face.
No, no. Sorry if I sounded so mean there. My brother always said I have a big mouth.
Here, have one on me.
Yeah, my problem is I'm too tired to punch your face in.
Already did.
Maul? Yeah. That jerk works for Maven Black-Briar now. Left me down here watching this garbage heap.
I guess he's better at all that talking stuff anyway. I'd just mess everything up.
The Akaviri blood seal can only be opened with the right kind of blood. Your blood, Dragonborn.
We should be careful. There's no telling what traps and wards the ancient Blades may have set.
The entrance must be past the Forsworn camp. Look for a canyon or cave entrance into the Karthspire.
Ah, yes. The entrance seems to be near what's now known as the Karthspire. We'll have to see what we find when we arrive.
Very good. I'll trust you to get there in one piece. Don't be long.
Your call. Might be safer to travel separately - attract less attention that way.
Don't worry, I'll get Esbern there in one piece. We'll wait for you near Karthspire. Good luck.
Well...that's disappointing. This one didn't survive the fall either.
No matter. Another one will be along any time now.
I'm sorry! This isn't what I want!
I don't want to do this!
I don't have any choice! I'm sorry!
Is someone there? Stay back! I don't want to attack you.
Stay away!
Stay back or I'll be forced to attack you!
Are you a member of the College, or did you just steal those robes from a real wizard?
You must be one of those wizards. From the College in Winterhold.
Wow! Look at that robe. Are you a wizard?
Those are College of Winterhold robes, aren't they?
Fancy robes. You a wizard or somethin'?
I like your robes. Are you a sorcerer? From the College?
It will keep it's hands to itself, yes?
Umm... are you in trouble? Is that why you're hiding like that?
I hope you're not planning on picking my pocket.
What? Why are you skulking about like that?
Look at you, up to no good.
You remind me of the Shadowscales, from the old histories.
Are you playing hide and seek?
I trust you aren't considering any... thievery.
You're not a thief trying to rob me, right?
You trying to hide? 'Cause I can see you plain as day.
You're a bad sneak. You're not creeping up on anybody like that.
You, my friend, need practice...
Can you help me? He's in the tomb doing Gods know what with my dead relatives.
Vals Veran. My family has never really seen eye to eye with him and he has finally gone off the deep end.
He's gone in to defile our family tomb by using our ancestors for his filthy dark elf necromancy.
No offense, I mean I'm sure you aren't into any of that kind of stuff.
My aunt went in after him, but she hasn't come out yet and I'm afraid to go in by myself.
My aunt went in after him, but she hasn't come out yet and I don't think I can take him by myself.
Fine, but I've locked the door so don't think you're getting in there without me.
Where is he? The one who was asking about the fugitive hiding in the Ratway?
You're in the wrong place to be asking those kind of questions, pal.
No. Not yet.
You'd better clear out before someone gets hurt.
Your lack of cooperation has been noted. We'll be back if we require further information. You won't get a second chance.
The answer ain't gonna be any different the next time. Arrogant elven bastard.
I'm... I'm sorry you had to see that.
I hope I didn't scare you.
It's a blessing given to some of us. We can be like wild beasts. Fearsome.
Come on now, you're a sharp one. You must have heard of werewolves before.
It's a blessing given to the most honored of the Companions.
Oh, no. Only the Circle have the beastblood. Prove your honor to be a Companion.
[QUOTE]Eyes on the prey, not the horizon.[QUOTE]
No, only members of the Circle get this blessing. Right now we're just seeing if you're worth keeping around.
Breathe deep, mortal. I would have you hear me well, so let these vapors fill your lungs.
I have watched you for some time, you know. The decisions you've made intrigue me, and I wonder if you are the proper agent for a task of mine.
In a sense, but no more poisoned than a fool after too much wine.
Well. You must have all those annoying gods on your side to have made it this far, whoever you are. Even I have to admit, that's pretty impressive.
You had your chance to talk!
We could always use help picking crops if you need a few extra coins.
Mining is hard work, but we pay a fair price for any ore you dig up.
Are you looking to work? The mines are nearby. You bring me ore, I'll give you coin.
I'll buy everything you've dug up.
There is an empty home in the city, but there was some... unpleasantness recently. I'm afraid it's not available just yet.
It's abandoned and it's always been abandoned.
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave?
Seems no one in this city has.
I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.
You there. Are you here to kill me? Slay the mighty Logrolf while he sits tied and helpless?
Praise to you, champion!
Ah, the new disciple. I hear you have quite the appetite.
It's an honor, Keeper of the Ring.
You've brought us quite the meal.
You were given Namira's ring? A great honor.
I remember my first feast. I envy you.
I'm so glad Eola invited you to dinner.
Namira spoke to you? I knew this feast was going to be something.
Now this is going to be a good feast.
Ah, yes. The courier. I guess you know my secret ingredient for that spiced beef, now.
You buy a war dog from me? There's a reason why my hounds are so eager to bite into people.
That's right. You're the sellsword. Thank you again. It's so nice to have help with my husband gone. Shame what happened to him.
One of my customers? Did you know I inherited the store from my late husband? Shame what happened to him. He had such good taste.
[QUOTE]The bloodiest beef in the Reach![QUOTE] Ha ha ha.
Shh. You mustn't speak about such things away from the shrine. Only you and your dinner guests can know.
Better if we don't talk about that. As far as anyone's concerned, we all had dinner at a nice inn along the road, and nothing strange happened.
Don't go talking about that. Only the dinner guests can know.
It's so good to have everyone around the table again.
Eola is a fine host. She really keeps the faithful together.
I'm just glad we had this, now. I was almost getting ready to eat my servant and blame it on the Forsworn.
When was your first meal, Banning?
Do dogs count?
Of course they don't count!
My friend Marex. We were hunting, and I thought he was an elk.
That must have been quite a surprise.
Either way, I came back with meat for the table.
The toes are my favorite part. I hope I get to take a few home with me.
I always preferred the liver myself. My brother had such a juicy liver.
Thank you for coming to dinner, Hogni.
I never miss a good meal.
This is lovely, as always, Eola.
Thank you, Lisbet. It's been such a joy to dine with you all these years.
Not too full on bread and wine, I hope?
I always leave room for the main course, Eola.
Oh my, yes. I absolutely love weddings. I haven't found my special someone yet, but there's still hope. Vittoria is, well, getting up in years...
Am I! Free food and wine, and nobody trying to throw me in the dungeon. I wish they did weddings here every day.
Not really. It's just a bunch of elders standing around, looking important. I wish something exciting would happen.
Oh. Why... why certainly. I keep telling myself I'm not losing a son, I'm gaining an Imperial. Daughter. An Imperial daughter...
No, I'm not having a good time. My boy just married a gods-forsaken Imperial. Skyrim is full of eager Nord women, and he beds down with the enemy.
The best. Vittoria's a good woman. Any man should be so lucky. I know my father's not happy about me marrying an Imperial, but that's his problem.
I most certainly am not. I've just lost my daughter to a Nord beast, and my nephew Titus is too busy playing Emperor to even show up.
I am, thank you. I do so enjoy singing at weddings. It's just one of the many duties we at the Bards College are called upon to perform.
So far. I just hope things remain calm. Wine gets drunk, tempers flare. This may be a joyous celebration, but it's shadowed by a lot of animosity.
Oh, yes. Presiding over the union of two lovers is one of my greatest responsibilities. It helps that Asgeir and Vittoria truly care for each other.
She's dead! On my watch! This won't stand!
I'm just here to provide protection for his eminence's cousin. Please, enjoy yourself.
Now look what you've gotten yourself into. No worries. Just sit tight. I'll find the release.
Just how long did you expect me to keep those people distracted? I had to let the whole plan fall through.
Well, at least you didn't do anything stupid. Next time, when you're given a job, don't wander off or take your sweet time.
I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Nothing around here has been going well lately.
Are you daft? This isn't the Dark Brotherhood! We don't go around murdering anyone, ever. It just isn't how things are done.
I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Nothing around here has been going well lately.
I guess I expected too much from you.
Looks like I chose the right person for the job.
It's good we hold the Reach. Were the rebels to gain control, the silver mines would give them coin to hire more thugs and expand their violence.
It was important we reclaimed the Reach. Letting Ulfric control the flow of silver was a mistake. One I'm glad we've finally corrected.
We need to stem the flow of silver to the rebellion. Until we retake the Reach, the Stormcloaks will plunder it's mines to fund further violence.
Hjaalmarch is an important buffer zone between the rebel forces and the capital. Ulfric will try to break through at some point.
Reclaiming Hjaalmarch lets me worry less about the rear guard, and push more men to the front. It was a mistake to let Ulfric control it for so long.
I'm losing my patience with this damn war. We must take Hjaalmarch back! The Stormcloaks will be beating upon the doors of the capital soon.
Ulfric will want to take Whiterun from us. But we will hold fast. We can't give the rebellion free reign through the center of Skyrim.
I can't believe we lost Whiterun. The rebels have a great advantage in controlling the center now. We must take it back!
By holding onto Falkreath, we control access to the Reach, Whiterun, and the Rift. Ulfric will try for it soon. We'll be there to stop him.
By taking back Falkreath, we control access to the Reach, Whiterun, and the Rift. We should never have given it up.
I fear losing Falkreath may give too much advantage to Ulfric. The rebels now control access to the Reach, Whiterun, and the Rift. I want it back.
Taking the Pale gives us another port in Dawnstar, and puts us within striking distance of Windhelm. That should make Ulfric a bit more cautious, eh?
Controlling the Pale gives Ulfric a port town and takes the pressure off of Windhelm. But it's only a matter of time before it's back in our hands.
Now that we have Winterhold, I can garrison some troops there until I'm ready to march on Windhelm.
There's not much up there, but if we can regain Winterhold, our proximity to Windhelm should keep Ulfric wary and wasting troops garrisoned at home.
I almost can't believe it's over. The rebellion is squashed, Windhelm is free. I must admit, Ulfric put up a stronger fight than I was expecting.
We will oust Ulfric from Windhelm soon enough. And when we do, I'll have his head on a plate.
Taking control of the Rift was a great victory. Ulfric must be rather nervous with us so close to his door step.
We need the Rift. We need to regain control of it before we can march on Windhelm without worry about our rear guard.
I almost can't believe it. The Empire has been defeated. The world bears witness to the power and righteousness of the sons and daughters of Skyrim.
Soon enough we will march on Solitude. And on that day the heroes of Sovngarde will march with us, and the Empire will fall to its knees in fear.
Now that the Empire has been driven from the Reach we can put a stop to the raping of her silver mines. That silver belongs in Skyrim.
The Empire's ravenous hunger for Skyrim's silver makes them fierce. But rest assured, we'll win the Reach and wrest it from their greedy paws.
Tullius must be getting nervous. Taking Hjaalmarch we're practically in his backyard now. As soon as we're able, we'll march on Solitude.
We should take Hjaalmarch. It'll be an important pressure point on the Imperials. We'd be within spitting distance of the capital.
We've driven the Imperials out of Whiterun. This is good. Very good. We now control the center. It's a powerful position. One I aim to keep.
The Imperials have really dug into Whiterun. We'll wrest it from them soon enough. We must. Its central position is key.
I'm proud we liberated Falkreath from the Empire. In many ways it's the heart and soul of Skyrim. Not to mention its rather strategic position.
The Empire thinks it holds Falkreath from us. But the souls of Skyrim's bravest are buried there and will fill our hearts and strengthen our blades.
Tullius has camps in the Pale, entertaining thoughts of battle. The Empire still underestimates the force of our cause. It will be their undoing.
I'm glad we've finally restored the Pale. It was extremely foolish giving the Empire control of another port.
I can't believe we let them take the Pale. Losing the port of Dawnstar is lessened only by the threat of Imperial forces being so close to Windhelm.
I'm not sure why Tullius is wasting his time trying to take Winterhold from us. But if he wants to throw his men away, I'll gladly accept that gift.
I'm glad we've taken back Winterhold. While the Imperials were up there, important resources were tied up stiffening our northern border.
I don't like Imperial troops holed up in Winterhold... such a close march to Windhelm. So I'm sending a campaign up there to take it back.
Damn Tullius. He's pocketed men in the Rift. It's dangerous having Imperials skulking about on the southern border of Eastmarch.
I'm glad we liberated the Rift. It was dangerous having Imperials skulking about on the southern border of Eastmarch.
Losing the Rift gives Tullius easy access to the south of Eastmarch. Talos preserve us. We must take it back!
I'm promoting you to Quaestor.
Take this blade, a symbol of your new station and responsibility. I'll keep an eye on your progress. The Empire rewards excellence, and so do I.
Battles are won by trained and disciplined men. Wars are won by talented and exceptional individuals.
I'm raising you to Praefect. Take this blade, as a gift and symbol of your new rank. You've earned it.
You've come a long way. I don't think we could do without you. I'm hereby raising you to Tribune. Congratulations.
Here, take this gift as a sign of the Empire's appreciation, and my own.
I have come to rely heavily upon you. It is only fitting that you join the upper echelon. I am hereby elevating you to the rank of Legate.
On behalf of the Empire, and myself, please accept this gift along with your new rank.
Congratulations.
However, I'm disappointed to hear that you fled from the field of battle. We do not reward cowardice in the Legion. I expect better of you.
We'll call you Ice-Veins now, for the thick blood of our land has seeped into your heart.
Here, take this. It's an Imperial officer's sword. A fitting weapon to use against our enemy.
Some brothers have taken to calling you Bone-Breaker, evidence of your ferocity and determination. A fitting name. So we shall all call you thus.
The war demands so much from us, and we give all we have to it and to the people... but I've kept a little something to offer you in appreciation.
Please take this on behalf of all the brothers and sisters.
And I need capable and loyal warriors close at hand. So I'd like to offer you a home in Windhelm. Speak with my steward who'll make the arrangements.
Multitudes of our enemies are buried in an avalanche of pain and retribution delivered by your hands. I shall call you Snow-Hammer now.
You show great passion for battle, and compassion for those we fight for. You are becoming indispensable to our cause.
We do what we do out of love for our brothers and sisters. Here, take this as a token of such love reciprocated.
You've become a true hero of Skyrim. I number you among my kin. You shall now be known as Stormblade.
The love of the land and her people flows from your heart, even as death to her enemies flows from your hands.
On behalf of the sons and daughters of Skyrim, on behalf of all that is righteous and true, take this token of our appreciation for your service.
But I'm disappointed to hear you ran away from the battle. The gods do not reward cowardice. Nor do I. I expect better from you.
We found this in the Jarl's treasury after we captured the city. I thought you should be the one to have it.
We found this in the Jarl's treasury after we captured the capital. I thought you should be the one to have it.
Found this among the dead. Something tells me I should give it to you.
Here. I want you to have this. Don't ask. Just take it.
I've come to rely on you. There's something I want you to have. It was my father's. It would be my honor if you carried it.
Something to report?
The General and I have our disagreements, but he's the best hope for both the Empire and Skyrim.
Many of my countrymen joined the rebels. They can't see the big picture. Skyrim needs the Empire as much as it needs us.
Make it quick. I get enough delays from politicians.
I trust this is something important?
There isn't someone less busy who can help you?
The boss is going to cut those creepy cave people to pieces!
Yeah! It'll teach them to steal from us! One of them took my good helmet.
I hope one comes running up here so I can stab it right in the face.
I would be fine if they didn't.  Have you seen their eyes? They don't have any! Gross.
La la la, la la la, la la la, la la la la. La la la, la la la la la laaaaaahhhh...
La la la, do do do do do, dum de dum dum...
Dum, di di dum, dum di dum, dum di di di di dum da da dum.
Ba ba ba, bum ba, ba ba ba, bum ba, ba da da da, dum da da...
Dum, di di dum, dum di dum, dum di di di di dum da da dum.
Vittoria! No!
Aaaaiiiiieeee!
What treachery?
The bride has been murdered! Somebody help!
No! Noooooooo!
I daresay you've learned all I can teach you.
