But... That doesn't mean there isn't more out there.
Over the years I've heard things. Powerful magics lost to the ages, incredible spells that only the most skilled mages can master.
This is the only thing I've ever found. I think it's better off in your hands.
What brings you here?
A dragon?
What?
Now we're in for it.
Shut up.
No, Housecarl!
No!
We're with you!
Yeah!
We're so dead...
Yeah!
Let's move out.
Gotta have a sharp axe to cut through all that fat...
Hurry up with it, we've got a merchant in the pit to take care of after we carve this thing up.
If there's nothing else, I really must ask you to leave.
I really appreciate what you've done for me. I'll never forget it.
Anything you can find would be of great help. Good luck.
Keep your eyes to the road.
Thanks again for the ice wraith teeth.
Be careful looking for those teeth... those little bastards are dangerous.
Keep your belly full and your shoulders strong.
Come back when you're ready to spend more gold... goodness knows I could use it.
Safe travels, landstrider.
Good journey, marsh-friend.
Return anytime. You're quite welcome here.
Remember, nothing but genuine fire salts will do... the forge knows the difference.
If you need any more smithing work, come see me again.
Thanks for your business.
It was nice to meet you.
Be careful out there... Riften can be dangerous.
Door's over there. Why don't you use it?
Come back and see us again.
Just get out of here.
If you'll excuse me, I have other things to attend to.
Imperial bastard.
Farewell, kinsman.
Support Ulfric or die trying. There's nothing in between.
Talos preserve you.
Talos guide you.
Farewell.
It's been good talking to you.
Good, now maybe I can get back to work.
Well, that was important.
Come back and see us again!
Travel safe.
Remember to give at the temple.
Excuse me.
When I find that bitch, I'm going to wring her little neck.
Visit me anytime. I'm not going anywhere soon.
I believe we're done.
Out of my way.
Don't forget to check your supply chest from time to time.
My experiments can't be completed until you've brought me those ingredients. Do hurry.
Now was it two parts giant lichen or three? Hm...
You'd do well to remember who's really in charge around here.
You'd do well to remember who's in charge around here.
May you return to Her Benevolence in safety.
You represent Mara now. Set an example for all.
Good journey, my child!
I don't know why I bother.
Try and get those marks without violence please. I don't want to be responsible for their deaths... or yours.
Sure, leave. Not like you care anyway.
Remain vigilant and don't trust anyone.
You've been kind, I thank you.
Any healing potion will do. Please hurry.
What am I going to do?
A Dreth never forgets a friend.
Remember, keep this to yourself.
Please, come back and speak to me anytime.
Be cautious, the pilgrimage to the Shrine is not an easy one.
I'd ask you maintain civility while you're here.
Good journey to you.
You're welcome in Riften as long as you continue to obey our laws.
I'm keeping my eye on you.
I have to remember... ward first, then summon.
Okay, now where did I put those spiders?
I see I still have much to learn. Lead on.
Please be careful, I don't wish to be the reason for your death.
Just stay away from me and I'll forget we had this discussion.
Safe travels.
Watch yourself around here, it isn't safe.
Yes, yes... goodbye.
You didn't need to leave so soon.
Give Vex a kiss for me.
Be careful, the road to Shor's Stone could be dangerous.
Don't forget us if you need supplies for your journey.
Honored guests.
Good people of Solitude.
Good friends and neighbors.
I just wanted to take this time to thank you all for being here. To thank you for sharing this wonderfully happy day with myself, and my new husband.
Are you all enjoying yourselves? Please, eat, drink, and make merry on this most happy of days.
My husband Aesgir and I thank you for coming to our reception. We thank you for sharing the love we have for each other.
Today, the problems of Skyrim are not my problems. Nor are they yours. Today we are joined in peace and happiness. So please, enjoy yourselves.
These days, it seems there is dread everywhere, whether it be war or dragon. But I beg you - here, today, put such fears aside. Enjoy yourselves!
In this courtyard, there are no Stormcloaks. There are no Imperials. There are only people, come to celebrate a union of two souls. So make merry!
I thank you all again for making this the best wedding a woman could ask for.
You have all helped make this a truly extraordinary wedding. All of my dreams have come true. So thank you. Thank you all.
May you all be as happy in your lives as I know I will be in mine. Thank you again for everything.
I guess we should have expected this response, hmm?
Astrid ordered me to keep an eye on you. Figured you could use a hand when the chaos erupted.
I'll try and hold them off as best I can. You get back to the Sanctuary!
We'll meet back up at the Sanctuary! I'll be fine. Go!
Do not be afraid. Your Shout will not harm us.
Shout at us, and let us taste of your Voice.
Strike us with the power of your Voice.
Let's make sure that overgrown lizard is really dead.
Damned good shooting, boys!
Is it really dead?
We killed it! I can't believe it!
I thought we were all dead for sure!
Look at that!
Everybody get back!
What's happening?!
Dragonborn? What are you talking about?
That's right! My grandfather used to tell stories about the Dragonborn.
I never heard of Tiber Septim killing any dragons.
There weren't any dragons then, idiot. They're just coming back now for the first time in... forever.
But the old tales tell of the Dragonborn who could kill dragons and steal their power. You must be one!
No signs of any dragon right now, but it sure looks like he's been here.
Spread out and look for survivors. We need to know what we're dealing with.
But I still hear the call of the blood.
We all do. It is our burden to bear. But we can overcome.
You have my brother and I, obviously. But I don't know if the rest will go along quite so easily.
Leave that to me.
Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you.
Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
Master, you're not truly considering accepting him?
Master, you're not truly considering accepting her?
I am nobody's master, Vilkas. And last I checked, we had some empty beds in Jorrvaskr for those with a fire burning in their hearts.
Apologies. But perhaps this isn't the time. I've never even heard of this outsider.
Sometimes the famous come to us. Sometimes men and women come to us to seek their fame. It makes no difference.
What matters is their heart.
And their arm.
Oh you're back. Do you still think you could stand as a Companion?
Of course. How are you in a battle, boy?
Of course. How are you in a battle, girl?
That may be so. This is Vilkas. He will test your arm.
Calm down there, whelp. Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake.
Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
That's the spirit. Vilkas, here, will get started on that.
Not here. Out in the yard. Come on.
The old man said to have a look at you, so let's do this.
Just have a few swings at me so I can see your form. Don't worry, I can take it.
Not bad. Next time won't be so easy.
Now that's impressive. You're mightier than you look.
What do you think this is? We don't do battle with magic around here, new blood. Now come at me.
Come on now, fight your own battles.
I'm guessing you're the newcomer then?
Oh, don't worry too much about it. They were all whelps once. They just might not like to talk about it.
And don't always just do what you're told. Nobody rules anybody in the Companions.
Not actually a Companion myself, but none of them know how to work a forge properly, and I'm honored to serve them.
My name is Eorlund Gray-Mane. I work the Skyforge. Best steel in all of Skyrim. All of Tamriel.
That attitude would get you far, if you were some stuffy merchant or a Jarl's footstool.
Around here, you'll want to learn to live your own life. Remember, nobody rules anybody in the Companions.
Well, I'm not sure how they've managed it, but they have. No leaders since Ysgramor.
Kodlak is the Harbinger, and he's a sort of advisor for the whole group, but every man is his own. Every woman, her own.
I have a favor to ask.
This isn't a command. Just decency. Help out an old blacksmith. I've got to get back to my work.
That's a good man.
Well done.
Ah, good. I've been waiting for this. Good to see you made it up here.
Ah, good. I've been waiting for this. Wait... I remember you. So the old man thinks you've got some heart, I guess.
Ah, good. I've been waiting for this. Are you new here?
You know this one? I saw him training in the yard with Vilkas.
You know this one? I saw her training in the yard with Vilkas.
I told you, this is the whelp that Vilkas mentioned.
Ah, yes. I heard you gave him quite a thrashing.
Don't let Vilkas catch you saying that.
There you are. I had wondered where you got to.
Do you think you could handle Vilkas in a real fight?
Ah, a man of action.
Ah, a woman who lets her actions speak for her. I knew there was something I liked about you.
Woah, ease up there. We're rough, but there's no need to kill a Shield-Brother over a dispute.
I like your fire, though. You'll make a fierce Companion. Let us hunt together sometime.
Here, let's have Farkas show you where you'll be resting your head.
Farkas!
Did you call me?
Of course we did, icebrain.
Show this new blood where the rest of the whelps sleep.
New blood? Oh, I remember you. Come on, follow me.
New blood? Oh, hello. I'm Farkas. Come, follow me.
Skjor and Aela like to tease me, but they are good people.
They challenge us to be our best.
Nice to have a new face around. It gets boring here sometimes.
I hope we keep you. This can be a rough life.
The quarters are up here. Just pick a bed and fall in it when you're tired.
Tilma will keep the place clean. She always has.
All right, so here you are. Looks like the others are eager to meet you.
Come to me or Aela if you're looking for work.
Once you've made a bit of a name for yourself, Skjor and Vilkas might have things for you to do.
Good luck. Welcome to the Companions.
You've already turned down a job that I had for you.
Work needs doing, and if you're not up to it, maybe you're not cut out to be a Companion.
Be cautious. Beasts are not nearly as predictable as men. Give the thing a quick death.
Good. I knew that we could count on you. It's simply a beast, but be cautious. The beasts of Skyrim are made of sterner stuff than most.
I knew we could count on you. Get it taken care of right away. Nobody wants an animal left roaming around in their place.
You're not afraid, are you? Of animals? Come back when you find your spine.
Unfortunate, but someone else will take care of it.
I see. Well, should you change your mind, the contract will be available for a while.
Looks like someone's been digging here. And recently.
Tread lightly.
Be careful around the burial stones. I don't want to haul you back to Jorrvaskr on my back.
Shor's bones... how did they find this place?
I see you've been allowed to know some secrets before your appointed time. No matter. Yes, it's true.
Not every Companion, though. Only members of the Circle all share the blood of the beast.
Some take to it more than others.
Of course you will.
Fine, I'll get someone else to take care of it.
This work isn't for everyone. Maybe you're more cut out for those snowberries up in Winterhold.
This isn't an order of cowards. I'll find someone more agreeable, I'm sure.
We've got to bring it down!
Don't let it get too close!
We've got to ground that bastard!
Come on! This is our best chance!
Attack while it's landed!
Now it's my turn, you son of a bitch.
For the Blades!
Let's get this over with.
Come on. What are you waiting for?
You're not afraid of me, are you?
Lorkhan's eyes, you're an ugly one, aren't you?
Remember Cloud Ruler Temple!
Did you think the Blades had been destroyed?
Now it's your turn, Thalmor bitch.
The Blades will never be defeated, Thalmor dog.
I could use a hand here.
I'm not afraid of you.
For the Blades!
I wasn't looking for trouble.
I gave up this kind of thing a long time ago.
You can still run. It's not too late.
You've brought this on yourself.
Thalmor dog! Death is too good for you.
You'll die knowing it was the Blades that sent you to Oblivion.
You're starting to make me angry.
I'm in a bit of trouble here.
I need some help with this one!
You should not have meddled in the Thalmor's affairs.
The Thalmor's memory is long.
Esbern cannot elude us, fool.
I shall sing of thee in Sovngarde!
Feel the bite of my axe!
It is glorious to battle once again in Tamriel!
Feel the thunder of my voice!
You will die for the glory of the Dragonborn!
You are not worthy of Sovngarde!
For the Dragonborn!
For Sovngarde!
My sword will taste of your blood!
Ah... the power of the dragon is yours! There can be no doubt that you are the Dragonborn of prophecy.
Alduin cannot ignore this for long.
Ah! I've heard of this Shouting, but never seen it. Fascinating...
I've read the dragon language, but to hear it spoken is most interesting.
This skill should prove very useful, Dragonborn. Fighting fire with fire, as the saying goes.
The dragons will surely fear your Voice.
I'll show you to your room. Right this way.
Let me know if there's anything else you need.
Roggvir. You helped Ulfric Stormcloak escape this city after he murdered High King Torygg.
By opening that gate for Ulfric you betrayed the people of Solitude.
There was no murder! Ulfric challenged Torygg. He beat the High King in fair combat.
Such is our way! Such is the ancient custom of Skyrim, and all Nords!
On this day... I go to Sovngarde.
Have you seen Astrid? She needs to speak with you. It seemed urgent. Come talk to me afterward.
Please. Not now. You'll know when I'm ready to discuss the issue.
Well now... would you look at that.
I never imagined we'd find something like this.
Why is this buried so far within Saarthal?
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Hjaalmarch. Congratulations.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of the Pale. Congratulations.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Winterhold.
I grant you this weapon from the armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify the guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Falkreath. Congratulations.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
I do. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs.
I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
You've honored my father's memory in more ways than I have words to say.
Divines watch over you.
I hereby grant you permission to purchase property in my city. Talk to my steward if you're interested.
And take this. A gift from the Jarl's personal stores.
The last time I was in Whiterun, the tradesmen were talking about you. It seems your reputation as a businessman is growing.
Glad to hear all my hard work has paid off. Maybe we'll fetch a better price for our crops next time we're in the city.
I picked up a set of fine silver brushes in the city, Reldith. I thought you might be interested.
How thoughtful! I'll come take a look after supper.
Anything I can pick up for you on my next trip into the city, Erik?
Thanks for the offer, Jouane, but I'm saving up for a new sword.
Good day, Lemkil. I saw some nice dresses for your little girls while I was in Whiterun. I'd be happy to purchase them, if you like.
We don't need your charity, Breton. If my girls deserve something nice, it'll be their father who buys it.
I hear your crops sold well at the market. Well done, Ennis.
I'm trying something new, offering discounts for bulk purchases. So far, that seems to be working.
Are you making good progress with the planting?
So far, things are going well. Let's just hope the weather holds.
Ah, there's nothing like fresh air and honest labor to bolster the spirit.
True enough, but there's nothing wrong with a little adventure now and then. Not much excitement in working the soil every day.
Those little girls of yours are growing like weeds, Lemkil.
Yes, and just like weeds, they're nothin' but trouble.
Now that you mention it, there is.
I have a buyer with, shall we say, a very odd taste in literature looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman... a wizard named Arondil and his peculiar cravings.
It's said to be spread across four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Then we have a deal.
In his later years, Andoril moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He prefered the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.
Yeah, but you're into gold. Let me know if you change your mind. I'm not going anywhere.
I can't believe it. You have them already?
Here, take this. This should cover your end of the work nicely.
It's a good start, but you need all four of the volumes or the set isn't complete.
Why don't you head back out to Yngvild and find the rest?
Only rumors. He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down.
The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform.
After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar.
The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
Good. I was hoping you hadn't forgotten about it.
As promised, here's your payment for bringing them to me. Got it as part of a fair trade from my client.
Spare a coin for a fellow Nord who's down on his luck?
So you can spend it on drinks at the Bannered Mare? If it's food you need, ask for that instead.
Never you mind, then. I'll find a more charitable soul.
That's what I thought.
Oh. No, no, no. Don't you understand? Guilt, innocence, right, wrong.... Irrelevant. What matters is I ordered you to kill someone, and you obeyed.
Indeed. For you, my friend, seem to understand what's truly important. When I give an order to spill blood, you follow it. No questions. No remorse.
Hmph. When most would speak, you listen. You think. You understand that the only thing that matters is you following my orders. To kill.
Good.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of the Reach. Congratulations.
I grant you a personal Housecarl to watch over your home and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold, and who owns at least one piece of property in my city.
You help my people and purchase a house from my steward, and I'll make you my Thane.
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane.
The Jarl has appointed me to be your housecarl. It's an honor to serve you.
Long life to you, Thane.
I am your sword and your shield.
Honor to you, my Thane.
What do you need, my Thane?
Honored to see you again, my Thane.
No one in the Jarl's court is above the charge of conspiring against the city. You're coming with us.
No one in the Jarl's court is above the charge of conspiring against the city. You're coming with us.
Oh, forgive me, Thane. I didn't realize it was you.
We'll look the other way this time, but even the Jarl's influence has its limits. Be more careful.
Wait... I know you.
In the name of the Jarl, I'm ordering you to stand fast!
Since you put it that way, I think we can overlook your crime for now.
All right, all right. Just keep your voice down and don't let me catch you again.
Everything here appears to be in order. You can move along now.
I can make all your problems with the guards go away. But it'll cost you. What do you say?
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Haafingar. Congratulations.
I grant you a personal Housecarl to watch over your home and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Whiterun. Congratulations.
I grant you a personal Housecarl to watch over your home and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
I'd like to offer you a place in my court, as a Thane. It's mainly an honorary title, but there are a few perks.
Now, by law and tradition, I can only grant the title to one who is known throughout Eastmarch, and who owns property in Windhelm.
If you do good works for the people and purchase a home from my steward, I'll name you my Thane.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Eastmarch. Congratulations.
I grant you a personal Housecarl to watch over your home and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title.
The Star is free to purify itself. Don't worry, mortal. I will return you before you are cleansed.
Malyn's enchantments are broken. Hold on. I'm going to pull your soul out of there. Brace yourself.
I don't suppose you're going to buy something this time?
Are you daft? I told you not kill any of them. How much clearer do you need me to be?
How about the gold? Did you remember to bring it or is that too difficult an instruction as well.
So, job's done and you even brought the gold. Best of all you did it clean. I like that.
Dumping bodies and keeping the guards quiet can be expensive.
I suppose it's not a total loss then.
Let me give you a piece of advice. If you want to make some serious coin in this business you need to listen to rules.
Now, on to other things.
Well done. And it would seem I owe you something in return.
Here you go, I think you'll find these quite useful.
Just browsin' today. If the gods be kind, someone will take mercy on me and spare a few septims.
If they do, promise you'll actually purchase something for once.
By Ysmir, I will. Gods know it's been too long since I tasted real meat.
I've got a recipe for venison stew that I want to try out. Will you have venison anytime soon?
Certainly. I'll be sure to bring some back for you the next time I go hunting.
Make it quick, and there might be a bowl of hot stew in it for you.
Ah, Olfina. How may I help you?
Got any sausages? I'm cooking a special breakfast for a friend, and they're his favorite.
Would your good friend be named Jon, by any chance? I've spied the two of you talking quite intimately.
Glad to see you're making new friends. I know Jon's death was hard on you.
Best you forget whatever you think you saw, elf. Such idle talk can prove hazardous to one's health.
How goes the begging today, Brenuin?
That's right, mock the town beggar like everyone else. But I've got a right to browse, don't I? I ain't hurtin' anyone.
Make it quick, then. I don't want your stink driving my customers away.
The gods smile on them who show charity. Best you remember that.
Those green apples you sold me the other day were delicious.
Aren't they? I always set some aside for myself when the traders bring them up from the south.
I'm sure you could charge double for those and still sell them all within a week.
You're right. I'll have to remember that the next time I get a shipment in.
Did you raise your prices, Carlotta?
I had to. The farmers are charging me double for the produce I sell.
Let me guess, they're saying it's because of this trouble with the Stormcloaks?
Exactly. Road patrols were cut in half because the Jarl needed soldiers. Now the bandits are bolder than ever.
They've been raiding the farms for food, and supplies are scarcer than ever. Maybe I should sell swords and armor, instead.
Maybe, but they wouldn't taste as good as a loaf of fresh-baked pumpernickel.
This is all just too much, too fast. Go get some work from Nazir. I need time to... to think...
I envy you the chance to see this dragon up close!
No! Get back! It's still here somewhere! Hroki and Tor just got grabbed when they tried to make a run for it!
Guardsman! What happened here? Where's this dragon? Quickly now!
I don't know!
Kynareth save us, here he comes again...
Where is it? I know you were trying to keep it for yourself J'zhar... You always try to keep it for yourself!
No! There's got to be more Skooma... Shut up! Shut up!  Don't lie to me J'zhar! You hid it! You always try to steal it from me!
No... No! You must be the one who took my skooma!
Listen up, legionnaires. Those Stormcloaks are here for the same reason we are.
Ulfric the Pretender wants that crown, but we're not going to let him have it.
I realize some of you may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and will not hesitate to end your lives either.
General Tullius is counting on us to bring back the Jagged Crown, and that's exactly what we're going to do.
Listen up. Those Imperials aren't here by coincidence.
Their spies must've found out we know about the Crown, and they don't want us to have it. But they won't stand in our way.
I know some of you are ex-legion and may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and they will not hesitate to kill you.
Keep your wits about you and watch your shield brother's back.
Ulfric Stormcloak is counting on us to bring him back that crown, and that's exactly what we're going to do.
What? Get over with the rest of the men at Korvanjund.
Korvanjund. Remember?
Good work! Lucky we had you with us today.
That crown must be here somewhere. Keep looking.
My pa always warned me not to mess with places like this.
Careful. No telling what will happen the next time you mess with that door.
Maybe that claw has a clue on it? You know, how to turn the rings so the door will open.
Keep a sharp eye out. There's no telling what we might run into in here.
All for an old crown, huh?
The Imperials will be sorry they got in our way.
So far, so good.
Yes, yes. This will create a fine fume.
That should do. Now - Inhale deeply.
Ah, have you? Let Kesh have them.
If anything actually happens, call a guard.
If the guards in the Gray Quarter weren't a bunch of n'wahs, I wouldn't be here talking to you.
My men have their orders. But it's a big city, and there's a war on. Plus these murders.
A few dark elves getting shoved around doesn't really amount to much.
Typical Nord. Beard for brains.
Watch that tongue, Rendar, or your whole lot could be down with the Argonians hauling ballast by tomorrow.
Well, nothing. At least not any more. Folk just call me that because of what I used to do.
I was a sailor for many a year. I made my coin as a trader and in time, I bought my own ship.
When I retired here in Windhelm, most folk already knew me as Captain Lonely-Gale, and the name just stuck.
Terrible shame, that. Seems we have a killer on the loose here in Windhelm.
He's claimed three victims that I know of, though maybe there's more that haven't been found yet.
All lovely young ladies, too. Let's hope the guards find that demon soon, and introduce him to the headsman's axe.
There's an author named Adonato staying at the inn. He's published a few works of historical fiction.
The clans Shatter-Shield and Cruel-Sea see most of the gold that passes through the city.
And obviously you have Ulfric, the Jarl and future High King.
Oh, and that busybody Viola Giordano. She's got her nose in everyone's business, which I guess is one way of being prominent.
If you're looking to pass the time, you can give Calixto a few septims and gawk at whater oddity he's come across lately.
If you're need of goods, there's a market. If it's a soft bed and a hot meal you're after, there's Candlehearth Hall.
Talos, who in life was known as Tiber Septim, united Tamriel and founded the Empire.
He was rewarded for his deeds by being joined with the Divines in eternal glory. The only mortal to do so.
We worship him that we might follow in his path. We can't literally join him in the heavens, but we may do our best to know them here on Nirn.
The Empire's elven puppetmasters never cared much for the idea of a human becoming a divine. So the worship of Talos is outlawed.
Skyrim doesn't take kindly to being told what to do. And to try and forget Talos, well... they may as well ordered us all to cut off our ears.
Like anyone, a crisis will push them towards devotion. I've been seeing a lot of the Shatter-Shields, since they lost their daughter.
Hillevi Cruel-Sea comes in a lot, but I haven't seen her husband here in years.
Ulfric prays for strength. I speak to Captain Lonely-Gale, but he doesn't spend much time here. Too busy.
Where else would we be?
When the Red Mountain burned, you could scarcely breathe in Morrowind. So we came west.
Windhelm is the first city on that road, and here we are.
If we had known the Nords would be so unwelcoming, we may have kept walking.
Well you see where we have to live. This forgotten alley. All the filth from the upper quarters flows downhill, like they say.
Good luck getting one of the guards to help with anything.
I tried to get Ulfric to even come down here to see the squalor, but the High Lord of His Mightiness couldn't find the time.
I've got what I came for, I better get back to Dragon Bridge.
Did you find anything at Wolfskull Cave?
None of that matters to me. Until someone takes a Dunmer, I let Windhelm deal with its own problems.
You are? Very good.... may I see it?
Oh... what a terrible shame. Well, if you think you know where you left it and can retrieve it, I'll be here.
Excellent. Very good. This is exactly what I need to complete a series of studies I'm doing on Dwemer craftsmanship and magical resonance.
I simply must have this! I'll pay you double what it's worth.
Wonderful. You've just made an important contribution to the advancement of a Dwemer scholarship.
Well... I suppose important research is worth every coin. All right. You have yourself a deal. How's double and a half its value in trade?
With this the world could have a better understanding of the Dwemer!
Come now, where's your sense of propriety? Extorting an old man like this.
Hold on, there. I suppose, in the uh, interest of research... I can spare a few more coins. Double and a half its value. That's all I can muster.
Ha! I'll see to it the Jarl hears of your abuse of a court scholar. Shame on you.
Oh... well... I can see you have no appreciation for scholarship.
I'm glad we could come to an agreement.
Pick a man and put him down. We attack on my signal.
Time to show what you're really made of.
For Skyrim!
I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
But there isn't any other way through.
You sure about that? Then please, be my guest and go strolling on in there. We'll stay here and watch your back...
Not so sure? Oh, then perhaps we should take a moment to look around a little, eh?
You there, Unblooded, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting.
There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry!
Maybe you can find a way through somewhere above us.
You have your orders. Get moving.
No, but I know they're out there. No other way they can come. Now shut up or you'll blow our ambush.
I don't like it. What are they waiting for?
Maybe they're so scared of you they ran away.
Careful, boys. There's bound to be more up ahead.
Don't give them a chance to warn the others!
Steady. A few dusty bonewalkers aren't going to stop us anymore than the Imperials could.
Now let's keep moving.
What in the nine holds is that?
Draugr. Ain't you ever seen one before?
Ah! The Hall of Stories... we must be getting close now.
One thing at a time. We're here for the Crown. Any of these carvings show a crown?
Hmm, looks like this is as far as the Imperials got.
Even if one of these pictures tells us where the Crown is, I'm betting we're going to have to find a way through that door.
See what you can figure out, Unblooded. I'm going to check out these carvings over here. Let me know if you find something.
Hmm... that looks like some kind of claw from a statue. I wonder what it's used for.
Look out!
I wouldn't do that again unless you know for sure it's going to open.
Looks like the door will open if we turn these rings the right way.
Is there anything on the claw that might show how to open this door?
Good job!
Alright everyone! Keep your guard up. No telling what we'll find down here.
Come on, boys. Let's spread out and see what we've got.
Unblooded, do what you do best. See if you can find some way to get that gate open.
How's it going, Unblooded? You find anything yet?
Keep looking, Unblooded. There's got to be some way to get that thing open.
You see a lever anywhere?
That's done it! Alright, boys, let's get moving. We've got more...
Steady now! They may be uglier than Imperials but they'll go down just the same.
Let's hope that's the last of them. Come on, let's see what's down this way.
Oh... I've heard of this. They say these walls show the history of the ancients who built this place.
Too bad we can't read these carvings. Who knows what secrets we'd uncover?
The crown must be around here somewhere. Spread out, and keep your eyes open.
We'll stick around here for a while and see if we can find anything else useful.
Yes, yes. We should proceed cautiously.
Namira grants us victory.
Praise to Namira!
The feast has begun!
I can smell the blood. Good and sour.
Good.
Is dinner ready?
I love this part of the meal.
I knew when you walked into the Hall of the Dead that you were special.
And here you are. Champion of Namira. Keeper of her ring. You're everything I hoped you would be.
That's the way I like it. Short and bloody. They never knew what hit them.
We had the advantage of surprise this time, but things won't be so easy from here on out.
Enough talk. Let's go kill some Imperials.
It's an honor, champion. Feel free to stay and mingle with your new coven.
There, there. It will pass. Going too long without a proper meal can make the stomach weak.
Feel free to stay and mingle with your new coven, if you have the strength.
What's the situation?
Stormcloaks were already camped out around the entrance when we got here. They don't know we're here yet, though.
Well, that's something at least.
What's the situation?
Imperials? Well, if they're keeping themselves comfortable, let's slip in and send them to their graves that way.
Cold as the inside of an ice wraith. That and some Imperials are camped out around the entrance, staying nice and warm around their fires.
Hail, Ilfhild.
Hail, Galmar.
No. And I'm not sure I'm better off for it now neither.
We're not leaving until we get what we came for.
Don't wait around for me. I bet I'll beat you to Korvanjund even though you start first.
Barring any more interruptions, perhaps we can locate the information I need.
We're looking for a book of alchemical recipes called [QUOTE]The Dreamstride.[QUOTE]
The tome bears the likeness of Vaermina on the cover. It should be here somewhere.
Now that they've been dealt with, we need to find the Torpor.
It should be in a small bottle, very similar to a potion.
I'll begin searching up here.
I'm relieved you discovered a bottle intact; this place looks as though it was ransacked by the orcs.
So... I've taken us this far, but you need to guide us the rest of the way. Drink.
Dawnstar's fate rests in that tiny bottle. The longer we wait, the more damage Vaermina could be doing to those poor people.
I understand your hesitation, but I promise you that it works.
Indeed. My reverence for Vaermina's machinations should not take precedence over our mission. My apologies.
The inner sanctum lies ahead. We must reach the Skull and put an end to Dawnstar's troubles. Lead on, my friend.
I call upon you, Lady Mara!
The Skull hungers. It yearns for memories and leaves nightmares in its wake.
Grant me the power to break through this barrier and to send the Skull to the depths of Oblivion!
You there! Ah... citizen. This area is off limits.
You are interfering in Imperial business. Yeah, so you'll have to pay us a fine... of say, 100 gold. Pay up, citizen.
The, um, Emperor thanks you... Now shove off!
Er, rather, have a nice day, citizen.
Fine. If you can't pay with coin, you'll pay with your life!
If you insist. Come on boys. This'll be fun.
Go on, get out of here!
Get out of my face!
It was a brilliant idea, really. Mostly mine, though Gavros took the credit.
Secret, though. Official Synod business. Can't talk about it.
You found... how in the world...
That's it. That's it! I don't know who you are, but you may have just saved this little project...
In fact, who are you, anyway?
I don't know what sort of help you expect from me, but if you can actually find the crystal I'd certainly be grateful.
You are, are you?
Savos wouldn't even grant us an audience when we came to you, but now you come here expecting something from me?
I don't much like this, I'll tell you. But you've saved my skin, so maybe I can overlook the past for now.
Come on, I'll explain on the way.
Ha! So you did.
I was almost beginning to think Gavros had gone and gotten himself killed just to spite me.
Well, with the Falmer skulking around I can't very well do this on my own. I guess you'll have to come with me.
I'll explain on the way.
No matter what Gavros said, this was my idea first. The Council is going to know that when I get back.
I was the one who thought of using this... this Oculory. I don't know what the dwarves called it. Something unpronounceable, I'm sure.
From all our research, it seems they were intent on discerning the nature of the divine.
This machinery, all of it, was designed to collect starlight, and then... I'm not sure. Split it, somehow?
It was my idea to replace one of the key elements with our focusing crystal. Months of enchantments went into it.
Let's just hope they got it right this time.
I suppose there's no point in concealing the truth any longer.
My knowledge of this temple comes from personal experience. I was a priest of Vaermina.
Faith? I don't have faith in anyone.
All I care about is cause and effect. Did the job get done and was it done correctly. There's no gray area.
I hope not. This is an important job.
I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business.
I also want to know how they managed to get the place up and running so quickly.
Head to the Bannered Mare in Whiterun and look for Mallus Maccius. He'll fill you in on all the details.
The only reason we're having this conversation is due to Brynjolf's assurance you won't botch another assignment.
He claims you possess some sort of uncanny aptitude for your line of work. Quite frankly I find that hard to believe.
I bought some poison. I was going to have my lazy, good-for-nothing assistant Mallus handle it, but he seems to have vanished.
If you plant this in the vermin's nest, it should stop them from ever coming back.
Don't come back until every one of those things are dead.
Oh, very well. Here's half. You get the rest when the job's done.
Well that's not how I operate, so forget it.
Oh really? And I don't suppose you'd just do it out of the kindness of your heart, would you?
I hope you're not expecting to get paid until the job's done.
Okay, okay. No need to make rash decisions.
Here's half. You get the rest when the job's done.
Yell all you want. It's not going to change my mind.
My only demand is that these vermin are permanently eliminated before my reputation is completely destroyed.
Saffir!
Wait... I....
I know your family's honor is important to you, but we can't afford it!
It took me weeks to find that thieves' den. I can't stop now, and I can't get the sword on my own.
So you're willing to starve your wife and daughter to reclaim some rusty old sword?
I just need to hire one, maybe two good men. You won't starve.
I'll put it plainly. You can claim your sword, or you can keep your wife. If you set foot outside the gate, I won't be here when you return.

Goraan! I feel younger than I have in many an age.
Many of the dovahhe are now scattered across Keizaal. Without Alduin's lordship, they may yet bow to the vahzen... rightness of my Thu'um.
But willing or no, they will hear it! Fare thee well, Dovahkiin!
Pruzah wundunne wah Wuth Gein. I wish the old one luck in his... quest.
But I doubt many will wish to exchange Alduin's lordship for the tyranny of Paarthurnax's [QUOTE]Way of the Voice[QUOTE].
If Alduin himself could not stand against your Thu'um, I feel no shame in my own defeat.
You've returned. Good. What did you find at Wolfskull Cave?
I wish you well friend. Be careful.
Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs.
A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
Good. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to do this.
I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.
Ah Potema. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history.
She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
Take this payment - the Jarl would thank you but she very much wants to keep Potema's return quiet.
Make no mistake we consider you a protector of Solitude.
Take this payment - the Jarl would thank you but she very much wants to keep Potema's return quiet.
Make no mistake we consider you a protector of Solitude.
Excellent! These things do have a way of working out when people take action. I'll sanctify the remains.
In case Falk doesn't make it clear - Solitude owes you a debt of gratitude.
I hope Falk made it clear that Solitude owes you a debt of gratitude.
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah.
Not like that it isn't.
The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all. Most people keep them as a curiosity.
Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
Look, I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set.
Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.
Unbelievable! You must be the first person to set eyes on all twenty-four of them in... well, the last two eras.
When I told you the set had to be complete, I left out a small detail... I honestly didn't think you'd ever get this far.
If the stones were remounted on the crown, it would be of great benefit to the Thieves Guild.
I have it on good authority that the crown is within Tolvald's Cave; dropped by a Dunmer caravan leaving Morrowind long ago.
If you can bring it back, we could restore the paragon... and reap its benefits.
I knew you had it in you. After all, finding the Stones was no easy feat.
Well, I'm not one to welch on a deal, so here's your reward. I hope you put it to good use. I know I have.
Many used to come to these caves. The forgotten. The wretched.
I'll need to lock up the store. Thank you so much for agreeing to help us.
I should lock up the store now. Thank you again.
Mara, I forgot how late it was. We'll need to lock up the shop.
Mara, I forgot how late it was. Need to lock up the shop.
Okay, well... I guess it's possible. I've been selling my sword arm for years now. Killed a lot of people. Could be someone wanted revenge.
But... But you're not going to kill me. Right?
I'm a woman living in Skyrim with six children and no husband. I don't have the time or patience to be [QUOTE]nice.[QUOTE]
Do some people look down on me? Have I made some enemies? You're damn right.
He he he he he he he. The real question is, [QUOTE]Would someone pay to have me killed... again.[QUOTE]
A day goes by without someone trying to gut me in the street, I get disappointed.
Please! I don't know! I mean, I'm a soldier. I've killed people. When I was ordered to. Maybe there were some times... some times I got carried away?
But war is war. Right? Nobody could blame me for that. Could they?
I'm kneeling here with my hands bound and a sack over my head, and you have the gall to ask me that?
What do you think, genius?
Fool! Don't you get it? I live in the shadow of death every day. A knife in every doorway, a nocked arrow on every rooftop!
If one of my enemies wouldn't pay to have me killed, I'd take it as a personal insult.
Need a ride?
I can take you to any of the hold capitals.
My carriage is the safest way to travel.
Olfrid sent ahead his compliments. Looks like his friend Arn is soon to be released thanks to his brand new identity.
More importanly, he's pledged the full support of the Battle-Born clan to the Thieves Guild.
Erikur assures me that Captain Volf will spend pretty much the rest of his life clapped in irons.
Best of all, he's also pledged to open doors for us in Solitude and to get things rollin' again.
Torsten was gratified the death of his daughter was avenged and the heirloom was returned.
At this very moment, he's layin' the groundwork for the Guild to reestablish itself in Windhelm.
Burnin' that banner was a nice touch, too. Should send a clear message to the Summerset Shadows that we're a force to be reckoned with.
Torsten was gratified the death of his daughter was avenged and the heirloom was returned.
At this very moment, he's layin' the groundwork for the Guild to reestablish itself in Windhelm.
I wished you could have sent more of a message to those Summerset Shadows upstarts, but hopefully they'll stay out of our business.
I hear Endon's quite pleased to have his merchandise back.
He's a powerful ally in Markarth. Should help the Guild regain a foothold in the west.
The Guild's at full strength and we have you to thank for it. We've had our share of dark times, and now they seem like a distant memory.
I'm goin' to tell you'll somethin' you'll never hear me say again, and if you tell anyone I told you, I'll deny it.
When you walk through the Guild, don't be ashamed to hold your head high 'cause you're the best damn thief in the place.
Success means that the Guild is gettin' stronger. We've picked up another merchant and a new recruit.
Bein' a thief is like a second skin for you, ain't it? Never seen anythin' like it.
If you don't watch out, you might even earn Vex's respect. Now that'd be something, eh?
We're still growin' by leaps and bounds thanks to you. Another merchant's just moved into the space outside the Flagon.
You're a natural. Never seen anythin' like it.
We've got a long way to go, but don't let that bother you... it's a lot farther than we've been in years.
I think you'll find that the Guild is beginnin' to grow. We've had a merchant move into the space right outside the Flagon.
It's nice to shake the cobwebs off and get things rollin' again. Keep this up and I can see a bounty headed our way.
Well, I never thought I'd see the Guild this way ever again. The place is growin' into what it used to be when Gallus was runnin' the show.
Contacts are springin' up all over and I've got young footpads beatin' down the door to join up.
I got one last special request of you. Finish this one and all of Skyrim's ours for the takin'.
I don't know what your made of, but I've never seen anyone tackle this many jobs without endin' up dead or in jail.
We've got half of Skyrim back under our wing and the coin's startin' to flow.
Now, if you're ready, I got another special job for you.
I've got another special request and they specifically asked for you.
Your makin' a name for yourself, that's for sure. But more important, you're makin' a name for the Guild. Keep it up.
Well, it appears your actions are startin' to make waves out there. People are talkin' about the Guild again.
In fact, I just got a special job request in. I haven't gotten anythin' like it in years.
Got word from Torsten Cruel-Sea in Windhelm that a rival Guild is tryin' to get itself started.
Not only that but they're givin' us thieves a bad name by murderin' their marks.
Get over there and see what you can do.
We actually got a request from one of the most powerful families in Whiterun, the Battle-Born's.
Make your way up there and look for Olfrid. He says he's got a matter that requires a delicate touch, and I suggested you for the job.
Don't make me the fool and let me down, all right?
I want you to head out to Markarth and speak to Endon. He's a silversmith... has some kind of a shop there.
His father was a good friend of the Guild back in the day, and we could really use his family's influence back on our side.
I need you to make your way to Solitude and talk to Erikur. He's lookin' to run some kind of a shill job.
Now, he's not exactly goin' to welcome you with open arms, but keep your cool. Do this job right and we've just made an important friend out there.
We will find her eventually.
She cannot hide from us forever.
If you locate her, find us in Rorikstead.
Quickly, come with me.
Find me the moment the Alik'r are taken care of.
And you're sure?
I've dispatched a rider to Helgen. We'll know soon enough.
By Ysmir, this is just what we need. There'll be panic in the streets if this proves true.
Panic we can handle, Balgruuf. It's the dragons I'm not so sure about.
Hmph.
Listen you impudent cur. According to my scrying something happened at Wolfskull Cave that returned Potema to this world.
You weren't nearly as successful as you think, fool. According to my scrying the Wolf Queen has returned.
I'm Sybille Stentor, court mage of Solitude, and according to my scrying you've managed to unleash Potema herself!
What did you do in Wolfskull cave?!
I shall not be bound.
Something is wrong. There is an intruder.
You ants don't have the power to bind me!
Summoned with words. Bound by blood.
Summoned with words. Bound by blood.
Summoned with words. Bound by blood.

Yes! Yes! Return me to this realm!
Summoned with words. Bound by blood.
As our voices summon you the blood of the innocent binds you Wolf Queen!
We summon Potema!
We summon Potema!

Long have you slept the dreamless sleep of death, Potema. No longer. Hear us Wolf Queen! We Summon You!
Wolf Queen. Hear our call and awaken. We summon Potema!
Just remember I'm here if you rethink your decision.
Please get me home!
Are you here to save me?
I've been hearing rumors of Silver Hand activity.
I've been hearing rumors of Silver Hand activity.
A group of them has holed up in the Reach.
A group of them has holed up in Haafingar.

If you can sneak into their camp and steal her plans, we'll have the advantage.
The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad.
The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad.
I don't know what the fight is about, and that's not our business anyway.
I just need you to go out there, look tough, and scare this milk drinker into submission.
No more than that. I don't want to hear about a killing, understand?
Shor's bones, boy. What did I tell you?
Shor's bones, girl. What did I tell you?
I'm cutting your pay for this job.
Be more careful next time. This isn't a game.
Kind of fun to push people around sometimes, isn't it. Good work, brother.
Kind of fun to push people around sometimes, isn't it. Good work, sister.
You seem to have a knack for this kind of thing. I'll make sure people in charge know.
I figured you had it in you. Nicely done.
Perfect. Hopefully this will let us know more about their movement. I think we've got them on the run!
Excellent. Looks like you've really driven them into hiding. Keep this up. We'll wipe them out, yet.
Not much further. Come, little thing. Serve me in death.
I'm not the only one seeing this, am I?
Why, this is utterly unique.
Token, you say? Let me see.
Oh, goodness me. You're a friend of Gabriella's, then. Well, I guess we both know why you're here.
Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can. It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you.
Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
There's a cave. No, not a cave. A... home? A place you feel secure. You will find safety there... sanctuary. I see snow, lit by the star of dawn.
And you are not alone. There are others. A child of night... a stalker of the sands? Oh, but before you are family, there will be blood. Such blood.
Wait! There's something else... A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest...
Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A Dark Brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
Your destiny is dark. Oh yes, so dark. But much of it has been fulfilled. You have found sanctuary, and the comforting words of a mother's love.
And you have companionship. A child of night, and a stalker of the sands. Together, you are a family.
Wait! There's something else... A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest...
It is the last resting place of an assassin of old. A Dark Brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.
Oh, very well. But my energies are low. I warn you - I won't be able to see much. Give me... five gold, and I'll do what I can.
Sorry, love, but I'm not a charity.
Are you joking? You just rented a room from me.
Sure thing. It's yours for a day.
What does this look like, the Temple of Mara? No gold, no bed.
Are you joking? You just rented a room from me.
Have a good rest. It's the big room with the double bed.
Sure thing. It's yours for a day.
What does this look like, the Temple of Mara? No gold, no bed.
A Forsworn agent. Running loose in the city. The Jarl is going to hear about this.
The Jarl has things under control. Don't you worry.
This was their city once. They won't stop until we're all dead.
Now you're being ridiculous. This is our city. Not theirs.
Someone was attacked in the market. Do you know who it was?
I think it was Margret. Poor woman, she was just visiting the city from Cyrodiil.
Yeah, but she was a Nord. And a noble. Perfect Forsworn target.
You're being paranoid. We're in control of Markarth. Not the Forsworn.
The Jarl is refusing to dispatch men to the front lines. Do you think it's because of the Forsworn threat?
Please. Those savages are no match for us. The Jarl is just biding his time.
Biding his time until what? Until another person is lying dead in the streets? Don't be naive.
The Reach belongs to the Forsworn!
The Forsworn. Here inside the city.
He was after Margret. Why?
Damn. Another body to get rid of.
Betrid. No! We had a deal you Forsworn bastards!
Why? We had a deal Madanach. A deal!
Traitors. Traitors all of you!
We'll handle things from here. Move along.
I said move along. The Forsworn are just a bunch of madmen. We have everything under control. Stay out of it.
That's right. It isn't.
Margret. He... he killed her. Right in front of me.
He... he tried to kill Margret. Right in front of me.
She's a traveler, from the Imperial City. Came by every day looking for jewelry for her relatives back home.
Why would anyone want to kill her? It doesn't make any sense.
No. She's such a nice woman. Comes by every day looking for jewelry for her family in Cyrodiil. Is it because she's a noble?
Why would anyone want to kill her? It doesn't make any sense.
I'm sorry. I don't think I can bare to sell anything right now.
Did you see that madman? A Forsworn agent. Here in the city.
Think he worked down at the smelter. Lot of the laborers there are sympathetic to the Forsworn.
They promise people they'll kill off all the Nords that rule over the Reach. Nothing but murderers and saboteurs.
Didn't you just see that woman getting attacked in front of us? We're closed.
So, it is done. Alduin dilon. The Eldest is no more, he who came before all others, and has always been.
Happy? No, I am not happy. Zeymahi lost ont du'ul Bormahu. Alduin was once the crown of our father Akatosh's creation.
Of course. Alduin wahlaan daanii. I would not have helped you if I thought otherwise.
You did what was necessary. Alduin had flown far from the path of right action in his pahlok - the arrogance of his power.
Indeed.  Alduin wahlaan daanii.
His doom was written when he claimed for himself the lordship that properly belongs to Bormahu - our father Akatosh.
But I cannot celebrate his fall. Zu'u tiiraaz ahst ok mah. He was my brother once. This world will never be the same.
And so you fulfilled your destiny, which you once said you did not believe in.
You once told me you did not believe in destiny.
Indeed, you saw more clearly than I - certainly more clearly than Alduin. Rok funta koraav.
Perhaps now you have some insight into the forces that shape the vennesetiid... the currents of Time.
Perhaps you begin to see the world as a dovah.
But I forget myself. Krosis. So los mid fahdon. Melancholy is an easy trap for a dovah to fall into.
You have won a mighty victory. Sahrot krongrah - one that will echo through all the ages of this world for those who have eyes to see.
Savor your triumph, Dovahkiin. This is not the last of what you will write upon the currents of Time.
Perhaps. At least it will continue to exist. Grik los lein.
And, as you told me once, the next world will have to take care of itself. Ful nii los. Even I cannot see past Time's ending.
I am glad you believe that. At least it will continue to exist. Grik los lein.
Even I cannot see past Time's ending to what comes next. Niid koraav zeim dinoksetiid. We must do the best we can with this world.
Zu'u Odahviing. Call me when you have need, and I will come if I can.
As for myself, you've proven your mastery twice over. Thuri, Dovahkiin. I gladly acknowledge the power of your Thu'um.
And so Alduin's lordship passes to you. Thuri, Dovahkiin. I gladly submit to your mastery of the Thu'um.
Oh yes, Cicero and the Listener! On the hunt!
Off we go.
Oh, but the Listener jests with poor Cicero. You already have company. You don't need my help at all.
I am honored to be chosen.
Lead on, Listener.
But you already have a traveling companion. I fear I would just get in the way.
I am yours, Listener.
Yes, Listener.
Oh, well... You seem to already have assistance. Surely you mean to remain inconspicuous...
Yes, Listener! I will remain in this very spot until you tell me otherwise. Spiders could eat my face off and faithful Cicero would not move an inch!
Yes, Listener. I won't move unless you give the word.
I'll remain in this location until ordered otherwise.
Home again, home again! I'll return to the Night Mother straightaway!
Oh, of course. Mother needs me, after all.
I will return to the Dawnstar Sanctuary immediately, Listener.
Yes, Listener. I'll be here if you need me.
Yes, Listener. I'll return to the Dawnstar Sanctuary without delay.
Of course. But if you need me, just give the order.
Listener!
You were told to find it, weren't you?
If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
Savos. Before... before he died.
He... He gave me something just a little while ago.
He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came.
I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him.
Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now.
Take it, and get out of here. Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us.
I said let's go. Now.
Arkay watch over you.
Yes. I'm your friend, and I've invited you to dinner.
I've been invited to dinner.... I'm so hungry....
Why don't you lay down and rest, while we get the meal ready?
I need to lay down. I'll just be a minute....
Come with me. Our feast is about to begin.
The meal is on Namira's table. Go ahead. Carve.

Before we enter, I must warn you about the dangers that could be lurking within.
Years ago, this temple was raided by an orc war party seeking revenge... they were being plagued by nightmares just like the people of Dawnstar.
No. Knowing they could never defeat the orcs, the priests of Vaermina released what they call [QUOTE]The Miasma,[QUOTE] putting everyone to sleep.
Try not to get carried away.
Go. Bring honor to yourself, and the Companions.
Get to it, then.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle over in the Reach.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle up in Haafingar.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle up in Hjaalmarch.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle down in Falkreath.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle right here in Whiterun Hold.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle out in the Pale.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle over in the Rift.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle over in Eastmarch.
We've gotten a letter about someone needing some muscle all the way in Winterhold.
Nothing refreshes the soul like an honest day's labor in good, tilled earth.
Looks like it's going to be a bountiful harvest once again. The gods continue to smile upon us.
It's remarkable that our farms are so prosperous given the harsh winters of late.
Looks like we're in for quite a harvest. We've had better luck with our planting than any village in the hold.
Luck? I think it has more to do with the hard work and good soil.
Maybe you're right. Even so, I can't help wondering if some other force it at work here.
The last wheat shipment fetched a fine price at market.
Well done! I don't know where I'd be without you, my old friend.
It pleases me to know that I can still be of use even in the twilight of my life.
Look at you! You're as filthy as a pig in a pen!
I am not! You're lying!
You smell like a pig's pen, too. What a stink! Have you been rolling in the dirt all day?
You're a liar! I won't listen to you. Leave me alone!
Father, how old were you when you left home?
I know where this is going, son. As I've said many a time. the world is a dangerous place. You're much safer here at the farm, with me.
But I don't want to be safe! I'm not afraid of the dangers out there. The only thing I'm afraid of is wasting my life on this farm.
Yes, that's your mother's side of the family talking. Just stay on for one more season, that's all I ask.
I heard you sneaking around downstairs last night. Were you trying to break into my chest again, son? I've told you to leave it alone.
I just wanted to try on your old armor, from back when you were a soldier. I thought I might be old enough to wear it.
I've told you a hundred times, I lock that chest for a reason. I don't want you getting a head full of ideas about adventure and glory.
I'm old enough to decide how to live my life, and I'd be honored to wear your armor, if you'd just let me. I'm strong enough to handle it.
Another fine day at work in the fields. I don't envy those city folk who miss out on the joys of working the land.
I'll tell you who I don't envy - those poor children who lost their parents in this war.
Lives lost, crops burned, land ruined... there's no greater sin than war. And yet, you were an orphan, and you've made something of your life.
I was lucky. If you hadn't rescued me, I'd probably be a thief, a mercenary or something even worse.
It's too fine a day to dwell on such things. Let's get back to work and forget about wars and orphans for awhile.
The way our crops have been growing, Rorikstead must have the richest soil in the hold.
Maybe we should start selling the soil along with the dung. We could make a tidy profit.
Hah! Who in their right mind would pay for dirt? You'd get laughed out of Whiterun for even trying it.
Hey, people have paid money for stranger things. Take our cow dung - we sell that by the wagon load.
When you're rich, you can waste as much money as you like on far-fetched business ideas. In the meantime, there's a farm to run.
I'm not saying it's my business, but I have to ask. Why are you so cruel to your little girls?
You're right, it's none of your business. How about you keep your nose out of it?
You keep on like you are, you'll end up with two daughters who hate you.
Hah! And what would a witless oaf like you know about raising children?
Your daughters are growing up fast, Lemkil. Seems like only yesterday they were newborn babes.
They've grown, all right - lazier and more stupid.
There's times I think you're the coldest man in Skyrim. This is your own flesh and blood you're talking about.
Today I'll teach you a useful spell that might just save your life. If you should ever fall into a river, you'll be very glad you learned it.
Oh! Are you going to teach me how to turn into a mud crab?
Oh, it's much better than that. I will teach you how to breathe underwater, with no need to turn into one of those ugly creatures.
Wow! Then I could dive into a river and swim so far away that Britte and father could never find me.
Now, clear your mind and breathe deeply. Good concentration is very important for spellcasting.
Hevnoraak planned his resurrection obsessively before dying. My duty in life and in death is to make sure he stays in this tomb for eternity.
He had a way of enthralling people and built up a loyal army of followers. Good men fell under his spell and were forever twisted. Made... evil.
After that, fear was enough to keep them in line. He could torture and humiliate them and they would not rebel. Even in death, they serve him still.
Good. Here you are. He'll follow you to Oblivion and back, if it comes to that.
Sorry. You already have an animal with you.
War dogs cost gold, friend. Come back when you have some.
What is it, woman? Sven drunk on the job again?
Hod. Just come here.
Hush, Frodnar. This is no time for your games.
Aw, mama, I want to stay and talk with Uncle Ralof!
That's right! Don't worry, Uncle Ralof, I won't let those soldiers sneak up on you.
I'm glad to assist you in any way I can.
But I need your help. We need your help.
Don't worry about me. I know how to lay low.
Helgen? Has something happened...?
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive.
There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora.
You dare bring me here? You must be punished.
[QUOTE]...Jarl of Windhelm and true High King of Skyrim.[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]As Talos is my witness, may this oath bind me to death and beyond...[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]...even to my lord as to my fellow brothers and sisters in arms.[QUOTE]
Now you're one of us.
Which means you get to tag along on a little trip with me.
Oh, and here. You're a Stormcloak now, you ought to look the part.
I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic.
I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
I'm concerned that when this place is unsealed, the Miasma will dissipate and they'll awaken; both orcs and priests alike.
The Miasma was created by the priests of Vaermina for their rituals. It's a gas that places the affected in a deep sleep.
Because the rituals would last for months or even years, the Miasma was designed to slow down the aging process.
Sadly, yes. The longer an individual is exposed to the Miasma, the more the mind can become damaged.
Those who've been under the effect of it for extended periods of time have been known to lose their minds entirely.
In some cases, a few never awoke at all.
[QUOTE]...and unwavering obedience to the officers of his great Empire.[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]...and unwavering obedience to the officers of his great Empire.[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]May those above judge me, and those below take me, if I fail in my duty.[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]Long live the Emperor! Long live the Empire![QUOTE]
Welcome to the Imperial Legion, soldier.
Just remember, we take care of our own. Once you're in the Legion, you're in it for life.
Speak to Beirand, he's normally out by the forge. He'll get you outfitted.
Now, if I'm not mistaken. Legate Rikke has a special assignment for you.
We're not done here.
It's all right. I will not shun you for what you are. Stay. I will tell you everything you have forgotten.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore.
Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are. She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment.
To Oblivion with you then!
A priest, filled with the taste of an easy life. Brother Verulus, from Markarth.
Give him this gold. Tell him you need Arkay's help exploring an old cavern for treasure.
And when he stands in Namira's presence, she will take care of the rest.
Draugr are below. Foul tasting.
The shrine of Namira is further inside. Keep going.
The shrine of Namira is beyond that door. Get ready.
Listen to your friend, Fruki. They are just dreams, my dear. I assure you that it is quite normal.
Everyone, please. I'm doing what I can to end these nightmares.
In the meantime all I ask is you remain strong and put your trust in Lady Mara.
Occasionally. But an Orc blade is a very personal thing. Anger, regret, pride. All these things are put into our steel.
When my daughter Lash chose to leave the stronghold, I forged a sword to channel all my shame and grief.
Honor me with a task, outlander. Bring the sword to my daughter, if you see her. It'll be all she needs to know.
So that's it, then. [QUOTE]Don't come back.[QUOTE]
Thank you. Here. You honored my mother's task and should be rewarded.
Now, I need to be alone.
Like I said, I'm glad to help in any way I can.
But I need your help. We need your help.
So we're just supposed to sit here while Arvel runs off with that golden claw?
That dark elf wants to go on ahead, let him. Better than us risking our necks.
What if Arvel doesn't come back? I want my share from that claw!
Just shut it and keep an eye out for trouble.
Is... is someone coming? Is that you Harknir? Bjorn? Soling?
I know I ran ahead with the claw, but I need help!
You. Over here!
That's it. Keep hacking at it.
It's coming loose. I can feel it.
You fool, why should I share the treasure with anyone?
No. Not again. Help!
Wait, come back!
Where are you going? Come back!
Noooo!
Aaaaagh!
Cut me down, or you'll never get the claw!
Where are you... get me down from this!
Sorry, but I have a treasure to get to...
So long [QUOTE]friend.[QUOTE] Ha ha ha!
You're not getting that treasure.
I'm too swift for you!
Too slow!
Get me out of here!
Hey, over here!
Don't leave me, for Arkay's sake!
Help me! Help!
Help me out of here!
Get me down. Get me down!
Ah, kill it. Kill it!
Get it away from me. Get it away!
Don't let it get me. Help!
Agh. Agh!
Keep it away from me!
Is it over?
Is it dead?
Is it safe now?
You'll never get the claw!
Too slow!
You did it. You killed it. Now cut me down before anything else shows up.
What? Who are you? Oh, never mind. Cut me down before that thing gets us!
Yes, the claw. I know how it works. The claw, the markings, the door in the Hall of Stories. I know how they all fit together!
Help me down, and I'll show you. You won't believe the power the Nords have hidden there.
Does it look like I can move? You have to cut me down, first.
Sweet breath of Arkay, thank you.
It's been forever since I've eaten so well.
And it shows, I've seen horkers with smaller guts.
Funny coming from a woman who's breath smells like she just kissed a draugr.
Would you two shut up before Brurid hears you messing around.
Stay away from Camilla.
Ah, Camilla. Fair as the morning sun. But I ask you, how could she prefer your brooding to my romantic tunes?
Just stay away from her, or...or else.
You play so well.
With you as my muse, how could I not?
Oh, Sven. You do know how to turn a girl's head.
Gimme a mug of ale.
A pint of your finest mead.
Some wine, please?
I'll have some mead.
Pour me an ale.
Coming right up.
Certainly.
You need to choose between those two boys. It ain't fair to Sven or Faendal to keep tuggin' on their heart strings like that.
It's bad enough my brother is harping on me to pick one. Don't you start too.
I'm just sayin' you should pick one to settle down with.
I got a new order in for shields. I'm gonna need some hardwood planks. None of that soft pine this time.
Ay, we can get that for ya. We just finished the timber for those catapults.
War may be good for business, but it's hard on families.
A hard truth, that is. Let's drink to the fallen ones.
Hey, haven't I seen you around the Flagon? I never expected to see another Guild brother down here.
They grabbed me in the Ratway. The nerve of these bastards... they need to be taught a lesson.
They grabbed me in Riften. They seem to think I know something. They just kept asking me the same damn questions.
Oh, yes? I wonder what that old busybody wants now.
Whatever it is, it will have to wait until after I've finished dealing with this dragon situation.
And I'm sure he told you it was urgent. Well, he's not the only Jarl in Skyrim with problems to deal with.
Whatever it is, it will have to wait until after I've finished dealing with this dragon situation.
So Delphine keeps up the fight, after all these years.
You'd better come in and tell me how you found me and what you want.
Delphine? How do you ... ? This is just a trick to get me to open the door, eh? I told you to go away!
I hear your heart beat like the Harbingers of old. Your glories in Skyrim are seen and honored.
In life we were enemies, but eternity's too long to hold a grudge - my heart's now free of such old hatreds.
Hero of the Nords I name you, Dragonborn, let none deny it.
The mist is gone! A glorious day!
The World-Eater is dead! The way is now clear!
You saved us all. We will sing of you forever.
Welcome, Dragonborn! Our door has stood empty since Alduin first set his soul-snare here.
The three await your word to loose their fury upon the perilous foe.
Do not fail Kodlak. He's earned his place here, and does not deserve to fall prey to Alduin's insatiable hunger.
My disciples still follow the difficult path - the Way of the Voice is neither wide, nor easy.
But if you stray from wisdom then to Sovngarde you will not return.
You freed Svaknir, a fool of a poet, but an honest enemy who has earned my respect.
Sadly, he's now lost in the soul-snaring mist - defeat Alduin, and his doom avert - I hope to greet him in this Hall as a friend.
Fate drives you, but you follow your own path. Choose wisely, lest you wander into evil.
Far you've travelled, your trials long, to taste of Sovngarde's sweet delights.
Seek ye food or song unending? Fighting, drinking, fellowship and boasting? Find welcome here, and warm your soul.
Hail, Dragonborn. That honor is also mine - to our shared birthright you'll bring new glory!
Dragonborn! Have you come to cleanse Sovngarde at long last of Alduin's foul mist?
Why does Shor forbid us to face Alduin? I fear no worm, World-Eater though he be.
I long to fight that foul worm, but by Shor's command we curb our wrath.
No gloom can hold my heart for long in Shor's bless'd hall, where no shadows lie.
A cup, Dragonborn, to death and glory!
Take your ease, let troubles fade.
By Shor's command we curb our wrath, so we feast and sing, til the final doom.
Shor's power protects this hall; but beyond is fear, brought by Alduin.
Shor's high seat stands empty; his mien is too bright for mortal eyes.
Banners, huh? Trying to pretty up the place? All right, you got it.
That'll come in handy, yeah? An alchemy station, maybe a little garden with some choice plants. All right, consider it done.
Oh ho. Now that's the Dark Brotherhood I know and love. This for business or pleasure? Ah, what's it matter, right? I'll see that it gets done.
Yeah, we can do that. I'm thinking a sewer grate on the outskirts of Dawnstar. Leads to a tunnel, then inside. You'll be in or out, quick as a coney.
Heh. Chamber fit for a king and all that, right? No problem. Give ya a big bed, decorate the room real nice, maybe even throw in a few extra baubles.
Suit yourself.
You're a little light on coin there, my friend. No gold, no refit.
Now, might I offer some advice? You should go to Riften and find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before?
Mallory is an expert [QUOTE]obtainer of goods.[QUOTE] We can use the money to repair and refit this Sanctuary. Make a true home for us, hmm?
You do that, and I'll see what I can do about recruiting some new additions to our Family...
You've come far, mortal, but can you stand against my inner council?  Let's see!
Don't applaud yourself too soon, worm!
Rip the eyes from her head!
Rip the eyes from his head!
The Forsworn have taken Kolskeggr Mine. We're the only ones left.
Troll's blood, what happened to you Pavo?
Gods.... You two head inside and get some rest. I'll send word to the Jarl.
The question is, what isn't wrong with Riften.
This city is corrupt. Rotten to the core. No one cares about anything except themselves and how much coin they can make off the misery of others.
Authorities? Have you been listening to what I said? They're all dirty. Every one of them.
The only way to get things done in this city is to keep your head down and pay off the right people.
Of course. Nothing gets done without my approval in this city. I have the Jarl's ear, and the guards in my pocket.
Anyone makes trouble for me and I pay a visit to the Thieves Guild. Make me angry and I contact the Dark Brotherhood.
You'd do well to remember that the next time you make such a stupid observation.
The Black-Briar family has always been allied with the Guild. Our connections with the Empire and within Skyrim make for a perfect fit.
I dare say the Guild owes its survival as much to my family as it does to its own people.
And you think that I care? Interesting.
