Fair Skyrim will be free from foul Alduin's maw, Dragonborn be the savior of men!
Dovahkiin, Dovahkiin, naal ok zin los vahriin, wah dein vokul mahfaeraak ahst vaal!
Ahrk fin norok paal graan fod nust hon zindro zaan, Dovahkiin, fah hin kogaan mu draal!
Huzrah nu, kul do od, wah aan bok lingrah vod, Aahrk fin tey, boziik fun, do fin gein!
Wo lost fron wah ney dov, ahrk fin reyliik do jul, voth aan suleyk wah ronit faal krein!
Ahrk fin zul, rok drey kod, nau tol morokei frod, rul lot Taazokaan motaad voth kein!
Sahrot Thu'um, med aan tuz, vey zeim hokoron pah, ol fin Dovahkiin komeyt ok rein!
Ahrk fin Kel lost prodah, do ved viing ko fin krah, tol fod zeymah win kein meyz fundein!
Alduin, feyn do jun, kruziik vokun staadnau, voth aan bahlok wah diivon fin lein!
Nuz aan sul, fent alok, fod fin vul dovah nok, fen kos nahlot mahfaeraak ahrk ruz!
Paaz Keizaal fen kos stin nol bein Alduin jot, Dovahkiin kos fin saviik do muz!
You might just make it. But for now, you're still a whelp to us, new blood. So you do what we tell you.
Here's my sword. Go take it up to Eorlund to have it sharpened. And be careful, it's probably worth more than you are.
You are not welcome here!
Unworthy!
Fall before the will of Sithis!
You dare invade this Sanctuary?
Yeagh!
Heyargh!
Grrr!
The Dread Lord awaits!
I... am Lucien Lachance.
Another soul for you, Father!
I weep for you, mortal.
Another thrall for the Void!
Yeagh!
Raaarr!
Grrrarrggh!
Huuragh!
Ha ha ha ha!
For the Night Mother!
Who's the fool now?
Stab you, stab you, stab you!
Yeagh!
Raarrgh!
Grraaagghh!
Eyyaargh!
Pathetic!
Yeargh!
Raaarrgh!
Grragh!
Arugh!
You dare invade my home?
Yeargh!
Raaarrgh!
Grragh!
Arugh!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
You can't kill what's already dead, mortal.
Ugh!
Oof!
Nuh!
Ha ha! I've suffered worse!
There is no pain in the Void!
You would shut out the darkness?
You wish to kill me? Someone has already had that honor.
Ugh!
Agh!
Ooof!
Nyargh!
Come on! Do it again! Ha ha ha ha ha!
I'm bleeding! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Ow! Cheap shot!
Is that the best the Listener can do?
Ugh!
Agh!
Oof!
Nyargh!
No!
By Sithis, I'll see you dead!
You won't get that lucky again!
Nyargh!
Agh!
Oof!
Ugh!
Precious release...
Father...
Ahhhhhhhh!
Yeeeaaahhh!
I... am... eternal...
Back... to... the Void...
I return to you, Father.
Ahhhhh.....
Hhhhuuuuuhhh....
Aiiiieee!
Aiiiieee!
Aiiiieee!
Coming... Mother...
Well done...
Uhh.. thank you...
But... we had a deal...
I can't believe you're speaking to me, after what you've done. You broke my heart.
We have nothing to talk about. I can't believe what you did to me.
Your words are cheap. Why should I speak to you after what you've done?
And why should I speak with you? You broke my heart.
You. You should just go. I don't have enough ale to stomach talking to you.
Look at you. Come crawling back, after everything you've done to me?
What do you want? There's no words left to say to each other.
All right, just because it's you, we'll try again.
I'll give you another chance, but watch yourself.
You want to try again? Fine, but I'll be watching you carefully.
Try again? You and me? Fine, but I've got my eyes on you.
You're testing my patience, but very well. I'll give you another chance.
All right, we'll start again, but watch yourself.
Get out of my sight!
Get out of here. Get out of here and never come back!
What did you say? Get out of my sight!
You're a monster. Leave and never come back!
What'd you say to me? Get out! I never want to see you again.
You come all this way just to hurt me a second time? Get out of my sight!
Leave. Now!
I've been hunting and fishing in these parts for years.
It's not like my poaching is hurting anyone. The Jarl can hardly eat every deer now can he?
There's enough for all of us if you aren't greedy.
Brothers and sisters of the Circle, today we welcome a new soul into our mortal fold.
This man has endured, has challenged, and has shown his valor.
This woman has endured, has challenged, and has shown her valor.
Who will speak for him?
Who will speak for her?
I stand witness to the courage of the soul before us.
Would you raise your shield in his defense?
Would you raise your shield in her defense?
I would stand at his back, that the world might never overtake us.
I would stand at her back, that the world might never overtake us.
And would you raise your sword in his honor?
And would you raise your sword in her honor?
It stands ready to meet the blood of his foes.
It stands ready to meet the blood of her foes.
And would you raise a mug in his name?
And would you raise a mug in her name?
I would lead the song of triumph as our mead hall reveled in his stories.
I would lead the song of triumph as our mead hall reveled in her stories.
Then the judgment of this Circle is complete.
His heart beats with fury and courage that have united the Companions since the days of the distant green summers.
Her heart beats with fury and courage that have united the Companions since the days of the distant green summers.
Let it beat with ours, that the mountains may echo and our enemies may tremble at the call.
It shall be so.
It shall be so.
It shall be so.
It shall be so.
Well, boy, you're one of us now. I trust you won't disappoint.
Well, girl, you're one of us now. I trust you won't disappoint.
Mirabelle will be waiting for you.
My son? Erik? What about him? Did something happen? Is he alright?
But the world is a dangerous place. Erik has no idea what he's getting himself into.
What's more, he's got no armor. I'll have to save up the money for it.
You would give your own coin to help my son? I'm moved by your compassion.
Your kind deed will not go unrewarded, my friend. Tell Erik I've changed my mind, and we'll visit Whiterun soon to fit him for armor.
I appreciate the gesture, but I'd rather not be in debt to a stranger.
Ah, I see. I've just remembered that I saved a few septims in case of an emergency. This is starting to feel like one.
Tell Erik that I've changed my mind, and we'll visit Whiterun soon to fit him for armor. And please don't hurt me!
Go ahead, hit me as often as you want. It's not going to change anything, other than to make me and the town guard angry.
I... I cannot deny the truth of what you say. Erik is all the family that I have left, but it's wrong to hold him back as I have.
Go and tell Erik that I've changed my mind. I'll see about borrowing some money in Whiterun for his armor.
Perhaps you should let a father decide what is best for his own son.
I welcome you, friend. How may I serve you?
So many refuse to talk to us. They call us thieves and smugglers. I am glad to see that you are not such a one.
Welcome. If I cannot serve you, I am sure that one of my other traders can do so.
I have traveled far across Tamriel to serve you.
Perhaps you have encountered Ma'dran or Akhari? Both are sworn to me, and both have worthy goods to offer.
The road makes this one weary.
The wind blows bitter cold in this place.
The longer we travel the roads of Skyrim, the more empty this land seems.
The warm sand of Elsweyr is far away from here.
The roads of Skyrim lead to many dangers.
We are creatures of the desert. The north wind chills us to the bones.
There is much beauty in this place.
How high the mountains of Skyrim rise!
A peaceful greeting to you.
It is a strange sight, the white flakes that sometimes fall from the sky.
The air is so clear in Skyrim, one can see forever.
A welcome to you, fellow traveler.
Khajiit welcomes you, and also your coin.
Do you seek to make a purchase?
Khajiit has wares, if you have coin.
Fortune smiles upon this meeting.
Welcome to you.
Warm sands, friend. How may this one serve you?
Please, come and browse our goods.
May your bed be warm and your food sweet.
You honor Khajiit with your presence.
Many fine things are here for you, friend.
Come and see what is for sale, traveler.
May the sun warm your path, friend.
Speak to one of the others if you wish to buy something.
This Khajiit guards the others.
Bring your coins, but do not bring trouble.
Khajiit is always watching for thieves and pickpockets.
Khajiit is ready for any troublemakers.
If you have come to see our wares, speak to the others.
Welcome to Khajiit's humble camp.
Khajiit is just a guard, and has no wares to sell.
Blessings of the moons upon you, traveler.
Some come to buy, but others come to steal. Khajiit shows no mercy to thieves.
Khajiit are not welcome in the cities, so we make our camps outside the walls.
There is no trust for Khajiit in this place.
Soon it will be time to replenish our supply of water.
The road takes us past many cold rivers. We can fill our skins there.
If the river is not frozen to ice, perhaps.
My bones ache for the moonsugar. It has been too long since I tasted it.
You know that our supply is limited. It could be a season or more before we get a new shipment from the south.
My ears hear the truth in your words, and yet my body shakes with the need.
Control yourself! Do not frighten away our customers with your fits.
Yes, of course you are right. Still, I would give much for even a few grains of moonsugar.
Put the thought out of your mind, and do not speak of it again.
It has been a profitable journey, and yet I long for the warm sands of Elsweyr more and more each day.
I feel the same. I do not think Khajiit were made for the cold.
Not only that, but these Nords have no love for us. They look upon us and see only thieves and smugglers.
It is a pity, but it cannot be helped. Perhaps if we continue to show that we can be trusted, they will open their cities to our caravans.
Hah! I wish that I had your optimism.
We have been in this land for so long, I have forgotten what it feels like to walk on warm sand.
Yes, I know just what you mean. My toes are numb from the cold more often than not.
Do you ever find that you regret making this journey?
In truth, I do not. I have always dreamed of seeing new lands, and it does not hurt that we are making a good profit.
That is true. Perhaps I should be more grateful for this opportunity. Not many Khajiit can say that they have visited Skyrim.
All this talk of dragons returning to the world makes me more than a little nervous.
Moons protect us! I hope we do not encounter one of them on the road.
I suppose if we do, we will find out just how fast each of us can run.
As the saying goes, you do not need to be faster than the dragon; you need only be faster than your friends.
Do you believe all this talk of dragons? Can the ancient ones truly have returned?
I wish I could say that I did not, but in every part of Skyrim, there is talk of dragon sightings. It is no coincidence.
S'rendarr be merciful! What ill fortune that this should happen now, while we are trying to make a living.
We are fortunate. We travel lightly, and can escape at a moment's notice. We have no home that a dragon can burn to the ground.
I feel pity for these Nords. When the dragons attack cities and towns, they will lose everything.
And we will lose customers. Let us hope that if there are dragons, there are only a few and they are not too foul-tempered.
I wonder if we should offer discounts to the soldiers.
The soldiers? From which side, the Stormcloaks, or the Imperials?
Both. One or the other is bound to win the war eventually. Why not curry favor now, so that the victor will look upon us kindly?
Hah, you have the foresight of a Khajiit in a sandstorm. If we offer a discount to both sides, the winners will persecute us for helping the losers.
Hm. I had not thought of it that way.
Between the war and the return of the dragons, I wonder if we should not leave Skyrim and ply our trade elsewhere.
I admit, the dragons are a concern, but we can avoid them if we do not stay in one place for too long.
That may be, but what of the war? That is not so easy to escape from.
The war? That is not a reason to leave, it is a reason to stay.
And what makes you think that?
Because war is good for business, of course.
Good question. I've only set foot inside a few times myself and that was in Mercer's company.
If you can get past his trained watchdog, I think your best bet might be the ramp to the second floor balcony in his backyard.
No. It's some sort of crazy contraption Mercer commissioned for quick escapes.
I'd wager a well-placed shot at the ramp's mechanism would lower it in a hurry.
That'd be Vald. A real piece of work, that one.
Mercer's holding something over his head, keeping him loyal.
Talk to Vex. She used to know him very well... if you catch my meaning.
That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know.
Vald? Good side? I think you have the wrong person.
The only thing Vald understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
Sure, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey.
Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.
Of mine? What is it?
No visitors. No way. Now piss off, before ya' make me mad.
I can't believe it! How did ya' talk her into this?
Never mind, I don't care. I'm just glad I don't gotta' work for Maven anymore.
Here, ya' did me a favor, I guess I owe you one.
You ain't got enough coin to make my problems go away unless ya' can talk Maven Black-Briar into letting me outta' my debt.
You try and set one foot in this yard, and I'll cut it off.
It's just across the bridge and up that hill.
We're close now. I can see the camp.
My men? What did you do? You'll die for this.
Wait, it's haunted? I don't like ghosts... let me think about this for a minute...
Why don't you go in there and get it?
Hmm....
Wait... who in blazes is this?
Oh! Um, he he... Hold on... I... I can explain...
Valmir, you rat. You're not a soldier at all! Must be one of the Thalmor!
I'm a Forsworn. One of our raids went bad, and I got captured.
Would've been fine dying for the Reach with my kinsmen, but the Silver-Bloods want their ore mined, so they threw me in here.
Murder. Banditry. Assault. Theft. And lollygagging.
Year seven, I think? Surprised I haven't cut my own throat out by now, but something keeps me going.
Guards brought me in about 12 years ago. Was running a good group of bandits up until then.
But these Forsworn. They're nothing like the men I cobbled together. They're real killers.
Guards say I murdered someone. I was just sleeping off some mead in my aunt's house, but that didn't stop them from arresting me.
I don't even know who they said I killed.
A couple of years? I wasn't a Forsworn when I came, but I joined up when I got in. Easier that way.
Don't want to talk about it.
Long enough.
The first time? Thieving. The second time? Thieving. The third time? Thieving. It kind of keeps going like that.
First it was 6 months, then a year, then 2 years. Now I'm in for life.
Yes, you certainly do.
You'll be going back to the College, then? I, uhh... I think perhaps I'll wait a bit before venturing there myself.
Let this whole thing blow over, you know. Give certain parties a chance to forget what I may have done.
Still, you've gotten me out of that cage, and I won't forget it. Thank you again, and good luck to you.
Have the books, do you? I mean, I'm very glad. That's wonderful.
You could, you know, let me out of this cage now.
The undercroft is ahead... ugh, Necromancers. Be careful.
The library is just through here. We're getting close now.
And the outpost at Dragon Bridge?
It'll be shuttered by the end of the month.
Very good. And you'll be returning to... Well, if you don't mind me asking, where exactly will you be going now, sir?
Hmph. Now there's an excellent question. An excellent question, indeed. Truth is, as soon as the Emperor sets sail,  I'm resigning my position.
Oh... I see. Well then, let me be just say that it's been an honor serving under you Commander Maro.
The honor has been mine. You should be proud of what we've accomplished here. The Dark Brotherhood is no more. And the Emperor, finally, is safe.
Yes sir.
And, once more, I prove Commander Maro the fool. I told him you can't stop the Dark Brotherhood. Never could.
My uncle Dengeir was Jarl until a short time ago. His old age and failing health caught up with him, and he stepped down.
He now serves us honorably as Thane, and to the great benefit of the hold, I now serve as Jarl.
Karliah's been through here. What does she expect to find?
The stench in here... this place smells of death. Be on your guard.
Pull the chain over there, and watch out for the spikes. Looks like Karliah reset all of the traps.
There's two more of them ahead.
Bone chimes... clever. Rigged to wake the draugr I'd bet. Don't blunder into any of them.
Karliah always was a nimble minx... slipping passed these draugr must be child's play for her.
We're on the right track. She's been through here as well.
Difficult? I am a Jarl. I eat the most succulent meat, drink the finest ale and hunt with the best hounds in the hold.
Meanwhile, my very capable steward sees to the needs of the smallfolk and ensures that my hold runs smoothly.
Being a Jarl could hardly be simpler. You should try it sometime.
It was Dengeir who made me a steward, long ago when he was young.
When Dengeir's health began to fail, young Sidgeir was appointed Jarl in his stead. It was simpler just to keep me as steward.
Sidgeir has no interest in running his hold, and so leaves such matters to me. As for my part, I do my best to see that folk are treated fairly.
Many battles have been fought here over the centuries. Graves were dug and monuments built, and the town grew around these.
In time, Falkreath came to be known as the heroes' graveyard. Many noble Jarls and renowned warriors asked to be buried here.
Falkreath's reputation has faded somewhat, but the graves remain, reminding us of the one inevitable truth of life.
That door up ahead... looks perfect for hiding an ambush. Be ready.
Leave this place... Leave this place...
We've been awaiting your return.
He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get him killed.
She'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get her killed.
Ysgramor was the hero who started the Companions. Wuuthrad was his weapon.
He came from the ancient homeland and killed all the elves.
But not all of them, because some of them are still here.
It was the blade hefted by Ysgramor when he returned to drive the elves out of the old Skyrim.
Without that axe, this whole land would be overrun still.
Wuuthrad is a relic of Ysgramor. Through that weapon, we trace our line straight to the first harbinger of makind in this land.
What fragments we have are displayed in honor, but we always seek more.
I watch you to make sure you are honorable.
If you are honorable and strong, then I can call you brother.
I watch you to make sure you are honorable.
If you are honorable and strong, then I can call you sister.
I would hope that's obvious.
Do well here, and you'll be a full member of the Companions.
Fail, and it won't matter anyway.
Bad people who don't like werewolves.
So they don't like us either.
A group of werewolf hunters who have gotten wise to our little secret.
They've made it their mission to hunt us down, but we are hunters ourselves.
Not everyone, but all the Circle are. It's a secret to everybody.
Not all of us, just the members of the Circle. We shouldn't be talking about this anyway.
Fascinating! Original Akaviri bas-reliefs... almost entirely intact!
Yes, of course. We'll have more time to look around later, I suppose. Let's see what's up ahead.
We're here for Alduin's Wall, right, Esbern?
Amazing... you can see how the Akaviri craftsmen were beginning to embrace the more flowing Nordic style...
She sold the city out to the Aldmeri Dominion. Were it not for her betrayal, Taneth could have held its ground in the war.
The other noble houses discovered her betrayal and she fled. They want her brought back alive.
The resistance against the Dominion is alive and well in Hammerfell, and they want justice.
You have? Where? Tell me now!
Money, if that is what you wish.
Now tell me where she is!
We cannot go after her, not without drawing attention.
You must bring her to us.
Lead her to the Whiterun stables, outside of the city. We will wait for you there.
All right, Delvin. What gives with that case of Shadowbanish you sold me?
What do you mean? That wine tastes finer than anythin' Surilie Brothers ever made.
Sure, it tastes great. Only one problem. You said it can make the darkness as clear as day when you drink it. Guess what? It doesn't.
Am I responsible if the vintage was off on that case? Sorry, you know the rules Vekel. No refunds.
Puttin' together another shipment from Morrowind, Vekel. Lookin' for anythin' special?
Well, if some Moon Sugar should fall into your lap...
Maybe. That stuff's gettin' tough to bring across the border with all the Argonian patrols.
Well if it turns up, I'll be willing to buy.
You need to tell your boys to place nice, Delvin. Almost threw two of them into the well last night.
They aren't my boys. Do I look like the leadin' type?
You know what I mean. Tell your boss that rough is rough, but when someone pulls a dagger fun time is over.
I'll pass it along.
Good news. I found that dwarven hammer you were looking for.
You did? Thanks. I get you the rest of your coin by tomorrow.
Yeah, funny thing about that. The price was a hundred higher than I expected.
Vekel, you have no shame. I'll get you the rest like I said. I want that hammer.
Why can't you just settle down and run the Flagon with me?
I don't want to settle. I like things the way they are.
Come on, Ton. Marry me. Let me take care of you.
I can take care of myself.
How dare you! After all we've been through together? How can you do this to me!
Look, I need to know. What's going on between you and Brynjolf?
That's all they are... rumors. So quit worrying.
I need you to do me a favor, Dirge.
Sure, Ton. You know I'm good for it.
There's a new guard nosing around the meadery. Can you do something about it?
Gladly. He won't bother you anymore, I promise.
Please milady, can you spare a gold coin for an old woman?
Please my lord, can you spare a gold coin for an old woman?
Please help me, I'm starving.
Please, I don't have anything to eat.
Can you spare any coin?
Spare a septim?
Go away.
Edda, you know well I barely have any coin to call my own. I'm sorry.
You must be starving. Here, spend it well.
All right, all right. Here.
Yes, I hope this helps.
Yes, of course. This war is causing your woes, it's hardly your fault.
Certainly, good lady. Here.
Are you joking? Go earn a living and stop loafing!
I would if I could, but I can barely make ends meet.
Here, this should help.
Of course, here. Be well.
Maybe you should look for work instead of begging for coin.
Here you are.
Oh you poor thing! Come by the temple and my husband and I will keep you fed.
Edda, Edda. There's no need for this. Just come by the temple and we'll care for you.
Sorry, all out of coin.
I've told you before, and I'll tell you again. Leave me alone.
Ugh, you reek. Get out of my way.
Here you go, dear.
Oh, very well. Just try and clean yourself up.
Get away from me, you filthy woman.
Spare a coin?
If you could spare a septim, I'd be grateful.
Help out an old man here with some coin, would you?
Hey, can I get a gold or two?
I could sure use some coin.
No. Now shove off.
Snilf, it's me. I don't have a roof over my head either, remember?
Oh if only I could provide more than this coin. I hope it'll do.
Again? Buy some food this time will you?
Yes, I hope this helps.
Another uncounted causality of this war. Here you are, you poor man.
Certainly, my good man. Here.
You're disgusting, stay away from me.
If I had even a pot to piss in, I'd gladly share. Sorry.
Yes, I hope this helps you.
Absolutely. Here you are. Be well.
Ugh, you smell horrible. Get yourself cleaned up.
Very well, here.
Oh you poor thing, you must be starving. Come to the temple later and let us feed you.
Snilf, I told you begging isn't the answer. I expect to see you at the temple later.
Sorry, no time. I'm late.
If you want to awaken from your next slumber, I suggest you leave me be.
What? No. Get away from me.
I suppose. Just get something to eat and stay away from the Bee and Barb for a change.
Very well, please use it for food.
Never. Now move aside.
That is your choice. We will not force you. But to join the Circle, your blood must be as ours.
Meet us here when you're ready.
Why are the potions I requested not completed?
I'm sorry, milady. The components for those elixirs are quite volatile and in some cases, very dangerous to handle. I must take care.
Excuses are not acceptable in my court. When I ask for something I expect results, and I expect them immediately.
Yes, milady. Sorry, milday. They will be completed.
There's still the matter of the prisoner to discuss. Now, his family is willing to contribute handsomely if we release him.
The execution will proceed as planned.
But, mother... this is quite a sizable contribution and the crime doesn't befit such a harsh punishment.
Are you going soft on me, Hemming? Perhaps I made the wrong choice installing you as steward.
No, mother. The execution will proceed as planned.
Hemming, have you dispatched that letter I gave you yesterday?
Yes, and I sent it with our fastest courier and under the cover of night, exactly as you specified.
Good. If I need to light a few fires in order to get what we need to defend this place from the Stormcloaks, so be it.
I'm almost certain he'll reach the Imperial City tomorrow, so we should have an answer by the end of the week.
Any word about our little problem in the Ratway?
I've spoken to Brynjolf and he assures me it'll be taken care of.
Next time you speak to him, tell him to clean up his own messes. I'm not about to jeopardize this position for a bunch of low-life thugs.
I'll let him know.
Your mother seems to have taken to her seat quite well.
Yes, she's been grooming herself for this for quite a long time.
It's surprising the Council is allowing a Nord rule Riften under the Imperial flag. That can't be their first choice.
Let's just say my mother knows which pockets to line and keep it at that.
So, have you thought about what I said?
I find the concept of sleeping with you not only repulsive, but morally unsettling. Does that answer your question?
You listen to me. I'd be careful wagging that pretty little tongue at me like that otherwise I may just have it cut off.
Just stay away from me and maybe I won't weave a spell to shrink something that matters to you.
Maul, can I ask a personal favor of you?
Well that depends on what the favor is, now doesn't it.
It's Hemming. He's making advances and I can't bear the man's presence. Is there anything you can do?
I'll talk to him, but he's stubborn. He's like his mother; he sees what he wants and he won't quit until he has it.
Anything you can do to keep his filthy hands off of me would be a welcome change.
My agents are telling me that we've appropriated the caravan from Hammerfell... with minimal losses.
For what it's costing me, I should be handed the merchandise on a silver platter.
The coin isn't just for the men, there's a lot of people that need to be compensated in order to make this happen.
And a hefty cut for yourself too I'm sure. Just see to it the items are secured and the rest disposed of properly this time.
I don't understand, Elgrim. The formulas you're giving me are for novices but I've advanced well passed that point.
Until you can do those formulas with your eyes shut, you'll never be ready to master the more difficult ones.
This is an utter waste of time.
Ingun! If you want to remain in my shop as an apprentice I expect you to act like one. No exceptions!
Very well, I'll keep practicing them.
Ingun, you clumsy fool! You've tainted our entire supply of Painted Troll Fat. You have no idea how hard that was to get.
I'm sure my mother can compensate you for it.
I'll draft a letter to Rythe. If you could have it sent to Cheydinhal for me, that would make up for your blunder.
I'll make sure it's sent right away.
Niluva, you promised me you'd pay me back yesterday. So what's the story?
Just give me a few more days and I promise I'll come up with it.
If you'd stop wasting your coin on that skooma, you'd have enough gold to live on.
Sorry, Tythis. I'll get it to you somehow.
How do you do it, Valindor? How do you work at Black-Briar Meadery and the Fishery without getting exhausted?
Oh, it's not so terrible. I actually find the work quite relaxing.
Relaxing? They must be working you to the bone! You should rest before you do yourself in.
Not to worry, dear Svana. I promise you I can handle it, but your concern is quite flattering.
Wujeeta, you really need to stop using that skooma. It's very bad for your health and I wouldn't want to see anything happen to you.
I can't, Valindor. It won't let me go. It's taking over my life.
It's an evil substance. Whoever's selling it to you should be brought to justice.
If there was any justice in the world, I'd just get this over with and die peacefully.
Wujeeta, you're worrying me. You look so... well, so sad.
Don't worry about it, Svana. It's my problem... no need for you to get involved.
Look, if you're in some sort of trouble, I could talk to Haelga.
No, no... please, I'm just tired is all. Thank you.
So how are things with you and Bolli?
How do you think? He's a pig. All I am to him is a warm body to lay with.
Nivenor! How can you say that? He gives you everything you ask for.
If I cared for your opinion on our affairs, I'd ask. Now, if you'll excuse me.
You found it? I've been looking for that blade for months. You took on all those bandits yourself?
Thank you. Here, my father had a favorite sword and shield technique. Let me teach it to you, in honor of his memory.
Bless you, friend. You have renewed my hope.
Before I came into Zenithar's calling, I confess I was a thief. But I learned a few things in my time that might help you survive. Let me show you.
You mean... there's still a chance? But how? Our plan has gone to ruin, everyone is dead, the Family...
Ah, yes, I can imagine you'd want to settle that score. Last I heard he was at the Solitude Docks, conducting the Emperor's departure.
The poor child is probably beggin' for us to string up her murderin' father.
Best tell the Jarl.
The spirit world is strong in this place.
Look to the graveyard. That is where you'll find her.
You saw her ghost?
I'm glad it was you and not me.
She's buried outside of town. That's where I'd look.
Give it to me quickly, before they see us together. You've riled up the priestesses, and the guards don't take kindly to that.
Here's your share. Nicely done.
Bunch of foreign troublemakers. Wandering around, getting into mischief, scaring the citizens.
They've been told to stay out of the city, but keep trying to get back in.
Ooh, you're a wizard! I mean, you cast that spell just now, yeah? I was hoping you could make me invisible or something. Can you? Make me invisible?
Awww. And here I thought you could do it...
Well, I'll just have to think of something else then. Bye.
Really? I mean... I still feel like I'm here.
Okay, great!
Now I'm finally going to have some fun around here.
Bye!
Okay, great!
Now I'm finally going to have some fun around here.
Bye!
You're dumb.
All right! I knew you'd do it. This is going to be so fun. You can't even imagine!
I can't wait to be invisible.
Come on. Hurry it up already. The waiting is killing me.
Hey... So are you ever going to make me invisible or what?
Boo! Ahahahaha!
Oooooh... weeeeoooooo....
That's right. Who's invisible? Me!
Surprise! Ahaha!
Really? I dunno... I don't feel invisible.
You disrespected the Brotherhood. And it'll cost you. You want back into the Family, you pay the price. 500 gold, and all is forgiven.
You may be Listener, and head of the Sanctuary, but your recent behavior sets a bad example. I must insist you pay a fine of 300 gold.
If the Tenets were still in place, you would be required to defeat the Wrath of Sithis. Now you just need to pay a fine to Nazir. Ah, the Old Ways...
When you disrespect your Family, you disrespect yourself. Don't you care for anything at all? Prove that you do - speak with Nazir, make reparations.
Bah. If it were up to me, we'd cut off your hands and never let you back in this Sanctuary. But no. All you have to do is pay Nazir a fine. Pathetic.
Ah, don't worry, we all like to break the rules sometimes. Just see Nazir and pay the fine. Seems I do that at least once a month...
There are so few rules here. All we ask is that you don't disrespect your Family. But for some reason, you have. Best talk to Nazir and pay the fine.
Idiot. I may not have a lot of rules, but that doesn't give you free reign to do as you please. You want to resume your duties? Go talk to Nazir.
Oh, but Cicero can't talk to you. You've been naughty, naughty. I think you need to clear this whole mess up with Nazir.
Looks like Cicero's not the only only one to go a little crazy from time to time. Eh, Listener? You should talk to Nazir, work this whole mess out.
With all due respect, Listener, you broke what few rules we seem to have. Nazir insists you talk to him and work this issue out.
I do apologize, Listener, but Nazir made it clear the initiates are not to speak with you until you first deal with him, and atone for your actions.
Good. I'll spread the word that you've made reparations. Now let's forget the past and get back to business...
Excellent. Now we can get back to business. I think it's best we just forget this ever happened and move on, hmm?
Then I suggest you [QUOTE]collect[QUOTE] it. Until you pay the fine, you are effectively cut off from all Dark Brotherhood duties and contracts.
Not ready? Well, my arrogant little sibling, until you pay the fine the Dark Brotherhood holds nothing for you. No contracts. No rewards. No respect.
I understand, Listener. And I hope you understand that until the fine is paid, I must insist you refrain from all Dark Brotherhood business.
My pa always warned me about these things!
Damn dustmen! Why don't you stay dead?
Just what I was afraid of!
Damn dustmen!
Why don't you stay dead?
Look out! Draugr!
It must be the Stormcloaks! Find them!
Look out! Draugr!
It's got to be the Imperials! Find them!
Don't know. He just said he needed to talk to you before you do anything else.
I don't like making him angry, but there is some work for you if you want it.
He didn't say, but you'd better move fast.
There's probably something I could find for you to do, but best to check with him.
I don't know, but he sounded impatient.
I did. Your time, it seems, has come.
Yes, and we have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad.
He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out.
Aela will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp.
Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp.
So I'm told. Try and keep up.
So I'm told. Let's see if you impress.
Ah, you're back.
Me? I'm Burguk's brother. I came back after serving many years in the Legion.
By then, Burguk had already become chief, and he welcomed me home as family, not a rival as is tradition.
I did. I was known as Ghorbash gro-Dushnikh in those days, in honor of my homeland.
Many Orcs leave the stronghold to join the Legion. They welcome our skill in battle and smithing, and we welcome a chance to see the world.
I do. There is a freedom the roads give you that the stronghold does not.
But I have a place here, and I wouldn't want to dishonor my clan by leaving again like some young pup.
I couldn't. It would dishonor the place the chief has made for me.
You're right. Look at me, talking in circles like some old wise woman. Very well, outlander. You have my axe when you need it.
Yes, but I am honor-bound to stay here.
Well, for that much, I don't think Malacath would turn his scowl on me. All right, outlander. My axe is yours.
My honor isn't so cheap, outlander.
I'm not a coward, outlander. You want me to prove it? Fine. My axe is yours. To the most dangerous corners of Skyrim and back.
As you wish.
I am Larak's daughter. Soon, I'll be of age and will be sent to marry an Orc chief in some distant stronghold.
Until then, I train. My new home will need strength, and my new sisters must know I am not weak when I arrive.
No. A chief's daughter marries who her chief wishes. It ensures the stronghold receives a fair trade in goods for my absence.
I used to look forward to the day when I was of age, to see new places and people, but now it feels like a cage.
Yes, but I must stay here and wait for the day when I'll be married and sent to another stronghold.
It is our way, and I am proud to follow my people's traditions, but I can't help but feel chained.
I couldn't. It would shame my chief and my mother and foremothers.
You're right. Malacath teaches us to meet our fate. Perhaps this is mine.
What do you know about my people, outlander?
No mercy!
Bring it on!
Gettin' to old for this.
You're mine!
I'll cut your throat!
Come on!
You've breathed your last!
Your end is near!
Out of my way!
You mean nothing!
Your life is mine!
You're making this too easy!
Your fate is sealed!
Nocturnal, guide my hand!
Dodge this!
Darkness consume you!
Shadows take you!
Is that all you've got?
You fight like a child!
Ha! You're pathetic!
Die, damn you!
Come on, put up a fight!
Give up?
Yeargh!
Rargh!
Hyargh!
Nyargh!
Yiiee!
Hunh!
Die!
Grrarrgh!
Die, insect!
I will end you!
You're as good as dead!
You're... dead!
Fall, damn you!
Agggh!
Come on!
I... Willl... kill you!
Ha ha ha ha ha!
You're pathetic!
Talos smite you!
Talos smite you!
Die dog!
Hahaha!
On your knees!
Take that!
Die!
Yeeeaarrggh!
Hhyyaarrgghh!
Nnnnyyaarrgghh!
Rrargh!
Hrargh!
Unnff!
Nuhn!
Aggh!
Oof!
Arrggh!
Gah!
Hunh!
Wagh!
Unh!
No...
Enough of this!
Damn it, no more!
I'll... get you...
I'm not done yet...
Gods... the pain...
You'll... pay for this...
Noooo....
Shadows take me...
Aghh..
I don't have time for this.
There's no need to hide. I won't hurt you.
Come out and face me, you coward!
I can smell your fear.
I can hear your heart beating.
Hiding? The shadows are my domain!
Hiding only prolongs the inevitable.
I know you're here. Show yourself.
I'll find you... it's only a matter of time.
Coward. Come out and fight me!
Come on, show yourself!
I'm going to find you...
Hm? Something's near...
Wait, I hear something...
I heard something.
Who's there?
What was that?
Time to fight!
Finally! Let's end this.
There you are!
Your feeble attempt to hide is insulting!
You can't hide from me!
Enough games, let's end this!
Come coward, now we fight!
I knew I heard something!
Now you're mine!
You've got moments to live.
I'm endin' you right now!
Sure, pick on the old guy!
Come on, I won't bite.
Let's get this party started.
Been itching for a fight.
I promise a swift but painful end!
No mercy for the weak!
I'll give no quarter!
So, it's to the pain then!
Ah good, I could use some practice!
I'll tear you apart!
The burden of death approaches!
Come, taste darkness's embrace!
Your life is forfeit!
I bring death from the shadows!
By Nocturnal's grace, I will defeat you!
I'll bury my blade in your heart!
Your death will be my triumph!
You're not a threat... merely an annoyance.
You've just written your own epitaph.
Your blood will adorn my blade!
This shouldn't take long.
So, it begins.
Where'd you come from?
Hey!
Talos smite you!
Sovngarde awaits!
This should be fun!
For the Emperor!
Die villain!
I'll enjoy killing you!
Guess it was nothing after all.
I must've been hearing things.
They picked on the wrong old man.
Haven't fought like that in years.
That was fun.
Waste of time.
Didn't even work up a sweat.
Pathetic.
That's what happens when you cross the Guild.
I think they got the message.
Damn, just as I was getting warmed up.
I hardly felt a thing.
And that's why I'm the best.
The afterlife will bring you darkness.
Bless you, Lady of Shadows... I live another day.
I send you to your rest.
You were no match for a Nightingale.
Shadows consume you.
That wasn't a fight, it was an execution.
So ends the lesson.
That was hardly worth my time.
How disappointing.
Hmph. Hardly a challenge.
That'll teach you to cross me.
That's the end of that.
Oh come now, resorting to petty tricks are we?
A bold but foolish move.
Coward.
You cannot escape!
Where'd you go?
Come back here!
Where are you?
You can't hide forever!
You can't get away from me!
Show yourself!
No one here now.
Must've scared 'em off.
Enough of this! Fight me!
So, you reveal yourself!
You can't hide from me!
Now you die!
There you are!
Ha, found you!
That is a fine idea. The stronghold would need the gold when I left to marry, anyway. I am ready when you are.
No. That won't be enough.
I am not weak. Very well, outlander, I will go with you whenever you are ready.
You dare challenge a child of Malacath?
Thank you for asking.
You wouldn't be a sellsword, would you? I have a little problem you could solve.
I used to be an adventurer in my day, then I settled down. Got married.
I may have accidentally let a prisoner escape. The leader of one of those bandit groups.
I told everyone he died during questioning, and I need you to track him down and make sure he doesn't show up to disprove that.
That's right. Used to explore all over. I'm the one who originally found the mine Darkwater Crossing was built around.
I was actually scouting a bit the other day, old times sake. Spied a brigand heading back to his camp.
Up for a little hunting? My husband is being a sad stick, so I can't go myself.
Whenever a group of marauders attack a Nord village, Ulfric is the first to sound the horn and send the men.
But a group of Dark Elf refugees gets ambushed? A group of Argonians, or a Khajiit caravan? No troops. No investigation. Nothing.
There's a group of cutthroats out there right now that Ulfric doesn't lift a finger to bring to justice, as long as they don't threaten Nord land.
Good. I'll have a sack of coin waiting for you when you get back.
This brings back memories. Come back when you're done and maybe I'll be up to showing you a few tricks.
That's a brave offer. I'd be happy to throw in my coin behind that.
You deal with them, I'll make sure you get paid. Maybe this old soldier will throw in some lessons as well.
Suit yourself.
Fair enough.
Yes. It is.
That's a load off my mind. Here's your pay.
You remind me of myself a few years ago. Let me show you a little bit about wearing light armor. It's helped me out whenever I was scouting.
Now I've got the itch to travel again. If you're leaving town, I wouldn't mind coming with for a while.
Now that's good work. Everyone will be a lot safer with them gone, Dark Elf and Nord alike.
Here, some gold as promised, and let me show you a bit about wearing heavy armor. Save you some aches on a long march.
My husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his [QUOTE]pretty Juniper.[QUOTE]
It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now.
I am. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
I was the finest scout in the Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Yes. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead.
Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
Of course I am. What do I look like, a tavern wench?
Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Well, aren't you sweet? I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.
Oh, you could? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.
According to my grandfather at least. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into.
Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary.
Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.
Why am I not surprised?
Very well.
So many things lost....
Well, I never claimed otherwise.
Pfft. Ungrateful milk drinker.
Thank you. Here, let an old alchemist pass on some of her secrets to you.
Thank you. It's a collection of regrets that I try not to forget. Here, I promised you this.
Look at it. That's real Nord craftsmanship, that is! Let me show you an old trick I learned as a scout. Makes it harder for the enemy to notice you.
My clan's shield. So Lenne really did stumble into that cave and was eaten by monsters.
In honor of his memory, let me show you a few shield techniques. And tell me if you're leaving town. Be good to travel again.
Look at that edge. Still sharp.
I'll present this to the Jarl later. As for you, let me show you some smithing techniques.
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
Oh. All right... I guess I'll just keep practicing on my own. Sorry to bother you.
Really? Great! Okay. So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the [QUOTE]right[QUOTE] way to do things.
Get your ward ready.
Great! Now I'm going to cast some spells at you. Keep your ward up so I can study it.
I think I see what I was doing wrong...
Come on. I don't want to hit you until you have your ward ready.
All right. That should do it. I think I'm ready to try the College again. Thanks!
We would but there's a big wedding taking place at Castle Dour. We'll have to wait until after the wedding.
Come back in a few nights when the wedding reception is over and we'll start the ceremony when you do.
Why didn't you say so? Take over my post. Make sure nobody enters the Solar.
The Emissary? What's this about?
Wait... who are you? Intruder!
Well? Get out of here and mind your rounds.
Please, cut me down!
You! Please, help me!
Hurry, cut me down!
I want to get to my son. He's all I have left.
That which is unknown can create unease, even fear. It is to be expected.
Some fear our new resident wizard. As they grow to know him, they will accept him.
Time will prove me right.
Really? He's safe? Where is he?
Mara's mercy, then he's safe! Come on, we have a lot to discuss.
What? You left him on his own? With the Thalmor after him? Go make sure he's safe and bring him here!
So what are you doing here? Lorkhan's eyes, you can't let the Thalmor get to him first! Get back to Riften!
Did you tell him you were Dragonborn? I didn't think so.
Lorkhan's eyes, do I have to do everything myself? Get back to Riften before the Thalmor find him!
Hasn't she told you? We were both Blades, back when that still meant something.
Now we're just fellow fugitives from the Thalmor. I didn't know she was still alive, but I'm not surprised. She was a survivor.
Well. They've been hunting down Blades since the Great War, on general principle.
But if you mean me, now, in particular... maybe they've started to get an inkling of what the return of the dragons means.
I don't suppose they want the world to end any more than we do. Or at least, they'd prefer to end it on their terms.
Haven't you been paying attention to anything I've said? Only you can finally defeat Alduin and avert the end of the world!
If we can just find out what this Dragonrend Shout is, you may have a chance.
Or not. There's no guarantee with prophecy. Merely hope.
Haven't you been paying attention to anything I've said? Only you can finally defeat Alduin and avert the end of the world!
If we can just find out what Shout the ancient Nords used, you may have a chance.
Or not. There's no guarantee with prophecy. Merely hope.
It's the prophecy, don't you see? Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world!
But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. The prophecy doesn't say. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope.
Not yet, not yet. When we get to Riverwood... with Delphine... I'll tell you both then, when I've collected my thoughts.
I never expected... well, suddenly here you are and now I'm too muddled to explain myself.
I still need some time to get used to the idea that there might be hope for us after all.
Yes, yes, you're the new Family member. Let's make this easy - consider me the cranky old uncle nobody talks to. You go your way, I'll go mine.
There you are! Astrid's told me all about you. Heard she pulled the ole' [QUOTE]Choose your victim[QUOTE] gag with you. Ah, I love that one...
Well, well. It's raw meat. Oh, my beautiful wife has told me all about you.
New brother. May I offer my most sincere welcome to our Family.
New sister. May I offer my most sincere welcome to our Family.
Welcome, my brother. Welcome to our Sanctuary. You have made the right choice, joining us, I assure you.
Welcome, my sister. Welcome to our Sanctuary. You have made the right choice, joining us, I assure you.
Hmph.
I'll give you a week before you end up dead in a ditch.
You certainly have a strange energy about you. I look forward to following your progress.
You just trust in Astrid, follow her orders, and you'll do fine here.
You're going to love it here. We have a lot of fun, and we look out for each other. Just like any family.
Ha ha ha ha! Again! Again! Do the part where he tries to buy you some candy.
Okay, okay. Wait. Here we go. [QUOTE]Ooh, you are such a pretty little girl. Would the sweetie like a sweetie? Oh yes, how about some chocolate?[QUOTE]
Oh yes, please, kind sir. My mama and papa left me all alone, and I'm so very hungry. I know a shortcut to the candy shop. Through this alley.
Oh ya, very good. Very good. My it is dark down here. Oh, but you are so beautiful. Such a lovely smile. Your teeth... your teeth! No! Aggghh!!
Oh Babette, but you are so wicked.
What about you, Festus? How did that last contract turn out?
Oh, yes, please, old man. Regale us with your tales of wizardry...
Ah, the young and stupid. Always mocking the experienced and brilliant. My contract went very well, I'll have you know.
Tried a new spell. Little something I've been working on in my spare time. Came [QUOTE]this[QUOTE] close to turning that priest inside out. Damned messy.
And what of your latest, Arnbjorn. Something about a Khajiit? Merchant was it?
Oh, a big doggy chasing a little kitty! How adorable!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
I am not adorable, it was not funny, and he wasn't a merchant. He was a Khajiit monk, a master of the Whispering Fang style.
But now he's dead... and I have a new loincloth.
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
You call yourself a wizard? I challenge you to a duel!
I won't take no for answer!
The gods will be the judge of that.
Stop it! This is a one-on-one duel!
I thought you were a wizard. Hit me with a spell!
You're cheating!
It's no fun unless you fight me with magic.
This is a magic duel. Ma-gic. You know, with spells.
That's better. Now we can talk.
The research I've done seems to indicate that Skorm Snow-Strider left part of his journal here after laying siege.
I believe it should indicate how to enter the blocked off sections of the stronghold.
I should warn you, Forelhost is quite haunted, but I'm sure you can handle it. Return to me here once you've obtained the staff.
Me? No, I'm too important to the war effort to risk life and limb in there... Besides, that's what I'm paying you for.
It seems that after the strength of the Cult was broken in the Dragon War a last contingent came here to create a stronghold and regroup.
King Harald's forces crushed stragglers here the during the First Era and it has been haunted ever since, but the specifics of the siege are unclear.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshipped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost.
And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power.
But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
Oh... well... of course they'd disavow all knowledge... spies are everywhere.
I've just been asked enough questions. I'm here to learn, not to explain myself over and over.
Forgive me, I didn't mean to assume.
No, I suppose we haven't. Brelyna Maryon, of House Telvanni. First of my family to leave Morrowind in a long time.
Now I'm here to study Conjuration. That's what's important.
Didn't you know?
Before the Oblivion Crisis, many elves called Winterhold their home. More visited the College from Morrowind every year.
After, growing distrust of magic made life difficult for many. Some left rather than endure the growing hatred from the local Nords.
Others returned home after the Red Year, when Vvardenfell erupted and caused much destruction.
Winterhold itself died in the years between then and now. What's left out there is a husk. Only the College really remains.
You consider Restoration a valid school of magic, worthy of study, don't you? Don't you?
Good, good.
Not that I require validation, of course. There are just some - and I shan't name names - who would disagree.
It can make life difficult when one's colleagues fail to recognize the research one engages in.
I... I see.
Well, I'm glad we've established this early, rather than me hearing about it years or decades later when the whispers behind my back are loud enough.
It's quite simple really. There are some who shall not be dignified by being named, who have implied that it is not.
That is to say, it's been suggested that resources used for my study of Restoration could be put to better use. Any other use, in fact.
It's not just healing cuts and bruises, you know. The undead are a very real, very dangerous threat and Restoration magics can keep them at bay.
Not to mention the benefit of wards! How can they continually overlook wards! It's baffling!
Well... No. Not really. Not directly, I mean.
But I know things are said behind my back. Conversations cease when I enter rooms.
I'm quite aware of what's going on here, and I will not stand for it!
You are now in the Arcanaeum, of which I am in charge. It might as well be my own little plane of Oblivion.
Disrupt my Arcanaeum, and I will have you torn apart by angry Atronachs.
Now, do you require assistance?
Of course I do. If I didn't, most of these books would've been burned to ashes or dissolved to nothing before the Third Era.
Mages need to be reminded to be careful around research materials.
A mage is only as good as what he knows. I try and make sure as much knowledge is available as possible.
We've been keeping this collection since the Second Era. Books have come and gone during that time, but it's mostly intact.
If you require assistance with summoning techniques, please let me know.
If you would, please also contain your summons to the College grounds. The locals do not need to be agitated further by Atronachs roaming their town.
The summoning of undead is even less advisable outside of the College.
By Sheor, no. Those archaic policies died out with the Mages Guild, and were never enforced here.
Necromancy, as any other type of magic, is a tool to be used.
Of course, non-mages may not see it that way, so we don't go around flaunting it.
Do not cross the bridge unaided!
You risk death by doing so, and you shall not gain entry.
You must first prove your worth, and then I shall lead you across.
Dragons, is it? Does that make you the fabled [QUOTE]Dragonborn[QUOTE] we've heard mention of?
You were just going to prove that you're Dragonborn.
Can you? You have the power of the Voice? Now I'm interested.
By all means, show me.
So you have the Voice, then? I would be quite impressed to see that.
You do indeed have the power. I'm impressed.
Please, follow me. I'll escort you inside the College.
The key to wards is that they take time to charge.
Not long, but you can't start casting with a fireball coming at you.
Also, if your ward isn't negated by an incoming spell, it will recharge itself after a moment or two.
Just be careful. Casting wards requires constant concentration, and you can easily find yourself drained of your magicka reserves.
Walk always in the shadow of Sithis.
May the shroud of death embrace you.
Darkness guide you.
Burn that little jester alive.
Remember, fireballs. You can never go wrong.
Go, incinerate some poor bastard for me.
Yeah, yeah. Goodbye, kill lots of people, Hail Sithis, and all that.
Go. Do what has to be done.
Have fun!
Can't wait to hear all about the next person you murder.
Have a good contract.
Kill well, and often.
Just come back alive, and I'll be happy.
Go on now. Time to get your hands bloody.
Take care of yourself, beef roast.
Later, ham hock.
Yeah, good luck.
Represent us well, brother.
Represent us well, sister.
Remember, when you kill - we all wield the blade.
Watch yourself out there.
Cicero bids you... farewell.
Oh, yes. Goodbye, goodbye.
Farewell, farewell!
Until next time, brother.
Until next time, sister.
Kill well. And often.
Right, then.
Stay safe.
Only way you could have found one of those is by stealin' it. Guess you'll fit in around here better than I thought.
So what do you want to know?
The name's Maul; I watch the streets for the Black-Briars. If you need dirt on anything, I'm your guy.
Do I look like a merchant to you? You're going to have to take that up with Vex in the Thieves Guild.
Get in good with them and you'll find her.
Not exactly. The crown is what the Guild calls a paragon; an object that enhances our thieving abilities.
At least, that's what I'm told it does... there hasn't been a paragon in this Guild for hundreds of years.
If we want to stay on top in Skyrim, the Guild needs that paragon back.
Without it, we're just a bunch of petty thieves.
When you Shout, you speak in the language of dragons. Thus, your Dragon Blood gives you an inborn ability to learn Words of Power.
Dragons have always been able to Shout. Language is intrinsic to their very being.
There is no difference in the dragon tongue between debating and fighting. Shouting comes as naturally to a dragon as breathing, or speaking.
In mythic times, when mortalkind was in great need, the goddess Kynareth granted us the ability to speak as dragons do.
For most people, long years of training are required to learn even the simplest Shout.
But for you, the dragon speech is in your blood, and you learn it almost without effort.
Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of [QUOTE]Wuld.[QUOTE]
Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of [QUOTE]Nah.[QUOTE]
Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of [QUOTE]Kest.[QUOTE]
Their Voices are too powerful for anyone not trained in the Way to withstand. Even a whisper could kill you.
Five. Our leader, Paarthurnax, lives alone on the peak of the Throat of the World.
When your Voice can open the path, you will know you are ready to speak to him.
As I said, you will know you are ready when your Voice can open the path to him.
How can you just sit here and wait? We should be in there!
We must gather our strength. Who knows what's inside?
Treasure, that's what! Get off your scaly rump and let's go.
Hush, Salma. We aren't alone.
Too easy.
There's the Blades agent! Kill him!
There's the Blades agent! Kill her!
If they had their way, you'd do nothing but sit up on their mountain with them and talk to the sky, or whatever it is they do.
The Greybeards are so afraid of power that they won't use it.
Think about it. Have they tried to stop the civil war, or done anything about Alduin?
No. And they're afraid of you, of your power.
Trust me, there's no need to be afraid. Think of Tiber Septim. Do you think he'd have founded the Empire if he'd listened to the Greybeards?
What? You have it?
No... No, as tempting as it is, it won't do to have both sides angry at us.
The College has had enough trouble staying out of the war. No need to make it worse.
You take that book to General Tullius or Ulfric and let them have their little triumph. It will be delivered back here to me soon enough.
They live in seclusion near the top of the Throat of the World, the great mountain of Skyrim.
They're masters of the Way of the Voice - of Shouting.
It's a great honor for them to summon you. They speak to very few - in fact, they hardly speak at all.
No doubt. The appearance of a Dragonborn at this time is not an accident. Your destiny is surely bound up with the return of the dragons.
You should focus on honing your Voice, and soon your path will be made clear.
The Voice was a gift of the goddess Kynareth, at the dawn of time. She gave mortals the ability to speak as dragons do.
Although this gift has often been misused, the only true use of the Voice is for the worship and glory of the gods.
True mastery of the Voice can only be achieved when your inner spirit is in harmony with your outward actions.
In the contemplation of the sky, Kynareth's domain, and the practice of the Voice, we strive to achieve this balance.
We study the Way of the Voice, according to the teachings of our founder, Jurgen Windcaller.
Very few are permitted to study with us here at High Hrothgar.
But in your case, Dragonborn, it is a privilege to guide you towards mastery of your Voice.
Sky above, Voice within.
Exactly. Nobody even remembers our name these days.
We used to be known across Tamriel as the protectors of the Septim Emperors. Those days are long gone, though.
For the last two hundred years, we've been searching for the next Dragonborn to guide and guard, as we are sworn to do.
But we never found one. Until now.
The faction that rules the Aldmeri Dominion. The ones who almost destroyed the Empire during the Great War, thirty years back.
There's no worse enemy to humankind in Tamriel. The Empire barely survived the last war. The Thalmor don't intend to lose the next one.
I'm very dangerous! Don't make me come out there and hurt you!
I'm not opening this door, so you might as well leave me alone.
If my friends find out you've been bothering me, you'll be very sorry!
Go away!
This one's mine.
Wind guide you.
Sky guard you.
Stand together and we shall defeat him!
There he is!
No escape this time, foul worm!
Careful!
Uh-oh.
This is not good.
Be careful. The Forsworn are just as dangerous as they look.
The roads just aren't safe these days.
I don't have time for this.
Where do they keep coming from?
Watch out. Wolves.
Should have picked somebody else for your dinner.
If that's the way you want it.
Good. I can use the practice.
Here we go.
Look out!
On guard!
Ah ha.
So it wasn't my imagination.
Ach, there you are.
Aha.
I've got one!
Bad move.
This won't take long.
Too slow.
This is how it's done.
Well, I guess you'll have to.
If you really think you can manage...
I mean, I'd hate to leave now and find out later you met some horrible fate at the hands of the Caller.
But if you insist, I suppose I'll be on my way. Thank you, and good luck.
Yes, let's!
Really, I think there's been a mistake.
May I just speak with her, please, to clear all this up?
Just let me out of here. I only wanted to help you!
Okay, now can you let me out? Please? I won't tell anyone it was you.
Just open the cage, and I'll leave quietly. Won't make a sound, won't bother you at all.
Quiet down.
Stop your whining.
She said you stay in there, and that's final.
I'll give you something to cry about if you don't quiet down.
You just can't leave well enough alone, can you?
And just what do you think you're doing?
Unfortunately for you, we don't allow men into the inner sanctum.
Unfortunately for you, we don't allow the uninitiated into the inner sanctum.
Indeed it is.
There are many valuable artifacts all through the temple.
You have committed a breach, and must pay the penalty.
Normally, a quick death.
Normally, a period of servitude.
Luckily for you, there are more pressing matters. We could make an example of you, but perhaps you could be put to better use.
The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil.
I don't expect you to know what that means.
Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us.
Through the Protocol, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone.
If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven.
So be it. We gave you a choice.
So be it. We gave you a choice.
We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten.
Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.
The sisters are communing with Dibella. They can't be disturbed.
You'll have to come back another time.
Why the drawn weapon? Is it contemplating violence?
Neat weapon. You're not going to hurt anybody, though. Right?
I trust you'll put your weapon away?
You planning on using that weapon?
Civilized people don't brandish their weapons unless they plan to use them.
Umm... you're not planning on using that weapon, are you? At least not on me... right?
You'd better know how to use that weapon if you plan on swinging it around in here.
Perhaps you'd care to put your weapon away? Hmm?
There a reason you're walking around with an unsheathed weapon?
This one wonders why you brandish your weapon so?
Might want to put it away that weapon... unless you plan on using it.
You got no respect, strutting about with that weapon out, threatening everyone.
Dear. You should put that weapon away.
You got guts walking around with that weapon out. Looking for a fight? Is that it?
Put that thing away before someone gets hurt!
Now, now... no need for weapons.
Nice weapon you have there. But I don't suppose you'd consider putting it away?
What's this? Is it spoiling for a fight? If not, it should hide its weapon away.
You want to fight? That why you have your weapon out?
Wow. Nice weapon! Can I hold it? I promise not to break anything. Honest!
Put your weapon away.
You're not planning on hurting anyone with that weapon there, are you?
So... carrying that weapon around like that makes you feel safe, does it?
Uh. Hey. That weapon there is just for show. Right? I mean, you aren't going to hurt me or anything... right?
In some parts of the world, wielding a weapon openly like that is an invitation to combat...
Ooh, real tough, wagging your weapon around...
I suggest you put away your weapon. Wouldn't want to cause a... scene.
You're not planning on using that weapon in here, I hope.
That's mighty bold, strutting about like that, looking for a fight. This one will oblige if he must.
Oh ho! What's with the weapon? Looks like it's about to get rough in here.
Damn fool parading around with your weapon out. You planning on hurting someone, huh?
You're making people a bit nervous. Should consider putting that weapon away.
Ever see someone killed with their own weapon? Would you like to?
Walk into the the wrong place with your weapon drawn? You might not walk out again....
It's probably best if you put that weapon away.
Nice weapon you got there. Care to put it away?
If you cause problems, I'll have to ask you to leave.
You're making my patrons nervous. Put the weapon away.
Put that thing away. You're making people nervous.
We've all seen your little weapon. We're impressed. Now, please put it away.
It's time to put the weapon away now. Thank you.
It is making patrons nervous. It needs to put the weapon away, now.
You. Weapon. Away. Now!
You can bring weapons in, but you can't use 'em in here. Got it?
If it's not too much to ask, put the weapon away? Thanks.
I trust I won't have to, but I'll bust your head in if you cause problems for my patrons.
While a good fight is always entertaining, my patrons don't like blood in their food. Put the weapon away.
If you don't mind, my patrons would appreciate it if you put the weapon away.
Don't break anything with that weapon, okay?
You break it, you buy it.
Please... don't break my wares!
If that weapon breaks anything, you will be buying it.
This is a proper store. Start acting like a proper customer. Sheathe that weapon.
Don't start swinging that thing in here.
If that weapon breaks anything of mine, I'll break something of yours.
Put that thing away, or get out.
You should probably put that away before you knock something over.
Break my stuff with that weapon, and I'll break you.
Watch it with that thing!
Fine weapon, but you wouldn't mind putting it away, I'm sure.
Look. You're making my customers nervous. Put the weapon away.
You. Weapon. Put it away. Now.
Don't start swinging that thing in here. You break it, you buy it.
Brandishing your weapon is not going to help you negotiate a better sale...
You're disturbing my other customers.
That weapon breaks my wares, we're gonna have us a real problem...
You won't be intimidating me into lower prices. Put that thing away.
Walking around with your weapon out is bound to make people nervous. We understand each other?
If that weapon causes problems for my customers, I cause problems for you. Got it?
Unless you're here to sell that weapon of yours, why don't you put it away.
Come on. Put the weapon away. You're making people nervous.
Pff. Go away, if you know what's good for you.
I got nothing to say to you.
I'm not looking for a conversation.
Leave me alone.
He's in the Flagon right now. Get ready.
She's in the Flagon right now. Get ready.
You're sure?
Of course I'm sure! He was asking about Esbern.
Of course I'm sure! She was asking about Esbern.
Doesn't matter. We'll kill them either way.
For your help, I'm sending word to the Orc strongholds that you're to be trusted. You should be welcome there now.
Yes. I earned the right by slaying my father in single combat.
One day, I will have a son who will challenge me when I become too old to lead, and the stronghold will have a new chief.
Until then, I alone have the right to have wives and children. It ensures our strength.
Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable.
But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary.
My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps. Deal with them.
We will see.
Then leave.
I'm impressed. Forsworn usually make short work of mercenaries, but you took care of them. Here is your reward.
Yeah. Follow my wife's orders, and don't do anything stupid.
You must speak to that Muiri woman, correct? I have heard rumors in Windhelm. She was recently implicated in a thievery, along with her lover.
The lover will likely be your target. If memory serves me correctly, he leads a group of bandits. So this may be rather interesting for you.
The contracts I dole out are fairly simple - go to a location, and kill the target. But this is different.
The jobs Astrid gives you will be more important, and usually more complex. Just keep your wits about you. And for Sithis' sake, don't get killed.
You're headed to The Hag's Cure, right? It's a good shop. You should examine their wares. Never pass up the chance to buy a good potion... or poison.
And one more thing. Have fun. You'll be committing a dark deed, but there's no reason you shouldn't enjoy yourself.
You're only young once. Trust me, I know.
Yes. Just because you're now a professional assassin, don't think you have to skulk around in the dark like a skeever and stab people.
Do what I do. Walk up to your target, introduce yourself, melt their skin off, and then run like the wind. Works every time.
You're being sent to meet with the contact directly, is that correct? What a most unusual occurrence. Astrid usually performs this duty herself.
I can only assume she wants to test the full breadth of your abilities. So. Be polite, and professional, and represent us well.
She said that? If I find anyone working against my wife, or this Sanctuary, I'll beat them to death with their own severed head.
Of course, they'd probably already be dead...
But you know what I mean!
You're joking. While I can understand if some family members wish to honor the Old Ways once more, surely no one would oppose Astrid's rule.
Does she? Listen, brother... Astrid is my mistress, and I worship the ground she walks on. But this Cicero business has her a bit... paranoid.
Does she? Listen, sister... Astrid is my mistress, and I worship the ground she walks on. But this Cicero business has her a bit... paranoid.
Oh! Well, I hope she doesn't suspect me. I mean, I've spoken with Cicero a bit, and he's quite charming. But I'd never go against Astrid. Never.
Ha! And would that surprise anyone? This Sanctuary's a mess. Wouldn't surprise me if somebody's talking to the fool on the sly. Making deals.
And no, before you ask, it's not me. I know which side my bread is buttered on.
To what end? Usurping Astrid's authority as leader of the Sanctuary? Hmmm... Yes, I can see her concern. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
Oho! The Listener wants my counsel! I thought you were above the opinions of mere mortals, now that you commune with dead old women.
Just remember Astrid's commitment to her Sanctuary, to her Family. A Family that now counts you as one of its own. Honor Astrid above all others.
You may be the Listener, or you may just be a lunatic who's started hearing voices. Either way, Astrid is still your mistress. Not the Night Mother.
The man you need to speak with, his name is Motierre? That's a very old and powerful Breton family, firmly established in Cyrodiil. Most curious...
So you're the Listener, hmm? Well that hardly seems fair. You just got here. The Night Mother should have spoken to me. Any idiot could see that.
But, I will serve gladly, as that's my lot in life. Now let's see. Ah yes, Volunruud. It's an old crypt, infested with Draugr. So plan accordingly.
If the Night Mother truly spoke to you, if you really are the Listener... your destiny was written in the Void. Astrid is right to fear your power.
You've got to kill a soft little woman on her wedding day. What's next? Murdering a crippled orphan in his sleep?
Your contract sounds simple, which means it certainly will not be. Getting into that reception will be easy, but have you thought about getting out?
Slaughtering the Emperor's cousin? At her wedding? Those guards will be out for blood. Wouldn't surprise me if the crowd jumped in too.
It's no fair. I love weddings. Astrid should have given this contract to me. Instead, she's got me visiting cities, assessing security. How boring.
But listen, I think I can help you. The wedding reception is outside the Temple of the Divines, right? In Solitude?
If so, the bride will probably address the crowd from the balcony. It overlooks the courtyard.
Well, there's an old statue there. I've seen it. Hanging right over where she'll be standing. Old means weak. Weak means it could fall. Hmmm?
Ah, killing her will be easy. She'll be so happy, she'll never see it coming. I should know, I killed a bride once.
It was our honeymoon. Tepid, I said! The bathwater should be tepid! Lukewarm is not tepid! Close, maybe, but there's is a difference! Stupid cow.
I hope you don't mind, but I took the liberty of surveying the site of the reception.
There's a small parapet, just opposite the balcony, that would prove an excellent spot for a long-range kill.
I left something there for you. If you're inclined to take that approach.
What's the matter, Listener? Night Mother not feeling very chatty these days? You need help from your flesh and blood lessers?
You've got to track a man, kill him, and then frame him for a crime. This contract's perfect... for me. Clearly, my lovely wife made a mistake.
Astrid had me investigate the Penitus Oculatus. Their members are highly trained, effective warriors. Be on your guard, brother.
Astrid had me investigate the Penitus Oculatus. Their members are highly trained, effective warriors. Be on your guard, sister.
Killing Gaius Maro in a city will be challenging because of all the guards, but fights, even murder, are fairly common.
Killing him secretly will certainly make things easier on you, but if there are witnesses, so be it.
Normally I talk to a victim before I end his life, but I wouldn't recommend it this time. Maro will be alert to danger. Talking may spook him.
I've taken the liberty of visiting the cities, and spreading some nasty rumors about Gaius Maro. To make his treachery that much more believable.
Remember, your target is Gaius Maro, the son. Not Commander Maro, the father! We need him alive. But the son... Ha! Scorch his face off!
Yes, do not underestimate Cicero. A man like that, small and foolish, is easy to mock. To underestimate. Don't make the same mistake I did.
Going after Cicero now would be a fool's errand. That little jester is currently being digested in Arnbjorn's stomach, mark my words.
Cicero destroyed any sympathy I may have had for him when he wounded Veezara. Kill the fool and be done with it.
All right, so maybe I was wrong. Maybe Cicero coming here wasn't the best thing that could have happened. But even I didn't anticipate this.
Well, you know the old saying. When life gives you lemons...
...go murder a clown.
I feel only pity for Cicero. He must die, of course, but can any of us truly blame him for his actions? We mocked him, disrespected the Old Ways.
Our actions were shameful. Surely, the Night Mother weeps this day.
The last thing you need is my help. Listener or not, you've proven yourself time and again. To Astrid, to the Family... and to me.
Hmm... Well, assuming this Gourmet is just a cook, it will probably be an easy kill. Just be discreet - alerting others will be the real threat.
Hmph. I wouldn't worry too much about this Virane giving you the information you need. Give him a good scare, and he'll squawk like a Hagraven.
That said... If your attack on Virane is witnessed, those Markarth guards are going to be none too happy...
Yes - don't kill the Gourmet!
Oh, I know you have to, but it makes me sad all the same. I love the Gourmet's recipes. The world will soon be a blander, less flavorful place.
You've been directed to dispose of the Gourmet's body, is that correct? I often find water to be a suitable hiding place. A lake, a pool... the sea.
Believe it or not, Festus likes you. He senses your power, your potential. Follow his instructions to the letter, and you may even earn his respect.
You get to kill the Emperor. The bloody Emperor. You'd better enjoy this one. You owe us all that much. So make it bloody, painful, and spectacular.
Yes. You're killing the Emperor himself. The Dark Brotherhood will get one shot at this, and you've been given the honors. So don't screw up.
