Savos Aren is wise beyond his years. He knows real talent when he sees it.
I'm sure when the time for promotions comes, they'll go to the most deserving mage.
Don't you think I'd make a wonderful Master Wizard? Maybe even Arch-Mage someday?
Nasty business with that Ancano fellow. Pity that I was unable to assist, but I was... otherwise occupied.
I care little for idle conversation, but perhaps you need help with Conjuration magic?
There are few places where one can pursue my type of work without fear of persecution.
That 'incident' in Morthal was just a misunderstanding. No matter what the guards claim.
The people of Skyrim have no appreciation for what we do here. Not that I care.
Should you ever fall victim to an unfortunate accident, I promise your remains will be put to good use...
Restoration is a perfectly valid school of magic, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise!
Why are my research materials constantly disappearing?
Once again, I have found very insulting notes left in my personal effects. Simply barbaric.
Just because I don't fit in here is no reason for others to ridicule me behind my back.
Ancano is exactly why we're so restrictive about access to the College. We'd all have perished if it weren't for you.
I'm sure you've made note of who's been the most helpful during your time here, Arch-Mage.
May I just say, it's a pleasure to have you leading the College. Really.
If there's ever any way I can assist you, please let me know.
I think the College is due for a change in leadership.
If you're working on any experiments, please clean up after yourself.
Just like anywhere else, it's all about who you know. Lucky for you, you know me.
I hope I can count on you if I ever need a favor.
It's a small group of us here at the College. Favors don't go unremembered. Neither do affronts.
The Arch-Mage triumphant! The College... Skyrim... All of Tamriel owes you a great debt!
I'm quite pleased that we're back to business as usual.
Certainly nothing illicit going on here, Arch-Mage. You can be quite sure of that.
Even with the College's laid-back attitude, there are still some things that are off-limits.
There are some experiments the College frowns on. If they're aware of them, of course.
If you ever need something, especially something hard to come by, let me know.
I've spent a long time building up a list of contacts for goods from all over Tamriel.
I am always available should you need me, Arch-Mage.
Like it or not, you are a shining example to future generations of College Mages.
After all that it's been through, the College still stands. In no small part thanks to you!
It's always encouraging to see the younger generations embracing education.
The College will be here for you, no matter what. We always look after our own.
Education is never appreciated until after the fact. Young people never understand this.
Have you, by chance, seen my research notes? I seem to have misplaced them.
Another day, another opportunity to learn!
What you learn here will last you a lifetime. Several, if you're talented.
It's no secret that the College's reputation in Skyrim is... tainted.
Please don't do anything to anger the locals. They don't need additional reasons to hate us.
It is not the place of the College to become involved in local politics.
Someday the College may be fully accepted by the Nords. I hope that my work as Arch-Mage may help.
Please don't bother the Arch-Mage unless it's absolutely necessary.
If there are any problems, let me know. It's my job to keep things running smoothly.
Day-to-day operations are my responsibility, which means if you become a problem, you get sent to me.
Mine is not a popular position, but someone needs to keep things running smoothly around here.
Like it or not, this College is a direct influence on the public's impressions of magic and those that use it.
It is up to each of us to present ourselves publicly as maturely as possible, and to remain above petty local squabbles.
I still can't believe it. You, the Arch-Mage? Never would have guessed it.
You know, this is one of a very few places where you can receive a real education in the schools of magic.
I think my parents reserved a spot for me here at the College on the day I was born.
There's a lot of pressure for me to excel in my studies. I hope I can live up to expectations.
Thanks to you, the people of Skyrim will continue to have a place to study magic. Even if most of them resent you for it.
I never would have suspected that the Eye could be so dangerous. Tolfdir is right, isn't he? Magic really can overwhelm you.
I've certainly learned more here than I ever expected to.
I wonder if the College's reptuation will ever recover from our adventures.
The College is a bit of an oddity in Skyrim. Magic isn't something that's looked upon fondly here.
Nords don't trust magic, or those that use it. Made it difficult for me growing up.
They won't say much, but most people have very strong opinions about the College and those that study here.
Don't expect the local Nords to take kindly to you once they find out you're from the College.
J'zargo is pleased, and more than a little jealous, to greet the new Arch-Mage.
J'zargo had expected to be named Arch-Mage. But there is still time.
Are the Arch-Mage's robes as comfortable as J'zargo believes them to be?
Skyrim couldn't be more different from Elsweyr. But magic... Magic's the same no matter where you go.
J'zargo will go wherever he can to learn more. Oblivion itself, if need be.
Khajiit are not known as mages, so J'zargo has much to prove.
J'zargo can learn magic from these men and elves, but they cannot learn to be as dashing as he. J'zargo comes out on top.
I think we could blow up half of Eastmarch, and people would still come to us for enchantments.
The local Nords may not like us very much, but they don't seem to mind having access to enchanted weapons and armor.
Savos doesn't care for politics. He likes to believe the College is removed from the rest of Skyrim.
If he could, Savos would float the the entire College above Skyrim, for all the Nords to see.
Greetings, Arch-Mage.
May I help you, Arch-Mage?
What was that you said, venomous wife of mine?
Nothing, you pig-headed oaf!
So, you made it out of there alive. Ancano was right... you are dangerous.
I'm afraid I'll have to take that Staff from you now. Ancano wants it kept safe... oh, and he wants you dead.
Nothing personal.
You survived! You have it, then?
Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
What are we waiting for?
Look around, see if you see anything unusual. Any signs of the mound being disturbed. Anything.
If my analysis is correct, the dragon buried near Kynesgrove will be the next to come back to life.
We need to find that burial mound before its dragon comes back to life.
This is worse than I thought...
I'll be damned, you did it!
I owe you some answers, don't I?
Really. We aren't interested in seeing all that. Remove yourself until you are properly attired!
You might consider putting on... something. Anything.
This one wonders - do you have no clothes, or just like the feel of the wind?
Gonna get cold tonight. Might want to at least cover your delicates.
Please. Remove your naked obscenity from the company of civilized folk.
Dear. You really ought to put some clothes on. You're embarrassing yourself.
Enough already. Put on some clothes. You're making people nervous.
You're naked!
You must either be crazy or supremely confident to go walking around with no clothes on...
Not sure you should be walking around naked.
It should be embarrassed to be uncovered so.
Umm. You got no clothes. You should get some.
Naked. Naked, naked, naked!
Dress yourself.
Ought put on some clothes. Bound to upset some people...
Put on a cloth sack at the very least. You're making me... unseasonably warm...
Aren't you... embarrassed?
You aren't as attractive as you'd like to believe.
Either I'm drunk, or you're naked. Possibly both.
Cover yourself. Have you no shame?
Next time, you might want to get dressed before leaving the house.
This one suggests donning some apparel.
Ysmir's beard, you're going to freeze to death...
Put on some damn clothes already!
You really should put on some clothes, you know.
All right, we've all seen enough. Put on some clothes.
The way you walk around at home is your own business. When you're at home...
What are you, some kind of barbarian? Don't care for armor?
It's probably not a good idea to walk around naked like that.
We're here to teach you a lesson.
This'll teach you not to take things that don't belong to you!
The mill!
The flour mill!
The smelter!
Somebody do something!
Hurry!
What's all the commotion?
By the gods!
What in the world...
This can't be happening.
It should be careful with those flames.
You're not supposed to play with fire, you know.
Take care not to set anything on fire.
You're not afraid you'll set fire to something?
What kind of fool plays with fire like that?
You're not planning on burning anything with that, are you?
Careful not to torch anything important.
I do hope you know what you're doing with those flames...
Try not to set anything on fire, all right?
Fire is not a thing to be played with...
Careful with that fire.
What's the matter with you? You want to start a blaze?
Dear, you really ought to be careful with fire.
Better not set anything on fire.
What do you think you're doing? Knock it off with the flames already.
Is it getting hot, or is it just me?
Whoa. Hope you know what you're doing with those flames there.
It is planning on starting a fire?
Hey now, you be careful with that fire.
I wish I could play with fire like that.
Take care with those flames.
Mind yourself with that fire. Don't burn anything down, now.
Have a fascination with fire, do we?
Umm... don't suppose you'd want to take that fire somewhere else? You know... somewhere away from me?
Careful with those flames, unless you plan on torching something.
Fire!
I do hope you know what your doing with those flames. It would be quite a shame if something caught fire.
Don't set anything on fire, all right?
Fire is not a toy.
Don't go setting the place on fire, okay?
Plan on burning everything down, do you? Damn fool.
You should be more careful with those flames.
Those flames get out of control, and you're gonna wish they hadn't.
Careful, now. Wouldn't want someone to get... burned.
Careful with that fire.
You've got that fire under control. Right?
Here. For you. For my hatchling of the heart.
I found this. I thought you might like it.
I wanted to give you this. A token of my appreciation.
Here. It isn't much, but... I hope it's the thought that counts.
I saw this and thought of you. It would be a waste on anyone lesser. I hope you like it.
Um... I was thinking you might like this. Here. It's nothing really.
In dark times friends bring light. This is for you. Thank you for your friendship.
I had to get this for you when I saw it. I hope you like it.
I'm glad we're friends. I have something for you. Here.
This one is honored by your friendship. I hope this gift does honor to you.
Here's to friendship. A gift! If you don't like it, too bad.
You're always a sight for sore eyes. Here, I've been hanging on to this for you.
I've been holding on to this for you. I hope you like it.
I have something I want to give to you. Here.
Here. For you. Don't thank me, just take it.
You always brighten my day a little. Here. I hope you like this.
It's really great we're friends. I was hoping to find some way to thank you. I hope this does the trick.
You are like my brood to me. Here. A token.
You're a good friend. Here. Take this. You'll like it.
So I found something. Here. Take it. I think you'll like it.
Here. This is for you.
I've been wanting to say thanks for being a friend. Here. It's not much, but I was thinking you might like to have this.
You're not tiresome like the rest of the people I have the displeasure of dealing with on a regular basis. Here. I'd like you to have this.
So... I've been thinking... I'm grateful we're friends. I'd like you to have this. It's not much, but I hope it's something you like.
A true friend is a gift. Here. I'd like you to have this.
You know... you ain't so bad. Here. Take this...
When I found this, I immediately thought of you. Here. A small token of my gratitude.
Here. I'd like you to have this as a token my friendship.
You bring a smile to this one's eyes and peace to his heart. Take this. A small token of appreciation.
In a world of fools, you stand out above the rest. Here, take this small sign of my friendship.
Here. Something I want you to have. Now, don't embarrass either of us by saying something sappy. Just... take it.
I've been holding onto this for you. Here! I hope you like it.
Here. I want you to have this.
I wanted you to have this. A token of my affection. Don't mean we're engaged or nothin'.
Here. Take this. I hope you like it.
I got this for you. It's nothing big, but I hope you like it. I want you to know I appreciate your friendship.
Many thanks. Here - a token of gratitude.
Thanks! Here - this is for you.
I'm grateful for your efforts. Here, take this.
Thanks a lot. Here - a little something for your trouble.
Here, take this small token of appreciation for your efforts.
Oh. Good job. Here... My way of saying thanks.
Good. Take this token of my gratitude.
Very well. Here, take this for your troubles.
Thank you. Please, take this for your efforts.
Well done. Here, a token of appreciation.
Thank you. Honor dictates something in return. I hope you find this pleasing.
I wasn't sure it'd ever happen. Here. I want you to have this. My way of saying [QUOTE]thanks.[QUOTE]
Finely done. Here, please accept this gift as a sign of my thanks.
Good. Take this gift. We're even now.
Wonderful! Here, take this. I hope it's fair compensation.
I couldn't be more pleased. Take this small token of my appreciation.
I'm truly grateful. Please accept this as a token of my appreciation.
It has done a good thing. It will take this gift as a token of gratitude.
Ah, good, good. Now please, take this. Just my way of saying thanks.
Thanks a lot! Here. Take this. For all your hard work.
Good job. Please accept this in return.
Much obliged. Here. It's not much, but take it anyway.
I'm surprised you succeeded. Please accept this as payment.
Excellent! Thank you... Here, take this as, um, a sign of my gratitude. It's not much, but I hope it's enough.
Your deed was true, and so is my gratitude. Please take this in return for your efforts.
Really? Good show. Here, take this. You know, as a thank you.
Fine. Please accept this token of gratitude.
I'm so glad you succeeded. Here. Please take this for your trouble.
Excellent. And now, please accept this token of appreciation.
Many thanks. And please, take this gift. I hope it's a fitting token to honor the deed.
Hmph. Hadn't expected you had it in you. Here. Take this for a job well done.
Well done, indeed. Please accept this as a sign of my thanks.
Very good. But you've created a debt between us. Here. Take this. We are even now.
My joy knows no bounds. Here. A little payment for your troubles.
Good job. Take this in return.
I can't thank you enough. Here, take this. It's not much, but please accept it as a token of my thanks.
Now, let us put this behind us and speak of it no more.
So we're not going to talk about this any more, right? Because I don't want to.
This is last time we speak of this.
Let's both get on with our lives now, hmm?
Now, let's pretend this never happened, shall we?
Umm... So, the business is done. This is the last we'll talk about it, right?
The deed is done. We need speak of it no longer.
Now let us turn our conversation away from such unpleasantness.
Now let's, um, not talk about this anymore. Okay?
Now, let us bury the memory of these dark deeds.
Now, so we're clear - this is the last time we talk about this.
Now, as far as I'm concerned, none of this ever happened.
Now we can both pretend this whole thing never happened.
I trust you'll keep your mouth shut about this.
Now the whole thing's over and done with. So let's stop talking about it.
Now... I trust we'll never have to speak of this again. To anyone.
Now I just want to put the whole nasty business behind me.
Now we can put this all behind us, hmm?
Now we never talk about it again. Got it?
Now let's not talk about it anymore, okay?
Now... This conversation never happened. Understood?
Anyway, it's done. Time to move on.
But enough of this. Such things are best forgotten.
Now let's just, you know, try to forget any of this ever happened. All right?

This here's Candlehearth Hall. Great room's upstairs, an' there's a bed for rent on the ground floor.
Got some fresh-baked bread an' good cheese, if you're after a bite to eat.
Mind you don't get fresh with Susanna. She plays the flirt, but it's just to get good tips.
Those Dark Elf refugees will take over the city if we aren't careful.
Be on the lookout. The Butcher could be around any corner!
Captain Lonely-Gale has been avoiding me, I just know it.
After what happened to those other women, I'm worried about my own safety.
Women murdered time and again, and all the guards care about is the war.
How can Elda hate the dark elves when she knows so little about them?
You didn't hear it from me, but if you want a real drink, try the Cornerclub in the Gray Quarter.
Did you know that candle on the mantle hasn't gone out in over a hundred years?
Stand away from me, or I'll crack you like an egg.
What are you looking at? Scared of strong women?
You look mighty tasty. Better not stick around for supper.
Working in Windhelm is great. I get to see Ulfric up close.
I never expected Ulfric to live up to his legend, but he does.
Ulfric was a true hero of Skyrim. He will be missed.
I just can't believe that Ulfric is gone. Skyrim will never be free now.
I couldn't ask for a better teacher than Oengul.
It's a new day in Windhelm. The Stormcloaks are gone, and so is their prejudice.
I wish the Nords, Argonians and dark elves in Windhelm got along better.
We Argonians do the work the Nords don't want to do.
The water is cold, but it's a lot better than having to work up in the dry air.
Shatter-Shield, East Empire Company... we'll work for any ship that pulls in, as long as they can pay.
The Nords don't appreciate us, but so what? I don't appreciate them right back.
Look, we don't have much love for your kind down here. Probably best if you just left.
Haven't seen you here before, egg brother. Welcome!
Haven't seen you here before, egg sister. Welcome!
The docks can be a dangerous place. Don't expect me to save you if you fall in.
Huh? What's that now? Leave me alone.
Another day, another septim.
The young folks are too happy to break their backs for the Nords. They forget what it was like to swim free.
Do you know my father? He's really important. He even talks to the Jarl sometimes.
Did you know my father? He was really important. He even talked to the Jarl sometimes.
All the Argonians at the docks are nice to me. Good thing, too, or father would run them off!
They say dragons are coming back. I want to kill one!
I made my fortune as a sea captain, but now I'm retired.
The townsfolk call me [QUOTE]captain[QUOTE] because I used to be a sailor.
I lost my family years ago. Truth is, I don't really know what keeps me going.
Did Viola send you to bother me?
Serving as Steward to Ulfric Stormcloak was a great honor, but I don't miss his temper.
I don't care that we lost, I'm just glad the war is over.
The Stormcloaks are finding victory across the land.
I'm not much of a strategist, but Lord Ulfric listens to my counsel all the same.
If you have any news of the western holds, take it to Ulfric immediately.
Terrible shame, what happened to those women.
I was one of the best soldiers in the Stormcloak army, until I took a sword through the chest.
I'd be out there fighting the Imperials right now if it wasn't for my war-wound.
Ever since that Imperial craven ran me through from behind, I've had trouble breathing. Don't have any trouble drinking though.
What? Were you hoping to claim this house for yourself? Well, the Aretinos always liked me, so I think I'm family enough to take up here.
The milk drinkers in this town wouldn't last five minutes in a real battle.
Rumor holds that the Aretino boy brought an assassin here. Sounds like nonsense to me.
I once killed six men, single-handed, while rescuing my brothers-in-arms from ambush by an Imperial patrol.
I'm not too proud to admit that I need a bit of help from time to time.
Can't say I mind the sight of all the Imperial guards. It's a change for the better.
All my goods are legitimate, which is more than I can say for some.
I like to share my good fortune with those who deserve it.
Trader dropped by recently with some lovely pieces, if you'd like to have a look.
Pardon the mess. We're really trying to do better around here.
[QUOTE]Windhelm's an easy posting![QUOTE] they said. Guess they didn't count on Ulfric's little uprising.
Can you believe the company won't even dock ships here anymore?
The conquering hero returns!
I really can't thank you enough for your help.
I still can't believe Isabella's gone. She was such a helpful young lass.
Now more than ever, the world needs tales of heroism.
I'll find some way to finish my book.
Know any tales of nobility and courage? I'm keen to record them.
Oh splendid, another Nord.
Come slumming to the Gray Quarter, have you?
Welcome, brother. Please, enjoy yourself.
Welcome, sister. Please, enjoy yourself.
Apparently some Nord women were murdered. Not sure why I should care.
At long last, Windhelm is free. No longer must we suffer persecution at the hands of Ulfric Stormcloak.
Things have been a lot worse around here since Ulfric took over.
It's not the cold of Skyrim that gets to me. It's the stink from the people.
When I've made enough money, I'm going to return to Morrowind in high style.
Both my daughters. Now my wife? How much is one man supposed to take?
Poor Nilsine has been wrecked since her sister was killed.
Seeing a good tavern brawl might be just the thing to lift my spirits.
Brond's one of the most savage fighters I've ever seen...
What I lack in strength, I make up for with tenacity.
You need anything, come see me. I'm as resourceful as I am discreet.
I have a lot of respect for Ambarys Rendar, but his views are a little extreme.
You look like someone who appreciates nice things.
Oh, pardon me. Was I in your way?
I hope someday we'll get to know each other better.
I see why the Nords like Skyrim. This crisp air is wonderful for the lungs!
You seem like such a nice person. I'd love to hear more about you.
Can't believe Ulfric's gone. If not for Hermir, I'd have left the city by now.
Everyone says Eorlund Gray-Mane is the best smith in Skyrim. I plan to change a few minds about that.
Need some metal hammered?
Hermir's become a decent smith. Like to think I had a hand in that.
With my swords in their hands, Ulfric's men will send those legion dogs running.
I lost my twin sister a while back. Have you ever lost anyone close?
My father says we need to just get on with our lives. Like it's that easy.
I've been a lot of things in my life. Pit fighter's the one I'm best at.
We should get a dragon for the Pit. I'd love to fight one.
I've been fighting in the Pit for years. That should tell you something.
There's two kinds of Pit fighters -- good ones and dead ones.
Ulfric once tried to get me to fight for him, but marching bores me.
Steel. Barehanded. Armor. Naked. It's all fighting. I can kill you with a weapon or by myself. No difference.
With Ulfric dead and the Stormcloaks gone, who will have the courage to champion the cause of Talos?
I've spent my life serving Talos. I don't plan to stop now, no matter what the Empire says.
Talos created the Empire. You'd think they'd show him more respect.
The way I see it, Ulfric's fighting a holy war.
Someday all of Skyrim will worship Talos openly, as we do here.
Whatever you've heard I can do is probably true.
If Ulfric needs a favor, he has it. Anyone else better pay well for the service.
I'd explain my research, but you'd just be confused.
Yes, I'm a powerful wizard. No, I won't put on a magic show for you.
My job? Well, I'm the Watcher of the Wheel! Which is... exactly what it sounds like. I watch the Wheel.
Watching the wheel isn't as simple as you might think. Have to inspect all the way around the ice, make sure it's not melting.
Don't get too many folks up here these days. Sometimes I think they've forgotten about me.
My time is limited, so speak quickly.
It'll take time to rebuild, but the Nords are no strangers to hard work.
The dark elves and Argonians won't soon forget Ulfric's prejudice, but I'm doing what I can to repair that rift.
Being a Jarl isn't something I ever wanted, but if I can help these people, then I will.
Got no time for a Nord who thinks he's better than everyone else. Keep walking.
I told you, I've got no patience for fools. Keep walking.
There's no glory in war. It's just something they tell soldiers so they'll risk their lives.
They call me a war hero. I'm no hero, I'm just a soldier who didn't want to die.
If Ulfric had his way, anyone who wasn't a Nord would be shipped right out of Skyrim.
The sooner this war ends, the sooner we can all get on with our lives.
Welcome to the House of Curiosities! I offer a brief tour for a few coins, or you can simply browse at your leisure.
If you've got some time, stop by my House of Curiosities. I promise you'll see wonders!
Welcome, friend, to Calixto's House of Curiosities!
My sister and I once traveled the world to assemble our collection. Such adventures we had!
I don't care much for the war one way or the other.
It bothers me that fewer people come to Windhelm these days.
Name's Nils. I'm the cook up at Candlehearth Hall.
Can't just throw the big logs on the fire. Got to have the little bits, too.
When I'm cutting wood, I pretend there's an Imperial soldier's head on the stump.
Hello, hello, hello. Interested in fighting in the Pit? The rules are strict, but if I don't see it, it didn't happen, know what I mean?
It's very important to Huki that all the battles are fair. What's more important to me is that my pay is fair.
Prove your valor in the Pit! If you haven't got any valor, prove your pocketbook!
When Ulfric was killed, justice was done. That might sound harsh, but it's how I feel.
I thought the the Gray Quarter would be a haven for my kind. I was wrong.
The Gray Quarter's not much to look at now, but it wasn't always so bad.
The cornerclub's been filling up at night lately. I'll bet Elda up at Candlehearth is jealous.
We might be poor, but is it really any better out there?
Not a day passes that I don't wonder if life would be better in Morrowind.
I don't see why we should live as an underclass to the Nords. If anything, they owe us.
Alchemy is simple. Unless, of course, you are simple. Then I can't help you.
Must you bother me now? I've almost figured out where it is.
My master can be a bit short-tempered, but I've learned so much from him.
I'll never have Master Nurelion's skill with potions.
I have a decent mind for potions, but I've also learned how to craft magical items.
I'm a sailor on the Northwind. We're laying over in Windhelm for awhile.
It's good to spend some time on solid land.
A life on the river makes for weak legs, so I do a lot of walking when we dock.
Captain Kjar expects the best, but he's a fair man. He never fails to reward hard work and loyalty.
Never much cared for Windhelm. The place is depressing.
I'm a lot happier out here on the deck than I am wandering around in that ruin of a city.
I heard those Forsworn out west live in caves. Can't be any worse than trying to live in Windhelm.
Can't wait until we raise anchor. Anytime the boat's not moving, I start to get impatient.
Sorry, but I'm not looking to hire any more crew right now.
You don't know what freedom really means until you've lived on the river.
Been on the river since I could walk. Wouldn't trade it for the world.
While you're on my boat, you follow my rules. First rule is, don't touch anything that doesn't belong to you.
The best way for us to win the Nords' respect is through hard work.
Too many dark elves in Windhelm complain about the way we're treated. What good does complaining do?
I'm proud of my farm. It takes no small effort to grow crops in this part of Skyrim.
I own Hollyfrost Farm outside the city. It's honest work, if a bit dull.
The Cruel-Seas have been sailors for generations. In truth, I regret not following in the footsteps of my ancestors.
If I make enough money from the farm, I'll buy myself a longship to sail the rivers of Skyrim.
I understand what potions do, but I don't always understand how they do it.
This is Stormcloak territory. If you're one of those craven Imperials, don't expect a warm welcome.
If you're here to join the Stormcloaks, the palace is inside.
Loyal Nords are always welcome here. Anyone else better watch their step.
If you're an Imperial spy, better turn around right now.
Stay away from the Aretino Residence. The place is cursed.
You should unload some of that unwanted gear. Head over to Sadri's Used Wares, talk to the Elf.
If you need an apothecary, the White Phial has respectable stock.
By the gods, you're diseased. Get yourself to the White Phial and purchase a remedy, before you infect us all.
The Dunmer get their drinks at the New Gnisis Cornerclub. Why they can't just call it a tavern is beyond me...
If it's bed or board you're after, Candlehearth Hall's got both.
Across the river to the northeast lies Yngol Barrow. Steer clear of that foul place, lest the walking dead claim you as their own.
The Eye of Talos was a fine ship, once. Now it lies wrecked, off an island just north of here.
Maybe you've seen masts sticking out of the water to the northeast? That would be the wreck of the Winter War. Fine vessel, back in its day.
South of here, and west of the road, lies Cronvangr Cave. Stay away from that cursed place, and the vampires that call it home.
Tell me you've seen them. Those... things. Small and evil, like something out of a nightmare. They come from Stillborn Cave, to the north. I know it.
I've no problem with your kind, Orc. But that stronghold you've got in the southeast? Narzulbur? It's an affront to my people.
I've no problem with Orcs. But that stronghold they've got in the southeast? Narzulbur? It's an affront to my people.
You hear the news? There's a dragon roosting up on Mount Anthor, to the northwest.
What's this? It thinks it can just throw refuse wherever it likes?
Really, the nerve of some people, leaving their trash wherever they please.
What kind of filthy barbarian just throws their trash on the ground?
Oh, by all means. Just leave your refuse wherever you see fit.
There's a place for trash, and that's not it.
In my day, we knew how to dispose of trash properly.
What's the matter with you? You think you can just go dropping your junk wherever you like?
Look at this one. Spoiled as a child, I'll bet. Allowed to leave trash just lying around...
I swear, is there no end to these uncouth savages, just throwing their trash wherever they please...
Hrmmm. Pick up your trash, fetcher.
And they call me a savage. Least I don't leave my trash lying around...
I never did understand the local custom of simply leaving one's trash wherever is convenient...
Who does that? Who just leaves their garbage lying about?
Gah! Quit throwing your garbage everywhere.
One person's trash is another's treasure. Don't be surprised if you find that gone...
What's he doing poking his nose in there?
What's she doing poking her nose in there?
Is he... sifting through trash?
Is she... sifting through trash?
What's he rummaging around in there for?
What's she rummaging around in there for?
Look at him, rummaging through refuse. Wonder what he's lost... besides his mind.
Look at her, rummaging through refuse. Wonder what she's lost... besides her mind.
Tsk. What a man will do for a few coins...
Tsk. What a woman will do for a few coins...
Picking through garbage. Has he no shame?
Picking through garbage. Has she no shame?
What's he digging around in there for?
What's she digging around in there for?
What's he doing? Looking for rubies in rubbish? Get a job!
What's she doing? Looking for rubies in rubbish? Get a job!
Maybe he's looking for something to eat?
Maybe she's looking for something to eat?
He might find something good in there. One man's trash is another's treasure.
She might find something good in there. One man's trash is another's treasure.
The poor dear must truly be hungry to comb through rubbish like that. Hope he finds something edible.
The poor dear must truly be hungry to comb through rubbish like that. Hope she finds something edible.
Sometimes it pays to look in every nook and cranny.
Sometimes it pays to look in every nook and cranny.
When you're hungry, you'll look anywhere for food. Can't blame him.
When you're hungry, you'll look anywhere for food. Can't blame her.
Desperate times call for desperate measures. Maybe he found what he was looking for in there.
Desperate times call for desperate measures. Maybe she found what she was looking for in there.
How unfortunate he has to dig through refuse like that. Someone should give him a piece of bread.
How unfortunate she has to dig through refuse like that. Someone should give her a piece of bread.
You never know what you'll find laying around in a crate or barrel. People toss the darnedest things in them.
You never know what you'll find laying around in a crate or barrel. People toss the darnedest things in them.
You have done well thus far, but trying times are ahead.
It is imperative that you return to your College at once.
You will be called on to take swift action. Rise to the challenge, and discover what you are capable of.
You are on the right path, and you will prevail.
So, you're saying you brought that cat down alone?
Why, you don't think I could do it?
Wasn't our last catch a Cave Bear?
Yeah, why?
Take down that one with your bare hands too?
Troll's blood was he a tough one!
Pfft
But, I've got the key to the Sabre Cage! Look!
What's that supposed to prove? Get back on patrol!
I'm the Jarl's personal blacksmith, but that doesn't mean I can't sell you a few pieces for a fair price.
The Empire has always been good to the Orcs, but this war of theirs is none of my concern.
I served in the Legion with Thongvor Silver-Blood. He's a good man and a tough soldier.
I learned to forge when I was a pup, then I joined the Legion and mastered it.
Poor Banning. Twice as much work here in the stables without him.
You need a reliable horse in the Reach. That's what we have.
You treat a horse well, it'll take you to Oblivion and back.
Traveling in the Reach is dangerous. You need a good carriage.
City of Markarth sure is a beauty. No doubt about that.
Stormcloaks took Markarth. It is good to see Talos worshipped openly again.
What can an old skald do for you, huh?
Songs are just old memories that help the mead go down quicker.
I've seen every corner of Skyrim, but nothing is as beautiful as the battlefield.
My father Kleppr is the one you want to talk to. I just clean up.
My mother and father yell a lot. Always have.
I work silver, like my father, and his father before him.
My wife Kerah runs our jewelry stall in the market.
My daughter Adara is also my apprentice. She's a quick study.
I prefer working in silver. More skill needed than forging iron or steel.
Silver-Bloods tax everything now that they run the city.
The finest jewelry in all of Markarth.
Redguard craftsmanship in every piece.
Are you looking for a gift for a friend, perhaps? Or... a lover?
Perhaps a silver necklace or a silver ring? Easy to wear and soft against the skin.
I have a necklace that would look lovely on you, or on a... special someone.
My daughter Adara is going to be a fine silversmith when she's older.
Jewelry for sale. Redguard craftsmanship in every piece.
You there, uh, the finest silver in Markarth is sold right here.
Maybe you could buy a gift for a friend? A best friend?
I'm going to be a silversmith one day, like my mother and father.
Being an apprentice is great. I get to swing a hammer at things.
Mama doesn't like me jumping up and down in the house, but I can't help it. I swear.
Stormcloaks or Imperials. Either way, all they want is everything for free and you to lick their boots.
Hey you. Yeah, you. Fresh meat for your stomach.
The bloodiest beef in the Reach.
You want a cut of venison or mutton? Of course you do.
Don't try to haggle with me. Buy or leave.
The secret to chopping meat is never washing your hands.
A man like me makes a lot of enemies. People are always trying to cheat me.
I paid extra for the biggest room in the Silver-Blood Inn. I need space to stretch these arms.
I am the Jarl of Markarth, now. The Silver-Blood family is finally where it should have always been.
Igmund was weak. We'll bring the order that the Empire should have.
Let the Forsworn ravage the Reach. Talos favors us. Our victory is assured.
The Silver-Blood family will be heard.
Jarl can refuse to see me all he likes. He can't ignore us forever.
Markarth lives because my family makes sure it's fed on gold and silver.
I'm Thongvor's steward now. Every coin in this city is ours.
We'll be sending generous resources to Ulfric. As much as the Reach can bleed.
Taxes. I love taxes.
Out of my way, kinsman.
Out of my way, outsider.
Bother someone else.
Didn't I speak clear enough? Out of my way.
Thongvor's made me his housecarl. Remember, me killing you is legal.
Keeping this place secure is as simple as breaking a few spines.
Used to have run-ins with the guards, now they have run-ins with me.
Outsiders. Pfft.
Blood and silver, friend. Blood and silver.
Just turn around and leave the city. That's the smart move.
My family owns this inn, but I've put Kleppr in charge. Right rat for the right job, I say.
I'm a busy man. Half this city works for my family, and I have to keep them in line.
Thongvor may be the head of the family, but I'm the hands.
We control every piece of this city. The people should be calling us kings.
If someone joins the Forsworn, we haul him to the mines.
Every prisoner in the Reach is just another worker for our family.
I'm married to Thonar Silver-Blood. Keep that in mind while you're speaking to me.
My husband Thonar handles all our family's business. He's an important man.
I married Thonar for the money, and I'm not the least bit ashamed to admit it.
I'm just a servant. Don't pay me any mind.
Working in the Treasury House isn't so bad. I earn good money.
Ildene has been working in the Treasury House since before I was born.
Sometimes I hear Yngvar singing in his room. He's actually quite good.
You just let old nana know if you need anything, all right dear?
I've worked in the Treasury House for almost twenty years.
There isn't an inch of this building that I haven't cleaned up.
So the Stormcloaks took the Reach? Maybe Talos really is on their side.
Arnleif and Sons Trading Company buys and sells anything you wandering types need.
No, I'm not Arnleif. Yes, I know it's called Arnleif and Sons.
The selection seems small, but we can provide whatever you need. Just ask.
I love hearing Ogmund sing at the inn. He's a true skald.
With Lisbet gone, I'll be taking care of you.
Let me know if there's something you need to buy.
I'm keeping Arnleif and Sons going, as best I can.
Never thought I'd be running the store. I'm not used to it.
Lisbet handles the customers. I just check the shipments.
Feel free to take a look around the store.
I've been at Arnleif and Sons all my life. It's a good store.
I remember old Arnleif building each shelf in this store himself.
Old Arnleif would be proud of Lisbet. She's kept this place running, thick and thin.
I brought in my cousin Cosnach to help me handle shipments.
There's no shipments coming in, so I do nothing. Just drink.
[QUOTE]Check the shipments[QUOTE] Lisbet says. [QUOTE]There are no shipments[QUOTE] I says.
No breaks for a good worker out here.
This is the Silver-Blood Inn. I'll let you figure out who owns it by yourself.
If I can't get you something, I'm sure my wife will bellow at me until I can.
Things are so much quieter with my darling Frabbi dead.
Unlike my husband Kleppr, I watch after our guests.
Now you just tell me if you need something.
You come right to me if you find an unwashed floor or lumpy bed.
I'll bend Kleppr's ear if there's anything wrong with a room you rent.
Isn't my son Hreinn such a good worker? Not like his father at all....
My worthless husband is gone, so I run the inn now.
I can't believe the mess Kleppr left things in. I have twice the work with him gone.
Don't mind the yelling. My parents are always going at each other.
I'm just here to clean up.
My father is more generous than he lets on. Gives me plenty of spending money.
The Hag's Cure is here for all your discreet needs...
I have potions for disease, love sickness, irritating children...
A little bit of old Reach magic can cure whatever ills you....
Oh yes... you'll need one of my special brews...
Not scared of an old woman now, are you?
I've taken over the Hag's Cure, since Bothela is gone.
I'm not sure if half these potions work. But they should. I think.
I wish Bothela was still running the store. I'm not ready for this.
I'm Bothela's assistant. She's the one you should talk to if you need an herb or a potion.
There's so much to learn about the shop. I'll never get it all straight.
Why can't the men in this city leave me alone?
Alms. I said [QUOTE]alms[QUOTE] you backbiter. Give a crippled worker a helping hand.
How about a septim? Wait, make that two septims, I feel like living it up.
Come on, you outsiders always have plenty of gold on you. Spare a piece!
They don't like us talking to people when we work.
Busy with the smelter.
Got metal to shape.
Just here to drink.
Can't talk. Mulush will beat me if I stop working.
I spill just a bit of metal, and Mulush takes it out of my hide.
Can't you see I'm working? Beat it.
Drinks here are watered down, but they're cheap.
I oversee Markarth Smelter. Worker gets out of line, I get him back in line.
These workers. Always complaining. Always excuses.
If a man has time to complain, he has time to work.
Shipment of silver this month is behind. Nepos is to blame, not me.
I tell Thonar I can only smelt what Nepos and his miners dig up.
Stormcloaks have taken the Reach, but we'll return. The Empire will bring order.
What do you want? Haven't you done enough damage to Markarth?
You speak to Igmund. Son of Hrolfdir. Jarl of Markarth.
Treat my people fairly, and I will do the same to you.
Forsworn have troubled the Reach for too long. I intend to deal with them.
Markarth is not without its problems, but the Empire is here to maintain order.
I can't believe we lost Markarth. Igmund's family has ruled there for generations.
I don't think we have anything to discuss, Stormcloak.
I'm Igmund's uncle as well as his steward.
I advise Igmund the same way I advised his father. Caution, caution, caution.
The Forsworn know every stone in the Reach. We have to wait them out.
Igmund is alive, and I'll keep it that way, Jarl or not.
You lay one finger on Igmund, and I'll end you Stormcloak.
As his housecarl, Igmund's security is my chief concern.
Igmund's father was killed by Forsworn. I won't rest until they've paid with their blood.
Raerek is far too cautious, but I'll agree with him on any measure that keeps this city safe.
Need a new blade?
Got an axe here. Good for cleaving up Forsworn.
How about some armor?
You'll want some thick armor if you're traveling the Reach alone.
Don't bother with Tacitus. Useless.
You'd think an apprentice could forge a few hinges. Not Tacitus.
I run the forge now. Kind of... scary.
Making weapons and armor isn't like making nails at all.
You need a sword? Uh, how about a small sword? Nail-sized?
I'm Ghorza's assistant. I help her with the forge.
Ghorza is the one you should ask if you need anything.
I'm not very good for anything more than smithing nails right now.
One time, I almost cut a finger off sharpening a blade. I hate blood.
I have things to study, what is it?
The artifacts I've discovered in Nchuand-Zel will make history one day.
I've only ever lost a few guards to Steam Centurions. Good odds, considering...
I used to travel so much before all this Forsworn nonsense. Such an inconvenience...
Oh, excuse me. With my uncle gone, things are a bit of a mess.
I'm not half the wizard my uncle was, but I still have a few spells worth buying.
Did you need something? A staff? Some enchanting materials?
I'm Calcelmo's nephew. I help him around the laboratory.
Don't let my uncle go on about his theories. You'll be here all night.
I'm afraid to touch half of the things we keep in the tower.
I try not to think about how my uncle got all the Dwemer Centurion parts.
Before you say anything, no, I am not from the Reach.
I have meals to cook for the entire castle and almost no help.
The Jarl gives me two incompetent assistants. Worthless.
I have to work, or Anton will rip my head off.
Anton sure looks like he's from the Reach, but don't tell him that.
Only reason Jarl keeps Anton on is because he cooks up a storm.
Don't mind the dogs, they get anxious when they haven't had dinner.
You should talk to Anton if you need anything. He's the master chef.
It's been a hard day cleaning. Good, honest work I say.
Even the dead need company. That's what Arkay provides.
We all come into Arkay's light in the end, but there's no need to rush.
Markarth is a city of wealth, but gold doesn't follow you in death.
Arkay's blessing to you.
You have the honor of addressing a member of the Thalmor. Bask in it.
The Dominion is here, and we're watching you.
The Thalmor know how to deal with Talos worshippers.
If you see any signs of Talos worship, it's your obligation to report them to me.
The Aldmeri Dominion is the only thing keeping the Empire on its feet.
This war is such nonsense. All this fuss over their false human god.
The Warrens isn't a place for your type. What do you want?
Warrens ain't for you. Trust me.
You don't want to be here. No one wants to.
Don't know anyone here doesn't have Rattles or Ataxia.
The Empire didn't think we could take the Reach, but here we are.
Let's see those Stormcloaks try to break into this canyon.
Outsiders aren't trusted in Markarth. Best keep that in mind.
Can't believe I'm posted here. Even the beds are made of stone.
You should see that Orc over in Understone Keep, have him forge you some new armor...
By Shor, you're hauling around a lot of junk. Best stop in at the Arnleif and Sons Trading Company, sell it off.
Let me guess - you need a drink. It's the Silver-Blood Inn you're looking for.
Break the law in Markarth, and it's off to Cidhna Mine with you.
Caught a case of Rockjoint, once. Bothela at the Hag's Cure fixed me right up.
Lots of nasty holes in the Reach, and Blind Cliff Cave is one of them. A filthy Hagraven nest, northeast of here.
There's an evil to the north, friend, and its name is Ragnvald. A tomb like so many in Skyrim, where the dead have found no peace.
Travel southeast and you'll find an Orc stronghold, up around the old Dushnikh orichalcum mine.
Beware the region northeast, across the river. Forsworn have taken refuge in Broken Tower Redoubt and Red Eagle Redoubt.
There's a small skeever den just east of the city, at Reachwater Rock.
The Forsworn have been spotted to the north, near Bruca's Leap Redoubt.
Need a trained war dog? Fiercest companion money can buy.
I'll be handling the horses with Cedran gone. Miss that old man.
A war dog is good company and good protection.
I like the loyalty of a dog. Not as fickle as a wolf.
You have to train a good war dog from a pup. Bite your arm clean off otherwise.
Ondolemar is the commander of the Thalmor in Markarth.
Worship of Talos is strictly forbidden.
It's all thanks to a special technique I developed. I call it the [QUOTE]Razor-Winged Butterfly.[QUOTE] I'd teach it to you... but then I'd have to kill you.
Yeah, well, don't expect many more stories like that in my future. I'm getting old. Being that amazing takes too much damn effort.
Hmph. Been awhile since I've actually cleaved someone in two. Forgot how hard it was to get the scimitar back out.
Let that be a lesson to you young pups. There is no challenge that magic cannot overcome.
Bah! A child could have accomplished it. Such is the power of the arcane. If you only knew of the spells I didn't use. He he he he he.
What? You think me too old, too feeble? There is more knowledge in me than in two of you pups put together. And knowledge... knowledge is my weapon.
Once again, you have underestimated me. You see the man, brutish and hulking. But I am wolf as well. Deliberate. Cunning.
Romantic, isn't? Like that time we first met. Remember that? Never seen so much blood. Ah, to be young again...
When I am become wolf, I am treachery incarnate. And then, then... there is no one who can stand between the hunter and his prey.
When I first received the blessing of the wolf, my creator gave me a valuable piece of advice. [QUOTE]Arnbjorn,[QUOTE] he said. [QUOTE]Never lose![QUOTE] And I never do.
He he. Don't forget that I am Shadowscale. I was, quite literally, born to kill.
It was a simple matter, really, when one has mastered the art of camouflage. Scale becomes stone, becomes shadow. Then... death.
My greatest challenge was deciding which weapon to use, for I am prone to indecision. Bow, dagger... axe? In the end, I opted for my claws.
In truth? It was so easy, I feel a bit guilty. Once again, the sweet, innocent child earned more trust than was wise.
You give me too much credit. For how could I fail? I am, after all, just a little girl. What threat could I possibly pose? He he he he he.
I am the perfect weapon. My innocent, childish form grants me nearly unrestricted access. Poison or a good bite usually takes care of the rest.
I am but a humble instrument of Sithis. Our Dread Father guides me. Therefore, failure is an impossibility.
In the end, I relied on a woman's natural weapons - beauty and seduction. The rest was a formality. Though, a rather wet, messy formality...
When one can divine the future, success may not be assured... but it can at least be anticipated. It helps that I've already foretold my own death.
Come now, dear husband. You above all people should know what I'm capable of.
Unscrupulous daring. It's why you fell in love with me, my dear.
Sometimes I just need to remind everyone why I'm the one in charge.
I guess I got tired of handing out contracts to everyone else, while I stayed home playing den mother. It was good to get out, and have some fun.
I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy myself. But more importantly, I made this Sanctuary some much needed gold. In the end, that's all that matters.
Well, I just did what had to be done. Nothing more. Nothing less. I'm just glad I lived to tell the tale.
Ah, contracts like that are few and far between, it seems. Makes me long for the old days...
It's good to see a fresh face. You wouldn't have happen to come from Whiterun would you?
Generally posting information is need to know only.
I... I've been trying to find the time and place to let her know.
I'm sorry, I can't help you.
If you want to know that bad then fine.
I'm afraid that kind of thing doesn't work on Captains in the Imperial Army.
That's the way it is.
Yes, Sir. Although I'm not sure you'll be happy to know.
Her daughter was sent to Whiterun, the skirmishes there have been violent. The whiterun legate, he needed to know the Stormcloak positions.
He sent out a party to scout the area. They happened upon a large force... I'm told none of them made it back.
Private Morrard... Angela's daughter was in that scouting party. She needs to be told.
You got Aldis to tell you something? I knew you would. What did he say?
I told her. I told her the imperial army would kill her. That this was a war of Jarls and Imperial Generals and we had no part in it.
She just wouldn't hear it.
It was brave of you to come to me with this. I can't thank you for it, not for this, but you have done me a service.
If you've come to Solitude to join the Legion, speak to Rikke. If not, just keep your nose clean while you're here... or you'll end up like Roggvir.
He's the sorry bastard who's going to be executed.
A gate guard who let Ulfric Stormcloak escape the city, after he killed the High King.
There's no greater honor than to serve. If you're serious about enlisting, speak to Legate Rikke in Castle Dour.
The crucial nature is pure apparent. Mundane sight traded for another sort.
I tried to tell him that he wouldn't get past the traps, but he wouldn't listen...
It was a stupid plan, and now Rigel is so mad she won't even let us cut him down from there!
Aye, and she's added more traps now as well... A moment of silence for our fallen friend...
Astrid, I've been hearing some, er... interesting things, from the others... about what you did when you left the Sanctuary last week...
Tell me, husband. Is it true what I've heard?
So, is it true?
I heard about what happened...
Tell me, brother. Are the stories true?
Tell me, sister. Are the stories true?
Your latest exploit certainly has the Sanctuary talking...
Come now. What everyone else is saying. It can't possibly be true...
You're referring to that blacksmith contract?
You must be talking about the caravan job...
Word certainly travels fast, doesn't it?
The temple contract? Well, I certainly won't deny my involvement. He he he he he.
The Redoran contract? Yes, you heard correctly. In and out of Vvardenfell in less than forty eight hours.
Ah, you must mean my little adventure on the ship...
Oh, you mean in that manor house? During the thunderstorm? Heh. What can I say? It happened, just like you heard.
But to be outnumbered twenty to one...
You infiltrated the position, eliminated the target, and made it look like an accident. Impressive. I'd say you earned your bonus on that one!
To kill triplets, secretly, and then have the whole thing blamed on the mother. Remarkable.
It was a suicide mission! Astrid said as much. Yet here you stand, hale and hearty.
By Sithis, you slew everyone! Well, except for that one you kept alive, to serve as witness. Does your wickedness, or your skill, know no bounds?
But really. A horker, some twine, three wood elves, and a hatchet? Points for creativity, if nothing else.
It's the part with the severed head I find most impressive. My compliments.
I'm just trying to imagine you hiding inside the body of a mammoth. Bloody brilliant idea.
Ah! You've retrieved the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller.
Well done. You have now passed all the trials.
Come with me. It is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.
Stand in the center of the room and prepare yourself to taste the Voice of the Greybeards.
Come inside. The other masters will meet us there.
First, Master Wulfgar will teach you the final word of Unrelenting Force. You are ready.
Wait, so... a costume? You're not serious...
Sure I am. We get some furs and tree branches, paint them white, and then tie them to Stump. Instant Frostbite Spider!
Frodnar... nobody is going to believe that your dog is a... Frostbite Spider. And if they do... they'll kill him. That's not much of a prank.
Oh yeah, and what would you rather do?
How about... we play tag! You're it!
Hey, no fair! Get her, Stump!
I'm getting out of here!
Those fools are actually fighting!
Hey! Watch what you're doing.
My money's on the big one.
Gods! Another fight.
I'm staying out of this.
Don't hurt me!
Please, someone do something!
Someone do something!
Somebody help!
Help!
A fight!
This should be good.
Get 'em! Kill 'em!
Ah!
Why are they hurting each other?
Well, your bounty is low... All right, get out of my sight. But you're known to me now, scum. Remember that.
You know what? You're not worth the hassle. Go... be some other guard's problem.
You speak to Burguk, chief of Dushnikh Yal.
You need steel? Speak to my forge-wife, Gharol.
Need a poison for your hunting? My mother, Murbul, knows several.
This stronghold respects strength, and strength alone.
Orc poisons are to be feared, if you wish to trade.
I have an old cure for Rockjoint. Common in little Orc children.
If you wish to trade, wait for the sun to rise.
I am Burguk's mother and wise woman to our tribe, outlander.
Malacath rewards the strong and punishes the weak.
Murbul knows many poisons and cures if you need them.
You should see Gharol if you're looking for a blade or armor.
I am the hunts-wife of this stronghold.
Burguk is a fine chief. He brings strength and wealth to the stronghold.
You wish to trade in Orc steel?
Strong gauntlets for strong hands.
Blades to kill your prey and your rivals.
We can trade when there's light outside.
I'm Burguk's forge-wife. I shape all the steel for the stronghold.
As forge-wife, I'm also in charge of our mine.
I am Burguk's favored wife. He knows my beauty should be praised.
Arob and Gharol eye me with envy. They don't know how to please their chief.
Umurn and Nagrub will be held up as weak next to the son I will one day bear for my chief.
I work the forge, with my mother Gharol. We mine our own ore and shape our own metal.
One day I will shape a weapon fit for a chief. Maybe that chief will be me.
I help in the mines as well as the forge.
One day, I must fight my brother Nagrub for chiefdom. It will not be easy.
I help my mother Arob with the hunt. We bring much meat and skins to the stronghold.
Brother Umurn is a strong warrior. I look forward to fighting him for chiefdom one day.
One day, I intend to be chief. I will fight my father and my brother for it, as is tradition.
I serve my chief and my brothers by working in the mines. It's the only place fit for an aging Orc.
Sorry, outlander, but this old Orc cannot help you. Burguk is the chief here.
I don't know how Ghorbash has so much spirit. He should act his age.
I used to wander the corners of Skyrim like you. I miss those days.
We honor the bravest fighters, but I have seen many types of bravery in my travels.
I am an Orc and a warrior, but I have no desire to become chief.
Tell me, mother, does Malacath favor our stronghold?
He is pleased. Ours is the strongest tribe in all the Reach.
I saw you working the forge today, wife. Your muscles have grown strong from the metal shaping!
Do they, my chief? Am I now favored enough to replace Shel by your side at the feast? Back your words with action!
No more talk of Shel. As chief, I will do what I please, so point your fiery gaze to our enemies.
My chief, Gharol threatens to have me work in the mines. You won't allow my pretty hands to dirty, will you?
No, my wife. You have been given other gifts to please your chief than mine work. I will talk to Gharol and all will be well.
Oh, thank you my chief!
It is a fine day to work the mines.
This metal will serve the forge well, my brother.
You could challenge Burguk, my brother. Yours is the stronger swordarm.
Serving in the Legion taught me to respect leadership. The stronghold needs Burguk.
The air has the smell of beasts. The hunt is good today.
Yes, mother. I'm eager to prove my skills today.
Ah, the air is good today. I welcome the smell of blood from all the kills I will make.
Patience, my son. The hunter days not welcome the blood of his prey, he waits for it.
You are speaking to Larak, chief of Mor Khazgur.
You should see my forge-wife, Shuftharz, if you need weapons or armor.
My mother, Sharamph, knows many remedies you may wish to take with you.
I'm a strict follower of the old traditions. Honor, strength, deeds.
My place is chief and my challenge is to lead my people.
I have poisons for your weapons, and cures for your ills.
Poisons can kill your enemies faster than any blade.
Do not allow Ataxia to fester. A smart warrior keeps a potion to cure diseases at all times.
If you wish to trade, see me during daylight.
I am wise woman to this stronghold.
Our chief is strong. That is all that matters.
You should see my mother, Sharamph, if you need a cure or a poison.
Shuftharz can forge you some armor, outlander.
Malacath protect you.
Larak is strong, but he has much to prove as chief.
You need some armor, outlander?
How about an axe? Malacath smiles on the axe-wielder.
We can trade in the morning, outlander.
The forge is strong and so is our chief, Larak. I'm content.
My son, Olur, learns the forge well. His work brings me pride.
I envy you, outlander. You can choose to leave if you wish.
Soon, I will be of age. The taste is bitter.
Perhaps I'll join the Legion one day, as my father had done.
I work in the forge and the mines. Mother says it pleases her and our people.
Even good hammers warp metal if struck without care.
Mother tells me to shape metal with focus and strength.
Malacath is pleased with your strength, Larak.
I am honored.
The way you and your mother forge weapons is impressive.
It's simple Orc smithing practice, my chief. Nothing that hasn't been passed down for years.
Thank you, my chief.
Your muscles ripple when you work the forge. It's pleasing.
Damn shame, Roggvir. You were a good man.
That makes Twenty-Three.
Talos protect you.
Roggvir. You damn fool.
I'm going to find whoever did this.
Kynareth preserve us.
Better this one than me.
Agh! Dead body!
Poor bastard's better off.
What a waste.
Another corpse for the pile.
Such a shame.
Damn shame.
Dead? Oh my goodness!
Shouldn't leave things around to trip over...
Oh my word, this is terrible.
Agh! Who did this?
Another poor soul lost.
Dead? How did this happen?
Oh... what happened?
Dragonborn!
Shor's blood, the Thu'um!
Are you Dragonborn?
By the gods, is that the Voice?
Wow!
That must be the Voice!
What in Arkay's name was that?
That sound... it's deafening!
Could that be... the Voice?
Those words have such power!
What sort of power was that?
That was amazing!
The Voice? Here?
That sound could bring mountains down!
You have a mighty voice!
That voice is power!
Louder than the roar of the Mane, that is!
S'rendarr's mercy!
Are you a Greybeard?
Did anyone else hear that?
By the gods, my ears...
That gave me the shivers!
Now that's a real man!
Oh gods, my ears!
Not so loud!
I haven't heard a true shout in generations!
Now that's the true Voice!
How did you do that?
What was that?
Do you honestly think your arrow will reach me before my blade finds your heart?
Give me a reason to try.
[QUOTE]To ensure an enemy's defeat, you must first undermine his allies.[QUOTE]
It was the first lesson Gallus taught us.
You always were a quick study.
Not quick enough, otherwise Gallus would still be alive.
Gallus had his wealth and he had you. All he had to do was look the other way.
Did you forget the Oath we took as Nightingales? Did you expect him to simply ignore your methods?
Enough of this mindless banter!
I'm no fool, Mercer. Crossing blades with you would be a death sentence.
But I can promise the next time we meet, it will be your undoing.
You're a clever girl, Karliah. Buying Goldenglow Estate and funding Honningbrew Meadery was inspired.
How interesting. It appears Gallus's history has repeated itself.
Karliah has provided me with the means to be rid of you, and this ancient tomb becomes your final resting place.
But do you know what intrigues me the most? The fact that this was all possible because of you.
Shhh. Listen to Enthir... we can't afford to miss a single detail.
We haven't much time for discussion, but what did you need?
Let's listen to Enthir's translation before we decide what we do.
Please, there isn't much time. What is it?
Please, make it brief. We have much to do.
Back, eh? And how was our friend Calcelmo?
Was there something else?
Yes, yes. What is it?
Can I help you with anything else?
Ah yes, my matchmaker. What is it I can do for you?
Look, I'm very busy, so this better be important.
I've already provided you with the key to my museum, what else could you possibly want?
What is it this time?
This better be important.
Karliah? Then she's finally found it.
Do you have Gallus's Journal?
A problem? Let me see it.
This is just like Gallus. A dear friend, but always too clever for his own good.
He's written all of the text in the Falmer language.
No. However, I know someone who might.
The court wizard of Markarth, Calcelmo, may have the materials you need to get this journal translated.
A word of warning. Calcelmo is a fierce guardian of his research. Getting the information won't be easy.
Then you were well informed. I am at this very moment on the cusp of completing my magnum opus on the subject.
I'm calling it [QUOTE]Calcelmo's Guide to the Falmer Tongue.[QUOTE] It will revolutionize the way we understand those ancient beings.
Preposterous! That research represents years of personal toil in some of the most dangerous Dwemer ruins in Skyrim!
You must be mad to think I'd allow anyone to see it before it's completed.
I'm not certain how many scholars you're accustomed to dealing with, but I can assure you that personal wealth is our lowest priority.
By defeating Ulfric at Whiterun we have solidified the allegiance of the Jarl.
Perhaps the Stormcloaks will soon lose heart for this little rebellion of theirs once and for all.
We've driven the Imperials out of Whiterun. This is good. Very good. We now control the center. It's a powerful position. One I aim to keep.
The rebels have agreed to cease hostilities until we hash out this treaty. Suffice it to say I'm not holding my breath.
For the moment we have ceased hostilities. We'll see what these Imperials have to say. I doubt we'll come to any lasting agreement.
Things are quiet for the moment. That won't last long. As soon as a new campaign starts, I want you there. Stay close. See me tomorrow.
The gods have granted us peace for the moment. But that won't last long. I'm sure trouble will be stirred up soon enough.
Of course. But why not let him go in first?
Of course. But why not let her go in first?
They may be cowards, but I'm not. I'll go with you.
Lead on.
I suppose you're right. I'm not a fighting man.
Go, and avenge my Laelette for me.
So you're the Dragonborn I've been hearing so much about.
Close the door, then we can talk.
Not here. Follow me.
The Greybeards seem to think you're the Dragonborn. I hope they're right.
Surprised? I guess I'm getting pretty good at my harmless innkeeper act.
You can't be too careful. Thalmor spies are everywhere.
It was the only way I could make sure it wasn't a Thalmor trap.
You ready to hear me out?
I'm not your enemy. I already gave you the horn. I'm actually trying to help you. I just need you to hear me out.
I'm part of a group that's been looking for you... well, someone like you, for a very long time.
If you really are Dragonborn, that is. Before I tell you any more, I need to make sure I can trust you.
Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before it happens, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.
That was well done. Come on. I've been wanting a closer look at one of these buggers.
Come on. Let's go see if there's a mythical dragon buried up there.
We need to find the burial mound. Let's ask in the inn.
I... it's true, isn't it? You really are Dragonborn.
So you were paying attention. I arranged to have Farengar recover the dragonstone for me.
It's what I do. I make things happen from behind the scenes. After all, here you are.
I shouldn't let you walk out of here, knowing what you know. But I guess even my paranoia has its limits.
You know where to find me when you change your mind. Because you will. You have to.
We remember what most don't - that the Dragonborn is the ultimate dragonslayer.
You're the only one that can kill a dragon permanently by devouring its soul.
The dragonstone was a map of ancient dragon burial sites. I've looked at which ones are now empty. The pattern is pretty clear.
It seems to be spreading from the southeast, down in the Jeralls near Riften. The one at Kynesgrove is next if the pattern holds.
I didn't go to all this trouble on a whim. I needed to make sure it wasn't a Thalmor trap.
You should know. You got the map for me. The dragonstone you got for Farengar, remember?
Slen Tiid Vo!
There's no time to waste. Let's go.
Like I said in my note, I've heard that you might be Dragonborn.
I'll explain what I want when I want, got it? You'd already be dead if I didn't like the look of you when you walked in here.
But I had to know if the rumors about you were true...
If you don't trust me, you were a fool to walk in here in the first place.
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life.
They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors.
Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I know they are. I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty.
And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life.
We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
You'll be back. If you're really Dragonborn, this is your destiny.
Let's get going.
Come on. We've got to get to Kynesgrove.
We'd better keep moving.
Ha. A few years ago, I said almost the same thing to a colleague of mine. Well, it turned out he was right and I was wrong.
That mound you remembered sounds like what we're looking for. East of Kynesgrove, right?
I don't know exactly. We need to find the ancient burial mound. Let's ask around town.
I'm glad you came. It's been a long time since we had a heart like yours among our numbers.
That pitiful ceremony behind the hall does not befit warriors like us.
You are due more honor than some calls and feasting.
We do this in secret because Kodlak is too busy trying to throw away this great gift we've been granted.
He thinks we've been cursed. But we've been blessed. How can something that gives this kind of prowess be a curse?
So we take matters into our own hands.
He was one of the strongest we had, but numbers can overwhelm. He should not have come without a Shield-Brother.
Get out of here. I'm going to make sure we got the last of them, and see if there's any information to be gotten from the bodies.
You and I have work to do. The Silver Hand will tremble at our sight.
There's a pack of werewolf hunters camped nearby, at Gallows Rock.
The Silver Hand. I think you've met them before.
We're going to slaughter them. All of them.
Lead on. Skjor's already scouting ahead.
To reach the heights of the Companions, you must join with us in the shared blood of the wolf.
I was hoping you'd change your mind. Come on. I'm heading to Riverwood, just up the road. My sister Gerdur will help us out.
All right. If I make it back to Windhelm, I'll make sure Ulfric knows how you helped me.
Skyrim needs people like you, if we ever hope to regain our freedom from the damned Empire. Good luck.
Keep an eye out for Imperials. They still hold this entire region. As long as we don't do anything stupid... we should be all right.
Aye, that's the work of Septimus Signus.
He's the world's master of the nature of Elder Scrolls, but... well.
He's been gone for a long while. Too long.
Come closer. Bask in my presence.
I am Hermaeus Mora. I am the guardian of the unseen, and knower of the unknown. I have been watching you, mortal.
Most impressive.
Your continuing aid to Septimus renders him increasingly obsolete. He has served me well, but his time is nearing its end.
Once that infernal lockbox is opened, he will have exhausted his usefulness to me.
When that time comes, you shall take his place as my emissary. What say you?
Indeed. Speak with me when the box has been opened, and all shall be revealed.
Be warned. Many have thought as you do. I have broken them all. You shall not evade me forever.
Go forth. Do the biddings of Septimus, for he is working my will in your plane.
What is this... it's... it's just a book?! I can see. The world beyond burns in my mind. It's marvelous....
Come, my champion.
Now you have my Oghma Infinium. It contains the knowledge of the ages as revealed to Xarses, my loyal servant.
For hundreds of years it's been shut away from the world. Septimus was a useful tool for unleashing it.
Now it is in your hands. Let us work wonders together...
Eirid and I are playing Hunt the Elf. It's my job to find the Elf, and kill it dead.
Have you seen it?
Thanks!
Thanks!
All right!
Fine, Elf-Lover. I'll find her myself.
I'll find that Elf. I always do.
I'm gonna find you, Elf!
Ha! Found you!
I hate this game.
That's because you always lose... Elf.
I understand Eirid's been playing [QUOTE]Hunt the Elf[QUOTE] again.
It's just children playing, Haran. I wouldn't fret over it.
I'm not [QUOTE]fretting.[QUOTE] I don't want Eirid playing those sorts of games!
All right, all right. I'll speak to her.
I understand Korir's been complaining about our customers again.
What of it? It's our Inn, and they cause him no harm.
I believe he was suggesting their presence causes him harm.
Well, then he's welcome to eat and drink at home, isn't he?
Well, isn't this a surprise!
How much of our money have you spent today, Ranmir? Anything left, or is it all gone?
If I wanted to get yelled at, I'd be home. Can't you leave me be?
Oh, I'm sorry. Am I bothering you? Am I making your life more difficult?
Please, come home. Just... Just come home.
Can't. Got at least two rounds to go.
Why don't you go... sell something.
Why? Because I'd rather be here trying to keep my only brother from drinking himself to death.
Ha! Drink ain't gonna kill me. Not today, anyway.
Is everything well, Nelacar?
Oh yes, quite fine. My accommodations here continue to be just what I need.
And there haven't been any... problems?
Are you referring to your other customers? No, everything is quite all right. I expect a bit of animosity now and then.
I see. Well, let me know if things get out of hand.
I say, you didn't hear any loud noises last night, did you? No, ahh... explosion sounds?
No, I certainly didn't!
Is there a reason you're asking me?
No, certainly not. A small experiment may have gone awry, but clearly with no discernable consequences.
I... see. And is this something I'll need to worry about in the future?
Oh, certainly I hope not! That would be quite unfortunate for my research.
Yes, yes, so you said. But so what? The end is upon us. I may as well die here as anywhere else. I'm tired of running.
Important? Far more than even she realizes! If you are Dragonborn, then...
Oh, yes. It's all been foretold. The end has begun. Alduin has returned.
Only a Dragonborn can stop him. But no Dragonborn has been known for centuries.
It seems that the gods have grown tired of us. They've left us to our fate, as the plaything of Alduin the World-Eater.
But, give me... just a moment... I must gather a few things...
Are we running low on mead?
No. Even Ranmir can only drink so much.
No, without Ranmir around we're running out of stock far less often than we used to.
Let's just keep an eye on the supply. It's such a chore to restock.
I suppose that's a benefit to having so few customers.
How long are we going to let Ranmir drink himself into a stupor? When will enough be enough?
As long as he keeps paying, I suppose. He keeps to himself, and isn't hurting anyone.
Are you so sure of that? I think Birna might disagree with you.
It's not my place to get involved in their family's business, remember? You're the one that told me to stay out of it.
Good morning, Assur. What do you want to do today?
We're playing Hunt the Elf. You're the Elf.
Why do I always have to be the Elf? I don't want to!
Too bad. That's what we're playing, and you're the Elf. Now go hide so I can hunt you!
Fine.
I know, I know. I'm hurrying.
Yes, I'll be ready in a moment, I just need one more thing...
Fine! I'll just... leave the rest of it. Let's go, then, if you're in such a hurry.
Come in, come in. Mustn't speak of these things in the Ratway.
You... Dragonborn? Is it really true?
So Delphine keeps up the fight, after all these years.
I thought she'd have realized it's hopeless by now. I tried to tell her, years ago...
Divines sake, Skald. Who do think we're threatening with our old war wounds? We're not soldiers, anymore.
So you're the newest member of our dwindling, dysfunctional little Family. I've heard quite a bit about you.
Stop. Turn around. And go back the way you came. Astrid is waiting for you. She's down near the entrance. You must have passed right by her.
You work hard, Daighre. Glad you have stayed with us.
I'm grateful, Skaggi. I'm sorry my daughter gives you so much trouble.
Skaggi tells me that you were bothering him today. Can't you and Torom just play by yourselves?
But mom, it's so boring with just me and Torom. I was just asking Skaggi some questions.
You leave him alone. I don't want to hear Skaggi telling me you've been bothering him again!
Yes, ma'am.
Mining out this old rock is a lot quieter, now. Thank the Divines.
Hard to believe there'd be an old crypt underneath the mine.
We're getting back to work as best we can.
It's crazy to still be working here. What if there's more draugr down there?
This mine will be our grave yet. I just know it.
Any day now more draugr are going to come out of that crypt.
We tunneled into an old crypt. We're warning strangers to keep out.
I'm not going into the mine with draugr lurking down there.
Guards are useless. They just stand around waiting for a full regiment to come and help.
We're keeping the mine closed until that crypt is clear.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.
There's still plenty of ore left in that mine. What a waste.
Mine's closed. Move along.
This is the last hagraven between us and my mother!
Greetings, mother.
Daughter. Who is this you have brought me?
I found a willing subject for you. Payment has already been discussed, of course.
Splendid! Please take a seat on the chair behind me, would you?
I'll just prepare the subject now...
I can't let you do this, mother. You have to die now!
I'm still busy, but I can always make time to speak with you.
Always a pleasure. What brings you back?
Any luck locating those jazbay grapes?
Ah, you're back.
I hope this is important... I get little sleep as it is.
I'm a bit busy at the moment, what did you want?
I have a lot to do around the farm, so make it quick please. What is it you wanted?
I don't suppose you could come back another time? I'm very busy.
This place is boring. Nothing but the same thing every day. Sigh.
I wish I could head to one of the capital cities... maybe even back to Mournhold. Anywhere but here.
One day I hope to become a painter, but at this rate it looks like it's never going to happen.
Can you imagine how wonderful it would be to set what you see on a canvas so you'd have that memory forever?
My sister keeps telling me that the farm keeps us alive, but I don't really call this living.
Aduri, how come the fields haven't been tilled like I asked?
Because it's boring. The fields are going to do fine... you don't have to dote over them so much.
Boring? That food is paying for everything. If we lose even a single crop, we could starve or be forced to beg. I won't have it!
All right, I understand. I'll do it tomorrow, okay? Just get off my back.
Have you decided if I can head up to Solitude yet? I hear it's the best place to meet someone who may be willing to teach me to paint.
I'm sorry, Aduri, not this year. Perhaps next year after the harvest, I don't know. There's so much to do.
It's not going to be next year, nor the year after that! You just care about this farm more than you care about me!
