Painting won't put food on the table, but our crops will. Be patient Aduri... it will happen someday, I promise.
Thanks for the help. Not many willing to take on the Forsworn these days.
Stand next to me, and prepare your Whirlwind Sprint. Master Borri will give the signal.
Follow me. Master Borri will test your Whirlwind Sprint.
We will do your next test in the courtyard. Follow Master Borri.
Master Borri will teach you the first Word of a new Shout. Attend to him.
Master Einarth is waiting.
You must feel the Word within yourself.
You learn quickly, as only a Dragonborn can.
Master Borri is waiting.
Dragons have the inborn ability to learn and project their Voice. Dragons also are able to absorb the power of their slain brethren.
A few mortals are born with similar abilities -- whether a gift or a curse has been a matter of debate down through the centuries.
What you have already learned in a few days took even the most gifted of us years to achieve.
Some believe that Dragonborn are sent into the world by the gods, at times of great need. We will speak more of that later, when you are ready.
Your quick mastery of a new Thu'um is... astonishing. I'd heard the stories of the abilities of Dragonborn, but to see it for myself...
No. Indeed not. But beware that your skill does not outstrip your wisdom.
Despite what you discovered it's still comforting to know my husband is at peace.
So, any luck finding my louse of a husband?
Hmph. If you see my good-for-nothing husband Leifnarr on your journeys tell him he's no longer welcome here.
Men are utter pigs... they only care about one thing.
You men are utter pigs... you only care about one thing.
Men are complete pigs, am I right? All they care about is one thing... and you know exactly what I mean.
If I ever catch my husband in bed with another woman, he's going to find himself homeless.
I can't believe my mother's gone. Now what'll I do?
I knew it! I knew my father was a hero and he didn't just run away.
It's just me and my mother at the mill here. My father is gone. We don't know what happened to him.
I hope you're not here to start some trouble. I'll fight you if I have to.
My mother taught me the millwork trade... you know, which trees to cut and which ones to pass up.
Someday I'll take over the mill... when I'm old enough.
I'm not afraid of anyone. Put a sword in my hand and I could defend this place if I had to!
Millwork sure is boring, but at least I don't have to work in a nasty mine.
Gralnach! I told you not to go through your father's things!
I'm sorry mother, now that he's dead, I just want to know everything I can about him.
I'm sorry mother, I just want to know more about him. You never tell me anything!
He was a wonderful man, and he loved us very much. I'm sorry I yelled at you.
That's because there's nothing to tell. He left us to fend for ourselves and that's all you need to know.
It's okay, mother. I understand.
I wish you didn't hate him so much... I wish the whole family could be together again.
Mother, I finished cutting at the northern stand. Where do I move on to now?
There is a copse of elms to the east. We could really use that wood.
I was hoping to head into Riften for supplies, but I can do that after I'm done with the elms.
Just be careful, Gralnach. That copse doesn't look safe. If you see any trouble, you run right home.
Thanks again for getting my bow back from those thieves. Next time they come knocking I'll be ready.
So, has my bow turned up yet?
Who in the name of Azura are you?
You look suspicious. You better not be one of those damn thieves.
It's not safe around here. There's thieves out there looking to steal everything you own.
You even think of taking something from my house... and I'll kill you.
Now that you've brought Dravin's bow back, he's back to his crabby old self. For better or for worse, I still thank you.
After we were robbed, Dravin's become more bitter than ever. He hates this place.
You'll have to forgive my husband's manners. He's not used to pleasantries.
The war's been hard on the farm and hard on Dravin. We don't know what to expect from one day to the next.
Someday, I hope we can get away from here... perhaps move back to Morrowind. This isn't at all what we expected.
I'm afraid we have little to offer you in the way of hospitality.
Synda... you left your dagger behind again yesterday. I told you, the road isn't safe.
Husband, you worry far too much. We are within an hour's walk of Riften.
That doesn't matter. All it would take is a stray wolf or a bandit crossing your path... I can't bare to lose you after everything we've done.
If it puts your mind at ease, I'll take it with me. I'm sorry.
Dravin! One of the soldiers I spoke to on the way home said you threatened them. What's come over you?
I can't stand them, they represent everything I hate about Skyrim. They're tearing the place apart!
All you'll accomplish by threatening them is ending up in the Riften dungeon. You're lucky they didn't take you seriously.
Sorry, Marise. I just can't sit back and watch them treat us like a resource. This is our home!
I don't care! Just stay away from the soldiers and keep to your business. It's the only way we'll make it through this.
Maybe we could invite some of those nice guards over. You know, for some supper?
No. I have enough trouble without more mouths to feed! They're the Jarl's men, they can eat supper at the keep.
Terrible. Only a matter of time before soldiers come and burn all my hard work into dust!
How do you think the crops are coming, dear?
Look at the sky. Be a terrible day tomorrow. I know it.
Oh, Rogatus! Maybe tomorrow will be pleasant for once, hmm? It can't be terrible every day!
Yes it can. I haven't been wrong in 50 years, and I won't be wrong tomorrow.
Are you all right, Gat?
Still shaken from all the fighting, my friend. It's been too long since I had to kill someone.
I try to think of it as coaxing the ore from the rock.
I keep hearing stories about Morrowind. Sounds like a wretched place.
I hear there's baked slaughterfish tonight.
Is there something I can help you with?
What's your trouble? Dasturn telling tales again?
We keep hearing that the war could come through here. I try not to worry about it.
It's tough to keep track of Hrefna. If her father wasn't such a snowback, he'd be around to help out.
I'm not proud of Hrefna's father. If she knew him, she wouldn't be either.
Hi! I've never seen you around here before. Are you a miner too?
Sondas takes care of me when mom's not around.
Derkeethus used to take me diving way down deep in the river. I miss him.
Mom says the Empire is mean, but I don't think they're that bad.
The Stormcloaks are named after Ulfric. He's a bad man, but don't tell the soldiers that.
A traveler? I'll be you've seen some sights. We should swap tales sometime.
There's a gorgeous tree that grows right up through a cave to the northeast of here.
If you're heading to Kynesgrove, stick to the road. Some pretty dangerous caves between here and there.
Verner used to love exploring before we got married. Now he's become a bit of a milk drinker. Likes to stay home.
If you head straight west from where the White River splits towards Whiterun, you can get a look at the Cradlecrush giants.
You looking for work? We could use an extra hand in the mine. Just bring me any Corundum you dig up.
Annekke used to help more with the mining, but nowadays she's a bit of a bounder.
I do love my wife. Just wish she'd get her head out of the clouds.
If you want some information about the area, Annekke knows it better than anyone.
Sometimes I feel like Annekke cares more about finding new rocks than being with me.
Did you see the fires from Goldenglow Estate? I was afraid the whole place was going to burn to the ground!
If you're looking to purchase goods, I have none to sell. You should head into Riften instead.
Pretty quiet out here on the farm. My wife and I kind of like the solitude.
Vulwulf has been quite generous to let me take care of their farm considering I am not part of their family.
The Snow-Shod's are very trusting to let me run this place without their supervision.
I'm glad there are guards outside the farm. I don't think I could defend the place alone.
My husband and I were just recently married.
I'm originally from Cyrodiil, but I left there after I had a falling out with my family.
This was the first door in Skyrim I knocked upon, and little did I know my future husband would be answering the door.
I like the farm life. It's a huge change from living in a city.
Addvild's made me a happy woman. I wouldn't want to be with anyone else in the world.
Impressive. Your Thu'um is precise. You show great promise, Dragonborn.
You show promise. Remain focused, and you will fulfill your potential.
You have the ability, but you need to learn discpline if you wish to fulfill your potential.
We will perform your next trial in the courtyard. Follow Master Borri.
Now we will see how quickly you can master a new Shout.
Now we will see how quickly you can master a new Word.
Stand next to me. Master Borri will open the gate. Use your Whirlwind Sprint to pass through before it closes.
Try it again. Breath and focus.
Is this your best effort? Again.
Come, Dragonborn. Attend to Master Borri.
So... a Dragonborn appears, at this moment in the turning of the age.
You are now ready for your last trial.
Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return.
Masters Einarth, Borri, and Wulfgar will each demonstrate a Shout. Make your choice.
Don't worry, though. You will find all three Words in Ustengrav.
Strike the targets as they appear. Breath and focus.
Master Borri has agreed to teach you the first Word of a new Shout. Attend to him.
Use both words, if you can.
Use both Fus and Ro. Together, they will make the Shout more powerful.
Well done. Again.
You learn quickly. Once more.
That's it. One more time.
Bex!
Come, we will do your next test inside the hall.
Without training, you have already taken the first steps towards projecting your Voice into a Thu'um, a Shout.
Now let us see if you are willing and able to learn.
Master Einarth will now teach you [QUOTE]Ro,[QUOTE] the second Word in Unrelenting Force.
First, let us see if you truly are Dragonborn. Let us taste of your Voice.
But the Night Mother is mother to all! It is her voice we follow! Her will! Would you dare risk disobedience? And surely... punishment?
You and the Night Mother are of course welcome here, Cicero. And you will be afforded the respect deserving of your position as Keeper.
Understood... husband?
Oh, yes yes yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Oh, be quiet you great lumbering lapdog. The man has had a long journey. You can at least be civil.
Mister Cicero, I for one am delighted you and the Night Mother have arrived. Your presence here signals a welcome return to tradition.
Oh, what a kind and wise wizard you are. Sure to earn our Lady's favor.
But make no mistake. I am the leader of this Sanctuary. My word is law. Are we clear on that point?
Oh yes, mistress. Perfectly! You're the boss.
Oh yes, mistress. You're the [QUOTE]boss.[QUOTE] For now.
We will see if you truly have the gift.
Show us, Dragonborn. Let us taste of your Voice.
Everything well, Jesper?
Yes sir, fine sir.
Good, good. Keep up the hard work. It'll all pay off.
Is everything well with you, my scaly friend?
Teeba-Ei is cold, but Teeba-Ei works hard as always.
Yes, well... That's all we ask of you. Carry on.
Yes sir.
How goes it, son?
I'm fine, father. Work is fine.
Good, good. It's honest work, son. No shame in that.
Of course not. I never thought otherwise.
Right. Well, you let me know if you need anything.
I'm going to Movarth's Lair to kill that monster. Are you with me?
Take us to Movarth's Lair!
Yes!
Yeah!
Yeah!
Take us!
Kill the vampire!
Kill him!
Kill him!
Let's kill him!
Destroy him!
I want vengeance for my wife!
Vengeance for Laelette!
We're marching on Movarth's Lair whether you come with us or not.
Um...this place looks dangerous.
Yeah. Kind of scary too.
And it's full of vampires?
Morthal is full of cowards! Let's go kill that monster.
Cowards! We must kill the vampires. We have to make them pay!
Let's make sure we're just as productive this month as we were last. If Bryling's happy, we're happy.
Yes sir, of course.
All right. Keep up the good work.
I just don't understand what kind of a man does that.
I am Master Arngeir. I speak for the Greybeards.
Now tell me, Dragonborn, why have you come here?
Shout for us, Dragonborn. Then we may have time for questions.
Oh, what is this? A visitor? To our farm? Oh, do stay for a while, dear.
Now, you don't let Rogatus cause you any bother.
My husband just gets cranky when he doesn't get enough sleep.
Our son Leontius moved to Old Hroldan nearly 30 years ago. I still miss him.
I hope my son has found some nice, well-mannered girl to settle down with.
Rogatus and I have been married over 50 years. He's always been a bit of a grouch.
My boy Leontius lives in Old Hroldan. Damn drunk.
I've lived through rebellion, Forsworn, undead, witches, wizards, hagravens, and marriage.
Next thing you know there will be some kind of damn blight and undead will walk the land.
You ever have to farm land while there was a battle going on? I have.
Damn soldiers always trample my crops.
I'm been farming this bit of land all my life.
Oh, wipe that frown off your face Rogatus. You've been wearing that frown for over 50 years now.
You want me to smile? What's there to smile about? Soldiers and dragons are going to be trampling all over the crops this year. I just know it.
Oh, stop being such a grouch! Not every visitor to the farm wants to burn it down! Maybe they just want to have a nice supper with us, hmm?
You don't invite monsters into your home to have supper! I won't have them here, and I'm certainly not smiling for them!
Damn Forsworn. Only a matter of time before they hit here, too.
Guess we'll have two more mouths to feed for a while.
Don't have much to say unless you're here to mine metal.
I'm in charge of Left Hand Mine. You cause trouble, you answer to me.
Left Hand Mine deals with iron, the perfect metal to dig with a war going on.
Kolskeggr, overrun with Forsworn, what next?
Did you hear that? Pavo was driven out of his mine. Almost everyone is dead.
What if the Forsworn come here? We aren't safe.
You should speak with my husband. Skaggi runs everything.
I'm just here to mine.
Got ore to dig.
I'm one of miners. Plenty of ore to dig up around here.
Don't have much to say to you. Got work.
It's amazing how much work goes into the little things, isn't it?
I'm just here to dig. Not much else to talk about.
Kolskeggr Mine is lost, friend. Forsworn killed everyone.
Don't go to Kolskeggr. It's not safe.
Gat and I are the only survivors.
Pavo and I had to fight our way out of Kolskeggr. Forsworn killed everyone else.
Thank Malacath we got out of Kolskeggr alive.
Don't know what I would have done without Pavo. Man's braver than he admits.
Poor Pavo and Gat. To have lived through a Forsworn attack.
Another day, another settlement gets attacked. No place in the Reach is safe from the Forsworn.
I'm the hardest worker in Left Hand. Better than any man.
Most women would rather die than dig, but I have a daughter to raise.
My Erith has her father's eyes. She's all I have left of him.
Why is everyone so upset? If there's Forsworn, the Jarl will take care of them, right?
Hope Pavo will be able to go back to his mine soon. Everyone needs a home.
What'cha doing in Left Hand? Do you dig up rocks too, like my mom?
Why do they call it Left Hand Mine? Can the miners use their right hands too?
Have you met Torom? He's the best dog in the Reach.
By the Eight, I didn't think you could do it!
Now maybe we can put all this behind us.
Take this as a token of our gratitude.
By the Eight, I didn't think you could do it!
Now maybe we can put all this behind us.
Take this as a token of our gratitude.
The god Arkay was once like us, bound to winding mortality.
But he willingly gave up this existence that we might better understand the vagaries of life and death.
It is through the ebb and flow of this cosmic tide that we find renewal and, in the end, peace.
May the spirit of Lavinia and all those who have left this world and its suffering know the beloved serenity of Aetherius...
... and may we one day rejoin them in eternity.
Do you not know the Daedric Lord of the Hunt?
He revels in the chase, and also gave the [QUOTE]gift[QUOTE] of lycanthropy to mortals.
A powerful force, not to be crossed. As I learned too late.
With those three vessels, Hevnoraak can restore himself. Find them before he can.
Kill him now, while we still can!
Did you find all of the vessels?
Do not interrupt the ritual. Go empty the vessels and sit on the throne.
Hevnoraak is defeated.
Thank you, hero. Now I may finally rest. Take Hevnoraak's iron mask. It may be of use to you, and serve as some reward for your feat here.
Boy, did you miss all the excitement.
There's too much of an obsession these days with knives and arrows. You can kill someone just as easily with a well-placed spell.
You like creepin' around in the shadows? Magic'll work just as good there as anywhere else.
Nobody ever expects a fireball from the darkened corner.
Talk to Babette about potions. She's the creepy little girl - can't miss her.
Yes, yes. I'm your brother and I'm supposed to greet you respectfully. So [QUOTE]hello.[QUOTE] There, satisfied?
I believed in Cicero. But he's betrayed us all.
Don't let my appearance throw you off. I'm older than you. A lot older. Getting bitten by a vampire when you're ten will do that to a girl.
It's been quite a boon, looking like a child. No one ever suspects a thing.
My targets make the mistake of not perceiving me as a threat. Last mistake they ever make.
I could brew some potions for you. Or train you in Alchemy.
You looking to buy some potions? Or maybe I could help train you to make your own?
Let me guess - Astrid failed to mention I'm her husband? She has a tendency to do that. Doesn't want the others thinking she plays favorites.
What do you want, beef roast?
You're part of a family now, hamshank. I trust you... you trust me. Got it?
Don't take offense to the nicknames, morsel. I'm a werewolf. Hard not to think of you as a snack.
Hello, tidbit.
It was a truly terrifying scene. Beautiful, in some respects.
Does death not come to us all? Is it not a certainty? I am, therefore, honored to be doom's herald. To play some part in a being's inevitable end.
In the Dark Brotherhood, I found acceptance, love, and my life's true purpose.
Death is but the time to sleep forever, in the Void.
Sithis' whisper be upon you, brother.
Sithis' whisper be upon you, sister.
It only hurts when I laugh. He he he. Owww...
Ah, you're back. It was good to fight alongside you. I'm sure people won't be forgetting that wedding anytime soon, hmm?
Me, I have been part of the Dark Brotherhood from the day I first hatched. I am a Shadowscale, you see. Born under the sign of the Shadow.
I serve Astrid, and this Sanctuary. Life is simple, and good.
The Shadowscales are all but forgotten. An ancient tradition, from another time.
Greetings, brother.
Greetings, sister.
Oh, hello hello!
You require the services of the Fool of Hearts?
Greetings, Listener!
How may I serve the Listener?
Brother.
Sister.
Need something?
If you bring mead, you're welcome here! Even if you don't, you're still welcome!
All this talk of dragons is making people antsy. Nonsense!
I visited the meaderies of Riften once, as a lad. Wish I had their skill.
Working our mine is dangerous work, but Dravynea keeps it going. Well, Dravynea and the promise of more mead.
You've got a fine look about you. Come have a visit at the Braidwood Inn. Better than home!
Welcome to Kynesgrove. If you want to do business here, you'll have to deal with me.
If it's malachite you're after, you've come to the right place. I'll pay for any you dig up out of Steamscorch Mine.
Kjeld speaks for Kynesgrove. Anyone who says otherwise is aching for a fight.
Roggi and I do the work around here. My wife and brats just sit around on their brains wasting time.
My wife is a good woman, but every man needs a little variety, you know?
An outsider? No reason to stop in Kynesgrove. Keep moving.
The mine's always on the verge of collapse. Good thing I'm around to keep it up.
Morrowind used to be a lovely place, but you couldn't pay me to live there these days.
Most people in Skyrim don't care for Dunmer. Roggi's the only one around here even half-decent.
I should get over to Windhelm more. See how the other Morrowind refugees are getting along.
Seen the remnants of the grove? That... well, that was me. Me and my sister.
Came here to start a lumber mill. Who knew the Nords cared about a bunch of old trees?
But... well, they did. Sacred, they said. So we work the mines until we've worked it off. Fair enough, I guess.
Oh, great, another wanderer. Slumming it on your way to Windhelm?
Wouldn't even be here if it weren't for my idiot sister.
I can't believe she dragged me all the way to this snowball. I'd rather be broke in Cyrodiil than broke here.
If these Nords don't let up soon, I might just make a break for it. At least Cyrodiil is warmer than this.
Did you see my husband already? I'm sorry... he can come off a bit rough at times.
I hope you'll stay for a bit. We could certainly use the business.
This is really quite a nice town when you get down to it. Just look at the view!
Got some nice comfy beds at the Braidwood Inn, if you're looking to flop down somewhere.
I've never seen you before. Leave me alone!
My pa runs this town, and you're going to be in big trouble if you mess with me.
You don't look so tough. I'll bet I could take you.
Why are you still here?
Yamarz was a fool. Always trying to scheme his way out of responsibility.
Well, the giants took care of him, and you took care of the giants. Two problems solved at once.
But, you took care of him and the giants. Two problems solved at once.
Now, take Shagrol's hammer back to Largashbur, and we'll see about whipping the rest of them into shape.
The Old Hroldan Inn is still open, bless poor Eydis's memory.
Skuli owns the inn with his mother gone, but I handle the rooms.
You should head on inside. Eydis or Skuli can take care of you.
I work for Eydis. She runs the inn.
You'll be looking to rent Tiber Septim's room I take it?
Old Hroldan is the stone that the Empire's history is built on.
Don't underestimate my son, Skuli. He may look young, but he can handle any drunks we get.
Skuli's father is off fighting for the Empire. I'm sure he's just fine.
Skuli's father is off fighting for the Stormcloaks. I'm sure he's just fine.
This is the Old Hroldan Inn. Clean beds and strong drink.
My mother's dead, but I won't close the inn. I've hired Leontius to run things.
If you drink too much, you're out. No drunks.
Changed the linens myself. They're fresh.
Hmm. That doesn't go anywhere.
I guess we'd better try this way.
Go ahead. I'll follow your lead and watch your back.
You dare challenge me?
I cannot be defeated!
My power is supreme!
Come on, show an old man what you got!
I'll cut out your eyes and sell 'em for coin!
You're nothing but a joke!
Don't make me laugh!
My blade thirsts for your blood!
Come on. Show me you've got what it takes!
You just made the last mistake of your life!
I'll spit on your corpse!
I've killed legions like you!
Is that the best you can do?
I claim your soul for Nocturnal!
The shadows will be your undoing!
Your death will be swift!
I'm having fun, are you?
Call yourself a warrior?
You're losing a lot of blood. Maybe you should sit down for a moment.
Come on! I dare you!
Come on, at least try to hurt me.
Die Imperial!
Where's your precious Emperor now?
You call this a fight?
Wake me up when you're ready to fight me for real.
You want me to close my eyes? Would that even things up a little?
Hahahaha!
Getting tired yet?
Die, will you?!
I've seen fresh recruits with more skill than you!
I'm not impressed.
I have no problem killing you. How do you feel about dying?
Ready to give up?
Hahahaha!
I'll enjoy killing you!
Now you're just making me mad.
Your blood is such a pretty shade of red!
The Emperor can kiss my ass!
Damn you!
I eat Legionnaires like you for breakfast!
I got something for you. But you'll have to come and get it.
I'm getting bored.
Are you trying? 'Cause I'm not.
Die damnit!
Come on, you're not even trying!
Let me make this plain and simple. No more jobs until you pay Vex. No get to it.
Aren't you supposed to be in Markarth? Finish that job and we'll talk about more.
Slow down, you have that special request in Windhelm to finish first. After that's done, I'll send you some more jobs.
Before I'm goin' to give you any more work, you need to finish that job in Solitude.
I want you to finish that job in Whiterun first. Then we'll talk about more work.
I handle the fishin', numbers and bedlam jobs... the ones with the more personal touch.
If break-ins are more your thing, go talk to Vex.
Good, my clients are gettin' impatient.
Bloody good timin'. Just got some more clients.
All right, anythin' in particular strike your fancy?
Bout time. Brynjolf's been gettin' on me about money.
Great. What do you want to do?
You're not getting anything until you pay the Guild back.
I think you should finish that special assignment Delvin gave you, then we'll talk.
I handle the burglary, shill, sweep and heist jobs. Most of them involve breaking and entering.
If you don't like that kind of work, talk to Delvin. He runs the more up-close and personal jobs.
Okay, what'll it be?
Got plenty, take your pick.
Got more than you can handle.
I bet you are. Which one do you want?
Good, we could use the coin.
We have to go through town and across the bridge to get to Bleak Falls Barrow.
You can see it from here, though. The mountain just over the buildings.
Sybille Stentor has a grasp of magical theory that I would never have expected from a human. Even a Breton.
No doubt most folk in Skyrim consider the dragons terrifying. I find them... wondrous.
Spiced wine for ya? It's a family recipe.
Wanderer like you needs a little fire in the veins. Some spiced wine?
Being old's not so bad. Daughter keeps me fed, and my working days are done.
I'm too old to work, but that don't make me too old to drink.
You got nothin' better to do than bother an old man?
You want to know the one truth I've learned in all my years? Life's too hard to face sober.
Hmm? Sorry, I was lost in thought. I'm planning my wedding, you see. So many details to work out.
Some say I got my position because my cousin is the Emperor. Nonsense. The man's given me nothing. He can't even be bothered to attend my wedding.
Good business for the East Empire Company means all the more gold for the Empire.
I don't have time for anyone too lazy or cowardly to make their own way in this world.
I swear, I left another bottle right here...
If you see my father Octieve around, stay clear. He'll only ask you for money or mead.
Seems there's no end to the needs of the Imperials. But what can I help you with?
When the Stormcloaks took Solitude, I thought for sure things would slow down. But they keep me just as busy as the Imperials.
Wanderer like you must have plenty of tales to tell. But I'm afraid I'm too busy to hear 'em.
I got some fine armor, if you're lookin'.
Need a weapon? Hmmm... By the looks of ya, yeah... Think I've got somethin' you can use.
It's good to be away from the forge for a bit.
As high priest of the Eight Divines, I bid you welcome.
As high priest of the Nine Divines, I bid you welcome.
We welcome you to worship the Eight Divines, freely and openly.
We welcome you to worship the Nine Divines, freely and openly.
Wander no more, for you are among friends here, and safe.
I'm afraid I'm running errands at the moment. But please, visit me later at the Temple of the Divines.
Well, now. I'm afraid you've caught me a bit out of my element. Most of my time is spent in the Temple of the Divines, you see.
Blessings be with you.
Blessings of the Eight Divines upon you. How may I help?
Blessings of the Nine Divines upon you. How may I help?
You look troubled. Have you come seeking guidance?
Feel free to take a seat, or pray at the shrines. We appreciate worship in all its forms.
Blessings to you. The Divines are listening.
The Divines saved me from the streets, and they can save you from your trials, as well.
May the Divines guide and keep you.
May you be saved by the Divines, as I once was.
I have no business with you. Leave me.
Go away. I have more important things on my mind right now.
I don't like strangers...
You, talk to egg-brothers. Deeja has no words for you.
You have no knowledge of who you speak to. Go away.
You want knives? You want them in your belly? No? Then you stop talking to Deeja.
Dock work is not good work. Better than Black Marsh though. Much better.
Oh my, old Ma'zaka has a visitor!
What brings you all the way out here?
Oh, for the salt spray, the creek of the mast, and the clash of sabers. Those were the days...
Hey! Wanna play tag?
Hiya! What's your name? Are you visiting? What do you do?
Papa says I won't see Roggvir any more, but he wouldn't tell me why not.
My papa says I'm greg-gare-ree-yus, just like him! He says it means [QUOTE]smart,[QUOTE] but my brother says he's wrong.
Papa used to say I was greg-gare-ree-yus, just like him. I miss him...
Spare some gold for a veteran?
Can you spare a septim? Lost an eye during the Great War, or I'd earn it myself...
I hid here in Solitude for a long time but war, war follows a man until it's done with him.
Them Imperials left me to die in Anvil, and I had to fight my way back home. Then they followed me back here!
Plenty of fresh fish for ya.
I've got some salmon to sell.
You shouldn't leave Solitude without trying our fish. Best in Skyrim.
I... I don't want to talk.
I don't have anything to say.
Pardon me.
Mother says I shouldn't talk to people...
Are you here to talk about my brother? Do you think his execution was justified?
I'm not looking for conversation.
If you want to talk about my brother, I'm not interested.
I'm in mourning. Can't you see that?
Ah, welcome to Angela's Aromatics. Can I help with some herbal needs?
Need something for a potion? You're certainly in the right place.
So, what are your needs? Perhaps a pinch of this, and a bit of that? Hmm?
You were there for Roggvir's execution...
If you're looking for potions you should talk to my aunt, Angeline Morrard.
If you're looking for potions, I think I can be of service.
I'm a little busy at the moment. I've got all sorts of errands to run.
You look like an adventurous one. I bet we're kindred spirits, you and I.
Beirand said you got here just before the execution. Must have been a lovely first sight.
Hmph. You know, you've got a certain... fire in your eyes. Just like my Beirand. Please, feel free to look around. We've got a bit of everything.
Hmph. You know, you've got a certain... fire in your eyes. Just like my Beirand did. Please, feel free to look around. We've got a bit of everything.
Welcome. Look around. We've got everything you could want in life. At least... that's what Beirand always tells me.
Welcome. Look around. We've got everything you could want in life. At least... that's what my Beirand always told me...
Hey! Wanna play tag?
I thought adventurers were supposed to look tough?
I bet my papa could beat you up.
I bet my papa could have beat you up. He was stronger than anyone.
I get to help mother with the shop. I used to help papa too... 'till I tried to use the forge...
If you're heading to the Blue Palace, you might want to rethink that outfit.
If you ever want to replace those old rags, stop by Radiant Raiment.
Why, hello! Here to buy? If you have to ask the price, you may be in the wrong store.
We provide clothing for all of Solitude's most... influential residents. But for you, I'll make an exception.
Oh, what delight. Another charming customer...
So good to see you again. How can I be of service?
Let me just drop everything to help you. I don't mind. Really.
I can help with purchases, but if you came to talk, see my sister. She's the one who gets on with people. It's her one virtue, really.
Welcome to the Winking Skeever, friend.
If you need a good rumor or two, I think I can oblige...
Traitors, civil wars, dragons. Bah. Those troubles don't cross my doorway. So sit, relax.
Feel free to make requests.
There's nothing like a good song to lift the spirit in troubled times.
Have a drink, rest your feet and stay a little while.
Uh oh. A fellow bard. I best not miss my notes or forget any lyrics.
New in town, right? If you need a place to sleep, head over to the Winking Skeever. We keep a fine inn.
You know, the Winking Skeever's not just the best inn in Solitude. It's the also the only inn in Solitude.
Don't mind me. I'm just running errands for the old man.
I'm just running some errands for the old man... Err... For myself. I'm just running some errands for myself...
Seems there's always more to be done...
Glad you decided to check us out.
Soft sheets and hard liquor. What's not to like?
Welcome to Solitude. Home of the arts here in Skyrim.
It is my personal mission to ensure that the Bards College preserves the great deeds of the past, in both poetry and song.
I generally don't involve myself in politics. Good tales deal with the issues of the day, but a wise bard remains a neutral observer.
We bards record history - we do not make it. You'd do well to remember that.
Never forget, the most important job of any bard is to entertain. The day you lose your audience is the day you cut your lute strings.
Youngest bard at the Bards College, at your service.
Anything I can do for you, I will.
The pleasure's all mine.
Good evening. I'm Pantea Ateia, the Master Vocalist.
It's been my honor to perform at the Blue Palace on many occasions. His late lordship was quite the admirer.
If you ask me, this damned rebellion can't end soon enough. I had to end my tour of Skyrim's courts. Too dangerous too travel.
To be honest, I simply can't stand some of my students. Only Aia shows true potential for greatness. The rest are just wasting my time.
I'm Dean of Lute at the Bards College, and no, I don't give private lessons.
It takes two things to be a good teacher. The first is patience. The second is a firm wooden stick for rapping knuckles.
Only reason I'm so good with a lute is because I'm old. It takes a lifetime to master.
You here to apply at the Bards College? Well don't bother - you're too damned old. Start past four, and it's all wasted effort.
Hello, yes? I'm the Dean of History. And scribe work, when I can find some quiet time.
My position, [QUOTE]Dean of History,[QUOTE] actually covers a wide range of subjects. I teach poetry, writing, history, and the finer points of court life.
What a fascinating time to be alive! Mark me, these days will be remembered long after we're gone.
If you love history, you're in the right place. Skyrim is steeped in it.
I wish only to graduate and enroll with the Legion. My drums will lead our troops to victory.
It's an honor to have Viarmo for instruction on drum, but he's far too reserved for my tastes.
Viarmo is too concerned with precision. What of instinct? Hmm? What of passion?
Lisette's a fine lass, but when I join the Legion, she's not the type to wait for my return.
Lady Ateia says my voice is second only to hers. But she's selling me short.
Few can resist my charms. Even fewer are worthy of them.
I can't understand why Jorn would want to join the Imperial Legion. Soldiers only appreciate one thing, and it isn't music.
You're new here, right? Welcome to the Bards College. It's like a... musical museum.
Dean Inge says a bard can never have enough practice. So, would you like a tune?
I'm so glad you got back from Olaf's Tomb okay. They gave you a tougher task then they gave me.
You know, I don't get the impression that I'm very well liked at the College...
Thane Bryling, at your service.
I can always find time to share a word with a warrior.
Many condemn the Stormcloaks, but I refuse. There is honor in fighting for what you believe.
This godsforsaken war is dividing our people and destroying our land.
Unless we have specific business, I'm not interested.
I think Bryling's the one you want to talk to. I'm mostly just here to scare away the riff raff.
You don't want to talk to me. I'm just a stand in for a dead Thane.
When I was a young rascal, I broke a man's arm with a single punch. Course, I had a horseshoe hidden in my glove...
The Imperials are good for business, and business is good for Skyrim.
Bryling's obsession with honor and tradition is quaint, but politically irrelevant.
I understand what's best for Solitude... and Jarl Elisif knows it.
Half of the businesses in town owe me money, and I own most of the rest. I practically run Solitude already.
Please address all questions to the Steward, Falk Firebeard.
My duty is to keep the Jarl safe. Not play nursemaid to you sycophants.
Keep your weapon out of your hands, and we'll get along just fine.
The Jarl has advised me not to talk about which court attendants I'd like to punch in the face. More's the pity.
Hello. I'm Gisli. But you can just call me Erikur's sister. Everyone does.
Welcome to the center of the world. Or at least my brother Erikur's world...
Have you met my dear brother Erikur? The man's as trustworthy as a Khajiit goldmonger.
Quickly, if you please. I'm quite busy running errands for my bastard of a brother...
Speak if you must, but mind your tongue. I do not suffer fools gladly.
Working for Erikur may be below my stature, but the compensation is... acceptable.
You look like you could do with a ripe apple. Or a tomato, cabbage or leek?
An apple to keep you healthy? A tomato to keep you strong? Surely you need one or the other...
You get around, right? If you come across any Stormcloaks... gut one for me. They did the same to my brother in Whiterun.
Mind yourself in my city, friend. This here axe in full swing is a right terrible sight...
Mind yourself in my city, lass. This here axe in full swing is a right terrible sight...
You stay out of trouble, now. The Castle Dour dungeon can break even the strongest will.
Not much work being a jailor. Long as you can ignore the pleading and all that.
Ain't many visitors come to the dungeon. Every now and then Sybille Stentor will come by looking for... volunteers.
If you have business, please see Falk Firebeard, my steward.
With the passing of my dear husband Torygg, the weighty position of Jarl has fallen to me. Please direct questions to my Steward.
Ulfric is a fool and a coward, who naively believes he can bring about peace through warfare. It's rather sad, really.
Thanks to Ulfric's rebellion, countless innocent people can't feed or clothe their families. It's unacceptably tragic.
Do you have business with the court?
I am the Jarl's Steward. If you have court business to tend to, you talk to me.
The Jarl is not to be disturbed with common affairs of court. You direct those concerns to me.
Just arrive in the city? Is it true what they say, then? There are dragons about?
Think I'll forge me a new sword, just in case things go awry here in Solitude. I'm the blacksmith's apprentice, you see.
We've got strong swords and sturdy armor, if you're looking to buy.
Apprentice blacksmith, at your service.
Blacksmith, at your service.
Be quick. I have little patience for mundane concerns.
I have so very many ways to deal with people. Very few of them pleasant.
You're trying my patience.
Surely you have something better to do...
Jarls come and jarls go, but a good cook stays for a lifetime. And I'm a very, very good cook.
Everyone knows General Tullius wields the real power Solitude. Elisif? Ah, she's a figurehead. A puppet.
Folks at court won't admit it, but Sybille Stentor scares us all to death.
Somethin' just ain't right about that Sybille. You know, I've never seen her eat a thing? That can't be natural.
Most of the time, people just forget I'm even here. That's why I hear so much good gossip.
Oh, hello! Just tidying up.
So exciting when new folk come into town. I bet you've had plenty of adventures.
Someday, a gallant hero will ride up and take me away. Someday...
Someday, I'll be a gallant heroine. You make it look so.. appealing.
Are you my gallant hero? Have you come to whisk me away, to a life of adventure and romance?
Maybe you need a partner? Hmm? Just picture it. Two women, the dusty road, strapping men at every tavern, a fortune in gold to be claimed...
I made a wish in the town well that a golden knight came to take me to his castle. Oh, does it spoil the wish if I tell?
Watch your feet. We just cleaned there!
Got lots of things to take care of. What do you need?
Hello, my child. Arkay watch over you.
May Arkay bless you with a long life, a proud death, and a restful grave.
Hello and welcome, my friend. How may I help you on this fine day?
True, I may look the part of dashing swordsman, but I prefer the art of wit to that of warfare.
Your typical Solitude wench is like the city itself. Stormy exterior, but ah the charms that lie within...
A sharp mind beats a sharp blade any day. Words to live by.
Ah, yet another new face. I'm from Hammerfell, you see. I can hardly keep track of all the people I've been meeting.
Always good to see a fellow traveler. I hope you've found the roads relatively safe. Free from dragons, at the very least...
If you're looking for any archery or fletching supplies, you should see Fihada. I'm just the apprentice.
Fletching suits me. It's difficult, and sometimes tedious. But a well made arrow strikes forth like the fury of a god.
You here for my next interrogation? I got nothing but time...
Leave me be, Imperial. I haven't got anything to say to you.
Don't think I don't know what's coming.
It's only a matter of time before Ahtar's blade finds my neck...
You got business at the stables?
Work hard for the future and leave the past be. That's my motto.
With a wife like Fridrika and a son like Horm, I'm the luckiest man in Skyrim.
You wouldn't know it, but before my family got killed? I was the luckiest man in Skyrim.
Is this about the stables? My husband, Geimund, handles the business.
Is this about the stables? With my husband gone, my son Horm handles the business.
I really don't mean to be rude, but I don't think there's much I can help you with.
My family's weathered its share of problems, but we don't dwell on the past.
Looking for a horse? You'll want to talk to my father, Geimund.
Need a horse? I guess I'm the one to talk to, since my da passed...
I grew up tending some of these horses. They're almost family.
When I was a boy, there was a year we couldn't afford enough feed. So I snuck my dinner out to the stables, and gave it to the horse.
Come in, come in! I was just about to take a break.
Living outside the walls is a risk, aye. But at least the guards don't come nosin' around.
We had some trouble, while back. Stormcloak tried to set the mill on fire. But we sorted her out.
What do you want?
Out here at work, Hjorunn treats me like an equal. Better than most in town.
Any day is a good one, long as I don't have to go into town. But some days, Hjorunn's too drunk...
Any day is a good one, long as I don't have to go into town. But with Hjorunn gone...
My duty is simple - oversee the Thalmor Justiciars, and make sure they perform their duties admirably.
The Empire, in its wisdom, has come to recognize Talos worship as a barbaric remnant of a bygone age.
Talos was a heroic man, but not a god. It pains the Altmer that we must remind our younger cousins of the difference.
We only want what is best for Tamriel. Surely, the rebels will accept peace when they realize this.
I could swear I've seen you somewhere before...
Can I help you?
My husband handles the indoor work. Just as well - he'd only hurt himself out here.
It's hard work keeping Solitude fed, but I wouldn't trust any other family to do it.
Oh, hello. Have a seat, will you?
I was a much younger man when I married Katla. Now I can hardly keep up with her.
My brothers would have been appalled to see a man outdone by his wife, but not me. Without Katla, this farm would fall apart.
You're a guest. And father says we have to be polite to guests.
Mama said I could help with the goats!
Father says I don't have the knack for reading, but mama says I won't need it to work the farm.
Good day to you.
Do you have business with the East Empire Company?
I will thank you not to interrupt me in my tasks.
You'd better have a damned good reason for being here...
It takes a brave soul to wander onto my deck. It'll take more than that to leave in one piece.
I'd say you're either brave or stupid, but I can already tell which one it is.
You must have a death wish.
You reek. A little friendly advice - take a bath and get some new clothes.
Whatever you're about to say, don't bother. I don't want to hear it.
What hole did you crawl out of?
Out of my way, or I'll cut you. Deep.
I've only been a part of the Red Wave's crew for a few weeks, but I've already learned to stay out of Captain Safia's way.
Forget wine, women and wealth - give me a calm sea and a good book, and I'm happy.
I hear Adonato Leotelli's staying up in Windhelm. I've read a few of his works. Be good to meet him someday.
Don't misunderstand me, friend. I like my quiet, and I like to read. But you trifle with my ship, my crew, or my captain? I will kill you.
You've not seen the night sky until you've seen it on the open sea.
My father was all the family I ever had. I felt so lost when he died. But the crew of the Red Wave's my family now.
I've seen some truly wondrous sights since I took to the seas. I had no idea a man could die in so many ways...
Just yesterday, I saw a musician in the street playing a flute. It was... beautiful. I want that flute.
Dorian is helping me perfect my fencing, but I don't think I'll ever be as good as he is.
You've found the Bards College kitchen. Congratulations.
Meals are served to Bards at designated times. Find an inn if you want to make requests.
You look a little sturdier than most of the Popinjays around here.
I once captained a ship called the Argent Raptor. She struck an iceberg and went down, just north of Windhelm.
My shipmates scoff at my love of finery, but I know envy when I hear it.
From ship's captain to lowly crewman... I suppose I deserve it after wasting all my coin on gambling and women.
I hail from Cyrodiil, but after a... misunderstanding with the law, I needed a swift change of scenery.
If it's arms or armor you need, see Beirand in Castle Dour. Bloody good blacksmith, that one.
If you need potions, head over to Angeline's Aromatics.
You can sell off that junk at Bits and Pieces.
The Winking Skeever's got warm beds and cold mead. You look like you could use both.
I don't abide fancy clothes, but you look like you might. I hear Radiant Raiments has a large selection.
Off the coast a ways to the east, you'll find the wreck of the Brinehammer. Never know what treasures may still be aboard.
You heard of Ravenscar Hollow? Cave on the island to the west. Place is a roost for those foul Hagravens.
If you must venture southwest, stay clear of Volskygge. It is a cursed place, a tomb where the dead still live...
The road to Whiterun's not safe these days. Lots of travelers just... disappear, south of Dragon Bridge. Can't find a trace of them.
Pinemoon Cave is down to the southwest, but it ain't fit for exploring. There are stories... Vampires, some say...
Been up to the Blue Palace? It's a sight to see. Even if it is filled with fops...
We couldn't have taken this city without you, sir.
We couldn't have taken this city without you, ma'am.
Everything's in order.
Solitude is as glorious as they said it was. Nothing like Falkreath where I grew up.
Don't talk to me, defiler.
I have no words. Talk to Anwen.
Pick up your mess. Then we'll talk.
I'm not going to talk to you until this mess is cleaned up.
Talk to me again when you've cleaned up your mess.
You mentioned something like that... when you were running off with my goat!
Tell you what - you bring back my goat, and maybe I'll give a damn about your staff.
We're married. I guess we'll need to decide where we're living, won't we? You can always stay with me.
I guess we have our entire lives together, now. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
We face the world together now. Where should we live? My home is yours.
We're united, but where should we live? My home is yours, of course.
I'm a married man! Hey, where should we live? I guess you could always stay with me.
This is the happiest day of my life. Where should we live? My home is your home now, of course.
Married. It doesn't feel like I thought it would, but I'm happy. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
The mine will be running better than ever thanks to you.
Nasty little buggers, aren't they?
The spiders put you through the ringer?
I hope you haven't arrived here looking for work in the mine.
Sorry, the mine's dry right now.
I hate seeing a good mine go to waste like that, you know?
If you're looking for supplies, I'd advise heading to Riften.
What brings you out to Shor's Stone?
Everything was going great in Redbelly. Then the damn spiders showed up.
You think you're tough, huh? Wandering Skyrim is a picnic compared to tunnel crawling!
The real work happens in places like this. Blood and sweat is what makes the world turn.
Sure, I used to be a soldier... but that was child's play compared to cracking rock.
Mining's my life now, I wouldn't want to do anything else.
Making that trip to Darkwater Crossing was a huge help. Thank you.
I trust my parents are well?
Would you happen to be headed towards Darkwater Crossing?
Welcome to Shor's Stone.
Have you ever been to Darkwater Crossing? Terrible name for such a beautiful place.
I suppose you're used to traveling, being a stranger around here.
Came all the way out here to see us, did you?
Ha! You showed those spiders a thing or two!
You're looking at the best miner in Skyrim.
I'd wager I could crack rock faster than anyone. Even you.
Takes a lot of strength to swing a pick axe, know what I mean?
Aye, I see the look you're giving me. Don't worry, I won't bite.
Morthal used to be a quiet place. But then, the world used to make sense.
You ask me, we'd be better off without that wizard in town.
This isn't the time or place for magic, or whatever it is Falion does.
I figure the guards could always use some help, so I keep my eyes open.
Been hoping they'd make me a guard, but not yet. Still, I'll help them out if I can.
The Jarl does little to protect us these days.
A new face! Such a welcome sight in dreary old Morthal. Welcome friend, welcome!
Don't fret over the gloom, there's nothing to fear! Old Lurbuk will brighten your spirits -- just lend him your ear!
The good people of Morthal have yet to embrace my talent.
Try as you may, they won't say [QUOTE]good day,[QUOTE] but will just walk away. Worry not, Morthal! Lurbuk is here to stay!
The fair Jonna does me a great courtesy by allowing me to entertain the guests of her noble establishment.
I, Lurbuk the Great, will win the hearts of the people of Morthal one day, mark my words!
Welcome to the Moorside. If you need anythin', I'll be 'round. Good to have a customer.
There ain't much to offer, but if you wanna place dry to spend the night, I'll rent you a room.
Runnin' an inn weren't my plan. But Falion decided to move here, so I joined him.
Falion had his work to keep him busy, and I needed somethin' to do. So, here I am.
I take what little business I can git. I'm grateful for anyone willin' to spend money here.
Ignore the Orc. He pays, so I let him stay.
I've tried to explain to Lurbuk that his [QUOTE]singin'[QUOTE] is gonna get his throat cut.
You'll want to be careful travelin' at night. The marsh is a dangerous place.
So, life has brought you to Morthal, and to me. What purpose this serves, we will no doubt see. Welcome.
Tamriel is full of wisdom and magic, if one is willing to look for it. Few have their eyes open.
Dark times, indeed. I fear the worst for Morthal and my people.
I try and take comfort in knowing that when all is lost, there is much to be gained.
It is my hope that I will one day return to Hjaalmarch. But the Divines have not shown this to me.
I speak, and others hear. It is my hope that instead they listen.
In Morthal, there is little to rule. But there is much to teach. And so, I am Jarl.
All this talk of rebellion and strife. Too many are focused on what might be instead of what is. It tires me to talk about it.
There is too much to learn in the world, too much to know, to fight over [QUOTE]laws[QUOTE] that have no real purpose.
We're safe here now. But what of Morthal?
The Empire brought stability, assurance to the people of Morthal, even if they didn't appreciate it. Now what do they have?
I fear for what this change will do to my family.
If you've business with the Jarl, I'd ask that you speak to me first.
I do what I can to see that Idgrod's time isn't wasted, and that she only has to deal with important matters.
Too many bother my wife with their petty problems, and then don't even understand the advice she gives them.
The only thing that matters to me is keeping my wife safe. I won't let anyone harm her.
Morthal doesn't need any trouble. You keep your nose clean, understand?
My mind weighs heavy enough. Leave me to my food.
Leave Idgrod and her family alone. They've been through enough.
This wasn't what I wanted. Not at all.
All that ever mattered was what was best for Morthal. Leaving it in Ulfric's hands... It's not right.
I'm just here to protect the Jarl, not to chat.
Morthal has enough problems without you bothering me.
I'm under a lot of pressure. If you don't leave me alone, I won't be held responsible.
Please don't mind Joric. He's not mad, really he's not.
To be driven from our homes, to be forced here... this is the last thing that Joric needs.
I don't... I haven't mother's gift, not quite, but I've seen things.
Someday I'll be Jarl. Mother reminds me often. I hope I can help the people of Morthal the way she has.
It's difficult sometimes... To know whether what I see is real or not.
I keep hoping this is another vision, that it's not real. But it is, isn't it? We really have lost our home.
For now, looking after Joric is my job.
You're different, aren't you? Not like anyone else. Not in Morthal, or Skyrim.
I don't understand. Why can't we go home?
I can't sleep here. The dreams are even worse than before.
I get lost sometimes. I'm not sure where I go, but I'm not... I'm not here.
Gorm thinks I'm mad. He doesn't say it, but I know he thinks it. Is he right?
My mother sees things. She doesn't know why, but she does. Only sometimes, she doesn't see me at all.
It's Falion. He... He did it. I don't know what it was, but he did it.
Keep your wits about you. Morthal's hardly a safe place.
I'm just a poor man trying to make a living. I'd leave Morthal were it in my power.
This damned war has cost us... me... everything.
My boy's to grow up without a mother? What life is that? It's not right, I tell you.
Hasn't been seen for a while. She just vanished without a trace.
Some say the swamp took her. Part of me wishes it were that simple.
Have you seen my mother? I'm still waiting for her to come home.
Papa says that I shouldn't keep waiting. Why not? Mama has to come home some time.
Who are the Stormcloaks, and why would mama want to spend time with them instead of me?
I know you for what you are. This town's blood is ours. Leave it! Now we must return to our roles lest the sheep suspect the wolves.
Well, aren't you the handsome one. You and I should spend some time together.
Well, aren't you the pretty one. I bet all the men chase after you.
The people here work so hard, and they never allow themselves a moment of fun. It's such a pity. It won't last forever though.
These people are like cattle. All they do is work, sleep and eat.
Gathering plants, picking mushrooms, brewing potions. It all gets so dreary after a while. This town needs something exciting to happen.
Thank you for saving me from Alva. I was completely under her evil spell. I'll never forgive myself for what happened to Helgi and my wife.
I... I'm not one for talk. Try to keep to myself.
Alva's been good to me ever since... well, since the fire.
I just try and do my job, and not to think about what's happened. Try to find what happiness I can.
Ignore the talk of spirits and creatures and such. It's just superstition.
There's enough real troubles in the world without making new ones up.
You are new to Morthal. We have not spoken before. This is interesting.
The changes in Morthal are of little consequence to me. So long as the laws are upheld, I do not care who does the upholding.
My talents are much needed here, in order to keep Morthal... safe.
Morthal is a troubled place, and it is my duty to see it rest in peace.
Please remain indoors at night. It is dangerous to go outside.
Do you like magic? Falion says I'm good at learning. I like learning about magic.
My mother and father died years ago. Falion takes care of me now.
I asked Falion if someday I could learn from the mages in Winterhold, but he doesn't like that idea.
If you need any alchemy supplies, I'll do my best to provide them. Assuming I haven't used them all up.
Jorgen and I both work hard, all the time. Morthal is important to both of us.
I don't get many customers, but that leaves me time to try things out. Experiment, I guess.
Unless it's about the mill, I don't have time to talk. Too much to do.
We've gone from a Jarl lost in her own head to a Jarl that cares for nothing but herself. Lot of good that does us.
The mill is my responsibility, and that's what I care about. That's all. Understand?
I just want to be left alone to do my job, and to enjoy what little free time I have when I have it.
We've got all the miners we need, so I hope you're not here looking for work.
Hjaalmarch isn't much, but it's a good start. I'll make a name for myself here, then maybe work my way up to someplace like Riften.
Finally, my leadership is being recognized.
Nothing here but the mine. Probably best you keep moving.
Pactur and I, we make sure the miners aren't stealing, and that the ore makes it to Solitude.
It's good that Sorli has finally been given some real authority.
I'll see to it that Sorli is safe now that she's running Morthal.
We left Sirgar in charge back at Stonehills. I hope that wasn't a mistake.
Sorli and I are just here to make sure the mine is run proper.
Wouldn't ever have expected to wind up living in a place like this, but the money's good.
Don't bother the miners. They've got work to do.
I'm in charge now that my parents are in Morthal.
I figured that I would run the mine someday. I just didn't figure that would mean now.
Guess the Empire's going to need plenty of iron what with all the fighting. That'll be good for us, I suppose.
Talk to my parents if you need something.
My parents keep a close eye on the miners. They can't be trusted too much.
I hear there's been fighting in Skyrim. Rebellion, maybe. Wonder if our iron is being used for weapons.
If you're here about the mine -- it's already got an owner, and she's not selling. If not, then please stay out of my workers' way.
You get used to the cold after a while. The harder you work, the warmer you stay.
I spend every waking moment making sure the mine is put to good use.
Bryling owns this mine. I wouldn't have much to live for if she hadn't offered me a job.
My job is my life. Whatever happened before doesn't matter.
I'm just here to work the mine. Nothing else matters anymore.
The outside world means little to us, and we'd like it to stay that way.
When you work hard enough, really get into a rhythm, everything else just fades away.
I'm just trying to make a living. I've no interest in trouble.
My business is my own. Why can't others see that?
The mine gives us purpose. Something many of us have wished for.
Stonehills' warmth is a welcome change in this cold, bleak land.
Teeba-Ei the hatchling never imagined working a mine in this cold place. Greater things were dreamt of.
This is not where Teeba-Ei was meant to live out the rest of his days.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked.
I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill.
The Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things. I can't be a part of that.
Gods, I can't run away from this. I have to stop her.
I'm going with you whether you like it or not.
Let's get up there before mother finds out what we're doing.
You want in there? Here's my spare key. Take whatever you want.
Alva? Didn't think she had it in her.
So Alva did it to get Hroggar for herself? I should have suspected her.
I assume you have proof? Can't go making accusations like that without proof.
By the gods! I assume you have proof.
Bah. If there was a tonic that could help me, I would have found it by now...
You would do that? It's good to know there are some people out there who are willing to help an old man.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in a long forsaken cave to the west of here.
Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the mixture. Here, take it.
Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.
A legendary bottle, forged in the days when Skyrim was just starting its turn to ice.
A small container, made of the magically infused snow that first fell on the Throat of the World.
It is said that the Phial will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it.
For an alchemist like myself, it is the most pure expression of my art. To create from nothingness is... poetry.
I have spent my entire life searching for it.
It brought me all the way to these frozen reaches from the warm embrace of Summerset Isle.
Entire years spent in libraries. Seeking out tiny villages with local legends that contain but a whisper of a hint of the Phial.
I even named my shop after it, hoping that it might attract anyone who had heard of it.
And now it's within my grasp... but the Eight, it seems, have chosen me for their amusement.
... for in my current condition, I'll never be able to lay my hands on it.
Splendid. Then we're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
But by Sithis, I hope I'm making the right choice here. You may be an effective killer, but your command of guile leaves much to be desired.
The sealed letter you delivered to me was mysteriously unsealed upon its arrival. I can only assume you've read its contents. Sloppy...
But moving on to business. As you probably already know from reading the letter... you're going to a wedding.
Splendid. Then we're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding.
Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding.
And they say romance is dead.
Soon. I'm not exactly sure when. But not to worry - the ceremony itself is being followed up by a public banquet that will last for several days.
Both Vittoria and her husband will be there for the duration, and everyone in Solitude is invited to attend. You'll have plenty of opportunity.
An excellent question. Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II.
Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation.
So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire.
The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Every now and again, we like to remind the shopkeepers that we're in charge.
If that means breaking into their strongboxes and stealing something valuable from them, then so be it.
Feel like doing a bit of shopping... the Guild way?
Got a shop owner with a very choice item a client wants to get his hands on if you do the dirty work.
Got a good one here involving a shop, a waylaid shipment of goods and an angry client. You fill in the blanks. You want in?
I have just the place. The owner likes to stash some lovely trinkets in his strongbox like this beauty. Can you get it for us?
The owner of this place just inherited an heirloom from a relative. You want in?
Sure. A client's relative lost this item in a gambling match and they're paying us to get it back. So much for fair play, huh?
The owner of this shop stiffed us on their last protection payment, but we're taking it anyway. You want to help us on this one?
Jiit caravan brought this shop a nice piece from Elsweyr. Think you can break into their strongbox and get it for us?
Got a client in desperate need for this item. He won't say what it's for, and we don't care. Can you take this one?
This is a public kill. How you do it is entirely up to you. Arrow to the throat? Knife in the belly? Your choice, so long as it's loud and messy.
Because of the current political climate, people are going to assume the murder is related to the bad blood between the Legion and Stormcloaks.
In any event, when Vici dies, it's going to be complete pandemonium. Best have your escape route planned out in advance.
Hmph. He had a trip to Skyrim planned for months, and canceled at the last minute. Much to his cousin's dismay.
Seems the Emperor realized his presence would necessitate a more direct role in the ongoing hostilities. A role he was, obviously, unwilling to take.
All that will change with his cousin's murder. Everyone will think it was motivated by the conflict between the Imperial Legion and Stormcloaks.
And the Emperor will be forced to come clean up the mess.
Of course. Take what you need.
Of course. Take what you need.
But what's all this about? What are you two doing here?
Hadvar? How do you know him?
Like I said, I'm glad to help in any way I can. Help yourself to whatever you need, within reason.
Just head north - you can't miss it.
It's the capital of Whiterun Hold, the biggest and the best of the nine holds of Skyrim. But don't take my word for it.
Cross the river and then head north. You'll see it, just past the falls.
When you get to Whiterun just keep going up. When you get to the top of the hill, you're at Dragonsreach, the Jarl's palace.
Just follow the road north. When you get to Honningbrew Meadery, turn left and the road will take you to the city gates.
It's not far. We used to go to the market there every month or so, until the roads got so dangerous with the war and all.
You really think I can be a blacksmith someday, papa? As good as Eorlund Gray-Mane? Or maybe... even as good as you?
Oh, I know it! You keep working hard, like you been doing, and you could be the greatest blacksmith Skyrim has ever seen.
He he. Thanks, papa.
You see, you're not well! Have a seat and I'll fetch you some tonic.
I'll... I can... just...
Master, you're far too old for this sort of journey. We don't know what's inside...
I'll be fine.
I'm so close to the answer...
May the Eight guide you to the Phial...
Please hurry -- I fear my master doesn't have much time left.
Good luck finding the fragments.
I'll just be tending the museum if you need me.
Please, open the door. I need to get out of here.
Are you one of them? Please don't hurt me.
I hope we reach Markarth soon.
I can't wait to learn from the priestesses.
Please, let's hurry to the Temple before the Forsworn find me again.
I hope Fjotra is happy in the temple. We're so honored to have given her.
Thank you for getting her back from the Forsworn. Dibella was smart to have sent you.
Let's get to the Forsworn camp. Her life could be in danger.
I swear, if those things have laid a hand on her...
Let's find Fjotra. This place gives me the creeps.
How could they live like this? It's disgusting.
I'm sorry, the Temple of Dibella is closed. You can receive your blessing, if you wish, but the other sisters are in seclusion.
I've heard stories about the wonders of the great Temple in Markarth.
But I never dreamed that I would even get to see it.
I am honored to be called for this duty. Please, lead on.
Now, there's no need to do anything rash...
This isn't as bad as it seems. I was going to tell Mercer about everything, honestly! Please... he'll have me killed!
I see you wish to be reasonable, perhaps I misjudged you.
The name of the person you want is Karliah.
All right, all right. It's Karliah... her name is Karliah.
They were a secret cabal of the three top rogues in the Thieves Guild. No one knew their identities.
Some people say they watched over the group, others say they were reserved for the most elite jobs. I don't really know.
It wasn't until recently that I heard Mercer Frey and this Dark Elf named Karliah were a part of that group.
Consider it a gift to ensure your silence. That thing seems to be bringing me nothing but trouble anyway.
Karliah didn't even want it, she wanted to keep the sale a secret. I can see how well that went.
I thought it was painfully obvious that Gulum-Ei was important to the Guild.
I'm sorry to say your payment for the job will have to go to elsewhere since you feel like taking things in your own direction.
Now, did Gulum-Ei give up any information on our buyer?
Did Gulum-Ei give up any information on our buyer?
No, it.. it can't be. I haven't heard that name in decades.
This is grave news indeed, she's someone I hoped to never cross paths with again.
Karliah destroyed everything this Guild stood for. She murdered my predecessor in cold blood and betrayed the Guild.
After we discovered what she'd done, we spent months trying to track her down, but she just vanished.
Karliah and I were like partners. I went with her on every heist. We watched each other's backs.
I know her techniques, her skills. If she kills me, there'll be no one left that could possibly catch her.
If only we knew where she was...
There's only one place that could be. The place where she murdered Gallus... a ruin called Snow Veil Sanctum.
We have to go out there before she disappears again.
Yes, I'm going with you and together we're going to kill her.
Prepare yourself and meet me at the ruins as soon as you can. We can't let her slip through our fingers.
Yes, I'm going with you and together we're going to kill her.
Here's your payment for Solitude. Prepare yourself and meet me at the ruins as soon as you can. We can't let her slip through our fingers.
I have a long-standing arrangement with the Dark Brotherhood. If I need someone in the Guild taken care of, we do it ourselves.
We both agree it's best to keep these matters in house.
I'm sure you've already noticed the markings. They're quite unlike anything we've seen before.
Now, I'm not sure that you're quite as attuned as I am, given my extensive years of experience, but can you feel that?
Arch-Mage Aren is already hard at work, and hopefully we'll have more information soon.
I'm afraid I must intrude. It is urgent that I speak with your associate immediately.
Now, I...
This is most inappropriate! We are involved in serious research here!
Yes, I've no doubt of its gravity. This, however, is a matter that cannot wait.
Well, I'm quite sure I've never been interrupted like this before... the audacity!...
I suppose we'll continue this at some later time, when we can avoid interruptions.
I need you to come with me immediately. Let's go.
Really? Well, allow me to clarify the situation.
I'd like to know why there's someone claiming to be from the Psijic Order here in the College.
More importantly, I'd like to know why he's asking for you specifically.
So we're going to go have a little chat with him, and find out exactly what it is he wants.
Now, you are going to speak to this... Monk... and find out why he is here, and then he will be removed from College grounds.
Find out why he's here, and what he wants.
I'd simply like to talk to you.
The Augur? Really? Well, it's certainly not my place to say anything about it.
I think you'd better go see Mirabelle Ervine.
What? The Augur? Oh no, I'm quite sure that's... He's nothing I'm involved in. No, no.
Mirabelle Ervine... Or Tolfdir. They're qualified to discuss him. Not me, definitely not.
It's not enough that you've stolen the spotlight with this Eye thing, now you're looking for the Augur?
I'm not sure what you're playing at, but you'd do well to remember your place around here.
The Augur? Tragic story, really. At least, the way I heard it. But that was a long time ago.
It was some experiment gone horribly wrong. Ghastly results, I was told. And his ghost still roams the halls, they say.
Of course, on further reflection, that may have simply been an attempt to scare me. Hmm.
Perhaps I'll ask Tolfdir what really happened. I understand he was here at the time.
Oh, no. No, that won't do at all.
Not my problem. Not even a little. Take it to Tolfdir, he's supposed to be looking after you lot.
That's nothing you need to concern yourself with.
The what of what? No. No idea.
If it's important, maybe Tolfdir knows. He seems to know a lot.
Huh? That sounds ominous. Are you getting yourself into even more trouble?
Did you ask Mirabelle? She runs things around here, after all.
I've never heard of anything like that. Did you ask Tolfdir? He's been here a long time, and seems to know almost everything.
The what?
No. No, I'm quite sure I have no idea what you're talking about.
I suggest you mind your own business and return to whatever it is you do here.
Well now, there's a name I haven't heard in some time.
My goodness, it's been years since I've spoken with him. I suppose he's still down in the Midden, but I haven't checked.
Are you going to see him? Do tell him [QUOTE]hello[QUOTE] for me, won't you?
Has Tolfdir been telling stories again? I thought I made it quite clear that this was a subject inappropriate for conversation.
Please don't allow him to continue to discuss the subject.
I am that which you have been seeking.
Your efforts are in vain. It has already begun.
But those who have sent you have not told you what they seek. What you seek.
You shouldn't leave weapons laying around. Someone could get hurt. And if I see you do it again, that someone will be you.
Have I made myself clear?
See that it doesn't happen again.
No? Do you care about rotting away for a month in a cell?
Ah, but nobody wants that, right? Painful for you, annoying for me. So, you pay my fine... and you walk away.
See, that wasn't so difficult, was it.
Is that so? Well then, I'll have to charge you with disturbing the Jarl's peace.
Come on. Let's see what you're made of.
Get him!
Get her!
Twelve septims on the big one!
Fight! Fight!
Drive that snowback to the ground. Come on!
You just going to stand there and take it? Fight back.
Who taught you to fight? Keep those hands up!
Don't let him get away with this!
Don't let her get away with this!
Get him!
Get her!
Come on, he's not so tough.
Come on, she's not so tough.
You want a real fight, eh?
Master, look. It's the Phial.
What? How?
It doesn't matter. Look, it's refilling with your tonic as we speak.
Marvelous.
He is gone.
But thanks to you, he died knowing his life's work was not in vain.
As am I.
You acted very nobly in helping my master realize his life's work. Thank you for that.
As for myself, I've always been content to simply be an alchemist.
I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.
Here, keep it. You are as much a part of its legend now as Curalmil was. I hope it brings you the happiness that my master desired.
You assaulted one of my family members. I've come to accept your apology.
You! Fetcher! I should kill you for assaulting my family. But I will accept your apology...
You know who I am? You attacked one of my clan. I've come to accept your apology... or your death.
You! You hurt my family. I don't like when my family gets hurt. Say you're sorry. Or say goodbye.
You attacked one of my family. What do you have to say for yourself?
You can't attack my family and get away with it, fetcher! I will have an apology, or your head on a spike. Choose.
Dishonorable dog. You attacked one of my kin. So now you're going to apologize... or I'm going to lop off your head.
Here's the situation. You attacked my family. So now you're going to apologize.. or I'm going to kill you. I hope we understand each other...
I trust this is the last I'll hear of your violent outbursts.
Stay away from my family if you value your life.
Good. But know that further dishonor to my family will mean your death.
You stay away from my family. Or you die. Be smart. Stay away.
This had better be the last I hear of you disrespecting my family.
Mark these words carefully, fetcher. Stay away from my family, or I will paint the ground with your blood.
Any further dishonor done to my kin, and I'll put you in the ground.
That wasn't so hard, now was it.
Come again?
I am prepared to deal with your insolence...
Fine. Then it will be an honor to kill you for your offenses against my kin.
Are you out of your mind?
If you value your well being, you will offer an apology...
You should be.
You may care nothing of honor, but I do. I'm not leaving without an apology.
You sure you want it to come to this?
In your death may you find the honor you lacked in life.
What? You stupid or something?
Say you're sorry. Say it now.
That's it!
Really?
You're making a fatal mistake. Apologize, and you may yet live...
So be it.
I will not tolerate this offense against my kin.
Are you mad? Apologize, or I will gut you like a horker.
Then you are fool, and will die for it.
Honor may mean nothing to you, but it means much to me. Your apology, or your life.
Only your death or an apology will restore my family's honor. Last chance.
Then I guess we're done talking.
Perhaps I haven't made myself clear. Your best and least painful course of action is to apologize and promise to leave my family in peace.
No? You sure? 'Cause we're reaching the point of no return here...
Annnddd... Point of no return reached.
Hrrrmm.
Hadvar! We've been so worried about you! Come, you two must be hungry. Sit down and I'll get you something to eat.
Sigrid! We have company!
Now, then, boy. Helgen was destroyed? How did you get away?
Now, then, boy. What's the big mystery? What are you doing here, looking like you lost an argument with a cave bear?
I don't know where to start. You know I was assigned to General Tullius's guard.
We were stopped in Helgen when we were attacked... by a dragon.
When your friend told me, I didn't believe it at first either.
A dragon? That's... ridiculous. You aren't drunk, are you boy?
Mara's mercy! A dragon... in Helgen? Why, it could be here at any moment!
Husband. Let him tell his story.
Not much more to tell. This dragon flew over and just wrecked the whole place. Mass confusion.
I don't know if anyone else got out alive. I doubt I'd have made it out myself if not for my friend here.
I need to get back to Solitude and let them know what's happened.
I thought you could help us out. Food, supplies, a place to stay.
Of course! Any friend of Hadvar's is a friend of mine. I'm glad to help however I can.
