Hadvar, did you really see a dragon? What did it look like? Did it have big teeth?
Hush, child. Don't pester your cousin.
What'd you pick up there? Oh, I wish I saw that first. You're so lucky!
Hey, someone had to take it, right?
Lucky for you that was just sitting there for the taking.
Oh, wow! That was just sitting there? I wish I found it first.
Hope nobody misses that...
You just find that lying around? Must be your lucky day.
That was just lying around? Good find.
Good, you're finally here.
I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it... she won't be using it to escape.
Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
I'm sorry, I was under the impression I was in charge.
You're leading and I'm following. Does that seem clear to you?
Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade.
The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.
She was a stubborn Dunmer... always had to do everything her way.
But she was also the best... bringing in more coin a month than some thieves heist in a year.
Gallus trusted her too much and let her get too close.
If you want to call it that, yes. Me? I think she was softening him for the kill.
Gallus would call her his [QUOTE]little nightingale.[QUOTE] He was absolutely smitten by her.
Twenty-five years ago I was standing outside these very same ruins. Gallus told me to meet here but he wouldn't say why.
When I arrived, Gallus stepped from the shadows. Before he uttered a sound an arrow pierced his throat.
Before I could even draw my blade, her second arrow found its mark in my chest.
Karliah was a master marksman and her greatest weapon was the element of surprise. I was lucky... she missed my heart by mere inches.
I staggered away from the ruins and my vision began to blur. It's then that I realized the bitch had poisoned her arrows.
The last thing I saw was Karliah dumping his body into a opening atop the ruins; an unceremonious end for a remarkable man.
To this day I've regretted allowing her to escape, even if it meant I had died trying. I owed Gallus that much.
Greed? Jealousy? Spite? Who can say what drove her to such an iniquitous act.
One thing's certain. I intend to find out before she draws her last breath.
Who... who are you? What's going on?
Priest of Arkay. I'm your friend.
You're my... friend....
She is the Goddess of Dawn and Dusk. Azura sees into the Twilight of the future, and guides her followers through it.
Not here. We will meet at Reachcliff Cave.
Bring Verulus here. The Lady of Decay will do the rest.
Go ahead. Eat.
Soon, Namira's blessing will be yours.
We will sate the hunger together.
Don't fear the unknown, the hidden, the wretched.
I will feast on you!
Glory to Namira!
Glory to the repulsive!
Namira grind your bones for my bread!
I will drink your blood and feast on your flesh!
It's nice to be back in a friendly spot, huh?
Listen, I'm going to lay up here for a while. You can make your own way to Solitude from here.
I'd recommend heading to Whiterun, just down the road from here. From there you can take a carriage to Solitude.
I hope I'll see you in Solitude. Good luck.
Come on. I'll feel better once we're under cover in Riverwood.
I hope that dragon isn't still flying around here somewhere.
I still almost can't believe it... a real, live dragon...
What do you need?
Yeah? What is it?
Did you really see a dragon?
Make yourself at home.
Take what you need, my friend. Within reason, of course.
Uncle Alvor! Hello!
Hadvar, thank Talos! Your friend told me about Helgen...
Hadvar? What are you doing here? Are you on leave from...
Shor's bones, what happened to you, boy?
Are you in some kind of trouble?
Shh.. Uncle, please. Keep your voice down. I'm fine. But we should go inside to talk.
What's going on? And who's this?
He's a friend. Saved my life in fact. Come on, I'll explain everything, but we need to go inside.
She's a friend. Saved my life in fact. Come on, I'll explain everything, but we need to go inside.
Come on inside. Sigrid will get you something to eat and you can tell us what happened.
Okay, okay. Come inside, then. Sigrid will get you something to eat and you can tell me all about it.
Ah, there you are.
I've consulted my contacts regarding the information you recovered from Goldenglow Estate, but no one can identify that symbol.
I can't believe Gulum-Ei's mixed up in all this; that Argonian couldn't find his tail with both hands.
Don't get me wrong, he could scam a beggar out of his last septim... but he's no mastermind.
Trouble? He's one of the most stubborn lizards I've ever met! You have your work cut out for you.
No, no. Mercer wants him alive, for now.
Stubborn or not, he's the only contact we've got at the East Empire Company.
Just keep on his tail and he's bound to step into something he can't scrape off his boot.
Gulum-Ei works in the East Empire Company Warehouse. He helps maintain all of the shipments of goods that goes in and out of Solitude.
That means he has the pick of the litter from some of the finest goods to grace Skyrim's shores.
He isn't exactly in the Guild, but he pays us a cut of all the stuff he lifts from the warehouse.
There are thieves and then there is Gulum-Ei. No honor, no code at all. He'd shake your hand and stab you in the back at the same time.
The cut he's supposed to provide the Guild has dwindled as of late. He says pickings in the warehouse are slim, but I'm certain he's lying.
Keep your eyes on him, he's quite crafty.
Just head right back to the Guild and get the information to Mercer. Nothing else is more important.
If you discover Gulum-Ei's holding out on us and has more loot stashed away than he claims, we'd find that information quite valuable as well.
A mercantile group that has established ports all over Tamriel. They pretty much dominate the whole shipping industry.
The Emperor himself supposedly backs them, which means they have fairly unlimited resources... so don't get their feathers in a ruffle.
So, what do we have here? Hmm. Let me guess.
By your scent, I'd say you were from the Guild. But that can't be true, because I told Mercer I wouldn't deal with them anymore.
Oh, wait... did you say Goldenglow Estate? My apologies.
I'm sorry to say I know very little about that... bee farm, was it?
Maybe I did, maybe I didn't. I can't be expected to remember every deal I handle.
This... it matches every description of the Phial that I've found in lore. But if it can't hold liquid, there's no way of knowing.
How did you manage to damage it, then? This is what I get for not retrieving it myself.
Thank the gods. I'll get to work on the Phial straight away.
Even though the Phial was damaged, I still think your efforts deserve reward.
Now, if you'll pardon me, I'm going to tend to Nurelion. I can make his final days a bit less painful.
Find the three vessels within Valthume, then return to me. With these we can defeat him.
In life, Hevnoraak drained his own blood from his body. His goal was to transfer his power back into himself after death, becoming a powerful lich.
The vessels contain that very blood. Empty them and you remove any chance he has of regaining his former powers.
More dangerous than you know. Left alone, however, he will awaken when he has grown too powerful to be stopped. This is the only way to be sure.
Very well. Empty the vessels into the sconce near the throne, then sit in the throne.
When you have done so, I will unbind Hevnoraak. He will awaken in a weakened state, but the lich is still to be reckoned with. Be ready.
Yes, old friend, I'm afraid it's not good news.
When you broke up the binding Potema escaped. We've encountered some of her minions.
Styrr says she's still in spirit form or we'd all be dead already.
You've already done us a service in stopping the binding, but I need you to go talk to him, to see if Styrr can tell us what to do next.
That'll teach you to break the law on my watch.
I thought it was finally going to be a quiet day.
You really thought you could get away with it?
Don't get any bright ideas.
Stop, in the name of the Jarl!
Come quietly or taste the Jarl's justice!
By order of the Jarl, I command you to halt!
Sheathe your weapons and come quietly!
Halt, outlander!
Surrender or die, outlander!
Clanfolk, stop the outlander!
Hold, there!
Lay down your weapons!
We are ready to mount our final attack.
Infos conditioned on Attack Delta go here.
Join the forces mustering outside of [CAPITAL]. (Infos conditioned on Capital location go here)
The attack will be launched imminently. Gather your weaponry and get to the front lines... Now, soldier!
Sometimes we like to remind a city that we mean business, so we hit it hard. Just steal whatever we can until we've made an impression.
Simple right? Almost. The catch is it doesn't count if anyone sees you take it. The message needs to be clear; we work in the shadows.
Steal from anywhere in the hold, and you even get to keep everythin' you stole. So, you in?
I always have bedlam jobs. Just remember to hit them fast and don't let them see you. Feel like going for it?
Of course. Don't forget to keep out of sight, it doesn't count if they catch you red-handed. You ready?
Taking an easy job, eh? Well, go and do some damage. Just stick to the shadows and keep out of sight. Want to go for it?
I'm sorry to be such a bother. We'll talk another time.
Is that so? You ought to join the Stormcloaks, if you haven't already.
Seems to me they're a bunch of narrow-minded bigots, just like you.
Meantime, you best steer clear of me.
Good. Too many Nords in this town have been listening to Ulfric's narrow-minded words.
He's tough, loyal to his men and a good leader, but if you're not a Nord, Ulfric will never trust you.
That's just what Ulfric wants you to think.
If that's what you really believe, then you're a fool. Never had much patience for fools, myself.
And you're right, at least as far as I'm concerned.
Don't let Ulfric or some of these other short-sighted Nords bother you. Most of us are happy to welcome newcomers.
If I make it back to Solitude, I'll put in a good word for you with General Tullius.
The Legion could sure use someone like you. Good luck.
You one of those [QUOTE]Skyrim for the Nords[QUOTE] types?
I killed a lot of High Elves in the Great War, and I didn't die. I guess that makes me a war hero.
The [QUOTE]Great War[QUOTE]... there was nothing great about it. Thousands died on both sides, and where did it get us?
Did we really save the Empire? Or did we just plant the seeds for Ulfric's uprising, and another war?
Help the Dark Elves? Oh, you must have heard me talking to Malthyr.
The Dark Elves live in a run-down slum called the Gray Quarter. Ulfric's content to keep it that way.
I guess they think I can open Ulfric's eyes to their plight, and get him to lift a finger on their behalf.
I'm trying, but Ulfric is set in his ways. For him, there's two kinds of people in this world -- Nords, and the folk beneath them.
I don't appreciate loiterers, if that's what you're here to do.
I hope you have coin to spend, and you're not just here to gawk at my goods.
Have a look around. I buy and sell just about anything.
I'm always happy to see a customer, but I won't deal in stolen goods. That's trouble I don't need.
Make yourself at home, please. Let me know if I can be of any assistance.
Fresh fruit and vegetables for sale!
Fruits and vegetables, all ripe and ready for your table!
Take home Windhelm's finest and freshest produce today!
Assorted fruits and vegetables, all delicious and affordable!
Come and browse my fine selection! Everything's fresh and delicious!
I've a little of everything for sale, come and see for yourself!
Cookware, knives and other goods for the home, all at reasonable prices!
Assorted wares and tools you just can't live without! Come and see for yourself!
Buying and selling a wide range of assorted goods! The best selection in Windhelm!
Go back to Morrowind, Dark Elf maggots! You're not welcome here!
Get out of our city, gray-skins! This is Nord land!
We don't want your kind here, dark elves!
This place reeks of gray-skin filth!
You like living in this filthy slum, dark elves? Maybe you should go back to Morrowind, where you belong!
Spare a coin for a poor old woman?
A few septims for my supper is all I ask.
I ask only for a little charity.
Will you spare a few coins to help someone who's got nothing?
I ain't askin' for much, just a few septims.
The Divines smile on those who show mercy an' charity.
A few septims ain't nothing. You can spare that, can't you?
Hear my prayer, son of Akatosh, and grant peace to these departed souls.
Lord of Seasons, I pray to you now that you might watch over the dead with mercy and kindness.
Mighty Arkay, God of Mortals, hear now the prayers of your humble servant. Bless these departed souls and welcome them into the realms beyond.
Mighty Arkay, I pray that you will shepherd these souls as they pass into the realm of death.
Feast your eyes on my strange and wondrous collection of curiosities.
For a few septims, I'll give you a brief tour that includes some of my most unusual items.
The objects you see here might look mundane at first glance, but I assure you, behind each is an unusual tale.
Windhelm is divided into four quarters. The Gray Quarter is the one that's home to all the city's Dark Elves.
If it looks to you like an impoverished slum, that's because it is. Ulfric prefers that we live in squalor.
He has nothing but disdain for anyone who isn't a Nord. He tolerates us, but that's the extent of his hospitality.
Not a day goes by that I don't think about returning to the ancestral home of my people.
Still, even with the rough treatment we've had at the hands of Ulfric and his lot, I've got ties here.
It's probably more trouble to pack up and leave than it is to stay. Besides, Ambarys can't run the cornerclub on his own.
Care to take a look around? This is not, I dare say, the Solitude botanical gardens. Have you any idea where you are? Where you truly are?
Welcome to the deceptively verdant mind of the Emperor Pelagius III. That's right! You're in the head of a dead, homicidally insane monarch.
Now, I know what you're thinking. Can I still rely on my swords and spells and sneaking and all that nonsense? Sure, sure. Or... you could use...
The Wabbajack! Huh? Huh? Didn't see that coming, did you?
Pelagius Septim the Third, once the Mad Emperor of Tamriel, now so boringly sane. I always knew he had it in him!
Well, I suppose it's back to the Shivering Isles. The trouble Haskill can get into while I'm gone simply boggles the mind...
Let's make sure I'm not forgetting anything. Clothes? Check. Beard? Check! Luggage?
Luggage! Now where did I leave my luggage?
Master! You've taken me back! Does this mean we're going home? Oh, happy times! I can't wait to...
Yes, yes, that's quite enough celebration. Let's send you ahead, shall we?
And as for you, my little mortal minion... Feel free to keep the Wabbajack. As a symbol of my... Oh, just take the damn thing.
You take care of yourself, now. And if you ever find yourself in New Sheoth, do look me up. We can share a strawberry torte. Ta ta!
Our daughter. Our little girl. She hadn't seen her tenth winter.
She was... he ripped her apart. Like a sabre cat tears a deer. We barely found enough of her to bury.
Sinding. Came through as a laborer. Seemed like a decent man.
He's stewing in the pit while we figure out what to do with him, if you've got the stomach to look at him.
What could drive a man to do something like this?
This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations.
Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it.
I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times.
Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway.
I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons.
I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame.
That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control.
Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore.
Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin.
Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.
I had just come into Falkreath. They needed some help working the mill, and I thought that would be something safe. Something I could do.
When I saw the little girl, I was just... I could feel it coming on. I could taste the... I needed to hunt.
But this pitiful, limited body wasn't meant for hunting. Slow. No claws. Weak, mashing teeth for chewing cud.
I held in my rage as long as I could. But it boiled inside of me.
She looked so fragile. Helpless prey. And then...
I... I feel terrible about what happened. About what I did. It would probably be best for everyone if I just went away.
At least you remembered one of the things I asked. Let me see that.
Let me take a look at what you found.
The Companions? In Jorrvaskr? They're recruiting new members, from what I hear.
It's too bad they executed Roggvir before we got here.
They say Helgen got hit by a dragon. One of those horrors comes here, we'll be ready.
Brigands I can handle, but this talk of dragons? World's gone mad, I say.
The Greybeards have summoned the Dragonborn to High Hrothgar. Such a thing has not happened for... hundreds of years.
There was a fight down in the Ratway, but reports are... sketchy. Some say it was Thalmor Agents, others say Thieves Guild. Some say it was both.
Word is Elenwen's furious. Big party at the Thalmor Embassy, and one of the guests went someplace they shouldn't. Caused quite a commotion.
Have you heard? There's been another dragon attack. Kynesgrove, this time.
What could it mean? The return of the Dragonborn? And who among us could possibly hold that honor? And such power?
By the gods, it's true, isn't it? A dragon has attacked Whiterun. How could mere men bring down such a beast?
By Ysmir, you did it. You killed a dragon.
There's been talk amongst the guards. That you are... Dragonborn. But such a thing... Surely that's not possible...
The guards in Dragonsreach say you've aided the Jarl. On behalf of Whiterun, I thank you.
I've seen you helping the Jarl. If only all visitors to Whiterun were as noble.
It was you convinced the Jarl to trap that dragon in the keep. And by Ysmir, it actually worked.
There's a dragon. Here. In Dragonsreach. And I thought it was just a name.
We had that beast contained. And you released it! Why? Why would you do such a thing?
Is it true what they say? There was a dragon held captive in Whiterun, and you... you released it? By the gods, man, why?
Is it true what they say? There was a dragon held captive in Whiterun, and you... you released it? By the gods, woman, why?
The Greybeards have arranged a truce between the Stormcloaks and Imperials. How long can such a thing last?
The Greybeards have called a peace council, at High Hrothgar. And can you believe it - both Ulfric Stormcloak and General Tullius have agreed to go.
Word is spreading like magefire! The great evil has been vanquished! You have truly saved us all!
All hail the Dragonborn!
In the ancient tongue, you are Dovahkiin - Dragonborn!
You! You're the one who wiped out the Dark Brotherhood! All the guards are talking about it... You're a hero to us all!
You hear the news? The Emperor has been murdered! Right here, in Skyrim. By the gods, if the Dark Brotherhood can do that, nobody's safe...
By the gods. The Emperor's been murdered. On his own ship... moored in the inlet. It was... the Dark Brotherhood. There was nothing we could do...
That old woman who runs the orphanage has been murdered. Say, didn't I see you coming out of there...?
Been a murder, over in Riften. Some old lady who runs an orphanage. Those poor children must be heartbroken.
Hey! You're the one who killed Alain Dufont, up in Raldbthar. Oh yeah, word about that got around. Man was a piece of bandit trash, is what I hear.
The Emperor's cousin, killed. Right here in Solitude. I feel nothing but shame...
The cousin of the Emperor was murdered! In Solitude, at her own damn wedding. Not a chance we would have let that happen here.
You didn't hear this from me, but we've uncovered a plot to kill the Emperor! It gets better. The ringleader? One of the Emperor's own elite guard...
There was some ruckus over by that weird black door. You weren't involved in that craziness, were you?
Been lots of people coming and going through that creepy black door. And noises...  I'd say it sounds like construction, but that's crazy. Right?
There are some that say the Dark Brotherhood is back, and stronger than ever. That they've made Dawnstar their home. Tell me - am I wrong?
The guards have been saying things about you... That you're the one that... Well... They say the Dark Brotherhood... Well. Never mind. Sir.
The guards have been saying things about you... That you're the one that... Well... They say the Dark Brotherhood... Well. Never mind. Ma'am.
Wait, I know you. You went into the Emperor's Tower, just before... before his decoy was murdered...
We just received word that somebody tried to kill the Emperor! Turned out to just be his double, but can you imagine if he had succeeded?
They're saying the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed. Wiped off the face off Tamriel. But that's not entirely true... is it?
You're the one all the guards are talking about. You went into that Sanctuary... wiped out the Dark Brotherhood! Friend, I owe you a drink.
The city's changed, friend. The Thieves Guild is on the rise... and they've got a firm foothold here in Whiterun.
Maybe you haven't heard, but the Thieves Guild is back. Windhelm is their city now, if you catch my meaning...
Markarth's a different place, now. Do business here, and you do business with the Thieves Guild.
A change has swept into Solitude, like a breeze off the ocean - the Thieves Guild has come...
Ain't no doubt about it. The Thieves Guild is back, and they've got Riften in their grip.
Welcome to Riften, home of the Thieves Guild. Or so they'd have you believe. It's all lies. They're just thugs... vermin, creeping around the Ratway.
The say the College has been snooping around Saarthal. Mages in a burial crypt. No good can come of that...
Some are saying the Psijic Monks have been seen in Skyrim. They're an ancient order. I had 'em figured for dead.
You hear the news? Those damn mages blew up Winterhold! Guess it was just a matter of time...
Word is the College of Mages is back to normal. If there's such a thing for that lot.
Your name's been cleared... by Thonar Silver-Blood. Consider yourself lucky.
So Madanach was behind those murders. Gods help us.
By Shor, is that... is that Azura's Star? How did you come to possess such a rare treasure?
Who did you have to kill to get that blade?
That is one... big hammer.
That mace... get it away from me. Get it away...
Your shield... Dwarf-make, is it not? But yet it seems so much... more.
That hammer... Why that's Aegisbane, heirloom of Clan Shatter-Shield! Last I heard, it was stolen by a couple of swindlers. Alain and... Muiri. Yeah.
What a foul and unnatural weapon you wield. Never have I seen its like.
Ugh. Your breath is foul. What've you been eating?
As if Skyrim didn't have enough outsiders. Now we've got mercenaries from Hammerfell struttin' about...
From what I hear, you're the one gave the Thalmor a black eye. Sure know how to pick your enemies, don't you?
You've come to Dawnstar at a strange time, friend. Seems everyone in the town is having nightmares...
The damned nightmares have finally stopped. Don't suppose you'd know anything about that?
You've been seen in the company of the Companions. That's an honorable path you're on, friend.
I know of your deeds, and am honored to address a member of the Companions.
Uch. Been tending your hounds? You smell like wet dog.
Heard about what you did. Killing those foul witches. Well done, Companion.
Kodlak killed, Jorrvaskr attacked. How could this happen, within the walls of Whiterun?
I heard about the attack on Jorrvaskr, and the killing of your honored leader. You have my sympathies, Companion.
Kodlak White-Mane has been laid to rest, I know. May his soul live forever in the halls of Sovngarde.
You... you're the Harbinger. Of the Companions. It is my honor to stand before you.
I hear the East Empire Company has reopened, thanks in no small part to you. Well done. All of Skyrim benefits from their trade.
You did this city a great service by catching that killer. Well done.
Good thing you did for Nurelion, retrieving that phial for him before he died. Man was obsessed.
By Ysmir, you've helped save the Gildergreen. Words can't express what that means to this city.
That sapling you recovered means the Gildergreen will live again. Your deed honors the people of Whiterun.
You've actually done it. You've found the Sybil of Dibella. You have done Markarth a tremendous service.
You... you were talking to that murderous savage. And then he escaped. What are you hiding?
First Torygg and now Elisif. Damn those Stormcloaks. Let's hope that Erikur fares better than they did.
Filthy she-hound Elisif got what she deserved. Let her serve as [QUOTE]High Queen[QUOTE] of Oblivion, for all I care.
Solitude wouldn't be the same without the Fire Festival. City owes you a debt of gratitude.
It's no secret the Aretino boy is doing some ritual, trying to call the Dark Brotherhood. But who's going to stop him? Me? I'll have no part of that.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Watch the magic!
Go cast your fancy magic someplace else.
Guard might get nervous, a man approaches with his weapon drawn...
Guard might get nervous, a woman approaches with her weapon drawn...
Sheathe those claws, Khajiit...
You come up to me, fists raised? You looking for a beating?
Releasing a captured dragon. I don't think I'll ever understand that one...
Whatever you need, Dragonborn. Just say the word.
Yes, Dovahkiin? How can I help you?
You have vanquished a great evil from Skyrim. You have saved this land... and our very souls.
No matter what else happens, the guards will always be grateful for everything you've done.
Looks like it's really happening. A peace council, attended by both Ulfric and Tullius, up on High Hrothgar. Maybe there's hope for Skyrim yet.
This truce with the Stormcloaks won't last a fortnight. Bloody savages will kill us while we sleep.
A truce? With the Imperials? They'll murder us all, first chance they get.
I caught a glimpse of that captured dragon. It's.. beautiful. In its own way.
Trapping a dragon in Dragonsreach. Damn clever idea you had, I have to admit.
You have the Jarl's confidence, friend. And so you have mine.
You couldn't possibly be the Dragonborn of legend. Could you?
If we killed a dragon once, we can do it again. With your help, of course.
If those Whiterun guards can take down a dragon, so can we.
Got to thinking, maybe I'm the Dragonborn, and I just don't know it yet.
For a dragon to attack Kynesgrove... Why? Why there? Is no place safe?
If I'd been on guard at the Thalmor Embassy, wouldn't nobody be disturbing that party...
Thalmor in the Ratway? What's next, Spriggans in the Bee and Barb?
I have to wonder... what does the Dragonborn do once he's summoned by the Greybeards? Can the Thu'um be taught, like any skill?
You know, I could have gone into that Sanctuary. Killed all those Dark Brotherhood types. But I was... sick that day.
Helgen... destroyed by a dragon. Hard to believe, isn't it?
I know who you are, assassin. I guess the rumors about your kind's [QUOTE]extinction[QUOTE] have been... exaggerated.
So the Emperor had a decoy. Poor bastard got murdered, too. But then, I guess that was his job...
Now, I know who you are. And... and I know your business... Just, please... These are good folk we got here. Mostly...
It ain't true what they say about you and... and the Dark Brotherhood? Is it?
There are stories about you, and dark tidings in Dawnstar...
Seems the Emperor's coming to Skyrim... and one of his own protectors was going to have him assassinated. Can't trust anyone these days.
I heard you were at the wedding of the Emperor's cousin. In Solitude? Gods, that must have been horrible...
I heard you were at the wedding of the Emperor's cousin. In Solitude? Gods, that must have been horrible...
Look, that Vici woman had a bodyguard. I know it's terrible she got murdered at her own wedding, but the city guard is hardly to blame...
You ask me, those brats in the orphanage are better off, now that old Grelod is dead.
The Emperor's cousin Vittoria Vici is getting married soon. The reception will be public - anyone in Solitude can attend.
The Emperor of Skyrim. Dead. These are dark times, my friend. Dark times, indeed...
We may guard Whiterun, but the Thieves Guild guards us. If you know what I mean.
Shirking the law in Windhelm ain't what it used to be. Not with the Thieves Guild running things...
Break the law here in Markarth, and maybe we can work something out. Courtesy of the Thieves Guild.
You know, the law here in Solitude can be a bit... [QUOTE]flexible.[QUOTE] So long as you've got the gold. That's the way the Thieves Guild likes it.
Seeing as how Riften is home to the Thieves Guild, maybe we can work something out if you have trouble with the law. For the right price.
The Thieves Guild used to run this city. Now they're nothing but braggarts and bullies, rotting to death down in their Ratway...
What business do College mages have in a place like Saarthal, anyway? It's a place for Nord dead... not your weird experiments.
One of the guards said he saw a mage appear out of thin air. Claimed it was one of those Psijic Monks. Man's been hitting the skooma, I say.
Imagine, blowing up an entire town. Damn College... Winterhold will never be the same.
You're that Mage from the College. Right? Hear things have finally calmed down over there.
You put those Forsworn down. Good job.
Gods damn those Forsworn. So many dead...
You see those warriors from Hammerfell? They've got curved swords. Curved. Swords.
Wonder what it's like for those Thalmor, now that they've been taken down a notch...
The people here are still plagued with nightmares. It's... unnatural.
No more nightmares. Thank the gods for that.
Now I remember - you're that new member of the Companions. So you, what - fetch the mead?
Honored Companion. How can I assist you?
Is that... fur? Coming out of your ears?
I'm telling you, I heard it. Howling. Those werewolf tales are true.
I find your wolfish grin... unsettling.
With respect, Companion, I'd ask that you and your friends muzzle that dog of yours. The howling coming from Jorrvaskr has gotten out of hand.
If it isn't the slayer of the Glenmoril Witches. How can I assist you, Companion?
Who would dare attack the leader of the Companions? In his own hall? There'll be blood for this, I know it.
Kodlak White-Mane is in a better place now. For is there any place better than Sovngarde?
Thanks again for helping reopen the East Empire Company. Gonna have them import me some of that aged Breton cheese.
I was this close to catching that killer. I swear it.
With Nurelion gone, I suppose Quintus has taken over business in the White Phial.
The Gildergreen blooms again. All thanks to you.
The Gildergreen will bloom again. All thanks to you.
Thanks for clearing out that vampire nest. You saved Morthal.
Wonder what kinds of things they've got the Dibella doing, over in the temple. Mostly praying, I reckon...
I know you had some part in Sinding's escape. Don't deny it...
We'll protect Erikur as best we're able, but I fear the throne of Solitude is cursed.
It is whispered that one of the Daedric Princes himself is behind the murder of Elisif. It would seem even the nobility of Oblivion favors our cause.
Watch the skies, traveler.
Stay out of trouble, Argonian.
What is it, Argonian?
Stay out of trouble, lizard.
Staying out of trouble, kinsman?
How can I help a brother Nord?
Stay out of trouble, Nord.
Don't cross me, Elf.
Stay out of trouble, Elf.
What is it, Elf?
Stay out of trouble, Khajiit.
What is it, Khajiit?
What do you want... cat?
Stay out of trouble, Redguard.
What is it, Redguard?
Stay out of trouble, Imperial.
What is it, Imperial?
Stay out of trouble, Orc.
What is it, Orc?
Hail, Companion.
You're that one from the College. Heard about you.
So you can cast a few spells. Am I supposed to be impressed?
Try to hide it all you want. I know you're in the Thieves Guild... and so do the other guards.
Psst. Hey, I know who you are. Hail Sithis.
Ugh. That armor stinks of death. You been grave robbing?
Ah, now that's a fine shield. And not mere Dwarven... is it?
What manner of staff is that? Such a horror...
You wield... Azura's Star? How... how can such a thing be possible?
Ah, Aegisbane. Sigil of Clan Shatter-Shield. But didn't that get stolen awhile back? Hmph. Must be rememberin' wrong.
Fine armor you've got there. Dwarven make, am I right?
Ebony armor. By Ysmir, 'tis a wondrous sight.
Is your armor made of... dragon bones? By the gods, what I wouldn't do for a set of that.
Is your armor made of... dragon scales? By the gods, what I wouldn't do for a set of that.
Some advice, friend. That armor won't offer much protection in a real fight.
You come talking to me wearing Imperial armor? You got stew for brains?
That's some fine Imperial armor you've got there.
Judging by your armor, I'd say you're an Imperial scout. If so, well met.
For your sake, I hope your took that armor from a dead Imperial scout...
You wear the armor of a mercenary. Now that's the life.
That's good armor you've got there, friend. Iron, solid and true.
Hmph. You wear that armor well. Iron may be simple, but it'll stop enough to keep you in the fight.
Fancy the leather armor, huh? Something to be said for going light.
That armor... it's like nothing I've ever seen. Like forged midnight...
Orcish armor, hmm? Had me a set of that once. Ugly and strong, like those that forged it.
That armor... Are you one of the Emperor's protectors? Can't say I envy you that job.
That armor... Are you one of the Emperor's protectors? Not very good at your job, are you?
That's fine scale armor you've got on there. Shiny.
Aye, now that's some fine armor. Good old-fashioned steel.
Ah, steel plate. Now that's a solid choice of armor.
What do you aim to do with that hammer, friend? Knock down a house?
No.. get that accursed mace away from me...
You wear the armor of the bear, my friend. A fine choice.
You dare strut around here, wearing that filthy Stormcloak hide?
That Stormcloak armor's getting on my nerves...
You wear that Stormcloak armor well, friend.
You wear the armor of a brigand. Best not cause any trouble on my watch.
I know Thieves Guild armor when I see it. You're not fooling anyone.
You wear the garb of a true Nord. I salute you.
Pigsticker like that's not going to get you far. Best visit the blacksmith.
That iron sword's pretty undependable. You should try steel.
Iron sword, huh? What are you killing, butterflies?
Aye, now that there's a beautiful sword. Like a sliver of midnight.
Why the Elven blade, hmm? Nord steel not good enough for you?
Favor a steel sword, do ya? Good choice for slashing or stabbing.
I've a lot of respect for the Restoration School. Skyrim could use more healers.
Lightly armored means light on your feet. Smart.
Hey, you mix potions, right? Can you brew me an ale?
Hands to yourself, sneak thief.
I find your hand in my pocket, I'm going to cut it off.
I know your kind, always sneaking about.
Go fiddling with any locks around here, we're going to have a real problem.
Fancy yourself an alchemist, hmm? Never could get the hang of that.
You're the one casts those illusions. Impressive.
Don't think you can barter with me like I'm one of those damned shopkeepers.
Best offense is a good defense, am I right?
Don't suppose you'd enchant my sword? Dull old blade can barely cut butter.
Heard about you and your honeyed words...
Hail, summoner. Conjure me up a warm bed, would you?
Destruction magic's fine, just don't go burning down any buildings.
Takes a fair bit of strength to carry a greatsword like that. But can you use it?
Keep your arrows in their quiver, archer.
Favor the bow, eh? I'm a sword man, myself.
The gods gave you two hands, and you use them both for your weapon. I can respect that.
You're like me, eh? Don't fancy those clunky two-handed weapons.
No lollygaggin'.
I heard the Gourmet is hiding out somewhere in Skyrim. You know, fella who wrote that cookbook.
We got a nickname for anyone who trifles with us guards here in Windhelm - [QUOTE]Suicide.[QUOTE]
Citizen.
I fear the night. Because the werewolves and vampires don't.
Bit late to be wandering around, isn't it?
Only burglars and vampires creep around after dark. So which are you?
You hear that? I swear, there's something out there. In the dark.
Let me guess - someone stole your sweetroll...
Could sure use a warm bed right about now...
I'd be a lot warmer and a lot happier with a bellyful of mead...
Just a few more hours and I can crawl under some furs...
Disrespect the law, and you disrespect me.
Thinking of settling in? There's a house for sale - Breezehome. You should talk to the steward up in the keep if you're interested.
You're that one lives in Breezehome, right? Fine place. Almost bought it myself.
Hjerim is a fine house, and it's up for sale. You should talk to the steward in the keep if you're interested.
Don't think you'll get special treatment just because you have a house in the city...
My heart goes out to Clan Shatter-Shield. Kin murdered, family warhammer stolen... There's no fairness in all that.
Proudspire Manor, now there's a fine home. Up for sale, too. If you're interested, talk to the steward, in the keep.
You own Proudspire Manor, hmm? Beautiful house. At least from the outside.
If you're looking to settle in Riften, there's a house for sale - Honeyside. See the steward in the keep if you want it.
Smart thing you did, buying Honeyside. Nice place, and why pay for an inn?
Ah, Vlindrel Hall's a fine home, if you can afford it. The steward in the keep can tell you more.
So you bought Vlindrel Hall, eh? Wish I could afford a house that nice.
They say Ulfric Stormcloak murdered the High King... with his voice! Shouted him apart!
What is it? Dragons?
My cousin's out fighting dragons, and what do I get? Guard duty.
Gotta keep my eyes open. Damned dragons could swoop down at any time.
I used to be an adventurer like you. Then I took an arrow in the knee...
Everything all right?
Trouble?
Staying safe, I hope?
I mostly deal with petty thievery and drunken brawls. Been too long since we've had a good bandit raid.
The Imperials think we need their laws. Pfft.
The Imperials think us all lawless beasts. I'm proof of their ignorance.
Tis a wicked axe you wield there, friend. That blade looks sharp enough to cut through a god.
You're the one saved the Fire Festival. I remember.
What do you need, bard?
Is it?
Ha! I do love it when the mortals know they're being manipulated. Makes things infinitely more interesting.
Were you now?
By whom?
Wait! Don't tell me! I want to guess!
Was it Molag? No, no... Little Tim, the toymaker's son? The ghost of King Lysandus? Or was it... Yes! Stanley, that talking grapefruit from Passwall.
Wrong on all accounts, aren't I?
Ha! No matter! Honestly, I don't want to know. Why ruin the surprise?
But more to the point. Do you - tiny, puny, expendable little mortal - actually think you can convince me to leave?
Because that's... crazy. You do realize who you're dealing with here?
Oh, you just don't understand. Without him, I am not free! Without him, I am doomed! All of his empire shall fall into chaos...
He stays in the Pelagius Wing of the Blue Palace. The doors are locked, and only Falk Firebeard can grant entry.
But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?
Yes, yes, go. Leave me to my ceaseless responsibilities and burdens...
Yes, but don't try to use force! He's far too mighty. He'd crush you like a clay doll, or drop you from the sky, or simply eat your brain right up!
Oh, but he probably won't do those things to you. Probably. Just remind him to come home, and... there'll be no fighting or unpleasantness. Probably.
He's just a little confused at the moment, is all. Knowing my master, he may very well reward you for bringing him to his senses!
Oh, no no no! No mistake at all. What you made was a choice. Granted, not a very wise choice, but these things happen. Ah, the folly of youth...
You know, you remind me of myself at a young age. All I cared about was riding narwhales and sleeping in honeycombs and drinking babies' tears...
Word of advice if you ride a Narwhale. Mind the pointy end.
Ah, but there I go, waxing poetic about my misspent youth. Now where were we? Ah yes. You're the mortal messenger. An I am...?
Honestly. Have you any idea?
Now that's the real question, isn't it? Because honestly, how much time off could a demented Daedra really need?
So here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to leave. That's right. I'm done. Holiday... complete. Time to return to the hum drum day-to-day.
On one condition.
You have to find the way out first. Good luck with that.
Wrong!
Actually, you do. Sort of.
I am a part of you, little mortal. I am a shadow in your subconscious, a blemish on your fragile little psyche. You know me. You just don't know it.
Sheogorath, Daedric Prince of Madness. At your service.
Yaaawwwwnn....
Oh, pardon me. Were you saying something? I do apologize, it's just that I find myself suddenly and irrevocably...
Bored!
I mean, really. Here you stand, before Sheogorath himself, Daedric Prince of Madness, and all you deem fit to do is... deliver a message? How sad.
Jolly good guess!
But only half right. I'm a mad god. The Mad God, actually. It's a family title. Gets passed down from me to myself every few thousand years.
Now you. You can call me Ann Marie.
But only if you're partial to being flayed alive and having an angry immortal skip rope with your entrails.
If not... Then call me Sheogorath, Daedric Prince of Madness. Charmed.
So you're the one that burned down Goldenglow Estate.
Do you have any idea what that little stunt you pulled is going to cost me?
I'm amazed you even bothered to show your face here.
So, you're the one. Hmm. You don't look so impressive.
You're a firebrand, aren't you?
It's about time Brynjolf sent me someone with business sense. I was beginning to think he was running some sort of beggar's guild over there.
I'm going to keep this short 'cause we've got a lot to do.
Honningbrew's owner, Sabjorn, is about to hold a tasting for Whiterun's Captain of the Guard and we're going to poison the mead.
What are you gawking at? Can't you see I have problems here?
I warned you not to cross Maven. If I hadn't stepped in and paid amends, you'd be... well, I think you know.
At least Sabjorn has found himself in Whiterun's prison. How unfortunate for him.
Word on the street is that poor Sabjorn has found himself in Whiterun's prison. How unfortunate for him.
Mercer thinks he knows a way to identify this new thorn in our side. He wants to meet with you right away.
And if I were you I'd hurry. I've never seen him this angry before.
You needed to know more?
You again? We have nothing else to discuss. Now move.
You again? We have nothing else to discuss. Now move.
Why are you following me? I told you, I don't know anything else!
Look, I've told you everything. Now leave me alone!
Our business has concluded and you're standing in my way.
Ah, I see you have the wine. Hand it over and we'll talk.
No Firebrand Wine yet? How disappointing.
Hmmm, you again. What is it this time?
What did you need?
Aringoth was a fool to think he could get away with this.
No time for idle chatter. Mercer is awaiting your presence.
Well, well. And you seem to be in one piece!
Thank you. I'll look these over, and inform Mirabelle if I find anything relevant.
[QUOTE]Night of Tears[QUOTE], eh? I remember this one. Well, isn't that interesting.
Did you read it yourself? If I recall it correctly, that has some interesting implications. You should mention that to Tolfdir.
And... here. I suppose you've earned these.
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind.
Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against south! The holy flame flickers and dies! We need his return.
Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the Jarl. No, no... such people are below him.
No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea.
Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius' Wing without that.
He is a great man, but one rarely praised! He rules twin empires that span the length and breadth of our minds! All know him, but few can name him!
But... he has forbidden me from saying his name. He says it distracts him, and woe to those who draw his ire.
But you will know him when you see him. He's the one who made me like this!
I'll make an exception for you, but do not bring anything out when you leave. Too many dark deeds transpired in those halls...
Well... I suppose in that case, it's okay to let you in. But only briefly. Be careful, and come right back!
If you really want to... Just be careful of the ghost! He snuck up on me once and scared me sick. It took a week for me to feel better...
How rude! Can't be bothered to host an old friend for a decade or two.
I have a saying - I'm not going to feel what you have to like. Or something like that.
Is it just me or is it getting saner and saner these days?
Pelagius stopped by and mentioned he hated you. Or I mentioned he hated you and he agreed.
I hope you're having a good time. Actually, I hope I'm having a good time. I could care less about you.
I see you've been minding your own business. So how is the mind business?
Do you mind? I'm busy doing the fishstick. It's a very delicate state of mind!
Please, take pity on an old madman!
Who among you can help me?
Wait, hear my plea! My master, he is lost between worlds and I cannot bring him back!
Why does everyone ignore me? Why do you turn your heads? Why will no one help me?
The flame of my master burns low. Without him, we are all lost and forever gray... Please, help us!
More tea, Pelly my dear?
Oh, I couldn't. Goes right through me. Besides, I have so many things to do...
So many undesirables to contend with. Naysayers. Buffoons. Detractors. Why, my headsman hasn't slept in three days!
You are far too hard on yourself, my dear, sweet, homicidally insane Pelagius. What would the people do without you? Dance? Sing? Smile? Grow old?
You are the best Septim that's ever ruled. Well, except for that Martin fellow, but he turned into a dragon god, and that's hardly sporting...
Yes, yes, as you've said, countless times before...
Hafrumph! Well then, if you're going to be like that... Perhaps it's best I take my leave. A good day to you sir. I said good day!
Reeaaaallllyyyy?
Ooh, ooh, what kind of message? A song? A summons? Wait, I know! A death threat written on the back of an Argonian concubine! Those are my favorite.
Well? Spit it out, mortal. I haven't got an eternity!
Actually... I do. Little joke.
But seriously. What's the message?
You. You must take the Lexicon. Free me of my burden.
Ah, at last! I hope you found the place all right.
Oh ho. The whimpering Nord, eh? Yes, yes, I can see how you'd come to that conclusion. Interesting choice.
Ah, the feisty goodwife. Quite the mouth on her. Someone must have wanted her dead... right?
The conniving Khajiit. Cat like that was sure to have enemies. It's no wonder you chose him.
The blubbering barbarian and the tenacious mother. Must have been one of them, right?
The timid warrior and the sly Khajiit. Must have been one or the other, right?
Hmm. The fearless wife and mother, and the underhanded Khajiit. Had to be one of them, right? Interesting choice.
Well, well. Aren't we the overachiever. Three possibilities, three victims. Must have been one of them, right? So why take chances...
Remember, the Sanctuary is in the southern Pine Forest. Just beneath the road, and away from prying eyes.
What is the music of life?
Welcome home.
Move along.
A little girl is dead because of me.
Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control.
I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring.
Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control.
I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring.
And I would deserve it, wouldn't I?
I can't stop you if that's what you want to do. Hircine is too powerful.
But if you spare me, I can be a powerful ally to you. And I would promise to never return to civilized life.
I know now that I can't live among people.
Thank the gods. Now let's deal with these other hunters. We hunt together!
Thank you for your help. I will make my home here, away from anyone I might hurt.
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh?
Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
I said not anymore. Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering.
I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.
He was an Apprentice here at the College. Not very skilled, but got involved with a group of mages who took a liking to him.
When they left, he took off after them. Stole supplies and books from the College, I suppose as a way to ingratiate himself.
Let's just call it a [QUOTE]difference of opinion[QUOTE] with the College.
They were interested in research that goes outside the bounds of what the College allows, so they were... persuaded to leave.
I beg your pardon?
No! Someone help me! Please!
By Sithis, this ends now! Back away, fool! Whatever you've been planning is over!
Are you all right? I heard the commotion. Who was Cicero talking to? Where's the accomplice? Reveal yourself, traitor!
I spoke only to the Night Mother! I spoke to the Night Mother, but she didn't speak to me. Oh no. She spoke only to him! To the Listener!
I spoke only to the Night Mother! I spoke to the Night Mother, but she didn't speak to me. Oh no. She spoke only to her! To the Listener!
What? The Listener? What are you going on about? What is this lunacy?
It's true, it's true! The Night Mother has spoken! The silence has been broken! The Listener has been chosen!
Then what in Sithis' name is going on? Cicero spoke to the Night Mother, but she spoke to you? Is this just more of the fool's rambling?
What?
So Cicero wasn't talking to anyone else. Just... the Night Mother's body?
And the Night Mother, who, according to everything we know, will only speak to the person chosen as Listener... just spoke. Right now...
...to you?
By Sithis.
And... what did she say?
Amaund Motierre? I have no idea who that is.
But Volunruud... that I have heard of. And I know where it is.
Volunruud? Well, that is interesting. I know this place...
Hmm?
No. No! Listen, I don't know what's going on here, but you take your orders from me. Are we clear on that?
The Night Mother may have spoken to you, but I am still the leader of this Family. I will not have my authority so easily dismissed.
I... I need time to think about all this. Go see Nazir - do some work for him. I'll find you when I'm ready to discuss the matter further.
But... What of Yamarz?
I see. He did not survive. He... He died well?
What? Why would he do such a thing?
Ah, that is good to hear, then.
Yamarz was a coward and a weakling. His deceitful ways have cost you all greatly.
So he has been punished? And what of us? What fate shall we suffer?
You'll have to prove yourselves, but I'm willing to give you a chance. Gularzob's in charge now. Let's hope he's a better chief.
You, place that hammer on the shrine. You're the only one who's proven worthy in all of this...
You have done admirably, little one.
You have helped rid the Orcs of Yamarz in a way that avoids the destruction of their tribe.
They will become stronger for it. And you... You have proven your strength.
You have earned my favor for now, mortal, and so I give you a little gift. Use it well.
You! You'll help me! You help people, right? That's what you do?
Absolutely not. That wing has been sealed for hundreds of years, and for good reason. They say the ghost of Pelagius the Mad still haunts it.
Ghost or not, there are reminders of his dark rule that are best left buried away.
Not on your life. It's dangerous in there, and Falk doesn't even like me and Erdi going in every year to clean out the spiders.
Oh, I'd get in trouble for that. It's not allowed. Besides, it's scary in there!
Well, perhaps it's time for some independent study.
Check with Urag gro-Shub in the Arcanaeum. See if he's aware of any references to this... thing that you and Tolfdir found.
I'd like to know as much as we can about it.
How could you just leave me here?
Well, everything worked out nicely, didn't it?
I've got to get out of here.
Why did I ever come here?
Please! Help me!
Don't leave me here!
Urag can be very helpful. Just don't antagonize him.
Well, you're certainly making a name for yourself.
I understand you're the one that found this... Orb in Saarthal.
You have what you came for. Now leave.
Take your books and go, before I change my mind.
Do we have a deal?
This thing from Saarthal. What does it do? J'zargo cannot say.
I hear you found some... thing in Saarthal. You think it could help make me a powerful mage?
We shouldn't have been disturbing Saarthal, no matter what you found down there.
At least something good came out of that trip to Saarthal. I didn't find anything but dust.
Welcome to the Midden.
Is it true? One of the Psijics was here in the College?
No one's heard from the Psijic Order in so many years. Hard to believe one would just suddenly show up here.
J'zargo regrets that there was no chance to speak with the Psijic Monk.
You must excuse me. I shouldn't be here.
It is good to meet you in person.
I hope you have good news for Mirabelle.
Please, make sure Winterhold is safe!
Well? Is everything out there all right?
Find Savos, and get him back here if you can!
What's happening? What did you people do?
You brought this on us! You!
Please, whatever you did, just make it stop!
What's going on out there? What happened?
Did you make something bad happen?
I'm not seeing things again, am I?
Whatever it is you're up to at the College, you need to fix this at once!
What have we gotten ourselves into now?
Well, this certainly won't help our image.
This is not J'zargo's fault!
By Azura, what's happening?
Shor's blood, what have they done?
What's going on?!
This can't be happening!
The Arch-Mage is dead! Dead!
Protect yourself! We're under some kind of attack!
We've got to stay focused.
We never should have brought that thing here!
I hope this isn't something I did.
If this is somehow your fault...
By the gods... what was that?
We need to find out what Ancano's up to.
I don't know what he's doing, but he won't get away with it.
I trust that you'll inform me as soon as the Staff is recovered.
I hope Mirabelle is helpful in locating the Staff.
So you're off to find some staff now? I don't see the point of that.
J'zargo has heard of the Staff of Magnus. Once you are done with it, perhaps you will allow J'zargo to... Borrow it?
Have you managed to track down the Synod, or the Staff of Magnus?
Please, tell me you've found the crystal. I've no wish to die in this place.
Unless you can find that crystal, there's no point in wasting more time with talk.
It's very important you do this correctly.
Have you managed to track down the Synod, or the Staff of Magnus?
You got what you came for, didn't you? Go then, back to your college.
We've got to find a way to put a stop to this.
I hope whatever you're going to do will work.
You'll defeat Ancano, won't you?
What are we going to do? How do we save the College?
I hope you know what you're doing.
I can't lose all my research. There has to be a way to save the College.
You really think the Staff of Magnus is the key?
How long can we keep this up?
J'zargo knows that you will save the College. You must.
J'zargo is sure this is the end. And this was supposed to be a safe place...
If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?
I've never seen anything like this, in all my years.
Can you imagine the kind of power behind this?
We never should have pulled that thing out of Saarthal.
Do you think Ancano knew all along what the Eye was capable of?
This is going to be terrible for business...
You're still alive!
Get to the College, before it's too late!
What are you doing here? You need to get that Staff, or else we don't stand a chance!
Our order will not forget your deeds.
You have done the world a great service.
Now what's going on?!
Psijics? Here now? What in Talos' name...
I knew you could do it!
We must hurry if we're going to defeat Ancano.
Gods, you'd better have something good up your sleeve. I've got nothing left.
We never should have brought that thing here...
I'll be amazed if any of us survive this.
If only we'd stayed out of Saarthal.
I can't believe any of this is happening!
J'zargo is going to stay right here until this is all over.
If only Savos were alive to see this...
To Oblivion with the rest of them - save yourself!
Why doesn't someone do something?
I'm not ready to die. I'm just not...
So much energy... So much power. Never in my life have I seen something like this...
Azura's Star! I knew the Lady of Twilight had sent you for a reason.
Hand it over to me. I will ask Azura to restore the Star to its original purity.
Are you ready for me to show Azura her Star and receive her wisdom?
Azura is watching over you. She has seen this before it ever happened.
All will happen as it has been foretold.
The Twilight has foreseen all of this. Everything will be revealed in time.
I told you what you wanted to know. What else could you want?
I can send you into Azura's Star as soon as you're ready.
Stop, outlander. You must pay for your crimes in blood or gold.

We're taking Falkreath. Get over there with the others. Fight well or die well.
We're liberating Morthal. Join the brothers gathering for the attack. Talos be with you.
The Imperials are here. All lined up pretty-like in their shiny armor. We'll put a few dents in those bastards before we give up the city. Move it!
Look, the Dark Brotherhood is a family. This Sanctuary is a family. And, we've always welcomed those... shunned by society.
Werewolves, wizards, eternal ten year-old vampires... what does it matter? In truth, I've rarely met a lunatic I haven't liked.
Cicero's problem isn't his madness. It's an adherence to an ancient, outmoded way of life. The Night Mother's ways... simply are not our ways.
He just couldn't accept that. And now he'll have to pay the price.
Oh, it's ancient. Apparently one of the first Sanctuaries in Skyrim. It hasn't been used by the Brotherhood in close to a hundred years.
If you say Cicero has gone there, it stands to reason that he's familiar with the place. That means you'll be fighting him on his own ground.
Tread carefully.
Should have figured Astrid would send you.
Do me a favor and kill that little jester twice. Just to make sure.
What gave it away?
Ha ha ha ha ha.
Yeah, got to admit that little jester is good with that butter knife. But don't worry, I gave as good as I got.
In there! Through the door. Some old Sanctuary, by the looks of it. I would have followed him, but I don't know the phrase.
All right, you convinced me. Doubt I'd be much good to you, anyway. The little fop cut me pretty deep.
But I slashed him good. Pretty sure I severed an artery. Don't know what you're going to find in there... but you can probably just follow the blood.
Kill me if you must. But I can't promise I won't haunt you till the end of your days if... if the Dread Lord lets me. Ha ha ha ha ha.
Good hunting. I'll see you back at the Sanctuary.
Gee, thanks for the help.
Kill me or don't, Listener! The power is yours! But spare poor Cicero, and a friend you will have! Oh, such a friend, until we enter the Void...
Oh, we have unfinished business you and I.
What do you think? Are we going to let Ulfric dictate terms to us before the negotiations even start?
What do you think? I can't let Ulfric dictate terms to me before the negotiations even start.
By Ysmir's beard, the nerve of those Imperial bastards, eh?
To think that we would sit down with that... Thalmor bitch. I say she walks or we walk.
By Ysmir's beard, the nerve of those Imperial bastards, eh?
To think that I would sit down at the same table with that... Thalmor bitch. Either she walks or I do.
This castle is old. Lots of places nobody's been in a long while.
Places where you can overhear things. See things.
And the Whispering Lady.
I know that he still worships Talos. That he hates the Thalmor almost as much as the Stormcloaks do.
That he worries about being chased from Whiterun.
That he... that I'm...  that I don't have the same mother as my brother and sister.
She won't tell me her name.
I've gotten good at listening to keyholes. At the door in the basement, I hear her talking to me.
I thought I was caught, but she started telling me even more secrets.
But I can't open the door.
In the basement. Trust me, you'll see it.
I bet she'll talk to you, too.
Regrettably, I cannot reach your plane so directly.
But I forgive you for not knowing who I am. Few hear my whispers anymore.
I am Mephala, the Lady of Whispers.
I tug at the web of connections between mortals. Love, hatred, loyalty, betrayal.
The boy was good at sussing out secrets. You, I expect to take a more active role.
First, you must open this door.
A piece of my power has been locked away behind it, and even my eyes cannot see past the seals.
I'd much rather it be in the hands of an ambitious and talented person such as yourself.
Just try to relax, Veezara. Let the elixir do its work. You'll feel better, shortly.
Achh... Thank you, dear. You are most kind. The jester's cut feels as bad as it looks, I'm afraid.
Damn it, this never should have happened! We knew better. We knew better, and still we let our guards down. Agh!
I'll admit, even I'm having a hard time disagreeing with you...
Bested by a fool. Who's the fool now, hmm?
Hush, Veezara. You were very brave. Astrid may well be dead if not for you.
She's right. I'll be forever in your debt, dearest brother. Now be quiet. Just... just rest.
Look, we've got to deal with this situation. You've got to deal with this situation.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life!
But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right.
After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild.
Search Cicero's room. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.
You must be the one Falk spoke so highly of. Welcome.
You've returned! I'm hoping successfully.
You know what needs to be done. Is there something more you need?
The courier must have found you.
Speak to Styrr. He can help.
I won't be able to relax until I'm sure Potema is dealt with.
Sure is. I've got another client -- wants me to do some enchanting. You can do the pick-up for me, if you want.
There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
All right. Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client.
Yes, yes I did. I've already sent instructions, you just need to make sure this arrives in one piece.
Ah, you're from the College? I've been waiting for you.
Please make sure this arrives in a timely manner. And don't scratch it up.
Oh, good. I've been waiting for you. Here you go, it's all ready.
Now, Sergius knows what I want. I'm hoping he can get it done quickly.
It's about time someone arrived. Here, make sure this is handled properly.
Oh yes, that. Here you go. I hope this can be ready soon.
Yes, yes. Let's keep our voices down, all right? Just make sure this gets there.
I need some more supplies. Can you help out with that?
I'm running low on Petty Soul Gems.
I'm running low on Lesser Soul Gems.
I'm running low on Common Soul Gems.
I'm running low on Greater Soul Gems.
I'm running low on Grand Soul Gems.
If you can bring me three more, that would be helpful.
I need at least five more, if you can find them.
Bring me another seven of them, if you can.
Ten more would keep me stocked for a bit.
In fact, there is. I need a soul gem filled, if you're up to it.
Here, take this Grand Soul Gem, fill it for me, and bring it right back. I'll be waiting.
Some other time? That's not going to help me much, now is it?
Ah, yes. Thank you. I'll get to work on this right away.
I'll add it to the list of things I need to take care of. Thank you.
Excellent. Thank you, I'll see that this gets put to good use.
Yes, a Grand one. Soon, please.
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
There are more books to be recovered and secured here in the Arcanaeum.
Well all right. Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.
Ah. Some other time, perhaps?
I had to use your pay to smooth things over with the client. They didn't want to be associated with a criminal. Next time, don't get arrested.
Gettin' pinched and endin' up in jail doesn't cut it with our clients. If you want to get paid next time, stay clean.
Yeah, your right. Probably a waste of your time anyway.
Sure, no problem. We'll find someone else to do it.
Don't even give it a second thought. Maybe next time.
Your not winnin' points with me with that attitude.
When you find your nerves, then we'll talk.
Fine, but you're not gettin' any wealthier by weaslin' out of everythin' I offer you.
You're not going to get richer with that attitude.
You need to bloody well get your priorities straight if you want to make it around here.
Too bad, looks like I need to find someone else to take care of business.
If you think you'll make your fortune kickin' around the Flagon all day, that's where your wrong.
And here I thought you were a master criminal. Guess I was wrong.
All-righty. Good luck out there, boss.
Here you go, boss. All the details.
Great. Watch yourself out there, boss.
Good... here's your assignment.
Finally, someone with backbone. Here you go.
Now that's what I like to hear. Off you go.
Nice. Here, this is what you'll need to know.
Keep this up and you'll be rich enough retire before you know it. Good luck.
Just remember the rules... keep it clean and keep it quiet. Here's the details.
Here's everythin' you need. You get caught, and we've never heard of you.
Just keep your eyes open and your mouth shut and you'll do fine. Let me give you the details.
A pleasure as always, boss. Here's your payment.
Got all your gold ready, boss. You can count every coin, it's all there.
I hardly noticed you were gone. Got your share of the spoils right here, boss.
Good job. Now here's your part of the deal.
Here's your share. Well done.
Nicely done. Here's your share.
And here's the spoils. Plenty more where this came from!
I can pat you on the back all day, but coin's coin, right?
This kind of work suits you... and is going to end up makin' you rich.
Couldn't have done it better myself. Here's your coin.
If you don't watch it, I may actually start to respect you. Job well done.
Sorry, boss. Had to use your share to cover expenses after you done and got messy.
I'm afraid I had to pay off a few officials to keep you out of jail, boss. Expensive to get murder off the books, know what I mean?
Now don't get cross with me, but the officials are demanding compensation for the mark you killed. Had to do it... had no choice, boss.
What's the matter with you? We said keep it clean! Well, you can just forget about your payment.
Sure you finished, but you killed someone to do it. Next time listen to the rules if you want to get paid.
You needed to do this clean and quiet, and you failed. Now we need to use your payment to cover your mistake.
I hope you weren't expectin' to get paid for this blundered job. Next time, the mark stays alive... you hear me?
This ain't the Dark Brotherhood. Next time, you keep the job clean and you'll get your coin.
Consider it forgotten, boss.
Are you bloody serious? You're not going to get ahead by quitting around here, that I can promise you.
You can't keep quittin' jobs when it strikes your fancy. You're going to make us all look like a bunch of amateurs. Think next time.
Keep droppin' these jobs and I might quit assignin' them to you.
Being connected to a criminal didn't make the client happy... next time, act like a real thief and don't get caught.
Good going... you got arrested. Now how do you think that looks for the Guild? Better luck next time.
Good. Here's what you need to do.
Suit yourself. You're the boss.
All right, whatever you want.
No problem, I'll find someone else. Don't worry about it.
Hey, you approached me. You want to play coward, that's your problem.
Look, I don't like wasting my time. Come back when you decide to get serious.
Not interested? Fine. Then let me offer it to someone with a little more backbone.
You need to start pulling your own weight around here, otherwise I might [QUOTE]forget[QUOTE] to offer you any more jobs.
Fine. I'll just keep all this coin for myself then.
Look, if you just want to sit around the Flagon all day getting drunk, that's your business. Just quit wasting my time.
The last time I checked, gold coins aren't falling from the heavens. You better take some jobs if you want to earn your share.
Keep turning down jobs like this and the Guild will begin to lose respect for you.
Fine. Here's everything you need to know.
All right. Take this and get out of here.
Fine. Just keep it clean. Here you go.
Good, just remember the order: do job first, get drunk second. Now take this and go.
Here you go. Hope you don't muck it up.
Here. Just don't make me look like an ass in front of the Guild and mess it up.
Whatever, just get it done. Here's the job.
Oh, you're back? I suppose you'll be wanting your pay then.
You did the job and you did it clean; that's all we ever ask. Enjoy the gold.
Didn't muck it up I hear. Good. Here's your share.
I suppose you want your share now? Here you go.
And with no strings attached. Not bad. Here, got some coin for you.
Amazing what people leave laying around for us to take, isn't it?
Fine. I guess you'll need your coin then.
Here's your gold. Try not to spend it all in one place.
I want to pay you, but I had to cover up the murder. Didn't expect you to go on a killing spree.
Sorry, I don't have a single septim left after paying the town guard to keep quiet about the mark you killed.
Look, I told the client you probably had a good reason to kill the mark, but well, they demanded reparations.
Are you out of your mind? We said no bloodshed! Well, guess what. You can just forget about your gold.
I thought it was crystal clear... no one dies on these jobs. Remember that next time you want to get paid.
You an assassin or a thief? Next time, keep your blade sheathed if you want to make any gold.
You drew blood, so you aren't getting paid. That's the rules. You don't like it, take it up with Brynjolf.
You idiot! We have to cover your mess up and that costs us gold... which means you don't get any.
No problem, I'll get someone else to take it.
Fine. Next time, save me the trouble and pass on it from the beginning.
Make up your mind, will you? You're starting to make us look bad.
First you take the job, now you don't even want it. I wish you'd make up your mind.
You've done a great thing, today. It doesn't matter who you support in the war; Potema would have been a blight on the land for both sides.
Without you this would have been a disaster. I should have paid more heed to Varnius' warnings.  I won't make that mistake again.
Ready to get moving?
So, what's the plan?
We heading out?
Whenever you're ready to leave.
You're ready to get going?
Shall we get moving?
We going?
Ready to get going?
You are ready to move, yes?
We are leaving?
Waiting.
Still standing here.
Mara protect us both.
I'm itching for a fight.
I'm right behind you.
Still here.
I've got your back.
Lead on. I'm behind you.
To Oblivion and back, as they say.
Ours is to follow, friend.
Khajiit guards your back.
If anyone sneaks up on us, I'll smell them coming. Or I might not. We'll see.
You're taking us somewhere warm, I trust?
An Orc follows to the death.
My blood's calm. I prefer it boiling.
You have a grim look.
We've stopped. What is it?
I'm still here.
Let's get going.
No! Not again! I shall not be denied again!
Potema herself? Please tell me you stopped them.
Any resident of Solitude can tell you, she was the deadliest person ever to come out of Skyrim.
Queen of Solitude, granddaughter of Emperor Uriel Septim II, five hundred years ago. Her fight for succession nearly tore the empire apart.
After twenty years of fighting, she had raised armies of the dead, led by vampire generals. If she returns to power, nobody could stop her.
A curious figure. Unrepentantly evil and nasty, of course, but also astonishingly brilliant, and obviously quite a necromancer at her end.
She was always so close to being Empress, but despite her machinations, it was never to be hers.
Ironically, if she were alive today, she'd be the only living member of the Septim bloodline. By all rights, she would now be Empress.
You think this is personal?
The Empire has no place in Skyrim... not any more. And you? You have no place in Whiterun anymore.
Don't worry. We'll take good care of your city when you're gone.
When Ulfric Stormcloak becomes High King, Skyrim will finally be the way my ancestors intended. It's a new day in Markarth.
You never were able to see the forest for the trees, were you?
How kind of you. And I've brought an army to give you a going away parade.
A convenient position to hold now. But mark my words, old man, in the days to come, Ulfric will spread his rebellion thin. And what then?
We need the Empire, as much as it needs us. We Nords are the Empire! Our blood built it. Our blood sustains it! You of all people should know that.
We Nords were proud warriors once. And we still could be. Evidenced by the men and women who fought and died bravely today.
You could see that if you had any faith left in that black heart of yours.
But no, you're content to snatch scraps falling off the Emperor's table. Fine. Take my home. Take my city. May it burn down around you.
If this was my Empire, I'd be able to worship whoever I damned well pleased. You wish to see an Empire without Talos? Without its soul?
We should be fighting those witch-elves, not bending knee to them. The Emperor is nothing more than a puppet of the Thalmor.
Skyrim needs a High King who will fight for her, and Whiterun needs a Jarl who will do the same.
A bit melodramatic, even for you Laila.
Pack your things and go.
Tell me, Vignar. Was all this worth it?
How many of those corpses lining our streets wear the faces of men who once called you friend? What about their families?
One day when you can see past your own interests, you will come to see that we were right.
And this... This is all wrong.
Enough! That's enough. I surrender... I surrender.
Peace! Everyone stand down. That's an order. Stand down!
Yield. I yield, Stormcloak! The city of Markarth is yours.
Stop! Enough! Stand down!
The city is yours.
It's over! Everyone stop!
I surrender... I surrender...
A likely story. They won't even do their own dirty work now, eh? Well, you won't get the better of me!
Now tell me where my brother is!
No? So you don't know anything about my brother?
Then what are you doing here?
Thorald... Thorald Gray-Mane? Fighting for the Stormcloaks, disappeared and believed dead?
You really don't know anything about this, do you?
Because they've got Thorald locked away somewhere, and if they find me here I'll disappear too!
I am not going to let that happen!
I can't do this all on my own. Are you... are you offering to help me?
What's there to say? You go against the Empire, you wind up dead. Thorald got what was coming to him.
Best not to ask too many questions about it. People might get the wrong idea about you.
Between the two of us, his family is better off thinking he's dead.
Thorald and I have history, all right? We used to be friends. So I looked into it when he disappeared.
I found out the Thalmor have him. And they don't let anyone go.
So I've kept my mouth shut. Like I said, his family is better off believing he's gone, because he's never coming back.
He fought on the wrong side, and he paid for it. That's all I have to say.
Oh come on, leave it alone. He's gone. There's no use in talking about it anymore.
I wish everyone could just get past that and get on with their lives.
It's been a while now. I miss him, but it's clear he's not coming back.
He knew what he was getting into. I don't... I don't blame anyone.
I used some contacts in the Legion, asked some questions. Was told I should mind my own business.
Last I'd heard, he'd been carted off to Northwatch Keep. Ever heard of it?
If you go in there, you don't come out. Ever.
Here, see for yourself. This is the last word I received. I'm telling you, he's gone for good.
You what?
Oh no. No, no, no. This can't be happening.
Please, you can't tell anyone. It must remain a secret! I'll do whatever you want.
What makes you think I know anything? Everyone knows he's dead and gone!
Okay, okay!
All I know is that Idolaf made some effort to find out what happened to him, but was told to stop asking questions.
He got some letter from the Legion and has left it alone since then.
I'll prove it to you, all right? I'll get you the letter. Just... meet me at the statue of Talos, and don't tell anyone about this.
That's privileged information. Now move along.
Unngh...  Uhhh...
Thorald? Thorald!
Brother? Is... Is that you?
I'm here! I knew I'd find you!
What in the world?
There's no time. We've got to get you out of here! Come on, let's go!
I'll round up what men I can, and meet you outside Northwatch Keep. We'll get in and out as fast as possible.
I'll see you there.
Well, well. I was looking for this little beauty.
If you happen across any other unusual trinkets like this, be sure and bring them to me. I promise it'll be worth the effort.
Here you go. This should cover it.
I think you'll find this payment to be more than fair.
Really? And what might that be?
I'm sorry, what?
