Will you take it to Captain Aldis?
She's so lost in her visions, and it's only getting worse.
I've looked after her safety for so long...
If she can't tell what's real and what's not, how will she continue to lead Hjaalmarch?
Yes, I suppose there is.
There is a letter, one I have had for some time now. I think it is time it gets delivered.
I cannot leave Idgrod's side, so I must stay here. Could you see that it reaches Captain Aldis in Solitude?
For me? From whom?
Well now, that is something. Hand it over, please.
I asked her the same thing and she wouldn't come out and tell me.
But now that I know who she is, I'd say she's trying to hit the Thieves Guild where it hurts.
Now you're speaking my language.
Tell you what. If you need any stolen goods fenced, you bring them to me and I'll pay you good money for them.
Consider me your new friend in the north.
Oh, no. I hadn't heard from Gorm for a while, so I'd hoped he'd given up on his little scheme.
The last time we'd discussed this issue was before this damnable war broke out. Things were different then.
Now, what's he's asking, it's just impossible. Even if it worked, the questions and accusations it would cause...
Well, I'll take it under advisement. Thank you.
Look here. There's something strange about this cabinet.
What's it say?
These are difficult times indeed, when men stalk their brethren like beasts.
My men are stretched thin as it is. If you offer your aid, I gladly accept. The guards will be told to assist you as necessary.
I'm happy to lend a hand as much as I can, as well.
All right, then.
I noticed a trail of blood leading away from here.
Helgird's taken the body into the Hall of the Dead to prepare for burial. She's a little crazy, but if she knows anything, it's dead bodies.
Friga Shatter-Shield's old place? It's been abandoned ever since she was killed.
Uf. Have you been talking to Viola Giordano? She posts those all over the city, and someone keeps taking them down.
Ask her about it if you want an earful.
I've been following him for months now. Well, not actually following. Trying to find him.
The guards won't help. The people won't help. I'm the only one who thinks he can be caught.
Just... try and keep out of our way.
Bolar has been in a bad mood for weeks, now.
Oh? I hadn't noticed.
Since Galka was taken from us. She's been... sad, I guess.
She's just worried about you. We all are. We just want you to be happy. We want to make you happy.
You wanted to see me?
Bolar said you had been looking for a new wife?
Well, I...
I don't think you're quite ready yet.
How will I know when I'm ready?
Sweet Mother, sweet Mother, send your child unto me, for the sins of the unworthy must be baptized in blood and fear.
Please... How long must I do this? I keep praying, Night Mother. Why won't you answer me?
Sweet Mother, sweet Mother, send your child unto me, for the sins of the unworthy must be baptized in blood and fear.
So... very tired...
Grelod, you old crone. You'll get what you deserve. The Dark Brotherhood will see to that...
Die, Grelod! Die!
Bolar and I will tell you.
How much longer do we have to work this backwoods mine?
A bit longer, yet. We need more money if we want to be chiefs of our own.
But I thought there was only one chief.
Well, right. One of us will be a chief.
What about the other one?
Which other one?
The other chief!
There's only one chief!
I found a big load of ebony at the bottom pocket in the mine.
I can't believe it's come to this.
I really thought you'd be able to save me.
Please, let's hurry.
Let's get to the stables before they find me.
Any news of the Alik'r?
Please, we need to speak in private.
What are you looking at?
Can you help me find someone? There's gold in it for you.
We're looking for someone. Maybe you can help.
I have some questions for you. I'm trying to find someone.
The Alik'r are not permitted within the city walls.
You're not one of those Alik'r thugs, are you?
By decree of the Jarl, the Alik'r are banned from Whiterun.
Do you have news of our quarry?
Thank you for your trust. I am eager to return to my homeland.
A woman -- a foreigner in these lands. Redguard, like us.
She is likely not using her true name. We will pay for any information regarding her location.
We are not welcome here in Whiterun, so we will be in Rorikstead if you learn anything.
We're looking for information about a woman -- a foreigner in these lands. She's a Redguard, like us.
We believe she may be hiding in Whiterun, but we're checking everywhere to be sure.
Are you sure?
Oh no! They've found me? I need your help!
Please, come with me. I need to speak to you privately.
The who? I'm sorry, I have no idea what you're talking about.
We're looking for a fugitive who comes from Hammerfell. A Redguard woman. She may be somewhere in this city.
No. There are too many people around. Come with me.
I've told you, we can't talk out in the open. Come with me.
So the Alik'r know where I am? What did they offer you? Gold? How many more of them are coming?
Tell me!
You have a death wish, then? If you know that name, you must know to meet him would be to meet your end.
But it seems we both have needs, friend. Perhaps we can help each other out.
You buy my way out of here, and I'll tell you what you want to know.
I have dishonored my brothers by being captured, and so they have left me here.
My life with the Alik'r is over now, but I have no wish to die in this gods-forsaken land. If I can be released from prison, I may start over.
See to that, and I'll tell you what you want to know.
100 gold will secure my release. You can afford that, can't you?
I suppose you'd better hope you can, if you want the information.
Get the money into the hands of one of these guards, and I'll tell you what you want to know.
Very well.
Kematu is west of Whiterun. It's an unassuming little cave called Swindler's Den.
You realize if you set foot in there, you're never coming back out. They'll kill you.
But that's your problem, not mine.
Then we have nothing more to say to one another.
Because I was clumsy enough to be captured.
Kematu always says we're supposed to be the best of the best. I wasn't.
Then I need your help and there isn't anyone I can trust here in the city.
You can't tell them!
Please, I need your help and there isn't anyone I can trust here in the city.
I am not the person that the people of Whiterun think I am. My real name is Iman. I am a noble of House Suda in Hammerfell.
The men who are looking for me, the Alik'r, they are assassins in the employ of the Aldmeri Dominion. They wish to exchange my blood for gold.
I need you to root them out and drive them away before they find me and drag me back to Hammerfell for an execution.
There will be. Of that, you can be assured.
Of course, sent by... what is it that she's calling herself these days? Shazra? Saadia? One of those, correct?
Did she appeal to your sense of honor? Your greed? A more... base need, perhaps? It doesn't matter.
No doubt she's convinced you that she's the victim. But, do you know why we pursue her?
Just like always -- nobody saw anything useful. The bastard's escaped again.
I heard a scream and came running, but she was already... like this... when I got here.
Sorry. I thought I saw a fellow running away, but didn't get a good look at him.
Eehhh... no. Sorry. But I did notice that her coinpurse was still intact, so whoever did this wasn't after gold.
I'm going to keep preparing the body, if you'll excuse me.
Another girl killed. This is Susanna, from Candlehearth Hall.
Served me a drink just a few nights ago... but I can't say I knew her.
To the east of here is a hidden grove where the Eldergleam resides. It's the oldest living thing in Skyrim. Maybe all of Tamriel.
Our tree here in the city was grown from a cutting of that tree. You can still feel the glory of the mother tree through it.
Even its name is an echo.
Look, everything was all just a misunderstanding. I didn't mean to tell Brynjolf to go jump off the pier. You'll tell him I said sorry, yes?
Take this. Every single coin I owe is there, I swear it.
I'll already told that buffoon I'm not paying you people a single coin!
Now if there are no more questions, how about following me and I'll show you what we're all about.
Look around you, I'm barely keeping this rathole together. The war's seen to that.
Good, and take this little message back to your bosses.
I'm not paying any of you a single septim... ever! Now get out of my inn!
With the rumors going around about how poorly your Guild's been doing, she's become much too bold.
I'm not that foolish. The last thing I want is a war with your people.
Look, I'm only telling you this because I care for her. Don't mistake this as acceptance for what you do.
Keerava has some family at a farm just inside of Morrowind. If you mention you know about it, she might just listen to you.
Just please, don't harm anyone. I couldn't bear the thought.
All right, let's settle down. I suppose we can try something practical...
In continuing with our theme of safety, we'll start with Wards. Wards are protective spells that block magic.
I'll teach you all a ward, and we'll see if you can successfully use it to block spells, all right?
Did you mark it?
No, I don't need to mark it. I remember it.
Someone has killed Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Grelod is dead! Aventus did it! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Hooray! Grelod the Kind is dead at last! We're saved!
Yay!
Hurrah! Hurrah!
Aventus really did it! He got the Dark Brotherhood to kill old Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha! Hooray!
We love you, Dark Brotherhood! Ha ha ha ha ha!
So where is it?
You can tell it because it has lots of ebony.
Do you ever get a weird feeling about those sisters?
Who has a sister?
Mauhulakh's aunts. You know... the way they're all around him all the time.
Looks like you're still in one piece. And more importantly, so is the book. Thank you.
That's just how it is with families. When we're chiefs, you'll see how it is.
Can we both be chiefs?
Not today, we can't.
Sometimes I think your head is made of rocks.
That would be good! I could use it to smash other rocks. Easier to mine, then.
Oh, good point. I wish my head were made of rocks.
Come, child, I will tell you how to track a snow cat.
But you said that was impossible.
No, just very difficult. You have to look for shift in various shades of white.
My eyes are sharp.
They are, but your mind has to be sharp, too.
Cough Cough
Cough
What's the most dangerous beast you've ever killed?
Oh, probably a troll.
They're fearsome!
They are indeed. Nothing like your mother, though!
That's what everyone keeps saying. But you didn't kill her. That's what I was asking.
Oh of course. My mistake.
What about my father? Was he a good hunter?
It's a wonderful house, my love. If you don't mind, I'm going to start a small store. Something to do whenever you're on the road.
You have quite a house. I'm thinking of setting up a small store here. Sell odds and ends.
Strange house, but strong. Solid. I think I'll open a store. A task to tend to whenever you're away.
This house of yours is wondrous, at least to these eyes. I've thought about starting a store. Something to do here when you're out.
This house is huge. I'll be tripping my feet all over this place. Hey, I think I'll start a little business here. Something to do, you know?
I've seen bigger houses, but it's yours, so I like it. Now, I think I need something to do if you're ever away, so I'll be opening a store.
A good house. You chose well. I don't like sitting still, so I've decided to open a store. Buy and sell whatever is needed.
Hello, my love. Back from some adventure I bet.
It's good to see you again, dear.
It's pleasing to see you again.
Ah, it's my love, come to visit.
Hello, dear. I haven't been drinking too much, if that's what you're thinking.
You and I, we're the only people in Skyrim worth loving. That's what I think.
Good to see you, dear.
Yes, my love? What do you need?
Do you need anything, my love?
Speak. You can ask anything of me, love.
Is there anything you need, dearest?
I love you. You know that, right?
What do you need, love? Ask anything.
Yes, love?
Oh, you've seen your father just trying to chase a skeever from his house. He's a bit soft.
Sometimes I'm surprised he's still the chief.
We all are, my dear, but sometimes the Divines reward those who don't seem to deserve it. Call it dumb luck.
Why are you looking at me like that?
The Dark Brotherh... Oh. Oh! I... my goodness, you're really here! The Black Sacrament. It actually worked?
Isn't there some business you should be tending to?
If you can... I want you to kill someone else, as well. You don't have to - not as part of our deal. But if you do... I'll pay you even more.
It's Nilsine Shatter-Shield, in Windhelm. If Nilsine dies, too... I'll make it worth your while.
What I need? What I need is for Alain Dufont to die! I want him hunted down and murdered like the dog he is!
What?
Alain is... is dead?
I... I'm grateful. It's just this... this isn't at all how I imagined things would play out. There was Alain, but I was considering more, and...
Ah, well. Dead is dead. Right? My thanks to you, assassin. Here's the gold I was going to pay for the job. You earned it, after all.
Excellent. Once Alain is dead, I'll pay you. In gold. I've saved up a bit. I hope that'll do.
But, well... There is one more thing. If you're interested?
I went to Windhelm to see the Shatter-Shields. They were old and dear friends, and... in mourning. Friga was killed recently. Murdered...
I met Alain in the tavern, while I was... drinking my sadness away. He was handsome, and charming. He said I was the [QUOTE]beautiful lily[QUOTE] of his dreams.
Alain made all the pain just... go away. But it was all lies! Alain used me. He ruined my name, destroyed my friendship with the Shatter-Shields...
Do you know why Alain was in Windhelm? He heard about Friga's murder. He wanted to befriend the family, in their grief... and rob them blind.
Alain used me to get close to my friends. And now they all think I'm some kind of... monster. Alain Dufont took my life. And now I'm taking his.
Well, what news? Is Alain...
That bastard got exactly what he deserved.
But last I heard, Nilsine is still alive. So I guess you decided not to kill her as well. I have to admit... I'm disappointed.
Here's the payment for killing Alain. And nothing for letting Nilsine live. Just remember, that was your decision.
Thank you. That bastard got exactly what he deserved.
And... I heard about Nilsine. You have more than fulfilled your part of the bargain. Please, take this - as payment, and a symbol of my affection.
I'll never forget you.
Ah, you're back. So, how went your first real contract? A bit more exciting than what Nazir's been offering, I'd wager.
Of course, dear. Of course. And, from what my little ravens tell me, you handled yourself quite well.
Now, I need your assistance with a matter of a more... personal nature.
Oh, very good. Very good indeed. You, my dear, are going to fit in here quite nicely...
Now, I need your assistance with a matter of a more... personal nature.
Very well. I respect your discretion.
Now, I need your assistance with a matter of a more... personal nature.
If you're looking for a room, you want the Four Shields.
You look like you've seen your share of adventure.
It's no easy thing to make a living in the wilds of Skyrim.
Don't see many travelers out this way.
This land's tough and unforgiving, but beautiful, too.
You hear all this talk about a war? I hope it never comes here.
Seen some mean-spirited folk pass through lately. Thought I was rid of those sorts when I left Markarth.
Welcome, traveler. Mind yourself in our town.
We aren't a big city like Solitude or Markarth, but we like it this way.
If it weren't for Michel, I'd probably be dead in a Markarth gutter by now.
Got a loving wife, a healthy son and a patch of land to call my own. What more could a man ask for?
Are you a soldier? One day, I'm going to be a soldier!
Pa says I'm too young to fight in the war, but I can still help by patrolling the town.
I wish I was a soldier! They get to travel and stay up late and have fun!
Have you met Lucky? He's my pet goat, and he helps me patrol the town.
I'm hoping to run my own inn someday.
Faida's teaching me the innkeeper's trade. She runs the Four Shields.
Please stop looking at me like that.
First the war and now there's talk of dragons. What's next?
Working hard gives a man reason for drinking hard! Well, that and putting up with a wife like mine.
You're a well-traveled sort, I can tell just looking at you.
You been to Markarth? They've got a tavern called the Silver-Blood Inn. Best ale this side of Skyrim.
Money's been tight since the mill burned down. My wife won't let me forget it.
They say a strong drink, a sharp axe and a good woman are all a Nord needs to be happy. Two out of three's not bad.
Rest a spell! Can't work every minute of your life.
Where is that lazy man?
You going to try and sell me something? Well, I ain't interested.
Did my worthless husband send you?
Got nothing to say to strange folk.
Keep walking, stranger.
Got nothing to spare for travelers nor refugees, here.
If you're looking for handouts, look somewhere else.
You want anything in this life, you gotta take it. Just not from me.
Faida's the name. I keep the inn.
Something different about you, I can tell. Hope you ain't here to cause trouble.
The meals I serve ain't what I'd call a Jarl's feast, but they'll fill your belly.
Seen a lot of travelers lately. Mostly soldier, nowadays.
You met the Lylvieves? Quiet family, but they're the heart of Dragon Bridge.
Poor Horgeir. Everyone in town knows about his wife's affair but him. Probably better if he doesn't know.
I think the dragons are here to test us, and make sure we're still true Nords.
I was a barmaid at the Winking Skeever when I met my husband, rest his soul. Wasn't for him, I'd still be working there!
Respect the law, and you'll have no trouble in Dragon Bridge.
Mind you don't cross Tassius. He's in charge around here.
Don't start any trouble and I think we'll get along just fine.
At least, if you're gonna cause trouble, go somewhere else, okay? Please?
Another quiet day.
Another quiet day... I hope.
Heard there were wolves on the road up north.
Those rebels better not try coming to Haafingar.
Oh my, a guest!
Please, make yourself at home!
Lone travelers can find these woods a little treacherous.
We've been looking for someone to join us in a hunt.
Hern and I do so adore guests! These guards are such a bore.
A guest, oh my!
Why don't you stay a while?
The patrols never seem to give us time to be alone, the nosy pests.
Is Hert his sister or his wife? Or both?
Hert keeps giving me this look. I don't know if she wants me or if she wants to eat me.
Just my luck, stuck in the sticks with this crazy old woman.
I grew up hearing songs about Eyldi the Bear! She wrestled a storm out of the sky!
Now that our [QUOTE]ghost[QUOTE] has been unmasked, I hope we see more visitors in town than just the occasional pilgrim.
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town... it's haunted.
We don't get many visitors through here, unless their headed up to High Hrothgar of course.
Need a room? Maybe a drink? You name it.
Let me know if I can get you anything.
Anything I can help you with? A drink or a room perhaps?
Pardon me, milord. Would you care to hear me play my lute?
Pardon me, milady. Would you care to hear me play my lute?
If you fancy a bit of music, let me know.
I can't believe Fastred's gone. I... I should have been nicer to her.
I can't believe Fastred ran off to Riften with that... that bastard.
My daughter's driving me crazy, so forgive me if I'm a bit on edge.
If you ever settle down to have children, think twice before you do it.
Any idea how I can get my daughter's head out of the clouds?
You a pilgrim or just passing through?
Watch yourself on High Hrothgar, I hear wolves prowl the steps.
I hope Fastred's doing well in Riften. I miss her.
You must be another pilgrim on the way up to High Hrothgar. No other reason to pass through here.
Pilgrim or not, if I were you, I'd move right through our backwards little town.
You better not be here to stir up any trouble.
And to think that we've been supplying the Greybeards with our own food supplies. What have they ever done for us?
Oh! You're a traveler! You must have so much to tell about the world outside this boring town!
Have anything interesting to tell me?
I can't imagine how exciting it must be like to journey from place to place. You're so lucky!
Narfi's happy now. Maybe Narfi can sleep. Sleep all night. Sleep, sleep, sleep.
Narfi's sad now. Still wait for Reyda. No more sleep. No, no... no.
I can't see you, Reyda! I can't find you! Why are you hiding? Hiding, hide, hide, hide! Don't make me sad!
Oh Reyda! Redya! You live among the clouds now, dear Reyda!
I miss Reyda. She was so nice to Narfi. Narfi's sad he can't be with Reyda.
You don't look like a pilgrim. Why bother visiting Ivarstead?
Hmm? What do you want?
Is it absolutely necessary for you to bother me right now?
Thanks again for delivering those supplies to the Greybeards.
Ah, good to see you again! How did that delivery go?
Passing through on your way to High Hrothgar? About to make a delivery up there myself.
I wish I could make my deliveries more often, but the road's getting dangerous.
7,000 Steps indeed... next time they need to build it closer to the ground...
I'm going to put those pelts you gave me to good use.
So, have you shown those furry menaces that I mean business?
This has to be the worst place in Skyrim to run a mill. How am I supposed to do anything with all those bears running around?
These damn bears are driving me crazy!
Can you believe it? Another pile of logs ruined.
I swear, if one more thing goes wrong, I'm going to burn my mill to the ground!
Hello, my friend? What can I do for you on such a fine day?
Miss Temba is much happier now that you took care of those bears. She may not look like she is, but I can tell.
Those bears are making Miss Temba so angry. I hope you can do something about them.
Such a fine day, smell the air! Isn't it wonderful?
I hope life's treating you well, friend.
The attack will be launched imminently. Gather your weaponry and get to the front lines... Now, soldier!
Gods. A woman attacked right on the streets.
Are you all right? Did you see what happened?
Balgruuf!
Ready to listen to the Silver-Blood family now, Igmund?
I think I'll like living here.
Ahhh... It's good to be home.
Vignar Gray-Mane! Your family was noticeably absent from the walls. Now I know why. Wouldn't a dagger in the back have sufficed?
Thongvor. I should have executed your whole treacherous clan when I had the chance.
So enters Maven Black-Briar, the glint of Imperial coin in her eyes. So tell me, what's the price for a woman's integrity these days?
Welcome back. I've left a few surprises for you to discover.
Enough! Both of you!
There is a burning city out there that needs a government.
Are you two quite done?
You, go pack your things.
And you, go sit on that damn chair and start acting like a Jarl.
If you ladies are finished bickering, there's much to be done.
Jarl Black-Briar put your government together. Do it now, or there will be rioting in the streets.
We must move quickly to prevent further violence.
If you two are finished with the touching homecoming, there's a city in chaos out there.
He's right. Galmar, come, let us restore order.
Come Galmar, we have much to do.
Jarl Black-Briar. I must admit, I do like the sound of that.
And don't worry about any rioting, Legate. I have it under control.
We will soon begin publicly executing captured men. That should send a clear message to the people.
Indeed. Come, there is much to be done.
This isn't over.
You hear me you old fool! This isn't over!
The Empire will return. Count on it.
Yes, but not likely the one you intend.
Now that is a shame.
But what you fail to realize is that you involved yourself in this [QUOTE]insanity[QUOTE] when you took Grelod's life. You made your choice.
Now it's time to face the consequences of your actions. You don't leave this shack until someone dies.
See, I knew we could resolve this civilly. A debt owed must be repaid. You understand that.
Well, get to it then. Pick your guest, and send the poor fool to the Void.  I'll give you the key to this shack, and you'll be on your way.
Am I to take your silence as acceptance?
Then you know where we stand. Make your kill, and we're square. Repayment of your debt is but a discreet knife thrust away.
Our Family, my dearest. Our Family. Together, united as one, the Dark Brotherhood can accomplish anything.
But you must be anxious to get to work. I'm arranging a job, but need a bit more time. For now, go see Nazir. He's got several smaller contracts.
Soon, the Night Mother will arrive. And things around here are sure to get even more interesting.
Ah, but one last thing. A welcome home present. The armor of the Dark Brotherhood. May it serve you well in all your... endeavors.
Soon, my dearest. Soon.
I'm arranging a job for you, but I need some more time. For now, go talk to Nazir. He may have some smaller contracts to tide you over.
Soon, the Night Mother will arrive. And things around here are sure to get even more interesting.
Ah, but one last thing. A welcome home present. The armor of the Dark Brotherhood. May it serve you well in all your... endeavors.
Hmm... Yes, the silence suits you. Gives you an air of mystery.
Now, down to business. I'm arranging a job for you. But in the meantime, go talk to Nazir. He may have some smaller contracts to tide you over.
Soon, the Night Mother will arrive. And things around here are sure to get even more interesting.
Ah, but one last thing. A welcome home present. The armor of the Dark Brotherhood. May it serve you well in all your... endeavors.
You want to talk to me? After everything you've done?
Divines smile on you, friend.
I hope the wilds claim you, one of these days.
What do you need, my friend?
I've had just about all I'm willing to take from you. What is it?
You and me, we're the only people around who aren't complete fools.
Now why would I want to talk to you?
Friends like you are hard to find and very valuable to me.
Something you need, you miserable wretch?
Good to see you. Finally someone useful is around.
I don't like talking to someone who holds their honor so cheaply.
Good to have you by my side, friend. I need reliable people around.
You have something to say, dog? Something on your mind?
You're someone who can get things done. I like that.
I should bash your face in after all you've done.
You've been a good friend to me. That means something.
What do you want? You've caused enough trouble.
Good to see you again, friend.
You. What do you want?
Now here's a man I'm glad to see.
Now here's a woman I'm glad to see.
You! You're going to hurt me again aren't you? Just stay away.
It's so good to see you again.
I don't mean you any trouble. Just leave me alone.
Divines bless you. May the ground you walk quake as you pass.
Gods strike you down.
My favorite drinking buddy. Let's get some mead.
Just looking at you makes me upset.
Good to see Skyrim still has such fine people. You give an old man hope.
You're just rotten. No good.
I hope your parents are proud of you. They have a lot of reason to be.
Leave me alone. Can't an old man have some peace?
You're not as dumb as you look.
Here to shame an old woman? Leave me be.
Well, look at you. If only everyone acted like you did.
You. Every time I look at you my blood boils.
It's a fine day with you around.
You're nothing but trouble.
Good day, friend! Keeping well?
Worthless. Everyone like you is completely worthless.
Good to see you. At least you know how to treat someone properly.
Every time I think of you, I imagine a Saber Cat closing its claws around your face.
It's so good to see you again.
You're mean. I hate you. I hate you forever and ever and ever.
You're the best! Can you be my father?
You're the best! Can you be my mother?
I hope monsters come and eat you.
I bet you could slay one of those mean old dragons. I bet you could do anything.
The gods know what you've done.
A fine day to you, friend. May you die with a sword in your hands.
What do you want, milk drinker?
May the gods watch over your battles, friend.
Absolutely no time to deal with lowlifes these days. Go away.
Oh, it's you. I was wondering why I was smelling something unpleasant.
So nice to have pleasant company for a change.
There are so few pleasures in life as fine as your company.
There are so many delightful ways I've pictured you dead.
We're one of the same kind, you and I. I'm glad to have met you.
Azura's wisdom to you, friend.
Filth. Run to the horizon before I hunt you down.
What do you want? Aren't your hands coated with enough blood?
May your next fight bring you victory, friend.
For your crimes, may Malacath boil your blood and grind your bones.
May your weapons be sharp and your prey fresh.
Khajiit wishes for you to go away. You have done us too much harm.
These sands are cold, but Khajiit feels warmness from your presence.
Its scent is foul, unclean. Hurtful.
Speak. Khajiit will listen until all the sugars in the world turn sour.
It fills us with rage. What harm does it bring to us now?
Ours is to smile at your passing, friend.
It annoys us. What does it want to take from us now?
It is our most favored company.
Everyone! Everyone! Gather 'round!
I have something amazing to show you that demands your attention!
Gather 'round all!
No pushing, no shoving. Plenty of room!
This way everyone! Over here!
You need to hear this!
Come on, Brynjolf... what is it this time?
Patience, Brand-Shei. This is a rare opportunity, and I wouldn't want you to get left out.
That's what you said about the Wisp Essence and it turned out to be crushed nirnroot mixed with water!
That was a simple misunderstanding, but this item is the real thing.
Lads and lasses I give you, Falmerblood Elixir!
Oh come on, are you talking about the Snow Elves?
The one and only.
Mystical beings who live in legends and were masters of great magic. Imagine the power that coursed through their veins!
How did you get that, then? No one's seen them in years!
My sources must remain a secret for their own protection but I can promise that the contents are genuine.
One sip of the elixir and your wishes will be granted. Great wealth, everlasting life or perhaps limitless power could be yours!
How much does it cost?
Only twenty gold septims! Hurry before my supply is gone.
Grow back that missing limb!
See into other people's thoughts!
Learn a library's worth of knowledge in moments!
Wield powerful magic incantations!
Live for thousands of years!
Who knows what powers the elixir will unlock!
Please hurry, I have only a few bottles left!
Only twenty septims a bottle!
He has to be lying!
Twenty coins? No one has that much.
Don't listen to him, he's making this up.
Why would you even listen to him?
He gives other merchants a bad name.
This is ridiculous.
I dunno, sounds like I should try it.
What if he's right? Maybe I'll buy one.
I could get rich and stop selling these trinkets.
This is just what I need right now.
I can't afford to get one, but can I afford not to?
That Wisp Essence didn't help, but maybe this will.
Well, I see that my time is up. Come back tomorrow if you wish to buy.
What a waste of time.
Damn. I knew I shouldn't have waited.
Good. Wait until I start the distraction and then show me what you're made of.
We've been contracted to make sure Brand-Shei remembers not to meddle in affairs that aren't his own.
Now, since we're not the Dark Brotherhood, we're not going to kill him, we're just going to make sure he sits in the prisons for a few days.
Do you want me to hold your hand as well?
You have the ring. All you have to do is pick Brand-Shei's pocket and plant it there.
Do you want me to hold your hand as well?
You're going to have to sneak over to Madesi's stall and use your lockpick on the strongbox.
Then when you have the ring, you pickpocket Brand-Shei and leave it behind.
You'll need to speak with Mirabelle Ervine. Her quarters are in the Hall of Countenance, but she could be anywhere on the grounds.
You've been quiet so far. What do you think we should do?
Well, your classmates certainly seem to disagree with you.
Is that so?
Not going to weigh in either way?
I admire your restraint, but there are times when you must make decisions, even without all the facts. Rely on instinct.
See? He agrees with us too! Why don't you actually show us something?
See? She agrees with us too! Why don't you actually show us something?
Oh, don't listen to him. We can do it, just give us a chance!
Oh, don't listen to her. We can do it, just give us a chance!
We're all pretty new at this, right? Let's just give it a chance. What's the worst that could happen?
Ah, that feels so much better! You forget how nice supreme power feels until you've been stuck in a cave for a few years.
It's a shame you wished for something so dull as me taking back the mutt. Quite the lack of imagination on your part.
Now, as for your wish... An end to the war, was it?
Now, as for your wish... Power, was it?
A lack of ambition like that really ought to be punished. Perhaps by turning you into a worm, or maybe a few decades of...
I'll make sure this war ends, all right. Just as soon as the dragons swarm across Skyrim and wipe out all of you puny...
You can be a part of a tremendous power - all you have to do is let your soul be absorbed by this axe. I never said it would be your power...
Vile! None of that - you made a deal, and the mortal stood by it honestly. Now it's your turn to come through.
Oh, fine. Have my boon and be done with it. I've got more interesting deals to make, anyway.
Welcome, welcome! We were just beginning. Please, stay and listen.
So, as I was saying, the first thing to understand is that magic is, by its very nature, volatile and dangerous.
Unless you can control it, it can and will destroy you.
Sir, I think we all understand that fairly well. We wouldn't be here if we couldn't control magic!
Of course, my dear. Of course. You all certainly possess some inherent natural ability. That much is not being questioned.
What I'm talking about is true control, mastery of magic. It takes years, if not decades, of practice and study.
Then what are we waiting for? Let's get started!
Please, please! This is exactly what I'm talking about. Eagerness must be tempered with caution, or else disaster is inevitable.
But we've only just arrived here -- you've no idea what any of us are capable of. Why not give us a chance to show you what we can do?
I wasn't sure that he'd see the light, but I'm sure you [QUOTE]explained[QUOTE] it to him. Well done!
He's as pig-headed a man as you'll ever find.
The key is that ugly dwarven urn in his shop. Smash that thing to bits and he'll change his attitude.
She's as stubborn as she is beautiful, isn't she? Glad you found a way to get her to pay.
Haelga is a devout follower of Dibella and dotes over the statue to the Divine that she keeps at the Bunkhouse. Use it as leverage and she'll cave.
Hmph. Yes. Yes, I believe you are. Very well, then.
You need to find and kill Safia, the captain of the pirate ship Red Wave.
The ship travels the northern coast, and sometimes isn't even in Skyrim at all. So you'll have to be patient. Good luck.
Get over to Windhelm. Tell Ulfric of our victory here.
They will sing stories of this day.
Well, well... color me impressed, lad. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
Well, well... color me impressed, lass. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
Reliable and headstrong? You're turning out to be quite the prize!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me?
I trust everything went well?
Have anything for us yet?
What is it with you and all these questions? Very well, ask away.
All right, I'll entertain you a bit more. Go on.
Now what did you want? I already paid you.
I know you... everyone's been talking about it. What are you here for?
I'm not paying you or Brynjolf a single coin! Now get out of my tavern!
I said get out! I'm not paying a single coin!
Here for a room or something to drink? Show me some coin first.
You want something or not?
We got the message... now just take your business elsewhere.
What do you want?
I hope you're here for friendlier reasons now... after all, I'm all paid up.
Oh no! You're the one from Brynjolf's outfit, aren't you?
No! That urn was priceless!
Please, reconsider what you're doing. Maybe I can pay later...
I... I don't care! I'm not paying!
I'm sorry, you're going to have to leave. Tell Brynjolf he'll just have to make due without my coin.
So, can I interest you in anything today?
Look, I got the message. What else did you want?
It's you! Please, don't hurt me!
Please! Don't take the statue! It's the only thing of value I have left!
Ask all you want, you can't squeeze blood from a stone. Not in this part of the world anyway.
If you're looking for a room, try the Bee and Barb. This place is for the working man.
What did you want?
I'll be here when you're done.
Come back when you grow a backbone.
Just leave me in peace.
I hope Brynjolf chokes on his gold.
I can't stand this city. It's impossible to make a decent living here.
She was the toughest of the bunch. Honestly, I'm amazed she didn't kick you out of the Bee and Barb herself.
Keerava's stubborn, but she's got a soft spot for family.
Talk to Talen-Jei at the Bee and Barb and see if you can get something out of him. They're... well acquainted if you catch my meaning.
And you. A Stormcloak? I'd thought better of you. You'll all come to regret this day.
Well, what happens now is you start your new life in the Dark Brotherhood. You're part of the Family, after all.
This, as you can see, is our Sanctuary. You won't find a safer place in all of Skyrim. So get comfortable.
Congratulations. You slaughtered an emaciated beggar in cold blood. You are truly an opponent to be feared.
Here's your payment.
Good. And I hope you were careful in that lumber mill. Those splinters and rusty nails can be quite nasty.
Your payment, for a job well done.
Of course she is. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
I could do this all day. Here's your payment.
No sarcasm this time. You faced a vampire, and lived to tell the tale. Well done.
And if you contracted Sanguinare Vampiris, be sure to get that taken care of. Else you'll end up like our own Babette.
Unless, of course, that was your goal all along. Here's your payment.
Wonderful. The only good bard is a dead one, as far as I'm concerned. All that singing and... mirth.
Your payment, as per the usual.
Personally, I've always found Argonians to be incredibly unpredictable opponents. Especially near water.
In any event, nice work. Here's your payment.
Ah! Well done! Well done!
Those caravaners can be an elusive bunch. Takes a fair bit of stalking to take one down. But then, that's half the fun, isn't it?
Here's your payment. Well earned, indeed.
Ah, so the hunter came to know the fear of the hunted, hmm?
Your payment, my friend. Well done.
Don't worry, my friend, I'll spare you the facetious quip about killing a defenseless old woman.
Infiltrating an occupied fort and making it out in one piece is nothing to joke about. Well done.
Your payment for services rendered.
I hope the elf didn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that.
But I digress. Here's your payment.
Hmph. Well, that's sure to throw a branch into Falkreath's well-oiled political machine.
Here's your payment. Well earned, as always.
By Sithis, now I am truly impressed!
To kill a pirate captain, on her own ship no less? Simply masterful!
You've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.
I'm afraid that concludes our business. You have exhausted all available additional contracts.
But I'm sure you've got plenty to keep you busy right about now, hmm?
As a matter of fact, I do. Two of them. One rather easy assignment, and another that should prove quite a challenge.
Your first target is an Orc bard named Lurbuk. The other is a vampire by the name of Hern.
Happy hunting.
I'm sorry, I don't. Come see me again later.
Well then, your timing couldn't be better.
As it turns out, I've got two new contracts. One rather easy assignment, and another that should prove quite a challenge.
Your first target is an Orc bard named Lurbuk. The other is a vampire by the name of Hern.
Happy hunting.
More work? My friend, you still haven't finished the last set of contracts I gave you. Why don't you concentrate on eliminating that final target.
More work? My friend, you still haven't finished the last two contracts I gave you. Let's get those done, hmm?
Well aren't we the eager one? Sorry to disappoint, but there's nothing. Try me again later.
There are indeed. Three, to be exact.
There's Deekus, a shipwreck scavenger. Ma'randru-jo, a traveling caravaner. And Anoriath, a hunter.
Hmph. How about, instead of giving you another contract, I simply deride you for not finishing the one you still have?
So it would appear. Though I'd suspect she'd want you to complete your other contracts first. Do those, then we'll talk about something new.
Just one right now, actually.
I need you to eliminate an old woman named Agnis, a servant in Fort Greymoor.
Well, yes. Two of them. But you're reaching the end of what I have available.
Your targets are a dark elf wizard named Maluril, in the dwarven ruin of Mzinchaleft. And Helvard, the housecarl of Falkreath.
Kill these two, and I'll have one last contract to give you. I'm just finalizing some details now.
Not so fast Elf!
I presume you're talking to me?
On your knees!
Unfortunately, we've had to implement more stringent entry procedures, due to some problems with the local Nords.
We don't anticipate any real violence, but it never hurts to be prepared.
Our newest members are housed here in the Hall of Attainment.
I'll ask that you please keep your voice down while inside, as others may be working on research or... delicate experiments.
Now I'll show you to your quarters. You're going to be sharing space with your fellow Apprentices, who you'll meet shortly.
This is where you'll be staying. This bed and desk are yours. Please try and be considerate of others.
Now, let's go back to the Hall of the Elements, where most of the members gather for lectures and study sessions.
Initially you'll be learning from Tolfdir, one of our most esteemed Wizards.
Tolfdir is likely already addressing the new Apprentices. Go on in, and if you have any problems, let one of our senior members know.
I said, on your knees, Elf!
Enjoy this while you can. Soon you will all be slaves.
Raagh!
Someone get that thing out of here and burn it.
Well would you look at that!
This appears to lead somewhere. Let's see where it goes.
I'm not sure. I certainly wasn't expecting this.
This appears to lead somewhere. Let's see where it goes.
Looks like we're the only ones who made it. Was that really a dragon? The bringers of the End Times?
We should keep moving. Come here. Let me see if I can get those bindings off.
Follow me.
Close the door.
Come on, close the door.
You're not afraid of me, are you?
Just close the door, will you?
Now we can talk.
Can you do it? Can you devour a dragon's soul?
Good. And you'll have a chance to prove it to me soon enough.
This is no time to play the reluctant hero. You either are or aren't Dragonborn.
But I'll see for myself soon enough.
You're wrong. It is my business. You may be the only one that can stop these dragons.
But you'll understand that soon enough.
Yes. A map of ancient dragon burial sites. I've looked at which ones are now empty. The pattern is pretty clear.
It seems to be spreading from the southeast, starting in the Jeralls near Riften. The one near Kynesgrove is next if the pattern holds.
That's her business. Not mine. Probably not yours either.
Another new student... I'm surprised at how many of you there are lately.
Well, first you'll need these. While you're not required to wear them, you may find them more to your liking than your current clothes.
I'll give you a brief tour, and then we'll get you to your first class. Are you ready to begin?
Yes, just a brief overview of our facilities. Are you ready?
Wonderful. Please follow me, and don't wander off.
I see.
Well, please let me know when you are.
The College of Winterhold has been a fixture in Skyrim for thousands of years.
The prominent feature here is the Hall of the Elements. It's our primary location for lectures, practice sessions, and general meetings.
It is. These aren't particularly glamorous assassinations, I'll be honest. Don't pay much, either.
But they'll keep you busy. Just do them as you're able. There's no real time limit - the targets aren't going anywhere.
You can turn each one in as it's completed, or wait and turn in the whole group when all the targets have been eliminated. Whichever works for you.
Well then, let's get started. I've got three available right now.
Your targets are the beggar Narfi, an ex-miller named Ennodius Papius, and Beitild, a mine boss.
When you've completed all those, we'll see if I might have some more.
Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
Half of Skyrim knows. Old hag gets butchered in her own orphanage? Things like that tend to get around.
Oh, but don't misunderstand. I'm not criticizing. It was a good kill. Old crone had it coming. And you saved a group of urchins, to boot.
Ah, but there is a slight... problem.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates.
Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole.
A kill you must repay.
We need to talk.
Look. Something is happening here. I'm not sure entirely what that something is, but... Well, we need to find out.
If the Night Mother really did give you an order to talk to a contact, we'd be mad to ignore it.
And I think we'd both agree, Cicero's brought quite enough madness to this Sanctuary.
So go. Go to Volunruud. It's a crypt, pretty far to the northeast. Talk to this Amaund Motierre. And let's see where all this leads. Hmm?
Best put your other tasks aside. The real challenge is about to begin.
With Vici's murder, you've started us down a path the Dark Brotherhood hasn't traveled in centuries. The assassination of an Emperor.
And now, your reward. A unique spell to summon a legend of the Dark Brotherhood. His soul serves us now in death, as his body once did in life.
Ah, and of course, a bonus, for killing Vici while she addressed her guests, as instructed. Gold... simple and pure. Spend it as you will.
Now then. Time to proceed to the next stage of the plan. Go and speak with Gabriella. She's been helping me arrange your next contract.
With Vici's murder, you've started us down a path the Dark Brotherhood hasn't traveled in centuries. The assassination of an Emperor.
And now, your reward. A unique spell to summon a legend of the Dark Brotherhood. His soul serves us now in death, as his body once did in life.
Unfortunately, in your zeal, you failed to eliminate Vici while she addressed her guests, as directed. I'm sorry, but your bonus is forfeit.
Now then. Time to proceed to the next stage of the plan. Go and speak with Gabriella. She's been helping me arrange your next contract.
Excellent. Once again, you've proven yourself a born assassin.
Tell you what. Why don't you hold onto Shadowmere a while longer? He's a fine steed, and hasn't been ridden nearly as much as he should lately.
And now that this Cicero mess has been mopped up, we can get back to the matter at hand, hmm?
You are not worthy.
Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Write of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro. I'm sure you remember him.
Oh yes, it is Cicero! You were a fool to spare me. What, did you think I would be grateful? Cicero should be Listener! Not you! Now you will die!
Ahhh.... gotcha! Oh, Listener, you should see the look on your face! Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
Oh, Cicero has returned! Not to kill the kind Listener, but to serve, until one of us dies horribly, in service to our Mother! Best friends forever!
In the meantime, I'll make myself at home in the Sanctuary. I'm sure Mother needs... tending.
You! You're responsible for the siege of Solitude! By Sithis, this undermines all our plans! Fool! Finish that mess, and only then will we speak!
You! You're responsible for the siege of that... city! By Sithis, this undermines all our plans! Fool! Finish that mess, and only then will we speak!
Well now. Funny you should ask.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've [QUOTE]collected[QUOTE] them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters.
You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.
There you go. Take a look around, there should be plenty of gear to choose from. I'm going to see if I can find something for these burns.
Let me see if I can get that door open.
Let's keep moving. That thing is still out there.
Come on, this way.
You. Over here!
Ah, there you are. Good, I was done speaking with that muttering fool anyway. We've got some business to discuss.
I do indeed.
You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in The Hag's Cure, when the shop is open.
The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament.
Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done.
Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.
You go speak with Muiri. I've got to deal with the Night Mother and her little... clown.
It's all up to you now... Listener.
Go. Quickly. Hide in the coffin before Cicero and the traitor meet.
It's time we put a little kink in the Emperor's security.
Off to Solitude with you. Time to give the Emperor some real motivation to visit Skyrim.
Goodbye, assassin.
You've got people to kill, my friend. Best get to it.
Go on, now.
Good luck. And try not to get yourself killed.
Happy hunting.
Be sure and introduce yourself to your new Family members. They're all very eager to meet you.
Humble Cicero lives to serve.
Damnable jester...
I took that prancing fool into my home, and this is how he repays me?
You may go now...
I am yours, master.
I am yours, mistress.
Walk always in shadow, my Listener.
Just say the word, master.
Just say the word, mistress.
Ready when you need me, Listener.
What a waste. Fools.
*Sigh* I was part of the gang in the ruins here. Friend of mine went crazy and stole the boss' sword. They blamed me for it.
Look, I'm done here. Mop the floor with these idiots for all I care. Just get out of my way.
Hmph. Suit yourself.
It's about time they turned their gaze from the heavens, back to our bleeding homeland. What do they want?
I have the greatest respect for the Greybeards, of course. And the dragon attacks are a growing plague.
But the political situation is still delicate. Not all the Jarls are fully committed to supporting me as High King.
I can't afford to appear weak. I can't agree to this unless Tullius himself will be there.
Good. Maybe he's realized he's beaten. The way things are going, we'll be knocking at the gates of Solitude itself before too long.
Good. We still hold half of Skyrim despite everything the Empire could throw at us.
I doubt the Empire has the stomach for much more bloodletting.
Good. They've had their victories, but Tullius is no fool. The Empire can't afford to keep this up much longer.
I can't agree to any peace council until I know Tullius will be there. The other Jarls could take that as a sign of weakness.
He is weak. And no doubt knows it. He's no fool, he'll come, if only to give his troops a chance to refit.
But you're right. Victory is within our grasp. We can afford to give the Empire one more chance to withdraw.
You're right. Let Tullius be the one to insult the Greybeards by refusing their summons.
Show up these Imperials for the foreigners they really are.
Hmm. We could use the time to bring in new recruits. Our losses have been heavy recently...
Yes. I'll give Tullius one more chance to quit Skyrim with his tail between his legs.
The enemy is mustering for a final attack.
Infos conditioned on Attack Delta go here.
Join the forces mustering at the [CAPITAL] (infos conditions on location go here)
Yes, my friend. Though no one has been able to get close to her for as long as I can remember.
As you can see, Eldergleam's roots are large and stretch far, blocking any path to her trunk.
Though, believe it or not, there are rumors of a weapon that even Eldergleam herself would lift her roots for, more out of fear than respect.
Oh, I don't believe those rumors, my friend. Besides, who would ever want to harm such beauty?
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have nothing more to discuss. I encourage you to take your time and enjoy yourself. You look like you could use the rest.
Mama, can we talk. You know, about papa?
Of course, sweetie. What'd you like to know?
I don't know. What'd he look like?
He had your soft face, and that silly grin you get when you've done something wrong. That's his, too.
You are in Eldergleam Sanctuary - just a small glimpse of what beauty Kynareth has to offer. Wonderful place, isn't it?
Oh, I don't believe those rumors, my friend.  Besides, who would ever want to harm such beauty?
Welcome to Eldergleam Sanctuary, my friend. If you have any questions, speak to Asta.
Oh, I don't believe those rumors, my friend. Besides, who would ever want to harm such... Wait, it can't be.
The rumors were true! You carry the one weapon Eldergleam fears - Nettlebane. I beg of you, don't harm the tree! Nothing good can come of it.
The rumors were true... I beg of you, don't harm the tree! Nothing good can come of it.
(Growling)
Not now. The Underforge, tonight.
Not here. The Underforge. Come on.
Thank you for coming, brother.
Thank you for coming, sister.
Ah, there you are.
The blood calls, brother.
The blood calls, sister.
Speak to me, Shield-Brother.
Speak to me, Shield-Sister.
Let's make the bastards pay.
Skjor's somewhere ahead. We need to find him.
Less talk, more hunt.
The blood calls, brother.
The blood calls, sister.
Let's keep moving.
You've returned.
There you are.
You don't know what you're dealing with. There will be consequences if you harm that tree. Leave this place - you're not welcome here anymore.
Yes, you were going to demonstrate your ability, were you not?
A standard spell for one skilled in Destruction magic is the Firebolt. Casting one at the seal on the ground here would be sufficient.
Those invested in Restoration magic find Healing Hands to be essential. Can you cast it on me? That would prove your skill.
The Fear spell has saved the life of many an Illusion mage. If you could cast it on the seal here on the ground, that would prove your skill.
The Flame Atronach is a vital companion for anyone relying on Conjuration. Summoning one here would certainly show your skill.
The Mage Light spell is useful to any mage, not just those specializing in Alteration. Can you cast one on the seal on the ground?
It would seem that you have yet to reach a level of skill that the College would find valuable, so I'm afraid I can't allow you to join at this time.
Unfortunately, one needs to be able to cast at least Apprentice level spells in any school of magic before being allowed to join the College.
And thus, you're not skilled enough to be a candidate. I'm afraid we're not interested.
Nords don't care much for magic. The College in Winterhold is about the only place it's not looked down on.
Otherwise you could talk to the Jarl's pet wizard in Solitude.
The College of Winterhold is the only place in Skyrim open-minded enough to teach magic.
Although Ulfric's court wizard has been known to take on apprentices once in a while.
Magic? Goodness, not here! Nothing dangerous like that! That's all kept to that College up in Winterhold.
Better that than dealing with Ulfric's wizard like some do.
Magic is for the weak. Elves, I mean. They keep to that College in Winterhold. They know their place.
Of course there is Farengar. He might be the Jarl's wizard, but at least he's a Nord.
Pfft, I should've guessed as much. Your kind sticks to that College in Winterhold, as well they should.
You'd never think to learn from a Nord like the Jarl's wizard.
There's a College in Winterhold that teaches magic. It's very secretive, though, and you know how people hate secrets.
The Jarl's court wizard was taught there. That one's full of secrets.
Magic? That's dangerous. You want to learn that, go to that College in Winterhold. They teach that stuff there.
Hey! I know. The Jarl's wizard could teach ya. He's lots closer.
I've got no interest in magic users. No use for their kind at all. They're way up north in Winterhold, and that's fine with me.
I don't even like our Jarl havin' a  court wizard.
Bit of advice, folks here don't care for magic or those that use it. If you're intent on it, check at the College up in Winterhold.
Either that or go see the Jarl's court wizard.
Looking to blow yourself up? I hear that's what magic does to you. There's a College in Winterhold that teaches magic, unless that blew up too.
Be a lot safer just to have the Jarl's wizard teach you a thing or two.
Magic is nothing but trouble. If you're set on it, there's that College in Winterhold or Ulfric's court wizard. But don't say I didn't warn you.
The people of Skyrim don't like magic much, so about the only place you're likely to find a teacher is the College of Winterhold.
That'd be the College in Winterhold. I suppose you'll be headed there, then. Well, don't let me get in your way.
Seen enough magic in my day to know to stay away from it. I'd stay away from the Jarl's wizard in Dawnstar too.
If you wanna be a damn fool, go to the College in Winterhold instead.
You lookin' for Falion? Why don't you go bother those mages at their College in Winterhold and leave my brother alone?
Any aspiring mage would do well to look for the College in Winterhold. Head there, and you'll get what you're after.
Although our Jarl's humble wizard might be willing to help you too.
Magic? Got no good use for that here. Mages keep to their College in Winterhold. Go bother them.
Wish the Jarl's wizard would up and leave with ya.
Head north to Winterhold. There's a College there, they teach magic. Most Nords don't care for them.
Else you could go see the Jarl's wizard. Might be able to help you.
Magic? You're on the wrong side of Skyrim. You want Winterhold... that College there. They teach it.
Otherwise you can try the Jarl's wizard. I wouldn't, though.
Winterhold. You want the College there. They teach quite a bit.
Oh, I think you'll find that magic is rare in Skyrim. Winterhold, though... The College there has it in abundance. Look there if you wish to learn.
Not here. Definitely not here. You want to learn, join the College in Winterhold. They'll deal with it.
Magic is... frowned upon in Skyrim. Only the mages at the College of Winterhold teach it freely. If you wish to learn, join them.
A prospective student, are you? Well, I'm afraid I'm not much good at teaching. You should try your luck at the College of Winterhold.
I have no time or patience for a student. Perhaps the College of Winterhold will grant you admission.
That's right. College of Winterhold, just north of town. Hard to miss.
No? Very well, it's your choice.
Well done, indeed.
Well, you clearly possess the minimum aptitude required. Congratulations. I'll escort you up to the gate.
You'll want to speak with Mirabelle Ervine right away. And welcome to the College of Winterhold.
Good to see you again, friend! We've opened the mine back up. If you're here for work, I'll buy any ore you have.
I never thought I'd see Kolskeggr again.
The mine is just how I remember it.
It's good to be mining again.
I've never seen Pavo so happy. It's good to be back in Kolskeggr.
I feel like we're mining even more ore than before.
It's the rush of good fortune, my friend. It makes you work harder.
Are you worried the Forsworn might return?
I doubt the Forsworn would risk holding this mine a second time. They lost many of their warriors.
Do you remember the Legion? Fighting the Thalmor in the Great War?
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war.
We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
There were many good battles, friend. I miss those days.
You miss them? I don't know how many times I feared for my life.
Well I can't just tell that to any skeever that washes up.
From the look of you, I'm guessing you're more looking to cause some trouble for the Horkers.
Haldyn will take my hide for this, but Skyrim's been feeling a bit confining lately.
We draw council at Japhet's Folly. The fools in Windhelm won't go near it, which is fine by us.
If you'll pardon me now, my crew needs gathering. Should be in Hammerfell before the other Horkers know who let slip their secret.
Aha! I knew you could do it! I just knew it! I knew the Dark Brotherhood would save me!
Here, just like I promised. This should fetch you a nice price. And thank you. Thank you again.
There you are. Look, I... I just wanted to say thanks for coming to find me. Back in Dawnstar. Crazy jester finally met his match, am I right?
The anticipation is killing me. Can you figure out who has the contract? Which one will you choose?
That twisted jester will pay for what's he's done...
I'm afraid I don't have a primary contract for you yet.
Why am I not surprised to learn Cicero is alive? I still can't stomach the little clown, but if you've welcomed him here, I won't question it.
Maybe I'll make the Potage le Magnifique, hmm? You may have killed the Gourmet, but true artistry never dies.
Maybe I'll make the Potage le Magnifique, hmm? But not the way you make it! Ha ha ha. No, certainly not...
I've been expecting you.
Should have figured the little lunatic would completely snap.
So, what of the old beggar, Narfi? Is it done? Has he groveled for his last septim?
How went your meeting with Ennodius Papius? Did you prove his paranoia legitimate?
I see you're back from Dawnstar. Beitild lies dead, I hope?
You're alive. Then I guess you haven't paid a visit to the vampire yet, hmm?
Please tell me you flayed that horrible bard alive and made a drum from his skin...
Taken care of that layabout Deekus, yet? Or does the idea of killing a fellow Argonian make your scales crawl?
No new boots? Does this mean the Argonian is still alive?
You smell like dead cat. Can I assume Ma'randru-jo has been taken care of?
How went your encounter with  Ma'randru-jo? Back in Hammerfell, I always loved watching two cats rip each other to shreds...
Hmph. No arrows protruding from your skull... Can I assume Anoriath is dead, then?
Ah, back from Fort Graymoor. The old servant has been put out of her misery, I hope?
So, you've returned from Mzinchaleft! A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. Assuming Maluril is actually... dead?
Back from your little vacation in Falkreath. So, did you enjoy the sights, sample the food... kill the housecarl?
You haven't faced that pirate captain yet, have you? Safia? I only ask because you're still alive...
So many contracts, so little time...
Will there ever come a time when the people of Skyrim no longer need our services? I think not.
Still here? What's the matter, can't handle what I'm throwing your way?
I wish I had more contracts to dole out. You handled those jobs like a born killer.
You reek of death, my friend. I salute you.
Remember the passphrase: [QUOTE]Silence, my brother.[QUOTE]
The Sanctuary is in the southern Pine Forest. Close to the road, but away from prying eyes.
Have you talked to Nazir? He's sure to have some additional contracts for you.
I don't have anything for you just yet. Please, talk to Nazir, and see what he has available.
I'm still trying to find a suitable contract for you. Continue to work with Nazir on the, um, supplemental assignments.
The Keeper will be arriving soon, with the body of the Night Mother. So many preparations to be made...
Go, take care of the Muiri contract. There will be plenty more, I promise you.
Why are you still standing there? Hurry, before the meeting begins.
Speak with Nazir and see if he has any contracts available. I need time to read Motierre's letter.
What are you waiting for? My husband is out there somewhere with that lunatic. Find them! Do what you've been tasked to do!
Shouldn't you be out ruining someone's special day?
Ah, good to see you, brother. Gearing up to kill the Emperor? Exciting times. Exciting times, indeed.
Ah, good to see you, sister. Gearing up to kill the Emperor? Exciting times. Exciting times, indeed.
Cicero is at your service, oh great and powerful Listener!
Let's kill someone.
Citizen?
You must be lost. The tavern is down the road a piece.
I'm fairly certain you wandered into the wrong building, friend...
Yes, Listener?
I am yours to command.
How may I serve you, my Listener?
Yes, Listener? How may I serve you?
Listener. It is an honor to stand before you.
How may I serve you, my Listener?
Please...
What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure.
It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...
Why are you people doing this?
Is it information you want?
This... this is about the inheritance, isn't it? All right! I'll tell you where I've hidden it.
It's in a hollowed-out tree stump. In the marsh, south of Solitude. Now please, you'll let me go now. Right?
Why don't you be a dear and let me go now. All right? I won't say a word to anyone. Our little secret. I promise.
You... you can't do this to me...
Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about that my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding.
Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me...
I just...  can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop.
Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...
So... wait. Cicero is alive? And we're all friends again? I swear, I can hardly keep up...
You know, I can still sell you some potions and such, or train you in alchemy.
I like it here. We should have moved to Dawnstar ages ago.
I can't wait to see what the future brings.
Do you need alchemy components? Or training?
Hello, Listener.
What do you think? Some more Nirnroot, maybe?
I learned to cook from my father. Ah, but that was a long time ago. Before, you know... I killed him. But let's not talk about that now.
I'll follow you till I'm dust in the breeze. You do realize that?
This place is already starting to feel like home. Must be all the bloodstains.
What do you need, Listener?
Listener, please... if Cicero is going to be a part of this Sanctuary I'll accept that. But can't you do something about the... dancing?
Got to admit, I find the Night Mother's presence... comforting.
The new initiates are working out well. Eager, dedicated, and not afraid to get their hands wet.
Things proceeding well, Listener?
Yes, Listener?
The Dark Brotherhood is on the rise again, Listener. I can feel it.
Cicero can talk for a moment. Just a moment. Then Mother must be... tended to.
Oh, I do wish to get to know you better. But I must tend to mother. Maybe we can talk for just a moment...
Yes, Listener? How can Cicero be of service?
You didn't die. A battle you live through is a great honor.
Did you ever want to return to your stronghold? Go back to your family?
What? Oh gods, I don't want to die...
Excuse me? What kind of question is that?
Me? Ha! Are you serious?
My name is Fultheim. I'm a soldier. Well, mercenary, really. You know, a... a sellsword. I've lived in Skyrim all my life.
That's all! I'm a nobody, really. So can't you just let me go?
None of your damned business who I am! If you're going to kill me, just do it already!
As Mara is my witness, if I didn't have this hood on right now I would spit right in your face...
Ahhh... Vasha, at your service. Obtainer of goods, taker of lives, and defiler of daughters.
Have you not heard of me? Perhaps I will have my people carve my name in your corpse, as a reminder.
What did I do? Please, whatever it is, I'm sorry.
I don't have time for this nonsense. I've got a home to keep and children to feed. Now let me out of here!
Tell you what. You release me, and I promise my associates won't hunt you down like an animal and butcher you in the street. It's a win-win.
I really just needed something to encourage you to go out into the world and spread merriment.
And you did just that! I haven't been so entertained in at least a hundred years.
Just a prank? Just a prank? The Daedric Lord of Debauchery does not deal in mere [QUOTE]pranks.[QUOTE]
This may have begun as a minor amusement, but it wasn't long before I realized you'd make a more interesting bearer of my not-quite-holy staff.
Let's be honest, here. I don't always think my decisions through.  But you... you're going places.
Maybe a little influence from your old uncle Sanguine could help adjust your course a bit...
My pleasure. But I think it's time for you to go. No fun keeping you locked up in here with the staff.
Wake up!
That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this.
Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.
It worked! I knew you'd come, I just knew it!
I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. With the body, and the... the things. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
Of course you are! I prayed, and you came, and now you'll accept my contract!
It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract.
You don't have to say anything. There's no need. You're here, so I know you'll accept my contract.
My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall.
The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us.
So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament. Now you're here! And you can kill Grelod the Kind!
Finally! My prayers have been answered!
You've come at last! I knew you would!
Grelod is the headmistress of Honorhall Orphanage. But not for long.
It's Honorhall Orphanage, in Riften.
Please don't kill Constance Michel. She really is kind.
Well? Is it done?
Grelod the Kind. Is she... you know?
What do you want? You have no business being in here!
Riff-raff! That's all you Riften people are!
This is an orphanage, not an inn. Begone from here.
You don't scare me.
You're trying to frighten me, hmm? Do your worst!
I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.
The what? Why how dare you! I will not be intimidated in my own orphanage! Get out! Get out this instant!
Aretino? Why that little bastard! You tell him I'm coming for him! And when I find him, it will be the beating of his miserable life!
What are you staring at, you worthless piece of gutter trash? I simply must start locking the doors again...
Is someone there?
What was that?
Huh?
Where are you?
You can't hide from me!
Over here!
Be careful!
Hey, watch it!
Don't do that.
What are you doing that for?
You could have just asked.
I saw you do that, you know.
Ha! Found you!
What do you think you're doing?
You're not supposed to be in here.
Oh no! By the gods! This can't be happening!
You dirty thief!
Stop, thief!
I understand.
Of course.
How much?
It can't be helped.
Not my problem.
It would seem so.
It's all in this note.
You've done well.
Maybe you can help me.
Thank you. Here, this is for you.
Just bring it back to me.
I can pay you.
Okay. Just this once.
How can I argue with that?
Okay, okay. You've talked me into it.
No need to get rough!
Whatever you say!
Don't hurt me! You win.
A little coin always greases the wheels.
Gold solves most problems, doesn't it?
For that price? Sure.
You expect me to believe that?
Nah. I don't think so.
That doesn't change anything.
I'll teach you to talk to me that way!
Hope you're willing to back those words up with your fists!
I don't have to take that from you!
What? Nooo!
We've got an assassin! Check the shadows!
Gods help us!
What in the...?
I suppose that'll do. Dibella teaches us forgiveness, after all. Even for a drunk like you.
I would need to challenge the chief, and take his head, to return home. I'd rather stay here.
Don't tell me you, of all people, are afraid of a battle.
If you had to kill your own brother to be allowed back home, you'd think twice as well.
You! You've got a lot of nerve showing yourself in this town again. What do you have to say for yourself?
Sorry's not good enough! Not while my Gleda is still out there, alone and afraid. You kidnapped her and sold her to that Giant.
Is that so? Does the name Gleda ring a bell? The star beauty of my farm? Kidnapped by a drunk lout and sold to a Giant?
You'd better remember her right fast, before I call the guards and have you hauled away.
You're damned right it does. I'll never breed another prize-winning goat like Gleda!
And don't you think of coming back to Rorikstead until you get her back from that Giant.
You really don't remember stealing a goat and selling her to a Giant? Are you thick?
Go get her! At least she's bound to follow you back - you smell just like the fermented feed she likes.
Gleda! And not a scratch on her! Happy day!
I still can't figure out why you stole her. You left a note explaining it, but half of it was gibberish and the rest had mead spilled on it.
Only bit I could make out was [QUOTE]repaying Ysolda in Whiterun,[QUOTE] and even that's mostly scribbles. Guess you could try there.
So, you're finally back. Look, I've been patient, but you still owe me.
It's not about the money, really. I wouldn't have given you the wedding ring on credit if you weren't so obviously in love.
But if there isn't going to be a wedding, the least you can do is give the ring back. That was one of my best pieces.
Aw, what's wrong? Did the engagement fall through? Look, how about we call it even, as long as you bring back the wedding ring?
That's really a shame - I was so looking forward to the wedding. You said you'd have all the most interesting guests.
How could you forget? It was the sweetest story I'd ever heard.
You met at the full moon, under the biggest tree in Witchmist Grove, surrounded by fireflies. It was straight out of a storybook.
Excellent! Sorry it didn't work out with you and your lady. I know how excited you were for the wedding.
You kept saying it would be a huge ceremony at Morvunskar. You said you even had some magic staff there that would handle all the guests.
I really don't have time to deal with you right now. Please just let me get back to my work.
But this is supposed to be your work.
Head to the Riften jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften.
You'll be well paid for your time.
Did she, now? Well, as it turns out, there are a few lingering contracts we haven't had the chance to complete just yet.
And more, dribbling in from time to time. I'll assign them to you as they become available. To be completed at your leisure.
You've come far, mortal. No doubt you seek to enter Potema's Sanctum.
I can see to that. We'll need plenty of fresh corpses to rebuild her army, you see.
None can stand against the Wolf Queen!
Well? What is the meaning of this?
I'm sorry, I'm afraid I don't understand.
Don't play coy. You asked to see a specific member of the College. Here he is. Now what is it that you want?
Don't play coy. You asked to see a specific member of the College. Here she is. Now what is it that you want?
There's been a misunderstanding. Clearly I should not be here. I shall simply take my leave.
What? What trickery is this? You're not going anywhere until I find out what you're up to!
I am not [QUOTE]up to[QUOTE] anything. I apologize if I have offended in any way.
I'm not sure what just happened but I assure you I will get to the bottom of it.
Whatever it is those Psijics are up to. They cannot be trusted.
For all we know, he's here to scout out the College. I'm sure they want to undermine our efforts.
This! This... Orb. The Eye of Magnus, whatever you want to call it. It's clearly powerful, and no doubt they want it for themselves!
I expect to be informed if they make any future attempts to contact you.
Great Malacath, we beseech you, aid us in our time of need...
Well, now that you mention it, there is something I've been trying to get my hands on.
I'm glad I'll have you beside me in there. This place chills my blood, and I don't care who knows it.
How did you get it? No, never mind, I probably shouldn't know.
I see... it looks like Suvaris has been traveling to Dawnstar to meet with a pirate crew there.
Get to Dawnstar and see what you can find out about these rogues. I'd wager they won't be too far from the tavern.
Try to find out where their fortress is. The captain, Stig Salt-Plank, has to know something.
Heard of them? I've been captaining a crew for 'em well on nine years now. What's it to you?
Know about them? Lad, you're looking at them.
Know about them? Lass, you're looking at them.
Just in time. This is Adelaisa, one of my superiors from the Company.
She's been dispatched to... eh... see to it that we get back on schedule.
You should probably speak to her.
I can't express how much easier you've made my job.
Maybe Adelaisa will finally ease up, but I expect she won't.
Ah, yes, your pay. The Company thanks you for your services. Should we ever be able to help you, stop by.
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started.
Pirates, you see.
Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell. Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe.
No. Not like this.
What do you need, guardian?
Yes, champion of Azura?
The Twilight watches us all, guardian.
Just glad all that business with Malyn is over with. What did you need?
I don't like doing business with Azura's faithful. Make it quick.
Look at me when I'm talking to you, eh?
You start flapping that jaw of yours or I'll start flapping it for you. You understand me?
Where'd you stash it?
Am I going have to beat it out of you? Is that what you want?
