I. I don't know, it wasn't me. I swear!
Honest, I didn't take it!
(Sigh) Let's just kill them both, eh?
(Whimpering)
(Sobbing)
Go on, then. Deliver my message to Sibbi.
I may not be fond of Letrush, but even I've got to admit he's got the upper hand.
Ah, well, I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in Skyrim. He agreed to sell.
I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal.
It does not.
I want you to talk to Sibbi for me. Then, I want you to bring me Frost and the Lineage Papers that prove the horse's worth.
Good man. You won't regret it.
Ah, you're a smart woman. That's exactly what I wanted to hear.
That's a real shame. You would've fit the bill nicely.
Don't tell me - Sibbi and Louis Letrush? Well, Sibbi is in jail and Letrush is certainly welcome to try. My hired help is more than a match for him.
I'm aware of who stole Frost. And why.
I had no idea you were a man of violence. What exactly are your intentions in this blessed place?
I had no idea you were a woman of violence. What exactly are you intending to do here?
You would violate this marvel of Kynareth's glory to fix that half-breed stump in Whiterun?
That's abominable. Barbaric. I'll have no part of this. Why didn't you tell me what you intended?
With pleasure. Nature has a way of finding vengeance, though. You walk a bleak path, friend. One that will lead to suffering.
Well... yes. There is something.
It won't repair the tree back at the temple, but we could bring them a new one.
Very well. I can't stop you. But I can't bear to watch it, either.
Follow me. I think I can convince the tree to help us.
I am a traveler. A pilgrim. I follow the voice of Kynareth wherever it can be heard.
I've dreamed of seeing Eldergleam for years. Might I travel alongside you? I promise not to get in the way.
I thank you for your kindness.
I understand. Some journeys must be taken alone. I'll be here if you change your mind.
You've been here for a while, right? What was it like back when we could still make runs out to the coast?
Well, before that cave-in sealed our ships in here we could loot any size ship we wanted.
Where did you keep all that loot?  I've been here almost a year and haven't seen any of it.
The Captain has it locked away in that drowned ship by his quarters. He says it's [QUOTE]to keep it safe[QUOTE] but I know he's just keeping it for himself.
If only we could get our hands on that treasure. We could get out of here and never look back.
Maybe. For now just lay low and do your job. I have a feeling we'll be rid of the Captain soon...
Yeah, rub it in. Just imagine what I could get done with my full power and none of these pesky [QUOTE]morals.[QUOTE]
Still, I've got this axe, and even if I can't use it, I'm sure someone would make a deal for it. Maybe I'll have a word with Molag Bal...
I knew I could trust you!
Yeah, yeah, dog gets master, master gets cosmic axe, everyone's happy. Just get over here, mutt.
Don't worry. I'll make sure he sees the light. I trusted you, now you trust me.
Well... I guess you could say I got on his nerves. I tend to be the voice of reason and he finds that... irksome.
He couldn't just kill me, you see. We're technically part of each other. But he was able to banish me from his domain.
Of course, because of our separation, Vile is now much weaker. I guess he figured it was a small price to pay for not having to listen to me anymore.
Oh, if I had my full power, granting that would be trivial.
I'd simply snap my fingers, and everyone in Skyrim would die. War resolved.
Really? Power? You're a dragonborn; you already have more power than most people who aren't immense, fire-breathing monsters.
Really? Power? Haven't you already killed enough of your foes using the more mundane means at your disposal? Swords, magic, etc.? How... uninspired.
As much as I hate to say it, you're almost as powerful as I am right now. But that's just because half of my power resides in that mutt, Barbas.
Come to think of it, I know of a win-win situation for both of us.
There's an axe. An incredibly powerful axe. An axe powerful enough for me to have quite a bit of fun, indeed.
If you bring it to me, I'll grant you my boon. No strings attached. No messy surprises. At least, not for you.
As I recall, it's resting in Rimerock Burrow. Barbas can lead you right to it. The little mutt might even earn his place back at my side.
In Rimerock Burrow, there's an artifact called the Rueful Axe. Bring it to me, and I'll take Barbas back. Simple as that.
I... you're right of course. It can be hard to hear the winds of Kynareth when all you hear are the rabble in the temple.
Death feeds new life.
I'm sure that, in time, this little sapling will grow into a new Gildergreen that will tower over Whiterun. Thank you.
One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables.
If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning.
What do you say?
I think we have a nice wealthy home for you to break into. Think you can clear the place of valuables and keep it quiet?
These people just inherited some heirlooms from a relative. Good timing for us, bad timing for them, eh?
Just got a tip on this house... should be stuffed with loot. Care to head over there and find out?
Got a message from one of my people that this place just came into some coin. Should be a good target. Want to take it?
Someone with connections to our Guild wants us to hit this place and send a message by clearing it of valuables. You want to handle it?
Good timing. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail. How about you make them pay for it.
You can give this house a once over. I hear they're fairly well-off and probably have lots of good stuff ripe for the picking. Sound good?
The owner of this place just got an inheritance from a relative lost in the war. Sound like something you can sink your teeth into?
Milk drinker.
You're here! I was beginning to think you might not make it.
What is it... what has happened to the Gildergreen? I have traveled long here to worship beneath its branches.
It was taken by a lightning strike. Wish I had time to deal with it, but it's hard enough with all these wounded from the war.
Please, don't just let it stay like this. It's disgraceful.
Here.
Well, here as in this plane. Mundus. Tamriel. Nearby, relatively speaking.
On the cosmological scale, it's all nearby.
Under deep. Below the dark. The hidden keep. Tower Mzark.
Alftand. The point of puncture, of first entry, of the tapping.
Delve to its limits, and Blackreach lies just beyond.
But not all can enter there. Only Septimus knows the hidden key to loose the lock to jump beneath the deathly rock.
Oh, but the Dwemer had more than even Septimus expected.
This will take time to decryptify. Be on your way, and Septimus will find  you if he has further need.
The ice entombs the heart. The bane of Kagrenac and Dagoth Ur.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me.
The Elder Scroll gives insight deeper than the deep ones, though. To bring about the opening.
Dig, Dwemer, in the beyond. I'll know your lost unknown and rise to your depths.
When the top level was built, no more could be placed. It was and is the maximal apex.
How long will it be sung? My feet were set upon the rock but it turned to mud and drew me down.
It lick the panes and smokes the glass...
The box contains the heart. The essence of a god.
I have devoted my life to the Elder Scrolls, but their knowledge is a passing awareness when compared to the encompassing mind of divinity.
The Dwemer were the last to touch it. It was thought to have been destroyed by the Nerevarine, but my lord told me otherwise.
I'll bring you everything we have on them, but it's not much.
So don't get your hopes up. It's mostly lies, leavened with rumor and conjecture.
Never thought I'd see you again.
We were told you may be coming.
Return when you have completed the Great Hunt.
Greetings, fellow hunter.
Lead on.
May Hircine guide our blades.
We follow you, hunt-master.
The Bloodmoon lights the way.
Show us the path to the prey.
Hircine chose you to lead the Great Hunt. So lead.
A sad time.
I've been looking for a way to appease Hircine.
There is a certain beast in these lands. Large, majestic.
It's said that Hircine will commune with whoever slays it. I tracked it into these woods, but then had my... accident with the child.
I want to beg his forgiveness. Give him back the ring. But while I'm stuck in here, the beast wanders free.
Mind your own business.
We've got nothing to talk about.
Leave me alone.
Excellent work, soldier. I have to admit, I had my doubts it even existed. Did you run into any trouble?
That's what I like to hear. I'll get the full report from Legate Rikke. Now then...
That's not for you to decide. Soldier.
I wouldn't have sent you in the first place if it wasn't going to be worth it. Now then...
Yes. Well, I didn't respond as quickly to the Legate's suggestion as perhaps I should have.
But at least we ended up with the damn crown. Now then...
By all means, let's hear it. It's the least I could do, since you already helped me grant one final wish for my last worshippers...
They were suffering so from vampirism, and begged me for a cure. Then you came and ended their misery! I couldn't have planned it better myself.
So, what's your heart's desire? What kind of deal can we strike?
Woof.
Woof.
Well, well. Hello there, big man.
Hello there, miss.
Barbas, at your service.
Ah, there you are. I've been waiting for you to arrive.
Collect the Rueful Axe from Rimerock Burrow, and I believe we'll have a deal.
Ah, you've got the axe! And my dog. Splendid.
You have business with Clavicus Vile?
It's nice to be rid of that detestable dog. Things are so much more fun without his incessant preaching.
Yes, I think you'll be just what I need.
Very funny. My master is Clavicus Vile, Daedric prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.
Skyrim is now host to giant, flying lizards and two-legged cat-men... and you're surprised by me? Yes. I just talked. And am continuing to do so.
Lead the way.
All right, then. We'll get together later.
Ugh. That insufferable pup? Forget it. Request denied. No deal.
I'm glad to be rid of him. Even if it does mean I'm stuck in this pitiful shrine, in the back end of... nowhere.
Well... perhaps there is a way he could earn his place back at my side. Maybe. But no promises.
Thank you. Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines.
I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there.
If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?
Excellent work. A hero and his faithful companion, retrieving the ancient artifact for the prince. It's almost... storybook.
Ah, but it almost seems a shame to give a weapon like that away, doesn't it? I suppose I could be persuaded to let you keep it...
But only if you use the axe to kill Barbas. Simple as that.
And?
Absolutely! Now I can reabsorb his body, and return to full power. All without having to listen to his whining.
Oh, sure, he'll be back in a century or two, but think of the fun I can have 'til then.
Enjoy that axe! And don't worry about poor old Barbas. After all, he really should have picked a better friend...
And I could absorb the spirit of poor, dead Barbas. He'd still be reunited with me.
And I'm sure Barbas doesn't want me to have that axe. He'd want it this way.
The choice is yours, friend. We're all counting on you to make the right decision. Put him out of our misery!
Hrmph. You're no fun at all. Guess I'll have to make my own fun elsewhere.
And with the pup back, I'll be restored to my full power. There's a whole world just waiting for me!
It's a shame, isn't it?
So, have you gotten Nettlebane back from those filthy Hagravens yet?
Do you have the Eldergleam sap?
Welcome, child.
Was I correct in hearing that you were traveling to the grove of the Eldergleam?
What's happened to the Gildergreen is a travesty.
Please move quickly. Eldergleam awaits us.
Is it much further to the sanctuary?
I can't believe I've finally made it here.
It's like it was in my dreams.
I can almost hear its heart.
Oh. I... well, I honestly didn't expect you to come back. Of course, I'm glad you did!
Now... I don't really want to touch that thing, though. Do you think you could handle the next steps?
Wonderful. I'll use it to repair the tree. Thank you so much for all your help.
But... I can't run the Temple without the support of people who are inspired by the Gildergreen. How can this little tree bring new worshippers?
Boss was looking for you - said he'd be up at the summit. Better not keep him waiting.
Hey! Somebody get down here! Help!
Anybody there?
I know I heard something.
Hello? Who's there?
You can't hide from me forever.
I know you're here somewhere.
When I find you, you're dead.
You afraid to fight me?
I know you can hear me!
Come on, show yourself!
Stay away from me!
I'm going to find you.
You won't get away.
Did you hear something?
Hello? Who's there?
Is... is someone there?
Ahh!
Now you're mine!
Thought I heard something.
Aha!
Time to end this little game!
I knew it!
Come on!
Here we go.
Hey!
Ahhh!
You're dead!
Get him!
You're mine!
By Ysmir, you won't leave here alive!
Oh, no you don't!
You're as good as dead!
Don't just stand there! Kill him!
Don't just stand there! Kill her!
Well well. Another maggot to squash beneath my boot.
Attack!
To arms, boys! To arms!
What in the bloody blazes?
Never should have come here...
I guess I was just hearing things.
Hmm. Nothing here after all.
Must be my imagination.
I was sure I heard something.
Must have been nothing.
Just getting jumpy I guess.
Mind's playing tricks on me...
I hope there aren't any more.
That takes care of that.
Good enough.
Teach you to mess with me.
All over now.
Phew!
That's the last of them.
Is it safe?
Damn, where'd you go?
Where are you hiding?
I'll find you...
Come back here!
Nobody here anymore.
Must've scared 'em off.
Cleared out, I guess.
Guess it's all clear now.
Oh well. Must have run off.
No sign of 'em.
Nobody here now.
There you are.
There you are!
I knew I'd find you!
Can't hide from me.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you.
Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.
Ah. Indeed, indeed. I do remember.
Delphine really is alive, then? You'd better come in then and tell me how you found me and what you want.
This'll just take a moment...
This one always sticks... there we go.
Only a couple more.
There we are!
Come in, come in! Make yourself at home!
Please. Come in. Musn't talk in the Ratway.
Come in, come in. Too many ears out there.
Come in. Quickly now.
It was a cold day. The end of Frostfall is nearly winter in the Jerall Mountains.
We heard the news at Cloud Ruler by courier, riding hard from the Imperial City.
30th of Frostfall, 171. Thirty years ago. The Great War started that day.
The Thalmor ambassador delivered his ultimatum to the Emperor Titus Mede: the heads of every Blades agent within the Aldmeri Dominion.
I knew, that day, that it was truly the beginning of the end.
And no doubt you're one of them. Leave me alone!
What's that you said? Dragonborn? Then... there really is hope after all?
You'd better come inside. Quickly now. Thalmor agents have been seen in the Ratway.
This looks like the way out! I was starting to wonder if we'd ever make it.
This way.
Come on, hurry up.
Better to stick together down here.
You can't shake us off that easily. Let's see what's here!
This is it. We've found Gathrik's tomb.
Well? There must be a way through. Look around.
That's done it! Let's get in there.
My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated.
He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
I know, I know... Wars to fight, dragons to confront, guild business to conduct.
Hey! What's this?
Who left that here?
Well! Finders, keepers as they say.
If nobody wants that, I'll take it.
Damn shame to leave that lying around.
It's a bit worn, but I'll take it.
Looks like it's my lucky day.
Hmm. What's this?
Hey! That's my sword.
Don't touch that dagger! It's mine.
I don't think so. That axe is mine.
Keep away from that bow. It's mine.
Hands off. That's my armor now!
You're too slow. I saw it first.
I don't think so!
I saw it first! I'm taking it.
Not if I get it first.
No. It's mine!
We'll see about that.
I'm taking it anyway.
No!
I think not.
You can take it over my dead body!
If it's a fight you want, it's a fight you'll get.
Back off!
You'll have to take it from me.
Your blood won't bother me!
You'll have to fight me for it.
I'll hurt you if I have to.
You're too slow and stupid to take it from me.
That can be arranged.
What's all the commotion?
They're fighting over that thing, I think.
Someone's going to get hurt.
Damn. Another fight.
Send another one in here! Send two! I don't care!
One of you get in here! I could put all of you down!
What are you waiting for? I know you want to kill me. Now's your chance!
Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown.
We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it.
The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as I finish up here.
The Stormcloaks are here in force. Stick close and follow orders so we don't stir up the whole place against us.
Looks like the damned rebels got here first. No matter, we have the element of surprise. Prepare to move out.
You ready, auxiliary?
Follow me.
This isn't a damn summer picnic! Hurry up. We need to hit them before they know we're here.
Oh... Oh how marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. Please, everyone. Enjoy.
Oh... Oh how marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. It.... I....
I think something's... wrong... I...
Charmed.
The Gourmet. Leave it to Titus to spare no expense.
I prefer a good roast duck. But your soup will do.
I've been waiting for this opportunity for a long time.
So glad we kept you in Skyrim. Serving your Emperor was worth the wait, of course.
You're not at all what I expected. I imagined you'd be fatter, honestly.
You've done your duty and we're all very grateful. Now... I'd like to eat.
Emperor Pelagius III.
Now surely even you know about Pelagius' decree? On his deathbed - oh, and this was inspired - he forbade... death! That's right! Death! Outlawed!
Typical Imperial rot. You speak of Skyrim like you know the land, know its people. You're from Cyrodiil! You know nothing about us! Nothing!
Oh, I know enough. I know those trouble-making Stormcloaks refuse to submit to Imperial authority. Such seditious behavior. Why it's treason!
And when the elves marched into your beloved Cyrodiil, and everyone took up arms against them, wasn't that treason? Against the Dominion? Huh?
Why that's not the same thing at all. The Dominion were invaders. Conquerors. We had to fight them, to preserve our own way of life.
My point exactly.
As I said, go speak with Gabriella. She's been assisting me with your next contract. This Emperor business, well... it does involve everyone.
Dear brother. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
Dear sister. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
You and I have business to discuss. Ah, but you have not yet reported back to Astrid, have you? Do that, and then we shall talk.
Easy, easy. Don't get up so quickly.
How are you feeling?
No, I saved your life. My arrow was tipped with a unique paralytic poison. It slowed your heart and kept you from bleeding out.
Had I intended to kill you, we wouldn't be having this conversation.
This better be important.
There's little time for talk, what do you want?
Yes, yes, what is it now?
You're quite noisy for someone who claims to be a thief.
Must you keep stopping?
What? What is it?
Glad the antidote is taking effect.
Quickly, what did you want?
Well? Grelod the Kind. Is she... you know?
Sadly, yes. Even the townsfolk have taken to calling her [QUOTE]Grelod the Kind.[QUOTE] Her very existence has become something of a running joke.
Grelod runs this orphanage because she's old, and set in her ways, and doesn't know any other life. These children need love, and comfort. I try...
But... I'm sorry, you should go. The children aren't up for adoption, and it's cruel to get their hopes up. Besides, Grelod hates... visitors.
Hello.
Oh, hi, I'm glad I ran into you. I was wondering if...
Hello, ladies! Is there anything a big strong man can do for you this fine day?
I don't know. If you see any big strong men around, let us know, will you?
<Laughter>
<Laughter>
Harpies, every one of them.
Oh, come now. Don't go away mad.
Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?
My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.
Fine, leave me to die.
Wait here. I'll be right back with your reward.
Yes, my youngest son. He's a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent.
He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.
So the disgusting pig sent you to bother me? One day, I'll tear his face apart so he can leave me alone.
My father doesn't know anything about me.
But I know about him. And about the war. More than he might think.
Now, if you're going to get those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.
That was a long time ago.
I told you. I'm done with all that. There's enough blood on these hands. I'm interested in creating things now.
The Prince of Plots usually gets what she wants. I'm surprised I'm not dead already. She must have had some reason to keep me alive so long.
Mind my words or I'll mind them for you: I'm slave to no man, no god, and no Daedra.
Boethiah talks about leaving your mark, a sign of your passing.... Well, you can make a mark on the world without treachery and murder.
Whenever a man's life is saved by armor made with these hands, these hands have changed that man's destiny and his family's.
So you can tell that heartless Daedra bitch I'm done doing her dirty work.
A man who feels no fear has no heart. I know fear. But it does not control me.
If you desire to fight me, then let's get this over with.
Hmph.
That remains to be seen.
I desired stealth and secrecy, but you executed the task with as much subtlety as a enrage mammoth.
But my purpose was ultimately gained. My previous champion was erased, and a new one born.
If you can learn to be subtle in rendering death, perhaps I will share more of my power with you.
You have done well, my Champion. You have earned my respect, a feat few manage and live to tell about.
I shall write your name upon the Tablet of Absolute Darkness.
Ahhh. Quite fine my friend. Quite fine.
So sad what happened to young Elisif. Tragic really. Such a young and pretty girl.
Was in over her head, I'm afraid.
But we should be done with murders in the Blue Palace. I've stepped up security around here.
Hmm... Yes, I've heard about all that fuss. I myself know it's all a terrible, terrible misunderstanding. I'm quite sure you're innocent in all this.
This one time only, I'll grant you special immunity for any past transgressions, real or perceived.
But going forward, I'm sure you realize that your fate is in your own hands. And the law can not be bent for personal friendships.
May your will carve itself upon the world.
Well, soldier? Can you do this?
What do you say?
Elder Scrolls. Indeed.
The Empire. They absconded with them. Or so they think. The ones they saw. The ones they thought they saw.
I know of one. Forgotten. Sequestered.
But I cannot go to it, not poor Septimus, for I... I have arisen beyond its grasp.
I can almost... hear them. I feel their life energy. Come, I will make the mixture.
Halt in the name of the Jarl Balgruuf the Greater!
Halt in the name of the Jarl Hrongar.
That's close enough.
Where's Anuriel?
Halt in the name of the Jarl!
It's a little late for that, don't you think?
He wants the city this badly, he can fight me for it.
She wants the city this badly, she can fight me for it.
She's watching over the others. Look alive now.
Somehow I doubt that will persuade them.
Stay back, lord!
No, Igmund. It's too dangerous.
Stop right there! Were I can see you.
Stay back, lord!
I'll be damned if I let this rabble take my city without raising my own sword.
I will not surrender Markarth without raising my own sword in her defense.
Riften denies the Emperor. You are here illegally. Stand down and you will be arrested and tried in the morning. Resist and you will die.
If they want my city, they're going to have to take it from me personally.
Protect the Jarl with your lives!
Kill them all. Protect the Jarl at all costs!
As you wish.
Protect the Jarl!
Protect the Jarl with your lives!
Aye!
Welcome to the Legion, auxiliary. Listen up.
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
And Mercer Frey?
That's quite a noble sentiment for someone in our... well, in your line of work.
My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Then... it's over and my death wasn't in vain.
I owe you a great deal, Nightingale.
Yes, my friend? How may I help?
Yes, fellow Nightingale?
I wish I could help you, but I've been a prisoner in this very chamber for the last quarter century.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?
My, my. What do we have here?
It's been a number of years since I've set foot on your world. Or perhaps it's been moments. One tends to lose track.
So... once again the Key has been stolen and a [QUOTE]champion[QUOTE] returns it to the Sepulcher.
Now that Ebonmere has been restored, you stand before me awaiting your accolades; a pat on your head... a kiss on your cheek.
What you fail to realize is your actions were expected and represent nothing more than the fulfillment of your agreement.
Don't mistake my tone for displeasure, after all, you've obediently performed your duties to the letter.
But we both know this has little to do with honor and oaths and loyalty. It's about the reward; the prize.
Fear not. You'll have your trinkets, your desire for power, your hunger for wealth.
I bid you to drink deeply from the Ebonmere, mortal. For this is where the Agent of Nocturnal is born.
The Oath has been struck, the die has been cast and your fate awaits you in the Evergloam.
Here's where you need to go.
Check your map.
Don't mock it, pup. Even the lowliest beasts can kill the weak and arrogant. We'll try more powerful enemies next, if you survive this.
Fine. Take them and be gone. Never return here, or else you'll face my full wrath.
Are you attempting to threaten me? After I've been so hospitable?
Well, then you won't be leaving here at all.
Something wrong, Ahlam?
Are you alright, Ahlam? You haven't seemed yourself today.
What's wrong, dear friend? You seem... distracted today.
Oh, it's Nazeem. He's been spending more and more time fawning over the Jarl. I swear, we're hardly ever home at the same time anymore.
It's nothing, I just... It's Nazeem. How did we get to this point, Danica? Is there no love left between us?
Hmm? Oh, well... To be honest, I was just thinking of Nazeem. The gap between us seems to be widening. He is just so... self-absorbed.
Now, now, my friend. You must look on the bright side. If soldiers storm the city, there's a good chance your husband may get killed.
Let those soldiers come here! You've never seen me throw incense. I could fell a giant.
If you don't mind me saying so, Ahlam, your husband is a damn fool. Any moment spent thinking about him is a moment wasted.
Ahlam, let's be honest. Your husband is an arrogant, domineering buffoon. These are the words you used to describe him to me... remember?
Oh dearest, who cares? So your husband is a lout. The work you do here, with me, is invaluable. The people of Whiterun know your true worth.
But it's more than that. Nazeem is obsessed with this civil war, as is all of Skyrim. I swear, it will consume us all.
Maybe Nazeem's obsession has merit. This civil war seems so big, so unceasing... I'm afraid, Danica. Afraid for us all.
Ha! Well, when you put it like that, it certainly puts things into perspective. But enough wallowing. And thank you, Danica.
Oh, you are terrible. You do know that, right? Ha ha ha ha ha.
Sir, we really must talk.
Balgruuf, my Jarl. A word, if I may.
I need but a moment of your time, my lord.
Speak.
What is it?
You've got sixty seconds. Go.
Well... It's your son. Nelkir. The boy has been acting increasingly peculiar. Moreso than normal, I mean. Something really should be done...
We really must discuss the security here in Dragonsreach. Perhaps we could limit patrols in the city, and retain more guards here?
There's been talk again in the streets. A general fear that the giants may move south, and then... Well, you understand.
One of the servants had a wonderful idea. Fireproofing Dragonsreach. In case of attack by, um... air.
My daughter Adrianne wants to forge a new sword for you. Now, it wouldn't be a Skyforge blade, I know, but she really is quite gifted...
I think the time might be right for another public appearance. Maybe address the patrons at the Bannered Mare? Or visit Jorrvaskr?
Damn it, Proventus. I've got war lurking just outside my gates, and this is what you offer me? This? Begone.
Yes, yes. Take care of it, Proventus. Whatever it is you're talking about...
Proventus, you're my steward. Your job is to offer me counsel. This? This is not counsel.
Hmm... All right, yes, I see your point. Make the necessary arrangements.
Of course, sir.
Yes, my lord.
As you say, my Jarl.
Don't you need my help?
Well, I... If you're sure...
I'll just be on my way then. Please do be careful, and thank you.
Well, I was only trying to help.
Fine, I'll just save myself then. Thank you for letting me out of that cage.
I was only trying to help you, you know!
I hope the Caller turns you inside out!
I shall do my best.
So you do. Thank you, this will help quite a bit.
Good morning, wife.
Hello, husband. You're rising late. You spent too long at the Sleeping Giant last night, didn't you?
Hello, husband. You slept well?
Ah. Uh. Of course I'm not just rising. You must have been out when I woke up.
Like a stone.
Well, I'd better get to work. I have to fix another saw blade for Gerdur's mill.
Take care, husband.
Expecting free information, eh? Help me deal with business first, then we'll see how I can help you.
Besides, you look like your pockets are a little light on coin, am I right?
And I'm busy. You help me out, and I'll help you out. That's just how it is.
What is life's greatest illusion?
Welcome home.
I believe the Legate gave you an order. I expect you to follow it. Dismissed.
Deliver your report to Legate Rikke.
In joining the Legion, you'll be taking an oath binding you to the service of the Emperor and thus to every citizen of the Empire.
Are you prepared to make that commitment?
Changed your mind? Decided you want to soldier for the Empire after all?
Well, then. Repeat after me.
[QUOTE]Upon my honor I do swear undying loyalty to the Emperor, Titus Mede II...[QUOTE]
Well, then. Repeat after me.
[QUOTE]Upon my honor I do swear undying loyalty to the Emperor...[QUOTE]
I see... Well, the Legion will still be here when you change your mind. Rikke believes in you. And I'm starting to see why.
Consider this. What greater glory than to serve the Emperor and his citizens here in Skyrim, in these days of greatest need?
Gaius Maro still lives. I am surprised. I had assumed you were more... competent.
I don't deal in land or property. Now, if you're looking for goods, you've come to the right person.
Hey! You dropped this back there.
You left this back there. Figured you'd be wantin' it. Here ya go.
I think you accidentally mislaid this, dear. Here you go.
You dropped this. Good thing I found it and not someone else, otherwise you might have lost it for good.
You left this over there. You want it back, right? Here.
I think you dropped this! Good thing I brought it to you, huh?
You should take more care, leaving things lying about. Here.
Excuse me. You misplaced this, I believe? There you go. Take care now.
You left this over there. You're lucky - someone else might have kept it for himself. Here you go.
Sing you a special song tonight, beautiful lass?
Not now, I'm working.
Bah. You're always working. Why else would I spend so much time here?
Mikael is quite the songbird. Maybe he's the reason you're here all the time.
Perhaps it's because there's no better way to face the cold Skyrim nights than with a belly full of ale?
Aye, the bard's got talent, I'll give him that. You just make sure his music is the only thing you're admiring.
Oh, there's a better way.
A buxom barmaid between the sheets will keeps me plenty warm.
Better yet, she won't make my head ring the morning after.
Oh Jon, darling. You know you're the only stone-biting, knuckle-dragging Nord for me.
Ha! That's my girl.
Saadia dear?
Oh Saadia...
Yes, mum?
Don't forget to polish those glasses later.
You still need to remove that blood stain. From the... incident.
Just a reminder, sweetie - the blankets still need to be washed.
We're running low on the Black-Briar mead. In a couple days I'll have you make a run, fetch some more.
I'll be needing you to mop the place down extra tonight. Lots of spills!
Of course, mum.
Oh, yes, Miss Hulda.
Certainly, mum.
Oh yes, mum. I'll make sure it gets done.
Well, look at this. Another city rat crawled outside the walls. I don't suppose you've come up here to tell old Froki about your supposed Divines?
Just what we need. City folk barging in, probably looking for an offering to their precious Divines.
Good. This is Skyrim, and we should honor the old ways. These foreigners don't even respect their own gods, much less Kyne and her Sacred Trials.
They're stolen idols! Imposter gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
That's what an old man gets for thinking the younger generation might be interested in learning some honor.
You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne.
It's an old Nord Tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher.
Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True Nord hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down.
I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.
Olaf! It is time!
So Mikael, what'll it be tonight, hmm? Something upbeat? A Breton jig maybe?
Mikael, son. How about something with a bit o' kick?
Well, I was thinking maybe something mournful. A High Elf dirge, perhaps? These are rather trying times, after all.
You know, Hulda, there's this lovely Argonian ballad I've been studying...
You trying to scare off my customers, son? Lively! Keep it lively!
We've been down this road before, Mikael. Save the sap and sadness for your lady friends. My patrons need life! Cheeriness!
Hmm... Yes, you do raise a good point. What about the [QUOTE]Sweet Maidenfair from Hadleyshire[QUOTE]?
Alright, alright... Um... How about [QUOTE]The Guttersnipe[QUOTE]?
I think [QUOTE]Seven Septims for Sigurd[QUOTE] will do nicely. Especially when they're in their cups.
Well, that's not bad. But I was thinking [QUOTE]Mogo's Mead[QUOTE] really gets the place moving.
Well then, consider it done.
Ah! An excellent suggestion. I'll do that one, then.
Going straight through or did you want to stop somewhere along the way?
Just sit back. This won't take long.
Climb in back and we'll be off.
Sit back and enjoy the ride.
Don't be long. I can't wait around forever.
That's fine.
Where do you want to go?
Did you need something?
Ready to go?
Woah!
I don't do charity. No gold, no ride.
You'd best hurry it up.
I can't wait here forever.
What do you suppose this is all about?
You ready to go yet?
Here we are. Solitude. Safe and sound, as always.
End of the road. Markarth, right on schedule.
Here we are. Whiterun. Everybody out.
This is it. Riften, jewel of Skyrim. End of the road.
We made it. Windhelm. Hope you enjoyed the ride.
No problem.
Hold on. This can get a bit tricky.
We're almost there. Windhelm's just ahead.
That's Solitude just ahead. Only a few more minutes now.
Ah, good. Markarth is just ahead. I'm glad to make it through the Reach one more time.
That's Whiterun up on the hill there. We'll be at the main gate before you know it.
Just a few more minutes and we'll be in Riften.
Now, I don't want to alarm you, but there are bandits in these parts. We're safe up here, of course. Just be careful if you're ever here on foot.
Lots of lawless folk around here. Foreigners, mostly. No offense.
Old Embershard Mine's up there. Used to produce a lot of iron, but collapsed and taken over by criminals, I hear.
Ever taken a swim in the Illinalta? Take care you don't get nipped if you do. Folk say it's teeming with slaughterfish. Who knows what else.
See those stones peeking through the surface? Used to be an old Imperial fort on the lake. Really! Stories say it up and sunk one day, but who knows?
Thieves used to hole up in Fort Snowhawk there, but they were run out. Wizards, they say. Suits me fine, so long as they mind their own by.
Hold your breath if you're superstitious. We're passing Shroud Hearth Barrow. Everyone knows spirits guard the old treasure there.
Got keen eyes? Might see nasty old Hajvarr up on White River Watch. Piece of work. Jarl should just run him out and have done with it.
Orc town nearby. Between you and me, we should have had them out years ago.
You ever hear the one about the Breton and the bear-tamer?
I used to play in the Yorgrim River when I was just a boy. It's true! I was never afraid of the stories about Forsaken Cave, of course.
I wouldn't wander here alone at night. Folk go missing around Chillwind Depths, the cave just over those falls.
There's Treva's Watch. I hear bandits moved in while the steward was off fighting the war. I wonder if he ever got that sorted out?
Between the cliff and Snapleg Cave there, I hate this stretch of road. There's an evil air up here. Getalong, horse.
What's your sign? I was born under the Steed, as luck would have it. Really ought to visit my doomstone somtime. It's fairly near here.
You can see Azura's Shrine for miles on a clear day. You people did a good job with that, I'll say it to anybody.
Say what you will about the dark elves, but they did a proper job with Azura's Shrine. Can see it for miles on a clear day.
Thalmor got their embassy up that way. If I had my way, the lot of those yellowback elves would wake up in a box back to Summerset tomorrow.
I'm not asking, but if you happen to be the type, I hear that Kilkreath Ruin is a shrine to Merdia. You know. Daedra worship.
Did you spot the Dwarven ruins up there? Mzinfazzle, Finchafft, Mzinchaleft? Good thing the Dwarves disappeared and stopped naming things.
We're passing Fort Sungard. Unbelievable view from up there. No wonder the Empire built a fort on that hill way back when.
Look out, I think we have company.
I don't know if we can outrun 'em.
Did you see that?
Oh my goodness!
Whoa! They killed Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Yeah! Get her! Kill her!
Imedhnain, I was just comparing the ledgers from last season.
Not too bad, I hope?
Worse. The loss of shipments from Forsworn attacks are really hitting us hard.
Where's Cosnach, is that lazy idiot out drinking at the Silver-Blood Inn again? On my coin?
He's just waiting for the shipments, Lisbet. He'll be back as soon as they come in.
There are no shipments scheduled today. Stop covering for him!
He's my cousin. Just give him another chance. Please.
Fine, I won't fire him, but I'm doing this for your sake. Not his.
Where were you last night, Thonar? Busy with work or have you found some other woman who's willing to tolerate your lack of ambition?
I am busy keeping this family in coin and your pretty little head adorned with jewels, so I'll thank you not to question where I go at night, wife.
Well maybe if you would finally convince Thongvor to put you in charge of the family, I wouldn't need to question you anymore.
I'll take control of the family on my own time, Betrid. Until then, my brother remains in charge and you'll keep your mouth shut.
Oh dear, whatever is a girl to do with such fearful brutes about her?
You have worked here in the Treasury House for a long time, haven't you Ildene?
Yes, child. Nana Ildene has taken care of the Silver-Bloods for many years....
It's just... aren't you worried about the Forsworn? Maybe it's not safe here.
Don't you worry Rhiada. If any Forsworn coming knocking on our door, Nana will let you know....
Thanks Nana. I feel better now.
You're a very pretty young woman, Rhiada.
Why, thank you Thonar. I'm flattered.
You're married, yes? To that young metal worker?
Eltrys, yes, just last season we were wed.
He's a lucky man to have such a beautiful young wife.
Thank you, Thonar. That's generous of you to say.
Ah, Nana Ildene, whatever would my family do without you?
Ah, Thonar, don't you worry. Nana Ildene isn't going anywhere.
Um, good. We reward loyalty, you know.
Oh, I know, Thonar. Only a mad woman would ever betray the Silver-Blood family.
Uh, yes. Quite.
Rhiada, did you clean the tables today? They're filthy!
I'm sorry, Betrid. I'll clean them right away.
No, don't bother. You're useless, as always. I'll get Ildene to do it.
I'm sorry, Betrid. I thought I had cleaned the tables properly.
Oh, stop apologizing. It makes you look like an idiot. Learn to talk back a bit, girl! Why, when I was in the temple....
The temple, Betrid? You were one of Dibella's faithful?
I misspoke. Never mind what I said. Now get back to work.
Your hearts are full of grief, and my own weeps at the loss of Skjor.
But his death was avenged long ago. You have taken more lives than honor demanded.
The cycle of retaliation may continue for some time.
Lad, I know what you've been up to.
Lass, I know what you've been up to.
Talos guide you, lad.
Talos guide you, lass.
Hello, dear husband. Have you brought more silver jewelry for me to sell?
Yes, I have. Adara made the rings herself. She is learning to bend the metal well.
They are perfect. Thank you both.
How are the necklaces selling, my wife? We could make more.
I'm afraid the necklaces aren't selling well. Customers are not interested in medallions engraved with the symbols of other provinces.
Humph. Used to be everyone in Markarth wore a necklace showing his home province, from Elsweyr to High Rock to Hammerfell and Cyrodiil...
We don't have travelers from Elsweyr or Hammerfell anymore, Endon. Only the natives and the Nords stay in Markarth now.
As they always have, along with those crazed Forsworn. They've driven off the color that used to make this city great.
I need to get back to the customers. We'll talk more of this when I come home tonight.
Care to try out a new ring, or perhaps my daughter could make you a necklace...
Oh, that sounds lovely.
Kerah, do you have anything... exotic? Something no other woman in Markarth would be wearing.
I do have one set of bracelets in a style that is popular with the nobility in Sentinel.
Sentinel? That's in Hammerfell, correct? And you say these bracelets are only worn by the nobility?
They are popular with the nobility there, yes. This particular bracelet is a copy of one worn by a Crown Princess.
Hmm. Maybe in a few seasons I could afford such a treasure.
You there, pretty lady. You need some fresh meat for your family? Just look at the blood coming from this cut....
That's disgusting, get that rotting carcass away from me!
What's wrong? You have to look at the blood closely to see the quality of the meat. How else will you know it's fresh?
I don't need to know if it's fresh from this distance.
Ugh. You're the most disgusting merchant I have ever seen. The guards should take you away.
The only people I offend are cheats who don't pay me enough gold coin, or idiots who don't know good meat when I throw it at their faces.
If you ever think of throwing meat at me, I will have you dragged off to Cidhna Mine so fast the guards will yank those filthy arms of yours off.
What do I do to deserve such hatred? You give people good food and good prices, and all they do is insult you.
Thongvor, I have the latest reports from Cidhna Mine and the smelter. We should go over them immediately.
Reburrus, there is a war being fought across all of Skyrim, and you bother me with the usual mundane reports about silver?
Look at these figures, Thongvor! Ore yield is down by half, and the amount of silver bars being smelted is slipping even more than that.
Oh, very well. I'll send my brother. He'll straighten this out.
Very good, Thongvor. It relieves me to hear you say that.
Did I hear correctly, Thonar? Is your brother really asking you to settle another dispute between Mulush and Nepos?
Someone has to keep the silver production running, Betrid, and that means keeping Mulush and Nepos in line once in a while.
Humph. Who's running the Silver-Bloods? You or your brother? You need to tell Thongvor that he should settle this himself or step down.
The only thing I need to do, dear wife, is make sure profits are up, no matter what. If Thongvor won't do the dirty work, I will.
You'll never be in charge of this family with that attitude, loving husband.
I said no! No adventures, no theatrics, no thief-chasing!
Changed your mind? Come with me. I'm heading to Riverwood. It's just up the road and my uncle Alvor is the blacksmith there.
I don't blame you for being angry about it. I would be, too, in your shoes.
But it was all a mistake. You weren't supposed to be on that cart with those Stormcloak traitors.
And the Imperial Legion needs your help, especially now, with that dragon out there somewhere, and Ulfric back on the loose.
No. Not yet. After all, a dragon... something out of old tales and legends... no one could have expected that.
But you can bet he'll be trying to figure it out. This could shift the whole balance of the war.
If you want to help stop that dragon, your best bet is to go to Solitude and join up with the Legion.
Stick close. Damn rebels could be anywhere. Don't worry, though. General Tullius will have them on the run soon enough.
Well... maybe not. Dragons haven't been seen in Skyrim for an age or more.
But wherever that dragon came from, and whatever it wants, Ulfric will get to the bottom of it. You can count on that.
Besides, you have your own score to settle with the Empire now. And with that dragon.
Yes, youngling. Have a seat.
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
(Heavy breathing - sprinting)
Oh. Well. Good day.
Bah. What's so good about it, hmm?
Good morning.
Shor's bones! Here it is! Alduin's Wall... so well preserved... I've never seen a finer example of early second era Akaviri sculptural relief...
Esbern. We need information, not a lecture on art history.
Yes, yes. Let's see what we have...
Look, here is Alduin! This panel goes back to the beginning of time, when Alduin and the Dragon Cult ruled over Skyrim.
Here, the humans rebel against their dragon overlords -- the legendary Dragon War.
Ah. Of course. Not everyone has an appreciation for the artistic wonders of the world.
Let me see if I can find the right panel...
Ah. Of course. Not everyone has an appreciation for the artistic wonders of the world.
Ah. Thank you! Excellent. Now... where were we?
Alduin's defeat is the centerpiece of the Wall.
You see, here he is falling from the sky. The Nord Tongues -- masters of the Voice -- are arrayed against him.
Are you paying attention, Delphine? You might learn something of our own history.
Look, here. In the third panel.
The prophecy which brought the Akaviri to Tamriel in the first place, in search of the Dragonborn.
[QUOTE]When misrule takes its place at the eight corners of the world[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]When the Brass Tower walks and Time is reshaped[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]When the thrice-blessed fail and the Red Tower trembles[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]When the Dragonborn Ruler loses his throne, and the White Tower falls[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]When the Snow Tower lies sundered, kingless, bleeding[QUOTE]
[QUOTE]The World-Eater wakes, and the Wheel turns upon the Last Dragonborn.[QUOTE]
So, does it show how they defeated him? Isn't that why we're here?
Yes, yes. This here, coming from the mouths of the Nord heroes -- this is the Akaviri symbol for [QUOTE]Shout.[QUOTE]
But... there's no way to know what Shout is meant.
Patience, my dear. The Akaviri were not a straightforward people. Everything is couched in allegory and mythic symbolism.
So we're looking for a Shout, then. Damn it.
Have you ever heard of such a thing? A Shout that can knock a dragon out of the sky?
Have you ever heard of a Shout that can knock a dragon out of the sky?
Let's go see if Esbern's right about Alduin's Wall.
After you, Dragonborn.
I know the area of the Reach that Esbern's talking about. Near what's now known as Karthspire, in the Karth River canyon.
We can meet you there, or all travel together, your call.
I was afraid you were going to say that.
I guess there's nothing for it. We'll have to ask the Greybeards for help.
I hoped to avoid involving them in this, but we have no other choice.
You're probably right. I was hoping to avoid having to involve them in this, but it seems we have no choice.
You did? Maybe that's why I'm so sleepy now.
I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
I'd rather take a moment and look around than walk blindly into an ambush.
There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry!
Maybe you can find a way through somewhere above us.
You have your orders. Get moving.
But there isn't any other way through, Legate.
Let's not jump to conclusions, soldier. The Legion always finds a way.
Auxiliary, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting.
I need to ask you to stop. That... shouting... is making people nervous.
Good. Glad we straightened that out.
Can't say I've heard of any laws against... whatever that is you're doing. But I'll lock you up if I have to.
I've got my eye on you.
Hello there, friend. Have you come to enjoy the sights and sounds of this beautiful sanctuary, as I have? Truly remarkable, isn't it?
Amazing that such beauty could exist in a place as desolate as the volcanic tundra.
Praise Kynareth for allowing such beauty in the world.
A truly remarkable place, isn't it?
Kynareth humbles us with her beauty.
Don't come any closer. I don't want Kynareth to think I'm on your side.
You're gonna get me out of here?
Thanks! I thought I was going to rot in here. So what's the plan?
What's the plan?
There's more of them somewhere around here.
Thanks again.
All right.
Will do.
Good! I've got a few scores to settle.
Great, let's go!
Lead the way.
I am the spirit of the hunt, just one glimpse of the glorious stalker that your kind calls Hircine.
And skillfully, too. I've been watching you for ages, it seems. You have the makings of a fine hunter.
You may even be my champion. Perhaps.
Your fealty is precious to me. I will make good use of it.
You bear my ring.
I may consider it. But you must first do a service for my glory.
The one who stole it has fled to what he thinks is his sanctuary.
Just as a bear climbs a tree to escape the hunt, but only ends up trapping himself.
Seek out this rogue shifter. Tear the skin from his body, and make it an offering to me.
Fly, my hunter. There are others who vie for my favor. A bit of competition. Don't dally while the prey flees.
There is no retribution in the hunt. It is not vengeance I seek, but the blood course of a living hunt.
There are others who would gladly accept my favor.
They will hunt him while you delay. Your choice.
You've done well, hunter.
And found my favor. That skin will serve you well, child.
Look more closely at it. My glories shall protect you from all this world's grievances.
Good hunting.
Why? I want to watch the soldiers.
Inside the house. Now.
Yes, papa.
Oh, but I will speak. I will speak to you. For you are the one.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, the Imperial Legion will need to begin its preparations immediately.
Security is being handled by a man named Voltus Agallon. His job is to travel throughout Skyrim, and ensure each city is prepared for Mede's visit.
You must find and kill Voltus Agallon. Doing so will disrupt security sufficiently that we will be able to, eventually, get to to the Emperor.
Agallon is an efficient man, and will certainly already have begun his tour of Skyrim. Unfortunately, we don't have his schedule.
So, you've got two options. Try to find Agallon yourself, somewhere on his route between the major cities. Or... find and steal his schedule.
You'll find that in his office, in the Legion stronghold of Dragon Bridge. It's your choice. Now go, and may Sithis speed you.
Keep back, citizen. I have important business I must attend to.
You are trying my patience, citizen. Back away. Now.
What? Filthy assassin! We'll see who lies dead!
Is that a threat? Back off, or by the Eight I'll cleave that arrogant head from its shoulders.
I'm sorry, but I really don't have time for this. Move along.
Maro is dead, I know. But we've got bigger problems right now!
You're back. Good. You'll want to hear this.
The fool went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Lucan at the Riverwood Trader had his store broken into the other night. Oddly enough, barely anything's been stolen.
Nobody trusts those mages, way up north in their college. Gods only know what they do up there.
There have been whispers. A boy, up in Windhelm, name of Aventus Aretino. Been trying to contact... the Dark Brotherhood.
Folk been hearing some strange stuff coming from the Aretino place. Chanting. Talk is, little Aventus is trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood...
A little boy, Aventus Aretino, got sent to the orphanage. Now there's talk he's trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. No good can come of that...
I was walking by the old Aretino Residence, heard the little boy, Aventus? He was chanting. It was the Black Sacrament, I tell ya.
Hear about the little Imperial boy, Aventus Aretino? The stupid whelp is trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood...
Have you heard about Aventus Aretino? He's a little boy, lives in Windhelm. They say he's been trying to get in touch with the Dark Brotherhood...
Been talk of a little boy in Windhelm, name of Aventus Aretino. Get this - he's been trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. Foolish lad...
I heard tell of a lad in Windhelm. Aventus Aretino. They say he's been doing the Black Sacrament, trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. Damn fool.
Hmph.
Aye.
Yeah?
What do you want, little elf?
Speak, elf.
What do you want, cat?
What do you want, lizard?
What do you want, Imperial?
What do you need?
Need something?
Yeah?
What do you want?
What're you lookin' at?
Speak.
Yes, yes. I haven't got all day...
Got somethin' to say?
I'm all ears.
What now...
This better be good...
What can I do for you?
Oh, did you need something?
Yeah?
Huh?
I'm waiting.
Out with it.
What do you need, handsome?
Is there... something I can do for you?
Hi there.
What can I do for you?
What do you want?
I don't owe you money, do I?
What are you starin' at?
Yes, sera?
And what might you need? Hmm?
You want something from me?
Speak quickly.
